I can only make adjustments when the are actually on but that's no problem.Just wanted to share this application.  I'm still very happy with these.

I'm a big fan of science fiction and just grabbed this one as my first amazon movie to watch on Prime free.It was a happy accident as the film is a modern 2008 I think shoot of a fifties era alien flick except with great quality and cherry vintage cars.  Campy, sure but as on oldster I liked it and the FREE Amazon Prime movies blows me away. Watch out Netflix. LOLTens of thousands of flicks, wow.I'm glad I'm an 'Amazonian Primate'! (Amazon Prime member)

I have 4 other computers including an ASUS HD monster gaming machine.  I have a 'smartphone' but I purchased this little 10 inch ASUS to fit in-between.  This is my 'SURVIVAL computer'. No joking.  My intent is to have a computer I can 'grab on the go' and have video phone, Radio, and Internet access just about anywhere. If Internet and Cell is out, there is still a large archive of info I have transferred to read.  All my eBooks are available in the Amazon Cloud but I still download them to the Hard drive in case the 'cloud' and my account is unavailable.I hooked it up to my 1Gb home network and transferred (at 100Mb) all kinds of important files, books, maps, 'Kindle for PC program' from Amazon, Email program, program archive, etc, etc..  My disk drive has 2 partitions (which is good). Drive C contains Windows 8 (I hate) and other programs I've installed. Drive D, I use to save data.  It's just one physical drive but you treat it as two.You have a slot for SD memory card (on the right side near front. It comes with a plastic DUMMY card that you remove to use) and I decided to use mine as a location for the cache of Internet Explorer and Firefox and reduce the writing to the hard drive. This seems to work well.ASUS again for some screwy reason provides you with 3 USB ports but only one is the new Superfast USB 3.0.  The other 2 are standard USB 2.0. I don't know why they don't make them all 3.0 as they are backwards compatible even on the cables. (Look for BLUE USB cables and a BLUE insulator in the USB Jack/Plug for fast 3.0 speeds)The Ethernet port as is the old speed of 100Mb.  I want 1,000Mb so I use a 'USB 3.0 to Ethernet 1Gb adapter. Now I can use my home network at the superfast 1Gb (1,000Mb) speed. USB 3.0 to Ethernet 1Gb adapter such as "Anker Uspeed USB 3.0 to 10/100/1000 Gigabit Ethernet LAN Network Adapter [ASIX AX88179 Chipset, USB to RJ45, LED Indicator, 18 Months Warranty]' for appx $22. REMEMBER to use Cat6 Ethernet cabling for 1Gb connection or everything falls back to 100Mb.  Yes, file transfers are faster from computer to computer and to my network storage drive.Windows 8 as in previous versions of Windows has an option to add extra memory (for some things) called 'ReadyBoost'.  It utilizes a (high speed) USP memory drive (aka Flash Drive).  Not all USB drives are useable for ReadyBoost and Windows will let you know. Appx $45 I use the SanDisk Extreme 32 GB USB 3.0 Flash Drive SDCZ80-032G-X46. Other Flash drives can be used. I like this one as I know it works, has a light indicating activity and I used the on my Gaming ASUS larger machine that runs Win7.  There is a limit as how much memory can be used and I notice in mine Windows set aside a little over '30Gb for ready boost'! ReadyBoost is very easy to setup because you just plug it in to a USB port.Like others here, I also downloaded a free 'Classic Shell' program that gives me back my bottom left 'Start' button and displays things more like Win7 or even XP. I still  have access to the new format in the Win8 desktop if I want it. Its the best of both Worlds. Notice how Microsoft calls small programs 'apps' to appeal to the cellphone folks I guess.You can't add more memory in the traditional fashion as in swapping out or adding new chips. You are limited to the 2Gb of RAM. (But you can use ReadyBoost and USB FlashDrives).I can 'Tether' my SmartPhone to a USB port and use the SmartPhone as an Internet source. I measured 10Mb download this way.BTW I had an Internet outage a few weeks ago and learned about 'Tethering' which kept me from going crazy without Internet. This added to the decision to get something with a larger screen than my SmartPhone.I also have installed MagicJack on this mini-laptop which also has Skype. So now I have several means of communication if necessary. I keep all of this in a tote bag and will get an extra battery as backup.Only thing left for me to get is an automobile to laptop charger and perhaps a small Solar charger, perhaps fold-able.I have no problem with the mouse pad that comes with the machine I did purchase a small wireless Logitech 'couch mouse' which makes my life sooooo much easier. Someone commented about the built-in pad causing problems when using an external mouse if you accidentally touch it.  It's true you will be running BOTH at the same time HOWEVER pressing the 'fn' (special function key left lower side) and f9 at the same time will toggle OFF (or on) the built-in pad and no more accidents.My wireless works great at 'N' speeds and performance is the same as my other computers. Ethernet will always be a better connection than wireless. They both have their uses. Have NOT tried any of the local 'hot spots' yet.I wish it had handles.  Handles would make carrying it around safer and easier to tote. Perhaps I'll look for some straps for carrying when I don't want to use the bag with all its paraphernalia.I'll be looking into the ASUS boot sometime as someone recommend increasing the amount of memory to the graphics 'card'.  The only problem I have had was when it tried to run a super big business security program and there was zero CPU left. I still had RAM but no CPU available, so I need to watch the CPU intensive programs.The Power Cord fits fine and does NOT fall out.  I thought it did when it slipped out but discovered if you apply a bit of pressure it will actually 'snap' and give a firm connection. Amazing.This is the second week and I plan to update this review from time to time.I hope my comments were of help to you.

My fault, I did not read the description thoroughly "retractable CAT5e Cable".  I have 1Gb system and all it would do was 100Mb.It would work in a pinch at reduced speeds, also the USB is NOT USB 3.0 and they did not say it was, I just expected more from a company like Belkin to be the latest since it's backward compatible.I would like to find a travel kit like this that uses the newer higher speeds for Eithernet and USB.That's what I get for 'assuming'.

Worked on my XT but not on my new Windows 8 notebook. I downloaded the new Windows 8 driver but still no go.  I think the guts need to be upgraded or something before it will work and sadly, Amazon does NOT say what versions of Windows this is for (or other systems). BOOOOO....

Not a lot to say about this except it works fine. The pull cord should be a tad longer but it's usable.  The cord switches ONLY the bulb and the socket contacts are ALWAYS hot. Note, AC sockets are TWO prong only so if you must use a 3 prong item use a adapter but be careful as you no longer have it grounded.  I have a metal body 3 prong AC electric drill that I would never use with an adapter because of the metal body. Stay safe!I hope my review and cautions were of some use to you...

I use this on my wireless headset when it's charging and I'm still listening to music at the same time. The 3 feet worked out perfectly for me. I wasn't sure which kind of USB connection this part of the headset (Logitech G930 USB stick to headset) was so I guessed a 'micro connection' and was correct.I hope my review was of some help to you...

I purchased these USB 3.0 cables to extend my USB 2.0 wireless Headset. I Purchased 2 cables (I always get an extra).When connected it didn't work (at first). I 'jiggled' the connections but no go. I tried the second cable and all worked fine. I went back to the first cable and plugged it in and out of the computer's USB 2.0 port about six times and tried it and all worked fine. I purchase 3.0 extenders even when 2.0 would work for 'future' uses.I'm assuming the one cable had a bit of corrosion that needed cleaned off and as I had been using the computer port with no problems earlier it had to be the new cable. This isn't anything new to me and I know better but in my rush I was ready to toss a good cable in the trash and just go with the second one.I've plugged this in and out several times and there is no problem.Bottom line is, who knows how long these (or other) cables have been sitting around and in what kind of an environment.  One should be ready to scrub or clean USB and probably other cables from time to time and before first time use and don't be a hot head like me...I am happy with BOTH of these and would purchase more if necessary.I hope my review was of help to you.
Still working fine after 2 years. I use it as a closed circuit video monitor 24/7.Very happy with this product.

This is still working 2 years later but It's under powered. There are some packages The plastic is too thick and this will lock up. It will zip through single sheets of paper but I got it for those darn plastic packages that tear up your hands trying to open. (Find the guy that came up with that and shoot him).Just need a bit more power and would be perfect (for me)

I've had this 3 years and have started many cars (mine and other folks). A few weeks ago my car battery started dying and I used this to jump it 3 times. I keep it in the car and the car gets very hot and very cold but it always works. Sure I know it's best to keep it indoors and It'll have more starting power available BUT that's not as handy as keeping it in a Styrofoam cooler which kind of helps a bit with the daily temp swings in the car. Bottom line is, this works and is still working 3 years later.  It has Never failed to work.It still charges to full and I know if my car sits out in the cold without starting for a couple of weeks (airport travel) this will save me.Very good product!UPDATE: It's been almost '4 years' since I purchased this and have use it about 12 times and it's still going strong. I keep it in the car trunk but the temperature doesn't seem to bother it and it still charges to 100%  I check the charge about every 6 Months if I haven't used it. Good insurance.Great product!

Did a lot of research before buying, the quality and content for the price is exceptional. After months of recommending omega-3s for my canine patients with arthritis, joint disease, hip dysplasia, etcetera, based on peer-reviewed journal articles in both veterinary and human medical journals I decided to start myself. FYI, one of the online sources that looks into content etc can be found at https://labdoor.com/rankings/fish-oil.  For those of you looking to supplement your dog, I always recommend using http://csu-cvmbs.colostate.edu/vth/small-animal/sports-medicine-rehabilitation/Pages/fish-oil-dosing-chart.aspx this dosing chart was put together by Colorado State's veterinary program for correct dosing based on your dogs weight (and since weight loss/maintaining a slim weight in dogs is the most beneficial treatment for slowing and improving the progression of osteoarthritis) this makes it easy to adjust dosing as your dog loses weight. Please note that the amount required in dogs is slightly more than doses recommended for humans.Back to the product, it has a pleasant neutral smell and taste, no fishy-ness or "fish burps". Yes the size is relatively large but they are easy to take.
Addictive, not too sour, delicious, is truly a 5lb bag, well packaged and labelled, arrived fresh and delicious! The only other place I can get this is over $5/lb so this is a fantastic deal

Exceptional product, works perfectly with my Paul Mitchell The Color permanent dye in A2 (blue black). Much nicer to my hair than the 20% I had been previously using. 32 oz will last a loooong time despite my very long hair and doing my roots at least every 4-5 weeks and pulling through my whole head every few months.

This is my favorite case for my phone I bought, great protection and feel, nice grip. Wish it was still available in more colors. Very durable, stood up to a lot, replaced a previously bought same item which took a lot of abuse and finally the outer hard rim part cracked after it was slammed in a car door (phone was unscathed!) Easy access to everything included s-pen that I use a LOT. easy to put on.

This speaker is a great size, stylish in shape, design, and feel, and has OK sound. I had to return it because it just didn't work for me. The connectivity set up was fast and easy (plug and play) but the bluetooth connectivity just didn't work for me. The second I picked it up and walked more than 5-6 feet away from my device (whether it be laptop, cell phone, or tablet) it cut out and wouldn't play. The whole point was for me to take the speaker into other parts of my (small!) apartment. It works fine when directly connected via 3.5 mm jack but the sound quality isn't the greatest compared to me just buying a standard external computer speaker, it was the wireless feature I bought it for. As I said I returned it, the return and refund process was swift and simple and I have no qualms with the seller who shipped it very speedily and it appears well made and has a very good (fast and long-lasting) charge. I was quite shocked with the performance considering it claims to reach 30 feet and the other reviews and ratings have been consistently superb.

This is my second of this exact size and model and I love it. The adjustability and auto-shut off (or not!) are great features. This is nice and long, I use it mostly on my lower back (but length-wise it can fit my entire back), my neck, and to wrap around my arm to help with stiffness and aches from an old injury. The first pad I bought lasted me several years, lots of abuse, packing it back and forth when I lived internationally and went back and forth to the US 4 times a year for 3 years. That one never died I just literally couldn't it in my luggage when I finally went back to the US for good. It is soft, plush and says its machine washable, I just never did. It does get nice and hot, just for reference I only use it on the two highest settings- 5 and 6, the rest are too lukewarm for me. It warms up fast!

This product is incredible. Fits and adapts to anywhere and handy to directly plug in devices. Surge protection is great. Took it with me out of the country where power surges, brown outs, and outages are common (this and most products do NOT protect against brown outs) and it worked great and EVERYONE asked me where I got it.
Very pleasant and minty, good protection for lips, not the most moisturizing chapstick but pleasant mild minty tingle

Great product works excellently. Easy to use and durable. Bought for our 100lb extra tall lab before we went on vacation camping. The collar charges very quickly and holds holds a charge for days and days. LEDS are super bright and there are 3 settings for best visibility - on steady, fast blink, and slow blink. It seems waterproof our dog swam in likes rivers and streams for 5 days straight and it cleaned up easily and didn't get torn up by thorns or sticker bushes.

Great product a life saver, holds a lot and has helpful snaps and design. It's fairly small so if you're in large animal medicine bear in mind you can't really fit more than 1 or 2 60cc syringes in addition to your other stuff. The detachable velcro snaps are great for scissors or ringed instruments
Works beautifully with paul mitchell 20% developer. Great blue tones, product is not expired and the sell ships fast.
Arrived fast and pens work great. My favorite pen for writing, smooth and bold but not too thick for medical documents
Works great, not expired, would highly recommend. Shipped fast.

Have been looking for this everywhere since I used to get it when I lived out of the country. It is by far my favorite tandoori blend, it comes out tangy and delicious and is very easy to make. You just need chicken, plain yogurt, and vinegar. This makes more of an orangy- colored dish as opposed to the more red/brown variations. Delicious and I prefer this packet method to the jars of paste for making my tandoori (and biriyanis)

Works great, I bought a large kitchen sized garbage can from ikea and its too big to fit standard kitchen bags in which is quite annoying so I have to get extra large kitchen bags which are basically normal sized standard trashbags and so it doesn't stay secured on the can until I got this. I was expecting a round rubber cord type composition but I probably didn't read the description thoroughly, this is more a synthetic braided outer covering overtop the inner rubber cord, kind of like some hair bands. It works great- the smaller size fit my can perfectly, its very secure, I just think having this outer covering of the band might make it less impervious to gross-ness whereas solid rubber is easy to wipe/disinfect/keep it white and clean looking. Regardless, great product and am happy with its quality so far. Seller shipped it promptly, it arrived before scheduled.

Please see my review for the smaller sizes- issue with screws that had powdercoating/paint that had come off and got everywhere (including my light carpet and my hands). The 66-120in size had beautiful screws without the messy finish, their finish was much prettier and better yet, stayed on the screws! Very elegant and classy look, very well made and sturdy. Great presence and finish to a room.
Pretty, elegant, small and thin. Not as solid/bold looking as they may seem. Very thin and delicate and tiny decorative ends. Good hardware and seems sturdy, but disappear in the room

beautiful, well made, strong, good hardware, very elegant in appearance, well packaged (manufacturer). My only beef, and not enough to detract a star, is that the sizes smaller than the 66-120in, the screws included are painted brown and the paint is like powder that comes off, fills the bag the screws came in and got all over my hands and carpet. It made a mess and took days to come off my skin and is still not off my carpet despite numerous scrubbings and leave ins. Interestingly, I also purchased the 66-120in and those have a finish on the screws that does not come off at all! Don't know if its an isolated incident, i bought multiple and all the sizes except 66-120 had this issue.
Entertaining and eye opening, very enjoyable read, its kind of amazing how poorly veterinarians used to play a role in veterinary public health and biocontamination and government regulation

Used heavily in vet school for editing and converting professors powerpoint and pdf presentations, some of which were disasters, huge in size, way to spread out, etc. Definitely recommended, I became a class hero for fixing and condensing notes and presentations
Recommended by a friend from the UK, very pleasant song
Does its job, well made. Wish it came with a low profile head option but I chose this one from several to make the outlet my mattress is up against more useful.
Very pretty and does its job. Wish it came in larger sizes too but its perfect for my front door. Heavy and well made.

Beautiful, glass is a bit dark so not much light or coloring is visible when theres a large tealight in it but its pretty. I ordered two and one was perfect the other one had the top section completely bent up away from sides with a permanent gap of about 1cm. Its very obvious and shouldn't have been shipped.

I have a small head and these maxed out barely cover the front of my ears no matter which way I position it. Wont be wearing much but they didn't slide around for me, just don't fit well at all. These are in no way womens or even junior in size.
Very cute and have some weight so well made and don't seem fragile. However, as others have pointed out, they are not golden or tan they are more yellowy in body color than pictured

I spent 4 years struggling with littmans. I was swayed by the sheer availability and color choices. I eventually switched from a basic littman veterinary to a littman cardio. I couldn't hear anything. Tried different ear pieces. Didn't matter if it was large animal or small I struggled. Finally after listening to a Rottweiler/lab cross with my cardio and hearing nothing abnormal, a clinician told me to listen again and use his welch allyn. It opened up an entirely new world to me. I heard a grade III systolic murmur, and more heart and lung sounds than I had ever before. I was so excited to get one and simultaneously angry that I'd wasted years not hearing ANYTHING I was supposed to. I get great clarity and loudness whether I'm auscultating an overweight 2 ton draft horse or an adolescent rat or an tiny budgie. I can actually count the heart rate of an excited mouse. I can not only pick up extra sounds but subtle lack of sounds in chests. I can hear great GI sounds. The quality and sound is phenomenal and I also splurged on the accessory kit that included the pediatric bell for my small exotic patients and tiny kittens and puppies. I'd spend twice this much to be able to go back and avoid all the money and time I wasted on a littman. They may work for some but not for me and I have great hearing. I am so excited and in love with this welch allyn and highly recommend it.

Beautiful and functionally, pulls together my whole bathroom set. Great quality, heavy enough that lifting a stubborn tissue out doesn't pull up the whole thing. Crackled glass very pretty, only one tiny piece missing but no sharp edges and you can't really tell just looking at it. Price on amazon beat kohls even with the 30% off I would've had.

Love it, works great, holds towels, hats, shirts, jackets, purses, bags. Keep all your stuff out of the sand. Inexpensive, great quality, will fit any pole/umbrella. Gift recipient loved, bought 2, other people around us at the beach asked where we got it from.

HUGE. Fits a huge percentage of my clothing. Great for moving or long vacations. quality nylon and zipper. DO NOT buy if you need compartments or want your clothes to stay flat and neat and folded and wrinkle free. This thing will inspire massive packing and stuffing, you won't believe how much it holds, you'll almost assuredly overpack and make it ridiculously heavy. This comes to another point, since this is likely to happen, having a shoulder strap would be very handy and preferred to just little handles. So just beware. Color is very pretty, and this bag seems to be sturdy and resist wear and tears. I've dropped and drug it and it still looks good. Don't expect thick heavy duty material, its thinner than you may imagine but again, its held up awesome

Got it for my brother who's christmas list included "unflavored ground coffee". He really liked it. Said it tasted good and wasn't too crazy or strong. I don't drink coffee so I can't personally judge but he is picky and enjoyed it, it was one of his favorites of the 4 different brands I got him. He said he would buy again and that it was fresh.

Got it for my brother who's christmas list included "unflavored ground coffee". He really liked it. Said it tasted good and wasn't too crazy or too dark. I don't drink coffee so I can't personally judge but he is picky and enjoyed it, it was his second favorite of the 4 different brands I got him. He said he would buy again and that it was fresh.

Got it for my brother who's christmas list included "unflavored ground coffee". He really liked it. Said it tasted good and wasn't too crazy. I don't drink coffee so I can't personally judge but he is picky and enjoyed it, it was his favorite of the 4 different brands I got him. He said he would buy again and that it was fresh.

Works as good or better as OEM, still in samsung packaging. charges fast and thoroughly. Both cords fit my Samsung Note 3, one fits my boyfriends Samsung S4 and my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 edition tablet. Good quality, arrived fast!

Beautiful and functional- roll nicely. I know other people that have similar ones as these and after 2 years they are rusted and nasty so I will update the review accordingly on the longevity and aesthetics as time progresses. I think these are going to stay pretty and functional.

Can't say enough, how much this stethoscope lets me hear and find that I couldn't with my old littman cardio. This accessory kit was even more than I needed, I basically got it just for the pediatric bell as my first clinical rotation was exotics. Its been amazing to use on birds large and small (from little budgies and baby caiques to large african greys and a raven), to mice, hamsters, guinea pigs, rabbits, rats, reptiles, snakes, turtles, ferrets. Great sound and clarity. Also comes with additional earbuds to customize your fit, and an extra ring. So far I've only used the pediatric bell but I will update the review should I need to use any of the other components.

Gorgeous, holds cotton balls or q-tips in my bathroom. Lid fits well and is very handy. Crackled glass looks beautiful and no pieces missing or rough/sharp edges. Amazon's price beat Kohl's price even with 30% off.

Really easy to start, colors show up beautiful on my black wet erase board. Great price and arrived SUPER fast. Really excited to use, clean off easily! The flow is nice and even and opaque. Hoping they have excellent shelf-life
Great size, weight, balance. Great grip and seems like it will wear well. Handles needles and tissue well. Arrived fast with excellent customer service and communication and follow up. Thank you!
Easy to apply, only made a few bubbles and they pushed right out! Cut-outs are perfect for this exact model which i appreciate. Looks great and works great with the s-pen. Won't go without!

This is a very cool case and I'm anxious to find out if it really holds a charge for 2 years. That doesn't seem possible. Linking the bluetooth was easy and the keyboard is good if a little small, but not much they can do about that since it's for the Mini. A little on the heavy side but still very nice
Soft and comfortable, and it looks good too. Can be worn alone or underneath a shirt.

Memory just keeps getting cheaper and smaller. I love this little flash drive. 64 GB and it's tiny. The addition of the second connector so you can attach it to yourself on his brilliant. Easily move files off your phone onto this device, and then if you want from this device to your computer. Or wherever. The transfer speeds are fast. This is a great deal on a good flash drive.

These are decent midrange headphones whether you plan to use them for gaming or just listening to music. They are relatively comfortable although as mentioned in another review the content to slide back over time. Still, for the price they deliver sufficiently good sound and the microphone works well enough.
Very comfortable, not too tight, and it looks nice alone or under other clothes.

Finally, a mattress cover with enough thickness to really make a difference. My old futon has gotten compressed over the years and can be very hard. Adding this to it made it so soft and comfortable I wanted to take a nap right away. Very nice mattress pad, very soft. Love it.

Although I'm a diehard Photoshop fan and have been using it for years, I found this program to be a good substitute, especially for those who don't want to pay the ongoing Adobe subscription fees. Yes there are differences, and there'll be a learning curve associated with starting any new piece of software. But in the long term it might be worth the effort to break away from the Adobe monopoly.
I would watch anything with Hynden Walch, the most talented voice artist of all time. Great show.
My second favorite protein bar after the Quest Cookie Dough bar, this is a nice variety, and I especially like the peanut and chocolate bar.

Delightful and delicious. I'm a big fan of dark chocolate and although I generally go for 80% and above just to prove what a chocolate connoisseur I am and to bask in the bitterness, this 70% Cocoa was a nice break from the usual.
This is the king of all protein bars. Don't waste time with anything else, unless it's another Quest bar. Even then, I think Cookie Dough is as good as it gets.

I was worried after reading some of the reviews on here if this would be the right choice for my two week trip to Europe. I needn't have. This holds a lot of stuff, the zippers hold up, it's very very light, and the straps are fine for walking to the train station from your hotel. The padding is good enough. I was really happy with this bag and would definitely use it again for any trip where I'm flying and need to pack as much as possible but still want to use overhead storage. I had zero hassles.

This is the second pair of ECCO shoes I've bought, and I pulled the trigger on these because my ECCO Men's Neoflexor Oxfords were so comfortable. I thought perhaps these, since they were a little more formal looking, might not be as comfy, but they are. This brand is my new favorite. If you work on your feet, do a lot of walking, or just want to have nice looking but comfortable shoes for the office, check these out. And watch the price because it goes up and down quite a bit on here. Shop the sales and thank me later. :)

Nice, foldable, portable, and usable. This cradle/swing/thing will keep your baby occupied and happy with lights and sound and can be folded up to take on the go. All in all a nice usable device, and although it's a little pricey you'll get enough use from it to justify the expense.

Another day, another strip outlet. I have these things all over the place and somehow the outlets always fill up with chargers and other devices hungry for some electricity. This is a nice one with some cool safety features, but ultimately I like it for the price. Works great.
Nice quality and looks on this necklace. Sterling silver and a reasonable price. Worth getting if you like this style.

First things first, how do you charge this thing? I had to download the manual to figure it out:Locate fingernail recess andremove back cover to exposemicro USB charge point. 2+ hrsfor full charge gives 8 hoursof playtime. 30 mins charginggives 90 minutes of play timeOk, with that out of the way, how are these headphones? Fantastic. Yes, the bass response isn't going to be what it would with a subwoofer up in your face. Don't expect miracles on that end of the spectrum. But the sound is clean and clear, and the fit is perfect thanks to a nice selection of ear plugs. The controls are logical and well placed. And you can use this for phone calls and music. It will hook up with any bluetooth sound source. Yes, they are a little pricey, but these are very nice and feel well constructed. I expect them to last a good long time.

I really like the printers in this series. The design is well thought out. I especially like the way the front opens automatically and the output tray comes out when you needs it, goes away when you don't. The one improvement I would ask for is a true keyboard on the touch screen to punch in the WIFI password, instead of the touchpad they give you. Other than that it's a great printer and scanner with easy set up and easy to use.

This IS the router I've been looking for. Wow, they aren't kidding around here. My old router was very good, but only reached about 2/3 of my apartment, so I had to use a signal extender to reach the rest. With this new router I don't need that anymore. This thing is powerful. Even my girlfriend noticed the improved WIFI signal. For her to comment on something like that, it has to be good. Is this a pricey little beast? You bet. But if you've got the money this is definitely the one to get. Set up was easy, no hassles. Love it.

The way you know these work is simple. Your biceps will be sore! In a good way. Like you've been working out. Except you haven't, you've just been sitting watching TV. Welcome to 2015 folks. The only downside is it's hard to use your hands while using this since your muscle keeps flexing. So bad time to be using the computer. But otherwise a great device.

I found these a little on the large size, especially the high waist, which you can see in the picture too. That said, this is a very fair price on a good quality pair of lined pants. Soft and warm. Comfortable, if a little large.
These are a nice pair of casual pants. Soft with just a little stretch. The fit and workmanship are good, and the price is fair. Definitely worth giving a try.
It's a power strip! That's about it. Has lights. Has outlets. Has a decent cord (6 feet). The main thing I like is the price. If you want a decent power strip at a decent price, this is it.

I love puppets, and I really love this grunting pig puppet. Folkmanis makes high quality puppets and this is no exception. The "fur" is soft, the puppet is cuddly enough to be used as a stuffed animal as well as a puppet, and the grunting noise it makes had my two daughters both laughing. They loved it, I loved it, and you will too. The price is very reasonable given the high quality and the hours of fun play time this will provide. Look at the other Folkmanis puppets too, I've never regretted getting one. Great company that really cares.
I'm sure this is a wonderful modem IF you can get it to work. I could not, despite spending over an hour. I finally gave up and switched back to my trusty old Motorola cable modem.

What the . . . this thing is like magic. Is it expensive for a guitar tuner? You bet. Is it the coolest guitar tuner I've ever seen? YOU BET! There is something truly amazing about strumming all the strings at once and seeing a display of which strings are sharp, flat, or right on. Tuning just became more fun and a bit easier. You can also pluck one string at a time and "fine tune" it. Really a clever and cool gizmo that I will be using a lot.

I really wanted to like this device, and I have a feeling that if they fix the software I will, but for now I feel it has limited usefulness. The Android software had a very difficult time connecting to the device, and then quickly lost the connection. Without this link, it's just another flash drive. They should have polished the software before putting this out there.

I've always felt Mackie gives a lot of bang for the buck. You'll see the gear snobs on message boards putting down Mackie gear while comparing it to something costing anywhere from twice as much to ten times as much. Looked at in terms of what you pay, it's very hard to find better gear, and this PA is a perfect example. Will it be enough for you to perform in a stadium? No. Will it serve the purpose for which it was built and intended? You bet! The sound is excellent, the Android app works perfectly, and the unit as a whole has tons of uses, both as a personal stereo system coupled with a phone or MP3 player as well as a versatile and portable PA for smaller spaces. It even has on board effects (reverb and delay). For those who will be playing in situations where power isn't available, I would add in the optional lithium batter, although you can also use standard D batteries.All in all this is a great PA for the price and well worth taking a look at.

You're going to have to be pretty strong to carry this table around, but they have definitely done everything they can to make this both as portable and as strong and useful as possible. When assembled it is very stable, and the padding is perfect. When folded it takes up as little space as possible and can be carried with the handle, although you might need a pretty good massage after carrying this table. :) All in all, this is very high quality and well worth the price.

This is a sticky mess, with unimpressive protein to carb ratio. Yes, it's got nuts, and that's a plus. But the thing was just melty and messy and unpleasant to deal with. I suggest finding something with a little more structural integrity, better flavor, and more protein.

I have nicknamed this machine, The Beast, a title it has certainly earned. This food processor is built to last and has enough attachments to make it useful for pretty much any slicing dicing or shredding task. The motor seems powerful and durable, although time will tell. Yes, it's large and takes up a lot of space, but you will get a lot of use out of it if you do a lot of cooking. The price is fair for this quality food processor. Check it out.

These are nice headphones, but I have a few concerns. First, they are very tight. I adjusted and adjusted and could not find a way to reduce the feeling that my head was a walnut and the nutcracker was going to work on it. Ok, it's not THAT bad, but it is tight, and for long term wearing this would be an issue. Second, I feel like the price is a little on the high side. Yes, they sound great, but with the little ear cups and the tight fit, I feel like these are not quite as premium as the price would suggest.That said, the sound is fantastic. If you have a small head or don't mind your ears being crushed, get them. Otherwise, keep looking.

I've tried a few similar devices and the issues are usually that the keys are too small or they made some weird choice on key placement that messes you up when you type. This keyboard suffers from none of those issues. It's very comfortable to type on and the keys were where I expected. It is thin, portable, lightweight, and the kickstand is great. I LOVE that it turns on when you lift the protective cover. That's the type of extra engineering I appreciate. A simple switch on the back will switch it between two devices. Hold a charge for a LONG time. All in all this is an excellent choice among the many options in this field. I'll be taking mine on my next trip.

This is a decent backpack. The reason I'm only giving it 4 stars is the price. I just don't see any features that justify the high price compared to comparable backpacks. I would take a look at what Case Logic has to offer before springing for this one.

This is a bit more work to put together than I expected, but it comes with everything you need, which is much appreciated. Looks sharp and the double rods and outward curve are a very nice design touch. This was well thought out and feels solid and durable. Nice job

This is a great set of strings for the price. I was really surprised at the quality, even on my crappy little guitar. String sound is very subjective, but to my ear these are great strings, and they are practically giving them away. Buy a set, even if it's just for backup.

Not impressed. Here are the pros and cons.PROS:+ lightweight+ built-in mic (but read the cons for more on this)+ fairly comfortableCONS:- The mic sucks. Really. Just dreadful.- The plug doesn't quite seat properly in the two jacks I tested it in, including a brand new LG G4 phone. You have to wiggle it to get stereo, and then you lose it again.- The sound quality is low. In particular the only way you're getting any bass is if you crank the volume, which is not recommended as it will damage your hearing over time. Even with the volume up, the sound is thin.All in all, I would suggest saving your pennies and spending more for something better.

Given the "Balance" they are trying to strike between flavor and nutrition, I think they've done a good job here. Sort of like little Cocoa Puffs in appearance, but the flavor is more along the lines of "soy protein pretending to be chocolate treat" territory. They are small and light, so this is a great snack to pack in a lunch or for a trip. All in all a good snack

This is a great creative fun toy at a reasonable price.PROS:+ Aerial and Cinderella figures+ Play Doh, of course+ "Growing" Rapunzel hair+ Make dresses with Play Doh and patternsCONS:- Please don't put that Play-Doh in your hair. :)Seriously, this is a a lot of fun and promotes creative play time. Much better than staring at phones and iPods all day.

Tasty treat and 13 grams of protein. Keep in mind, that's 13 grams of protein per bag, not per bite. Here are the pros and cons:PROS:+ Yummy+ Easy to carry and eat as a snack+ healthier than other easy to pack snack optionsCONS:- A bit more sugar than I would like, but they do taste goodAll in all, this is a good option to toss in your kids' lunches instead of something with more sugar and no protein. Looks a bit like cat treats but tastes good.

These are a yummy mess. Here are the pros and cons:PROS:+ High protein+ Low sugar+ Real nutsCONS:- They melt and become super sticky- A little too sweet for my taste, but others seem to like the sweetness- Did I mention sticky? Bears mentioning twiceYou will not want to eat these at work if you're wearing nice clothes. Your fingers end up a stick mess. Other than that, they are very good.
This is a nice piece of costume jewelery, but nothing really to write home about. It looks nice. I have no idea what the price will be as the detail page is not yet available.

This stuff is good, not great.PROS:+ 26 grams of pure protein with just 2 grams of sugar,+ only 150 calories+ no-mess tub+ scoop in the lid, not hunting around through the powder (thank you)+ mixes wellCONS:- the flavor. Yes, it's a protein drink, but still it's a bit chalky compared to Optimum Nutrition, my go to brand.Since taste is subjective you might still want to give this a try.

This is so well designed. Here are the Pros and Cons:PROS:+ Design. Color and shape is very nice+ Has a "night light" that you can turn on or off+ Three speeds, the lower two are very quiet+ Cord hidden underneath for safety+ It's adorableCONS:- A little expensive, but you're getting good value for your moneyI would definitely recommend this air purifier.

Nice Crew T-Shirts. Here are the Pros and Cons:PROS:+ Soft+ no tags!+ good quality cotton+ very reasonable priceCONS:- Not really a con, but I prefer V-necksFor the money you'll be hard pressed to find this high quality.

This is a great frying pan. Here are the pros and cons:PROS:+ non-stick surface that really is non-stick+ easy to clean+ has a solid hefty feel, but not as heavy as cast iron+ heats fast and evenlyCONS:- the handle gets hot, be careful!- only use wood or plastic utensils so you don't scratch the surface- it's a pricy little panOverall, I appreciate the quality and usefulness.
Nice light cream, doesn't feel goopy or oily, no scent. This is a very good basic face lotion. The addition of SPF 15 just makes it that much nicer and more useful. Recommended.

The missing star is because you can't attach it to the headstock.Pros:1. light weight2. small3. inexpensive4. works like a charmCons:1. doesn't close down enough to clamp onto headstock for storage2. make sure you get the right one!, This one is "Designed for acoustic and electric guitars with radiused fretboards". Radiused means curved. If your fretboard is flat, they have one for that too, but this isn't it.All in all I'm glad I got it.

This is a decent curtain for the price, but you might consider the following.Pros:1. Looks nice (from a distance)2. Inexpensive3. Easy to install if you already have a curtain rod upCons:1. Edges look a little rough, subject to fraying2. Feels cheapNot bad for the price, but not the best

Elixir makes great guitar strings. This Light Top Heavy Bottom is exactly what I was looking for, since I tend to hit the top strings pretty hard and if anything breaks, it's going to be those. This gives me a little wiggle room to get crazy during live performance.

Flimsy junk. In fact, with the way the loops are designed on the sides, I didn't understand how it could possibly attach to, say, a Wilderness Instructor Belt. And I didn't bother investigating too much into it, because the plastic was too thin and flimsy for me to seriously consider using it for carrying a .45 double stack mag.

I was really looking forward to trying this sight after how much James Yaeger raves about it, and it's highly regarded as one of the best combat sights out there. They're beautiful sights, bright and crisp, solid and of high quality. Come with a nice kit of tools and loctite type stuff, directions on how to assemble it, etc. The company did a great job of making a quality product that's very user friendly. And I loved how the big front dot shows up so clearly when acquiring a sight picture, as well as the vertical line of the rear sight. Good stuff.HOWEVER ... There is a major design flaw that I could not overcome.As you can see in the picture of the sights, the rear sight is kind of a 'shelf'. If you think logically about how the rear XS sight lines up with the front sight vs other sights (a deep notch cut out in between two dots), you'll realize that when you line up the sights on target, the pitch of your aim is canted a lot higher than it would normally be with typical sights. I.E. you're aiming high. Very high.That's why in the directions, they talk about super-imposing the front sight on top of your target, and James Yaeger talked about hitting farther targets by basically visualizing away the bright white outer circle and imagining just the tritium dot super-imposing on the target.But, when you line up the sights properly, even with the front sight over the target (as opposed to under it; apple on a post), you end up shooting high. Like even 6 inches high at combat range. People say "They're combat sights. They're not supposed to be super accurate." However, they ~could~ be, if it weren't for the fact that the rear sight is putting your aim point too high. So I tried to adapt for a while. Tried to shoot more instinctively, focusing on snap shooting while just focusing on the front sight and the target. And I was able to do a lot better and get (vertically) much more on target. That said, though, at the range, there was just way too much unpredictability when it came to vertical placement.Ultimately, I decided to remove the design-flawed rear sight, and keep the big dot front sight, which is AWESOME. The rear sight I installed in its place is the rear sight from a Meprolight set, so now I have two rear orange dots, and the big white XS front dot, and that works really well.Incidentally, the rear sight was a real bitch to remove. The red lock tight stuff included in the kit glued the sight onto the slide so tight that I was pounding on it in a vice with lots of different tools for over an hour until the included drift tool was destroyed and I ended up having to use a screw driver to punch it out. I sure am glad I had elected to not cover the top holes of the rear sight with the loctite like Yaeger had recommended.Despite the problems with the rear sight, I'm still very impressed with the quality and design of the product, and fully intend to look into the XS Big Dot product line for shotguns, etc.
This is seriously sized as if it were for a 12 year old. No way it could fit an adult female, and even the smallest and most anorexic of women might have a hard time making this work.

These steel recoil spring guides are great. I don't know if it makes any difference in the feel of shooting, but they feel nice and solid. A couple of things to take note of, however:1. If you get one with a design on it, realize that there's nothing to keep the design (like this punisher head) oriented straight up in the right position. As the slide moves, the design will move randomly, end up upside down, etc. I ended up exchanging this punisher one for a plain steel one.2. Being as these are made of steel instead of molded plastic, they are comprised of parts. I was surprised at the range the other day when the recoil rod exploded apart while I was shooting. The larger end of the recoil spring guide is a piece that actually screws onto the guide rod, holding the springs and the entire thing together. Imagine a big steel thumbtack with screw threads instead of the stabby part. After comparing the gathered parts to a similar steel guide rod I have from the same manufacturer for another caliber pistol I have, I was able to reassemble the parts. Using some heavy pliers to hold the springs down and out of the way, I applied some lock-tight and screwed the piece back in--problem solved. If I knew better, I would have seen it coming. For a while, that end had been gradually unscrewing itself over the last few trips to the range. I noticed something odd in the way of the end (pictured with the Punisher skull design on this item) protruding slightly from the end of the gun at rest. Didn't know why, couldn't figure out why it was happening, but it didn't seem to be hurting anything, so I let it be. Now, I will be watchful and inspect this aftermarket rod every once and a while to make sure the screwed-on end isn't backing off again.They say that this upgrade is totally unnecessary, as the Glock factory recoil spring guide rod works just fine and never really breaks. They also say that if it DID break, the Glock factory recoil spring guide rod is something that ~could~. So I like this steel one. But be aware that you may have to maintain it from time to time.

Pretty good solution to carrying Glock .45 magazines. I've had a hard time finding an OWB single mag holder for double stack Glock .45 mags (21). The OEM Glock plastic one was too flimsy and didn't fit well on a wide belt, most blackhawk ones, etc., are too tight for a .45 (although they work great with my 9mm), cloth ones by Voodoo Tactical, etc., are too bulky and have mixed QC results (I got one with a broken stitch).This one ended up working very well. Soft leather. Looks good. And like other reviewers have said, it kind of looks like something else other than a magazine. Like some sort of cell phone case at first glance. Being horizontal, it doesn't stick up past your belt, where vertical ones might rub your back or otherwise annoy you from time to time. Depending on where you put it on your belt, it might get in the way of putting your hand in your pocket, or it might not get in the way at all. Took a little trial and error to figure out.Attaching it and detaching it from your belt is easy enough. However, the one week point I see there is the velcro. Having a thick magazine in it like I do means that feeding it through my belt and attaching to (attachment) strap from the top means that there's only about half as much purchase as you see in the stock picture. I can see the velcro becoming worn out over time, and maybe starting to have trouble with it accidentally detaching from the belt while going about my day. Who knows. But it would have been nice if there was something more secure there. Like maybe an adjustable clip.A Glock 21 magazine is pretty big for this, and is a snug fit, but not too big that it'll be hard to pull the mag out if I need it. Obviously, double stack 9mm mags and others would fit just fine. There's a good amount of adjustability. However, with smaller mags, it seems that the more you adjust by tightening down the magazine retention strap, the more you'll cut into the velcro area that the belt attachment strap needs. So there'll be a point where a thin enough or short enough mag wouldn't fit.You can see in my picture that I'm wearing it to the rear of my EMT pouch (knife, light, pen). Wearing it too far forward (in front of the EMT pouch) made it stick out in a weird place on my side that got in the way. Behind, however, is perfect, because I don't notice it, and being that my EMT pouch is dropped a little, they fit together efficiently.
Dense, hard, heavy rubber balls. Great for SMFR stretching, especially under feet. Much better than tennis or racket balls, and this is one of the better values out there.

This is a magic potty seat. While it may seem just like any of the billions of potty seats that follow the same form and function, although with different colors and different cartoon designs (they're pretty much all the same and follow the same pattern), this one is special. When you've got a kid who loves Mickey, and refuses to sit on the potty with other potty seats, get this Mickey one, and ... voila! Magical progress down the road of peeing and pooping in the potty.

Nice. This is a good hat. I have a really hard time finding good Fedoras, because my head is about a 7 5/8, so I wear somewhere between an XL and XXL in many hats, but sizes vary so much that most hats end up too small. If your head is a little too big for the majority of hats sold where the largest size is "XL", then this should fit, unless you're 7 3/4 or larger. I have a "Wynn" hat by Bailey Yates, which fits me well but has a too-short stingy brim. This one fits the same, but the brim is wider.That said, it's a warm hat. The inside is all wool with no liner. The leather band also has some puckers here and there from where they attached it to the hat without any concern for the blemish that would be left behind. It will be too hot for the warm months. Makes a good winter hat, though.
Cheap. It's expected. Had a crack in it along the back edge. Looks cool, but you're getting exactly what you expect out of a cheap mask.

If you're looking for extended parts for the Glock 30s, this is it. I had a hard time finding an extended slide release that would fit a .45 size Glock in the stainless steel (as opposed to black) finish. First, I tried ordering the "Ghost" slide release, but that one ended up being too flimsy and not flush enough against the side of the 30s (I.e. was susceptible to catch something).The extended slide release supplied in this kit fit just fine, and works well. The pins swapped out easy and look good. And the take-down levers are also great. I never intended to use those, as I had already ordered an installed a stainless steel Lone Wolf take down lever. But I installed this one on another Glock, and the way that the grips are angled make this one even easier to use than the typical (Lone Wolf or OEM) extended take down levers. They just grab your fingers so easy when you're trying to take off the slide.Good stuff. Looking for stainless steel finish for the 30s? This is it.
Weird fit. The buttons extend down to low (just below the sternum) and are too spaced out compared to typical henleys. Like other reviewers have said, definitely run small. Was also missing a button.

Lousy construction / design. This would be a cool shirt if it weren't for the designer being drunk when figuring out the sleeve/shoulder connection. The shoulder area is inflexible or otherwise flawed in a way that if you raise your arms, the whole shrug area the shirt raises to in poofy weirdness, looking silly, and making you have to pull the shirt back down to straighten out every time you lower your arms again.
A fraction of the price of the magpul ladders. Grippy, good feel, easy to install, and cut to fit with a knife. Looks great.
Might be good for kids. It sure looked like an adult pair of sin guards when I bought it, but these things are tiny.
Awesome patch. It is a little big and will likely hang of the Velcro backing of whatever you're putting it on, so those gear cogs can get caught on stuff and in the way. But what a great patch.

Bought this from Wal-Mart. Easy to install, read the instructions and all, but this thermostat has a mind of its own.Every once and a while I notice it feels to hot inside, and I find that it's set to 68, or even 75. It's random. I'm frequently having to go through the whole program to make sure the two different times during the weekdays and weekends are set back to where I want it. Frustrating.
Fan-freaking-tastic for my PLR-16. Holds my .223 pistol, several magazines of varying sizes, as well as other miscellaneous stuff. Happy with the quality, zippers, and layout. See my posted pics.
These are pretty decent and tough, and do everything they say they will. However, the line isn't as dark and consistent as the typical Pilot G-2 gel pens that I carry. Good for an EDC pen.

These things are freaking awesome.I had the idea of buying one after I saw a firearms instructor using one at the range to pick up brass. (Genious!)They're fantastic for picking up any manner of stuff. Bits of trash on the carpet, trash outside, shooting brass of course (SO much easier than multiple trips picking up a dozen shells at a time squating or bending), and kids LOVE to pick up trash with these. I ordered four of these for the house for family cleaning, and one that folds in half for the range.Go technology!

Ever notice how at fast food restaurants, the pictures of food make the menu items look awesome, then when you get the actual item, it doesn't even compare? It's small, squished, and disappointing?Same with this mask.It was squished into a shape that was irreparable. Permanently damages into a non-mask shape by sitting under a stack of other squished masks or whatever before it made its way to my door. On top of that, while I was trying to put it on anyway to try and fill in the squished parts, I found that the moving jaw didn't accommodate my face, so I couldn't even fit the mask all the way around my head properly, much less move the jaw.I suppose it's possible that there's a small random chance that you'll get one in good shape, but that's not what I got. Cheap crap.
Looks like it'd be a pretty good hat, but if you wear a hat larger than a 7 1/2, it'll be too small. I'd say that 7 1/2 is the largest size this will accommodate. Too bad.
This was junk. A huge black sheet roughly resembling a shirt. You'd think it'd be fairly decent by the price, but it was within the same caliber as the cheapest Halloween crappy costumes.

Not bad, but the quality won't last in any type of recreational fighting (Amtgard), because all of the links are butted (and not very tightly). The sizing is not accurate. According to the description, it fits up to a 50-something inch chest. Mine's 48, and I wear XXL shirts. And with a light cotton shirt under the chain, it fit like a size L shirt. Pretty tight, much less have enough room to move.Came in a Fedex first rate box, and the seller was happy to take the return and reimburse for the shipping back. Unlike the other chain shirts in this price range, this was was NOT covered in grease/oil when it came.
Great comforter. A little expensive. But it looks like it does in the picture, is the same size and build as a typical cheap king comforter, and it works as it should.

These look awesome online, and in person, until you realize that its apparent mass-production leaves a lot to be desired in quality control. This particular seller made continuous mistakes sending me the right color mask, so I had the opportunity to see three separate products. Each had their own unique problems with symmetry, and it seemed that after the masks were heated and shaped, they were each 'skewed' by varying degrees as if they weren't properly protected when cooling, or as if they were squished to one side or another.As other reviewers have mentioned, the design is very hard on the bridge of your nose. The placement of the foam inside is poor and insufficient (and not centered), and the way the straps hold the mask on by pulling it toward your face, if you want to keep it secure enough to play airsoft, amtgard, whatever, your nose will take the pressure. I had to buy a softball nose protector-cage-thing to attach to the inside of this mask to make it work.So it looks really cool, and visibility is very good too with the side windows. But, it's a crap-shoot to get a half-decent production, and it'll need modification to be effective for its purpose.

While I thought at first that the cloth-exterior foam-scuplted construction was novel, it could have easily been more durable. The inner lining was reinforced with a thin clear plastic, which was split at the chin. After trying to wear it for the evening, it was also very hot. Looked cool, but had some short-comings that could have been designed better.
Great costume. For my little guy great. Found some hulk hands at a thrift store, and he's thrilled. Nice hat/hood, too.

I bought this book as a potential gun-themed children's book, also to support the cause, and also to provide some support in the face of all of the bogus reviews steeped in liberal BS and sarcasm. (Is there a single 'real' review here?)While I support the open carry movement and love the idea of a book like this, there were just several ways in which the authors failed to accomplish what this was supposed to be. One thing to note, while it's not a big deal, but it was a surprise--this book is large. 8.5" by 11". For some reason, I expected it to be smaller.This book depicted a 13 year old main character, Brenna. It didn't really mesh with the design of the book. Many 13 year olds are reading adults books, and this book, with its large print and illustrations, seemed more like it was aimed at maybe 8-10 year olds. Maybe that's because the authors wanted to make her a little older so it'd be less controversial when her parents took her shooting at the end? Who knows. But it seems aimed for 8-10 year olds, but they're supposed to identify with 13 year olds, and then the writing style is basically aimed at adults, which brings me to the next point.As far as a story, it's terrible. I've seen this in a lot of 'libertarian fiction', but it's really bad here. The narrative is the loosest attempt to deliver the ideals of open carrying and its arguments into a story. This book doesn't know whether it wants to be a children's story (for 8-10 or 13 year olds ... who knows) or a long article about the arguments and merits of open carry. There are ways in writing to deliver the semi-political points an author wants to make without bashing people over the head all the time with dry and lifeless talking points. Like realistic dialogue. And concrete examples of abstract points. And not having characters say stuff that real people would never say in day to day life. Kind of like, "You just never know when you might need to protect yourself and love ones. People wear seatbelts and have fire extinguishers. They hope to never need them, but it's best to be prepared, I always say!"As a children's book, this is a fail. It may be best approached as a novelty item for adults, and a compressed explanation about open carry, its arguments, its merits, and a few author opinions that aren't necessarily consistent with the rest of the gun loving world (like the parents keeping their daily carry pieces locked up in a safe. Practical gun owners who carry daily and have a 13 year old kid who has been around guns all her life wouldn't need to lock up their guns. Their kid would be well educated. Or the author's interpretation of the 2nd Amendment and the 'militia' thing.)I would read this to my kids if it was written for kids, but it's not. Still not a bad booklet about Open Carry, though.**Edit**After reading through some of these reviews some more and seeing how polarized reviewers are about this little book, I'm amazed at how many gun-haters there are on Amazon, and I'm certain that my 'helpful reviews' rating will plummet now that I've jumped into this, because I'm clearly outnumbered.Do take note, folks contemplating this book beyond the tip of a smug, bigoted leftist nose, the number of reviews here that are *not* Amazon Verified Purchases. I guess a lot of ugly-spirited people love to waste their time spouting off in the wrong place.

8:01 MinsThe best basic upgrade you can perform for your Glock (this is a Glock 26 but it works for all models) is an extended slide release. This video was made to provide a tutorial for replacing the slide release, a little more clear than my last video, as well as installing a cosmetic slide backplate.This back plate is customized, starting with a basic anodized aluminum "smooth gold" plate from the Glock Store, and having the TRI-FORCE (Legend of Zelda) etched onto it by a laser engraver.The first half of the video is all about the extended slide release. The second half is about the back plate.

8:01 MinsThe best basic upgrade you can perform for your Glock (this is a Glock 26 but it works for all models) is an extended slide release. This video was made to provide a tutorial for replacing the slide release, a little more clear than my last video, as well as installing a cosmetic slide backplate.This back plate is customized, starting with a basic anodized aluminum "smooth gold" plate from the Glock Store, and having the TRI-FORCE (Legend of Zelda) etched onto it by a laser engraver.The first half of the video is all about the extended slide release. The second half is about the back plate.

Last Winter I was beset with a terrible lingering cold/flu that went on and on, and my typical medicines and self treatments weren't gaining any ground. So while researching further remedy, I came across a YouTube video of a woman demonstrating how she used one of these to clear her sinuses. I went to Wal-mart and bought a pack with one rinse bottle and 50 packets.I'm very impressed with this product's ability to clear your sinuses. It does work well; there's a reason it's got so many good reviews. Mixing with warm water from the shower and adding a packet made a rinse that didn't burn my sinus cavities, and it seemed to work really well and left me feeling better temporarily.However, I'm pretty sure my misuse of this product made me go deaf for a while. In the video I watched, the woman demonstrated spraying up into the nostril while making a 'howking' sound/action, which forced the water through the sinuses and to the back of the throat. When I tried to repeat the motion as expertly as I could, forcing the water through and trying to suppress my gag reflex, I didn't think much of the fact that I was also filling up my middle ear with the rinse solution, forcing the solution up my Eustachian tubes.Today, when I read the directions, I can see a single sentence saying that if you feel water in your ears, to STOP using the rinse. Back then, thinking that I was doing it properly, looking back, I think I forced all that phlegm yuck and infected junk up into my middle ears, and filled them with a soup of toxic stuff about to be attacked by bacteria.Over the next several days after starting to use the product (incorrectly forcing the solution up my Eustachian tubes), my cold developed into bad sinus blockage headaches, then into an ear infection. One day, I found my middle ears were full of fluid (and toxic nastiness), were unable to drain through the Eustachian tubes, and at around lunchtime, the pressure became so great and painful that my eardrum ruptured. Later that night, my other eardrum ruptured, leaving me 95% deaf. My ENT doctor the next day told me that it was the worst ear infection he'd ever seen, and it took over 2 months to heal and regain my hearing.This is a great product, and I still have it, and will likely try it again to clear my sinuses, without the howking action that forced the solution into my inner ears. Without the howking action, it just sprayed up one side and comes down the other, as well as draining somewhat in the back of the throat as well. But be careful how you use it, and make sure you're learning to use it from the right source (the directions), because it can cause serious damage.

4:28 MinsMade a video to show shoppers what it looks like aside from pictures. Pretty happy with the product, but the spring is so strong that it's hard to manipulate the mount while on the go. Very good value, and good quality.Edit **A couple of months later**I leave this on my dashboard all the time, and the sticky ability to stay in place has been fading. It's such an annoyance to pry it apart with two hands to put my phone in there for watching and listening to videos, that now, this device mostly serves as a place to put my hats in the van. Very good for stacking hats on. But not really using it for its original purpose.Edit ** A Year Later **I don't use it for the phone anymore. Ever since it became dusty, the sticky is gone. It's still a paint to adjust on the go, and it just won't stay put anymore. Now it's an irregular hat holder. I can throw a hat on top of it when I'm in the vehicle, and it works for that.

I was so pleased to see when I received this item that it was based on the Walther/S&W P99. My girl and I purchased a couple of these after a fun evening playing shooting games in an arcade. Always looking for new ways to train for speed and accuracy of firearm handling, I thought this would be the bee's knees, especially when I found that it's design was the same pistol as my real gun.Unfortunately, despite the great quality of the product (great trigger pull too), the Wii, with its one sensor bar, is just not up to the level of technology required to be calibrated for accurate aiming at the screen. The cursor on screen cannot line up vertically with the gun sites (the cursor is always too high when the sensor is below the TV, and too low if the sensor is on top), and as you aim further and further to the left and right edges of the screen, the cursor goes farther and farther out of alignment horizontally to the outside.So, what this effectively ends up being is a Wii pointer in the shape of a gun, where the gun's sites are meaningless, and you end up aiming by using the cursor, which I guess is better for shooting games than just using the remote by itself. But if you're into firearms and you think that this will improve your ability to snap-shoot? It won't. At best, it'll just get you more comfortable with quickly maneuvering something in the shape of a handgun. And it's fun as hell for the kids.

2:55 MinsI love Condor products, but this was a dud in my opinion. Even though it looks nice and it's high quality, there's a lot of wasted space, and it's just not very practical for holding stuff efficiently.

See the picture I uploaded. These come in white, blue, yellow, green, and red. The label is only visible on one side. I did read the reviews first, but it wasn't THAT hard to figure out that to write on the labels, you had to remove the keyring (which acted as a retainer), then the piece of plastic, then the paper. The paper on the inside for writing on was a random mix it seemed of typical copier-type paper, and a slightly heavier and glossier stock paper.They're cheaply made, but will not disintegrate or anything when you touch them. They're sturdy enough for their purpose. For the value--the cost for 50 of these things--I'm very happy with the purchase. Note in the picture the size of them compared to the sharpie marker. It was hard to tell the size from all the different versions of this available on Amazon, but they're just right.

It's hard to tell from the title or description of this hat (the model number listed is even wrong), but this is an "Epoch" brand hat, model HE30. You can see the Epoch logo on the cloth band on the inside of the hat. If you research Epoch, you'll find that they don't have much of their own independent presence on the internet, but they're listed a lot on ebay as Epoch.I've been searching for good Fedoras for a couple of years now with no real hat stores where I live, and frequently play hat roulette on Amazon. My size is pretty big, and it's hard to find stuff that actually fits. Hats sized as "L/XL" are too small on me, and most "XL's" are too, so I have to go more by measurements, and that's a gamble too.I ordered an XL of this hat because it claimed an inner circumference of 24". It ended up fitting pretty perfect, maybe a tad loose. The hat itself is of good quality, soft, crushable, and easily as nice as many scalas, stetsons, and others I've seen. I have the black one, but if you ordered this in brown, it would fit in among the "Indiana Jones" style hats that are all over Amazon. If you look at the hats sold by Sakkas (no mention of the brand Epoch), or the listings for similar Epoch hats on Ebay, you'll see the technical specs vary a bit. The brim of this hat is 2.5".Satisfied. About to try another Epoch.Update - Even though it started a little too loose, it seemed to conform to my head a little better (tighten somehow?) and fits perfectly. I did end up trying to buy another Epoch hat from this vendor, a teardrop fedora with a 2" brim that similarly claimed a 24" circumference, but that one ended up too small. So sizing is still a gamble, even with this brand. But this particular hat, the HE30, was a gamble that paid off. It's my favorite hat now.

Bought this after looking everywhere for something to satisfy the concept of holding my pocketknife and a pen, possibly other pocketries. I have a Remington 3.5" folding knife that I use frequently, but have had a hard time finding something in which I could carry it on my belt. I carried it in (what could effectively be described as) a belt pouch for a while, but couldn't access it quickly. So I tried this, and it works pretty well.This EMT pouch has four compartments. A sleeve in the back (for scissors), which I keep empty, the velcro-flapped pouch in the middle, where my knife fits very well, and two different sized loop sleeves on each side, where in the picture you can see a flashlight and a pen.In reality, the 'flashlight' tube works perfectly for a typical click gel pen, and the tube showing a pen in the picture is too small for all but the thinnest pens. It would be nice if the tubes were the same size so I could carry two pens there, but as it is, all I carry in this pouch is my knife and one pen, and I'm fine with that. Good, tough fabric. Fairly satisfied.

Bought this so that I could put my company logo on it for the company kegorator.Started out okay, seemed decent quality. It was a little difficult to create the artwork for it because of the weird dimensions, but I ended up wrapping up a piece of paper, coiling and inserting it until it fit right, trimming the excess, and using that, once unrolled, to figure the dimensions for Photoshop (think a warped and curved trapezoid). After a little trial and error, I ended up creating a graphic for it that would fit once printed (in color) and cut to size, then voila--it was a cool tap handle for a while. I'll post a picture if I can.Not a month later, the threads on the inside, from frequent tapping and re-tightening, stripped, and now it's useless. But still pretty.

3:23 MinsPretty decent case. Bought it after Amazon suggested it for my FLIR I5 Thermal Imager. Great customization options.** Update One Year Later (ish) **I have several of these now. They're good cases, and fully customizable, even though once you elect to cut out and shape the open spaces (for stuff), once the foam is gone, it's gone. My first one was for the business, for the Thermal Imager. I've bought several others for demo cases for holding various stucco materials, etc., for in home sales. Not long ago, I ordered another one of these to make a case for my Oculus Rift DK2. As I've prepared several of these, I've taken to sliding the hard dividers into the perimeter areas of the foam, storing them between the foam and the case's shell, just so that I don't have to throw them away or keep them somewhere else. Pretty good cases. Good value.

Great hats. Bright, great material, high quality. I bought several for my marketers, and they look great combined with orange vests. However, I wear size 23 5/8 hats, and the largest size is far too small for my big 'ole head.

So, to be honest, I made my way here because I was looking for chew toys that would be good for adult humans. :)Incidentally, by boy was also born with problems that led to feeding issues and delayed oral development, problems with textures, etc. It took a long time to transition him to solid food, but he's a lot better now. Back then, we used those 'NUK' sticks, but this would have been a great item to help him if only it was more well-known. Never even heard about these things from feeding therapists or anyone else!Anyway, I purchased two. One for me, and one for him.As far as my son goes, he's currently 3 years old, and he's played with and chewed on this some, but hasn't been too interested in it. As I said, I wish I knew about these earlier. It's a great, high-quality chew, with multiple textures, and would have been very helpful in fixing all those oral problems. Would have been great for teething too, even earlier. This would have been far superior to teething rings and such.So for me. I've got some bad habits of eating when idle (even though I'm not hungry), and I've always chewed on pens, etc., so I had an idea some time back to find a good chew toy appropriate for a human mouth that could fill that need and avoid taking in the extra calories. Maybe burn off a little stress, too. Eventually I found my way to these 'grabbers', settled on this one, and I'm pretty happy with the product.Great quality. And the silicone it's made of is pretty invincible. Just so you know, this isn't like a hard rubber. It's CHEWY. Like chewing on soft rubber. I've been careful with the force I applied at first to avoid damaging it, but it seems no matter how hard I bite down, even with the sharp parts of my molars, it springs back, and the surface is totally unmarred. Although, I suspect I could damage it if I tried.So far it's fulfilled its purpose of something to chew on idly while at the computer. And it's had plenty of positive effects, which may be worth some consideration for all 'normal folks' who might think adult chew toys are weird.There really is something to the marketing of dog toys when they talk about cleaning a dog's teeth and strengthening their gums. As I chew on this, lots of things happen:- The little texture knobs press between my teeth and massage my gums.- My mouth produces saliva, which helps regulate the glands and also cleans my teeth.- The rubbery texture rubs against my tooth enamel and leaves my teeth feeling clean.- Obviously, chewing this grabber will strengthen your Masseter and Temporalis muscles, and probably the smaller jaw muscles, too. (Which makes the muscles a little sore for the first few days, as can be expected.)After I chewed on this for a while the first time, when I was finished with it, my gums felt like I just flossed 15 times, and my jaw felt like the alignment was different (straightened out). I've also taken the time to stretch my jaws apart after lots of chewing, since chewing on this was basically just the 'concentric phase' of an exercise, and I didn't want the muscles to tighten up. Going from 'never focusing on chewing' to suddenly 'lots of chewing' needs to be approached like any other exercise, including stretching and being careful not over-do it.We humans can probably get a lot out of regular chewing exercise just like dogs do. Apparently, TMJ (lockjaw) results from the atrophy of these muscles, and doctors have directed their TMJ patients to jaw exercises. So here's another thing we can do to keep a totally overlooked set of muscles healthy. A couple of days after I started chewing on this grabber, I flossed my teeth (I hardly ever floss; I know, I know), and the flossing didn't stress my gums AT ALL--because my gums had been exercising and were stronger.**Update**2012-12-26 - It's no longer a workout for my jaw (the muscles have grown stronger and adapted), but the silicone HAS weakened enough to where those time texture nubs have started coming off. The nubs are about 1/8" x 3/16" oval-shapes, not really a choking hazard.**Update**2012-12-30 - Haha ... so okay, the nubs have continued to come off, and now the silicone on the long end isn't as 'springy'. In fact, it's losing its structural integrity on the inside, and starting to split (from the inside out), so this definitely won't last much longer. I'm having to be more gentle with it now for fear of tearing it open.
