I could always chew on the loop end (as I idly chew on it, as you would a pen, while typing here), but that's pretty awkward to chew on without using your hands too.**Update**2013-01-27 - Okay, so this is good, but it won't last. From the last update to now, whenever the end starts 'fraying', I cut it back with some scissors. By now, this slightly 'P' shaped chew toy has become more of a 'U'. I can see it would be possible (but difficult) for a child to bite (vigorously pull) off a chuck big enough to be a choking hazard, but not likely. As a parent, you'd just have to monitor it every once and a while. The 'nubs' do break off eventually, whenever they're in the current focus area, but even though they might end up in your kid's mouth, they are too small to be a choking hazard. So your kiddo might get a few tony pieces of silicone in his tummy, but he won't choke on it. I suppose any chew toy, no matter how awesome, will wear down eventually.

Bought this as a gift for a friend who likes death metal. Upon receiving the package, I used it myself to prepare some files for him and evaluate the drive's performance.Quality of the outer housing is so-so. Novelty, obviously. But if you wanted a real flash drive, there's plenty of those out there to choose from, right? Well, there's a push switch on the backside of the skull which allows you to slide the drive port in and out of the housing on the bottom. The USB port attachment, which typically metal on nearly every single flash drive on the market, is just white nylon plastic. So delicate. Be careful. The speed is below average, showing around 2-3 MBps when writing files onto the drive.It's a fun gift, but for use as a flash drive it's mediocre at best (suitable if you don't care).

Cute elephant toy. Nice squeakers. It does have a few loose seams and strings that I had to tighten or cut, and it's not 22 inches. More like 18. But it is cheap, soft, and I like how the eyes are embroidered instead of hard plastic.

4:10 MinsComprehensive review of the pipe by video.Being able to deal with the pipe with just one hand instead of two is great, especially when reading or, say, messing with a smartphone like I was in this video.Took off one star because even though it's solid, I'm sure it could be more-so. After the videos, when I went to clean the pipe and tapped it upside down on the deck rail to clear the bowl, the stem came apart from the pipe where it was coupled between metal and plastic. Wondering how long that metal connection will stay tight, or if it'll loosen up over time. Will have to be careful with that part.Overall it seems to be a great value. And the detailing of the bowl is awesome.Shipped out fast, despite that it was NOT Amazon Prime. Ordered on the 8th, arrived on the 12th.2012-09-26 Update - The bowl is a little small. It'd be nice if it were bigger.

These wraps are a nice red/black pattern, and are good and soft, but have NO adhesive backing. I immediately initiated a return, and proceeded to have this wacky conversation with Bonnie of Crazy Cart:Return reason: Different from website descriptionBuyer comments: There is no adhesive backing, like the description clearly states. Please send me a prepaid shipping form, and I'll expect a full refund.First, they wanted a picture of the product, then after I sent it, they responded:- For this issue,we would like to issue you $2 as compensation. Is it fine?I said no, that I wanted a full refund.- For this issue,we would like to issue you $4 as compensation. Is it fine?I said no, that I wanted a full refund, because it was seller error.- For this issue,we would like to issue you $5 as compensation. Is it fine?I said no.- We have issued a full refund to you through amazon.com.

Very happy with my purpose. Fits great, comfortable, and easy to snap on and off. Looks great, soft leather, good craftsmanship. And the leather seems to be darkening as it gets wet, dries, etc. The little 'conquer' plaque is very crisp and shiny, and I find myself passing it on my sleeve from time to time to polish it.Great product, great company.

Take a look at the picture I uploaded up top.This hat is ... eh. Didn't fit quite right, was a bit too floppy. Hard to shape. In reality, the color was nowhere NEAR khaki. It was dark brown. The same typical dark brown / moose / chocolate color you see in lots of wool hats.returned.

2:24 MinsI wanted a wall-mounted gun-rack where the long arm would just sit in there unsecured. That way I wouldn't have to wrestle with any tight rubber clamps, or make a lot of noise, etc. This was the cheap option. Not perfect, but it works.

1:55 MinsGreat little card holder. Looks good, feels good. Good quality. Great value.Here's a video so you shoppers can see exactly what it looks like.** Update 2 1/2 Years Later **I've still got this case and carry it in my pocket full of business cards every day. It still snaps closed pretty securely. The leather shown in the picture are like panels of metal with the fake leather coating the outside, so the leather has worn away on the corners, revealing the metal underneath. The panel on the underside has warped a bit to be concave in a way that the corners are trying to pull away from the main body of the case. If I wanted to, I suppose I could pull up on a corner and rip the panel from the case. Don't know how strong it's held on there, but I won't test it. It's still functional, but not very pretty anymore. I typically carry about 12 cards inside.I also have a soft leather card holder that I use for secondary wallet stuff (store rewards cards, etc), which has rounded at the edges as its aged since it's soft. At least with this (reviewed) case, it composed mostly of metal, so it still protects the business cards just fine despite being so worn out.
Didn't work. I could tell it was getting power from the outlet, but the display had nothing, and no amount of finagling could produce any results. Dead on arrival. Crap.

It's nice. Brilliant white, sharp as hell, it is a Fedora more than some sort of Panama hat, so it you're looking for a white classic Fedora, this works. Lots of contradicting info in the reviews. But the brim IS just as long as in the picture. And the edges do snap, but not reliably. For mine, the back edge is snapped down, and if I try to snap it up, it snaps up the front too, so it's basically a turned-down brim--not like a Trilby like in the third picture. I put a feather in the side.Because it's straw, I've been terrified of how delicate it seems. When I try to pull it off or put it on with the pinch, I feel like I'm going to crease it and tear it, so I set it atop my head and push down into place from the sides. Pushing up from the sides under the brim is also how I take it off. I don't know if I CAN treat it like a normal hat and don't have to be so very careful with it, but it cracks and creaks with every move. Once I had an itch on my head, and my fingers went up to scratch it through the hat as a reflex, and CRUNCH. But the more I wear it, the more it seems to be softening up and seeming more sturdy. I also sprayed Scotch Guard on it in the beginning, which made it crackle a lot for a while whenever I touched it. But not anymore.The inside headband is an elastic cotton band. Works great, and holds it snug to your head. Sometimes TOO snug, but it loosens up. It seems the hat shrinks a bit in the heat. Some reviews say you don't have to worry too much about the size, and some say they got by well ordering a size down. Don't buy it. Order your size, or a tad larger if you're feeling adventurous. Which brings me to the bad point:(Oh, side tangent--mine also came in a box that was too narrow and making the brim curl up on the sides.)Dealing with the company and returns is a real pain. And if you don't fight for what's right, you'll be screwed. As you can see you have to pay for shipping. No Prime here. So my hat came to me, after I used the sizing chart, and was too small. The company actually expected me to pay for shipping again to send it back, and pay AGAIN to have the replacement hat sent back to me. That's THREE TIMES. Almost the price of the hat.Anyway, I got Amazon to give me a credit for the cost of shipping it back (good 'ole Amazon). Then Ultrafino (who I went back and forth with multiple times by email and phone, and they usually didn't answer their phone) intended to process and refund the old hat; told me to order the new size in the meantime. I paid the shipping for the second hat, since Amazon had already credited me the previous shipping. THEN I learn that Ultrafino only intended to refund me the purchase price of the first hat and KEEP the shipping charge I paid initially. So I got her to agree to refund the shipping too. Later, when the refund went back to my bank account, it was lacking the shipping charge, so I had to call back and have them refund me the additional amount. She said she'd process it that day. A week went by with no results. Finally after threatening to start a dispute with Amazon, she processed the additional refund for the original shipping.So finally, after a lot of haggling and hassling, I had a hat that fit me while only paying for the hat and shipping once. And I'll give Ultrafino credit for eventually agreeing to do the right thing, but they sure made it difficult.Great hat, but you'd better get it right the first time.
5:31 Mins

This hat is made the same way as the cheap 'Granule' brand mesh Ivy caps available at Wal-mart. I bought one of those for myself, and couldn't wear it because it was too uncomfortable.The more important thing, though, since I bought this for my son, is that it was way too big. He wears hats that fit 4-6 year olds, and this was way too big. So big in fact, with the stretch band, that I could almost stretch it over my XL adult head.So hard to find properly sized kid hats online.

This candle is the best I was able to find looking for a 'pine' candle on Amazon, since my local options were limited. It's pretty with the pine needle sprigs, etc., built into the gel at the bottom, and it's big enough to last a long time.The pine scent it gives off could definitely be stronger. Way too subtle and weak for me, for what I was looking for. But for $8.xx, it's a lot cheaper than Yankee candles and whatever else I was able to find, since it seems that pine candles aren't really available in big stores anymore.It's okay. Just bought a Yankee Candle (Balsam and Cedar) yesterday on their big sale day since this one wasn't quite what I was looking for.

I got this hat from Nordstrom's on sale at the beginning of Springtime. Top quality, stout and wide. It's a great quality hat, and I'd recommend it, although the more I get into hats, the more I think it's not really MY style. It has a cotton sweatband, but it otherwise unlined on the inside. On the inside, it's the same wool surface that's on the outside. So in Springtime and Summer, it's too hot. Will also upload a picture.Incidentally, I'm selling this one to clear out space for more hats. ;) This is a size XL, and it's in perfect condition. Contact me if interested.

Lately I've been searching all the Walmarts in town for this Fever wash, but couldn't find it anywhere. This package of 6 looks like the best value per ounce. When comparing to other packs sold online, make sure to check the total ounces of each container.This stuff is great. In a hot shower, using the soap creates an invigorating scent that I've always thought smells a lot like pine trees. Far superior to any other soaps I've used, simply because of the awesome smell during the washing.

This is a great guitar strap. It's soft and light, comfortable, secure, and has a nice print.You can see me wearing it on some of my videos on my music page:eddie patin dot com slash musicor user "fireandstonemusic" on facebook.
These screen protectors are just like the one you get when you buy Otterbox armor. Great film, sticky on one side, easy to apply. And there's THREE. For $1.25. Awesome.

I have a Martin 000cxe Acoustic-Electric. That means that the strap mount on the bottom is the same place where I plug in my cord.This strap was nice-looking, and the locking mechanism was a pretty cool thing. But it didn't work for my guitar at all. The bottom strap mount was too wide, and could fit the large area of the strap-lock where the lock ratcheted through, but it only made it one click, and wasn't enough to get a hold. Tried all sorts of ways to rig it to make it work, but it wasn't going to happen.The top mount is attached to my guitar at a bit of an angle, and when I locked the strap on (which locked on perfectly), the fact that the end of this strap, containing the mechanism is solid plastic (vs the soft bendy leather/whatever of normal straps), the strap lock did not conform to the guitar in an appropriate way, and stuck out awkwardly to the side.This while this strap is a nice concept, its application to my guitar absolutely didn't work. Returned and replaced with a normal strap.

Looks great, good quality. It's smaller than you'd think, and is a great size for pockets. Small enough to hold bills folded and folded again. Tight clip; tight enough that you have to pry it open a little with your fingernails. The Dollar Sign design does, however, get in the way slightly when trying to push your money into it because of the extreme end of the 'S' that can snag the bills a little. Happy with my purchase.Update:I still carry this around, but it's not working exactly as a money clip any more. Got tired of the folded bills eventually working their way loose, so now the money in there is also wrapped with a rubber band. And the edges are sharp and poke at my leg through the pocket liner. Eh.

This is definitely not 80 Lumens. The spot and concentration of the beam is much wimpier than it should be. I bought this to replace a Coleman that was somewhere between 75 and 90 Lumens, and that light TOTALLY put this light to shame. And the momentary switch of the tail-cap is very stiff--doesn't respond very well. Too easy to flicker accidentally when you fidget your thumb. I've definitely had better. Nothing tactical about this; I wouldn't trust it to use in tandem with a pistol.The metal housing is nice and solid, but the lens is obviously that cheap, thin plastic. The lanyard is low-quality, and is held on by a plastic collar, which I can see breaking in the future.Disappointing, but cheap enough (on sale for $20.xx) to avoid returning, and keep in a random 'I need a flashlight' place by the bed or whatever.

5:23 MinsYou'll have to excuse the quiet audio and initial poor lighting. Blackberry 9700's don't take great video, and it took me a round or two following the kids on the bike to realize that things would look a lot better if I actually turned the lights on. :/I didn't buy the YBike from Amazon, because I found a much better deal from a toy salesman selling his demo model. But this thing is cool. I bought this for my son, who's pretty small, just over two, and a bit behind on development from being born early and spending some time in the NICU. This kids in this video are my sister's, a little older than my son.Since I've taken this video, my son has tried the bike and is warming up to it. He's pretty young for it still, and a little tactily (spelling? 'relating to tactile contact') defensive. But he loves the bike. He's just getting comfortable mounting it, and is more comfortable pushing backwards than pulling forward. I know this will do great things for his balance. My son is just about (or right under) three feet tall, which means something like a 10-11 inch seat height, and he can sit on this just right, with his feet flat on the floor.Very sturdy toy. And a great thing to start with when the kids are still small and learning balance. Get a Strider or something later, when they've mastered movement of their own bodies. As you can see, however, even when they're older (the kids here are 4 and 6) and perfectly mobile, they still love these YBike Originals. They're a lot of fun. There's also a YBike Advanced, which is less stable and capable of going faster, turning sharper, etc., which I've recommended to my sister for the 4-year-old, who's having trouble figuring out the pedaling concept on a normal kid bike.

Great looking pendant.Came on a crappy cord. I had to make adjustments, add rings and a lobster clasp, as well as four metal beads (two of them silver) to weigh down the hammer, which wasn't all that heavy.Wearing Thor's Hammer to me is a warrior thing and a symbol of strength and perseverance. I've also seen Thor referred to as "The Sky God", which also has a unique meaning for me.
5:11 MinsEnjoy the video.Video taken with a Blackberry Bold 9700, which doesn't have that great of a camera, and the mic is even worse, so I apologize for the sporadic volume.

This modern version of some heaters that we already had is like a lot of new modern versions of things coming out lately ... wimpy.For its size, it just doesn't cut it. Not enough heat. Not enough power. Maybe it's trying to be more 'green' or something, but the same heater from a few years ago totally squashes this one in performance. Try another heater--this is a waste of money.Looks nice, though. It tries really hard, I guess. (Pats head.)

I bought this for my dad for Christmas, who's been on a cast-iron kick lately, buying skillets of various sizes and looking for a dutch oven. This book seemed to have the best reviews compared to similar titles, and promised to show techniques that could be helpful in becoming a skilled cast-iron cook.No techniques. It's a cookbook. Just another cookbook.

So for those of you who looked around all over for a high-vis parka, here it is. It's great, it's less expensive than a lot of alternatives.This IS ... since there's no way to really tell ... a shell parka only. There's no insulation, no fleece inside, no removable liner, etc. Just a shell. Seems to be very weather resistant, though that hasn't been put to the test for me yet. This is a 3/4 style jacket, so it goes down the legs a bit, far past the waist. And it looks very sharp.It could use better pockets. For work, it would be more convenient to have better-designed pockets. I've seen other models (or other year's versions) of this jacket that have, for instance, normal hand-warmer pockets behind the two big cargo pockets on the front. The cargo pockets are held only by a velcro top, and there's definitely room for more pockets (document pocket, etc.), but it only has the two.The wrists are elastic, and there's a hood that folds into the collar. The jacket has that type of zipper that has a pull on the top and the bottom, so you can have a varying degree of zippered area, or just zip it like normal and leave the bottom pull all the way at the bottom. There's a drawstring for pulling in at the waist and another at the very bottom. The snaps are plastic, and could be sturdier. Pretty good parka, though.I'd order a size up; it seems to run a little small. You'll also need room in there for insulation layers.

This is a pretty lousy gaiter. It's made of thin, stretchy material (approaching semi-transparency). For times when you actually NEED a neck gaiter, you'll need something more. And it can only really work as a gaiter or a headband, there's NO WAY this will stretch or stay in place to the point where you can use it as a balaclava, or some of the other multiple uses it claims it can be used for. El cheapo.Returned.

3:15 MinsI totally forgot to say something VERY important in this video when I was talking about sizing issues with a previous order of the Trail version of the Minimus, and got side-tracked by talking about the sole or something. But take note. I normally wear size 9 4E shoes. I've ordered the Minimus in the past (direct from New Balance), and ordered a 9.5 2E (the widest these get), but it wasn't big enough--they caused foot pain. With THESE Minimus MX20's, I ordered a FULL SIZE higher than I normally wear. 10 2E. And that seemed to do it. No pain. So, wide feet? Go a full size up.If I end up having problems with these shoes later on, I'll update this description. Enjoy the video.Notes added as time goes by:- The shoes are so light, it's like I'm wearing slippers or water shoes.- Ground feel is considerably less sensitive than true minimalist shoes like Vibrams, but still more sensitive than normal shoes.- On this particular model, the circle-patterned soles don't have much in the way of traction. Very slippery on ice.2012-07-01 - Still wearing these shoes on a daily basis. Still super comfy. Holding up well, minimal wear on the soles.2012-09-16 - Still wearing daily. Seams, stitching, fabric, mesh--all holding up fantastic. No unraveling starting anywhere. The ONLY wear this shoes has been taking is the soles wearing down. Probably at about 50% now. Still plenty wearable, but will soon be flat, therefore no grip. Didn't really have any grip to begin with on slippery surfaces, so once the snows come, these will be put away until next year, I think. Still happy with them, still comfortable. Great for everyday life, great for working out.2012-11-01 - With the onset of winter, I've stopped wearing these shoes daily because they're totally vulnerable to water, and (as I remember from last winter) have no traction in slippery conditions. Back to 'normal' New Balance cross-trainers.2012-12-15 - Incidentally, I've noticed over the course of the year with these shoes, that I've developed some heavy callouses/bosses above some toe joints, and I was starting to experience serious pain/inflammation of the joint where my big toe connects with my foot. I thought I might have been developing GOUT for some reason. Now that I've been wearing 'normal' shoes for the last month or so, that joint pain is gone, and the callouses are going away. I don't think these shoes were good for me in the long run.

6:49 MinsVideo showing various capabilities of the camera.Something I forgot to mention in this video: this is a webcam, so make sure you follow the directions for the install, or it might not work right with the software, etc. Following the directions meaning: Put the CD in first, then plug the camera in during the installation when it asks you to. Don't plug the camera in before you start the installation.Great camera. Enjoy the vid.Updated annoyances:- The software does weird stuff if you've got a two monitor setup. Clicking between different 'mode' will make the interface window JUMP back and forth between both screens. Just an annoyance.- The Audio mic is okay, but not as nice as I originally thought. After I've made a few acoustic music videos for YouTube, I've been annoyed by the mic's distortion and splash when I hit high notes or sing loudly. Also, whenever you turn the cam software on, "right sound" is checked on by default, which applies a weird low-quality compressor and noise gate to the recorded audio, which means that if you're playing guitar and singing, those filters will destroy the result. Which is also really annoying, especially if you forget it on when you record a song, finally get through an entire take, then watch the video--and "Right Sound" screwed it up.

I was concerned that this cartridge might have inferior printing capabilities than buying a Dell cartridge, or a refurbished cartridge, or whatever, but it's totally fine. Definitely the best value. When it came in the mail, I had no trouble installing it, and it was printing fine (no discrepancies), and still is. This is a good cartridge for the Dell 1100.

Ordered this for my two-year-old son. I was a little surprised--it was a little smaller than I thought it would be for some reason, but it's a great toy. Very attractive and clean, cuddly and comfortable. Great price. Definitely recommend.

Received a Coby Kyros MID8125-4G as a gift, and MAN it's been hard to find aftermarket stuff for it. Well, after much research, and seeing another few reviews, it looks like THIS was the case for the 8125. Although I wasn't totally sure until I received it and put the tablet inside.It works. It's pretty nice. I didn't have to do anything funky with USB settings or anything for the keyboard to work. The fact that it has a 'prop' on the outside of the tablet side is kind of nice--makes the tablet into something like a laptop. Construction seems good enough, and the keyboard, while small, is definitely a step up from using the touchscreen keyboard, which is even smaller.Pros:- Has two loops on the inner binding for attaching a couple of styluses. (One is included.)- Nice vinyl / semi-leather feel and look.Cons:- This was designed with no thought to where the cable connecting the keyboard to the tablet will be stuffed away and rest. Not to mention the USB female to Mini-USB Male adapter (comes with your 8125, is required to hook up the keyboard). So when it's closed up, you can keep the cable in the binding (sort of) with the dongle just hanging out like a bookmark. And the adapter cable? Who knows where that could fit. Hang out the other side if you're patient enough to close it right. It would have been REAL nice to make some sort of pouch built in somewhere to hold the cables, because there's nowhere for them to go away to.- The magnetic closure is weak, especially when you've got the cover jammed shut over a couple of ill-fitting cables with nowhere to go. I saw another reviewer solved this problem by adding a velcro dot. I'll probably do that too.- No USB power is routed to this keyboard, which means the Caps lock, Num lock, and Scroll lock don't work. Which isn't really a big deal, because you don't need them anyway. There's still a 'shift' key after all.- Definitely adds a lot of size/bulk to the tablet. Not as slick and thin to carry around anymore.Overall not bad, with a really annoying flaw. It'd be nice to see another option on the market out there.

1:00 MinsFor a while I was trying to figure out a way to replace my old Remington 870 furniture with something synthetic, AND figure out a way to put a good light on there. After looking over all manner of replacement stocks and forends, usually packaged together, along with lights with pressure switches that need to be mounted on the magazine tube, etc., I ended up going this route for a few reasons:- Replacing the furniture with a full stock/forend set, especially if I wanted Speed-feed or something AND a decent light (and mount) would be almost $200 or so for decent quality. What I ended up doing cost me a little over $80.- Replacing the old (SOLID) wood stock with something new would reduce the ability to use the stock as a blunt weapon, especially if I got one of those flimsy tactical AR types.- Most forends with rails were TOO tactical, which would be uncomfortable to use (full rails), or too heavy, and getting a pressure switch light would mean another mount and a cord hanging to get caught up in the action. A major advantage of a shotgun is SPEED, so I wanted to keep it light and fast and not be a gear ninja (mall ninja, gear whore--whatever).This stock is great. Good value, looks fantastic, and good rails that aren't overwhelming. It would be nice if the grip had a more 'rubbery' feel than 'plasticy', but it's okay. I ended up mounting the light on the left rail, back enough where I can easily manipulate the switch with my thumb.The light is also reviewed here:NEBO PROTEC ELITE HP230 - weapon light

1:00 MinsJust got this light in the mail today, so I haven't shock-tested it yet. That said, I looked at a LOT of lights before I ordered one, basing my choice on reviews, lumens, features, price, being low-profile, as well as suited for my needs: to put a light on a shotgun that was simple, cheap, reliable, and would keep my shotgun light and fast (don't want to be a farkle ninja).The first thing I noticed about the light is that it's made of aircraft aluminum, where it appears to be plastic in the pictures (I should have read closer, I suppose), and feels very sturdy.Oddities:- It comes with two back-plates (for the batteries). Don't know why. They don't seem to have different effects or anything--it's almost as if they gave you a backup for some reason.- When you're putting the batteries in, the O-Ring isn't seated very well, and falls/folds/slides in with the batteries or out of place pretty easy, so you must use surgical precision when putting in the batteries. No big deal, though.There are three different light modes: bright (full lumens), less bright (still pretty bright--maybe half lumens), and strobe, and you must cycle through these (which is a slight annoyance to me, but I don't know of any alternative). The switch is a revolving switch, kind of like the cylinder on a revolver, on the back end. Which you can cycle through it (click, click, click) to keep the light on or off, or just push it slightly with your finger/thumb in one direction or the other to have a momentary effect. Even if you push it momentarily without clicking it into the next position, it still cycles through bright/dim/strobe. This means I'll ahve to get very familiar with using it, so I'll always know the order if I'm stalking around or something and suddenly want to use the strobe, for instance.Fits great on a pistol, and is super easy to use with your off-hand index finger. Putting it on my similarly new Mako Forend for my Remington 870 shotgun (what I purchased the light for), on the left-side short rail, it's pretty easy to operate with my thumb. Also easy enough to cycle the action while holding the switch as a momentary light.Compared to other lights I read reviews about, it looks like this light is more likely to hold up to the shock. If it doesn't, I'll update this in the future.Great value.P.S. - Here's the forend that I reviewed separately:Mako Remington 870 Handguards with 3 Rails

This is the kind of clip you feed through your belt so that there's no chance of the clip slipping off and you losing your keys. It fit through my 1.5" belt with a little room to spare. (Maybe goes up to a 1.75"?)With my shirt un-tucked, it rubs against my belly from time to time in an annoying way, but it's no big deal, really. It would be nice if you could get the black version on Amazon.Cheap, effective, good quality, holds keys very securely (not going anywhere), and fairly easy to remove the keys when you want to. Good buy.Update:This clip is great. I now have two, so I don't have to switch it when I alternate pants/shorts.HOWEVER ... the metal edge, unless you're tucking your shirt in, will press up against your belly sometimes, which is definitely uncomfortable. Of course, I have a big belly. Maybe skinny folks won't have that problem. I've lessened the annoyance lately by wrapping the upper edge in a sort of soft-sided tape (you know ... those strips of felt-tape stuff you put inside bicycle helmets?).Update:There's definitely better out there. I got tired of relining the outside with tape-backed foam (to avoid stabbing my belly with the metal edge), and one of the two I had broken. The metal clip part actually snapped one night when I tried to attach my keys.This is what I bought to replace this clip, and I'm very happy with it:Bianchi Accumold 7405K Belt Keeper with Key Holder, Black

So when looking into the whole 'EDC' phenomenon, which I fell into as I was looking into options for something like a 'belt-pouch', I came across this along with the bazillion other similar models from Maxpedition.My purpose was to move everything from my pockets to a compact pouch I wanted to wear on my belt. Max's EDC pouches seemed good at first, but they opened sideways (from a belt), and also needed modification to wear on a belt. The H-1 was another option, but it was velcro only, and I wanted a secure snap. The M-2 looked good but maybe too small. I was also worried that this M-1 might be too big (look stupid and get in the way), and then I was worried that it might be too small for ~everything~ I carry.Got it in the mail today, and it's awesome. It looks great and has great construction (of course, from Maxpedition). I got the foliage color which was on sale. The belt loop is very stout. AND ... I was able to fit all of my 'pocketries' with a little room to spare. Doesn't stand out--looks like a camera case or something. Doesn't look dorky, but maybe it just doesn't look dorky to me. ;)Was able to fit:Front- Wallet- Blackberry Bold 9700 with armorBack main- Keys- Pens- Comb- Knife- Chap-stick- Business card holder with biz cards and rarely-used plastic cards- Some folded up paperworkI'm not using up all of the space. I'd like to still fit a pocket notebook in there, a tiny nail clipper, and maybe a thin flashlight. Pretty comfortable, but it'll take some getting used to to wear it all the time. I intend to modify it by attaching a cut piece of soft Velcro to the hook side of the flap Velcro, rendering said Velcro nonoperational. (Don't want to hear RIIIIIIIIPPPPP every time I have to access my phone or wallet. The clip is sufficient.) Currently not using the 'secret belt loop pouch', or the small front zippered pouch. It'd be nice if it had some outer pen-holder-loops like the M-2. The pens inside the main pouch will slow down getting to my keys, which will be a problem if I'm ever trying to escape a raging werewolf by quickly getting into my car.This will work well for carrying stuff on a belt. I'm glad I got the M-1 instead of another model.

This was a pricey carafe. And it's attractive as hell. But still, only keeps coffee at a reasonable temp for maybe less than a day. Which might seem like a long time compared to most other carafes available on Amazon, but I once had a carafe that would keep coffee hot for over two days and warm for another.I wouldn't buy it again, because of its price. I'd have to buy it again if I wanted to use it again, because the life of my carafe was cut short by a short fall. Bringing this carafe full of coffee with me on a road trip, I went to open the door where it (and other stuff) was, it had shifted during travel, and it fell maybe two feet from my little car to the ground. Boom/shatter! After picking it up, I could here what sounded like ice water sluicing around in there. The insides had totally shattered and mingled with the coffee. Very delicate. Dead carafe.

This is a great clipboard for door-to-door work in the dark.The material clip is strong, and the rubber corners hold. Tried and true design on many clipboards, and works better than metal-only clips. The retainer-clip at the bottom (that holds the inner compartment closed) functions better than a lot of those hinged-snap closures out there.The light is fantastic. It locks into place, looks great, and showing people your papers on a dark porch, lit up by the four lights ... looks freakin awesome. Very flashy. And practical. Lighting up (white) paper does offer a bit of glare that hurts night vision, but I'll try putting some clear tape over the lights, marked with red sharpie--see if that helps.I also like the way waiting for someone to open their door on a dark porch, with the light on and holding the clipboard in front of me ... makes me glow. ;) If I can't see a doorbell hiding in the dark, I'll just angle the clipboard to light my search, or angle the light to watch my footing when I leave.Typical space in the compartment, though no specific 'pen holder' area.The batteries that came with it were totally dead.Love this clipboard.--UPDATE 2012 February--Months later, I still love this clipboard. I did drop it once, and it fell hard, which seemed to jostle the electronics to the light had a loose connection, but whacking it a few times with my palm seemed to fix it, and the light's still fine. I'm also still on the ORIGINAL set of AAA batteries I put in back in October, and I use this light constantly on for 2 hours or more a night, 2-3 nights a week.

This was a good buy.  I don't like it when people handle my hose and it kinks.  I like my hose to be stretched to the limit, bent, pulled, and jerked this way and that without incurring any damage or denting.With this, you can let anyone yank on your hose and wrap it around their hands or arms.  Your hose won't crack or kink.And when it's turned on, the water just gushes freely.  No obstructions, unless--god forbid--you get stones in there.  Then you'll have to seek the help of a professional.  Or just chop your hose off at the rocks.If you are looking to really spray far and wide with your hose, this is the one to buy.  50 ft long!  You can pull your hose to its fullest length, run in circles with it in your hand, or just toss it around.  It will not kink or leak.Also, ladies, this one is light weight.  So don't shy away from the hose.  It's perfect for gardening and gutter cleaning.Great hose!

Not well-made, but the toys resemble their counterparts.  And the voice acting is perfect, clear and loud enough.  Not annoyingly loud.  Just perfect.The toy should be priced at half what is now, but business is not fair.  If your little pig loves Peppa, give it a try.  If he/she is rough, do NOT buy it.  It will break.  Cheap plastic.

These coffees are weak in comparison to the Death Wish brand or even the Kicking Horse brand.  Three Peckered is extremely light, like drinking watery hotel coffee.  So, brew it extra strong.  Then it becomes palatable.  Resurrection is weak but tastes very nice and smooth.  Dead Man's Reach is the a medium strength roast that has a little more flavor.No acidity.  Good taste.  Mediocre at worst.  If you like a smoother, gentler coffee, these three will do.Better stronger coffees are the Death Wish, Valhalla Java, and Kicking Horse varieties.

Year Four ends weakly.  Very disappointing.  Very bland.  This year is marked by some fun moments, great battles, and deaths.  Yet it never gets rolling like the past years, and the very end is quite literally ...boring.  But as a whole, the Injustice saga is great reading.  And the art is fantastic in every issue!  Hoping Year Five is interesting and entertaining.  The first three were incredible.  Buy them.  Year 4 you can skip.

Very good book.  Does justice to the franchise.  The scenes are exciting and informative without info dumping.  Just enough description to imagine the settings and characters--but just enough.  If you are a Predator, Aliens, or Prometheus fanatic, read this.  Takes us far into the future of humanity, where space is a new frontier full of scary things.

I know the author meant well, but this was a waste of time.  Like reading platitudes on writing websites.  There is truly nothing novel here.  It's a short book, like having a conversation with an aspiring writer--but you have to pay for the conversation.No.  This is not a useful book.You want to write well?  Check out Stephen King's book, David Morrell's book, Chuck Wendig's books, and Self-Editing for Fiction Writers.

As long as you realize this is not a "how to" book, you will get a lot out of this.  This book is for people who are searching for a reason to write, a passage through emotional or creative blocks, or reasonable "permission" to write.  You will come through this book feeling like you have a right to write.  If nothing else.  And your new-found freedom will affect both your writing itself and the chances of your writing affecting others.It's an important book.  It's not FOR WRITERS, so much as it is FOR WRITING.  Thus for everyone, no matter your education or career.  You will come to understand that what you have to say matters.  And maybe others need to read it!

Interesting book about a strange man who was rejected by his people, became angry, and started a "religion" which would ruin the lives of millions.  From a man who had visions of Gabriel, Muhammad became a pedophile warlord gaining followers through violence and the promise of loot.An insightful look into the man who created an evil we deal with today.  An evil which threatens the very freedom of America, the sanity of the developed world, and the lives of our women and children.The similarities between Nazis and Islam are interesting.  I think this book reveals how a weak-minded man--like Hitler--caused such chaos and violence and terror, that the reverberations of his insanity are felt today in the Middle East and Worldwide.Buy this book. Then check out Spencer's other books.  Buy Brigitte Gabriel's books too.Good sources of information on the Muslim Jihads and creeping Sharia Law fanatics who desire the subjugation or death of us Infidels.  We "Dhimmis" or second class filth human beings.

Excellent and succinct overview of the most evil religion to ever plague mankind.  If you really want to know where the Muslims are coming from, how they lie using "Taqiyya," how corrupt a pedophile Muhammad was, and how "abrogation' allows Islam to hate us all, BUY THIS BOOK.Never more has there been a need to understand the ghastly religion of "peace."  Great writing.  Great research.  Straight of of the unholy and accursed Quran.

Ok, thiis definitely a teen movie.  Not a mature comedy in any way.  The laughs come every so often.  But in between the laughs are horrible, unending renditions of songs!  They don't shut up.  Song after song.  It drones on and on and ruins the movie for any but the most devoted musical fans, in my opinion.It's just simply not worth enduring the terrible music for a few giggles.  And the plot is simplistic and hackneyed.  Nothing new here.  Same old gags and plot twists.If you are 12, this will be a giggle fest.  If you are an adult, it will feel like American Idol is on at full volume and there is no off button on your TV.

Look, it's not the original in any way.  It is informed by the original one.  You'll catch a lot of re-used or updated ideas in this film, which is like finding an Easter Egg.  But after a while, the movie has to stand on its own.  It barely does.  Let me explain:If you have never seen the original, this movie will be a nice scary treat.  If you have seen the original, this will be a neat curiosity.  In either case, you do NOT want to waste money buying this.One reason for this is the writing.  The characters accept some insane paranormal situations with ease.  They hop to action as if it's no big deal to enter another dimension filled with nasty spirits.  People smile or giggle at the most inappropriate times.  They make cute jokes.  The teen is made out to be a useless bizzotch, yet the little boy is quite a cool character.  Which makes no sense, in my opinion.  If your sister was inside a TV, you would take things seriously and be on the verge of a mental breakdown.The effects are excellent.  They are not explained at all.  The acting is wonderful.  But the dialogue and lack of development in some scenes really ruins the mood.It's as if the movie could not decide if it wanted to be funny and campy or serious horror--which, as we all know, spells death for a horror movie.When writing a moving genre film you really have to have the characters take things seriously to make it scary.  You have to have people acting realistically.  This movie fails to do so.But if it's your first dip into this kind of film, go for it.  It has a few scares and freaky moments.  If you're a veteran, pass it by.

True Blood starts out strong, mysterious, and sexy.  The series then devolves into a sex romp soap opera.  Then devolves again into a sort of Kardashian nightmare--everybody at the party is a weirdo.  Then it becomes like when you wake up to Kanye's face and realize what you have done, but it's too late.  You have to finish what you started.It's a great show that lost gas and failed, in my opinion.  The first two seasons are worth watching, definitely.  Not for kids.

Teeny tiny Trump book.  You can carry it in your pocket, your purse, your navel, your shoe--yeah, it's tiny.  But it reads just like Trump is sitting across the table from you.  Straight to the point advice, in his manner of speaking.  No fluff.  No elaboration.  Each chapter starts with a profound quote.  The book gives you a small window (pun intended) into Trump's mindset.  It also helps you think like a winner.  Simple truths, simply expressed, that can be implemented in simple ways starting immediately.  It's like conversation after Sunday dinner with your wise grandfather.BUY IT.  OR YOU'RE FIRED!

The BEST of the series.  It should really end here.  This movie was NON-STOP action.  And inventive, interesting action at that.  You are going to watch without blinking, with mouth wide open.  The dangerous predicaments are thrilling.  The hand-to-hand combat is insanely fun and complex.  The dialogue is well-written.  Nothing corny.  The plot twists and turns at such a fast pace, until its pile-up of a climax leaves you breathless.  Its resolution includes a touching tribute to Paul Walker (RIP) that breaks the wall between viewer, actor, and character.  Beautiful.BUY IT NOW.  Trust me.  That rental fee will be a waste of money, because you are going to want to re-watch the spectacular stunts and combat in this baby!

This Avengers has its peaks and valleys.  It's a high-quality middle-of-the-road movie.  The effects are great, but you are clearly watching CGI-flooded scenes way too much.  It gets exhausting.  The story is not that deep, but it has a lot of action.  The dialogue is not memorable, and it gets lame at times.Ultron is a a maniacal lounge singer.  Just does not seem to fit with the Ultron from the comics, but Spade is amazing, so he brings a new life to the villain.A running joke about Cap just gets beaten like an old dead fish, over and over.  It wasn't funny to begin with.Yet this is a safe superhero movie for the kids.  Nothing taxing on the brain.  Nothing overwehelmingly exciting or exotic.  It's just a well-done romp through a few Marvel characters' lives with a boat-load of effects and action.Not bad, not great.  Wouldn't buy it.  Once you see it, there is not much to re-see.  I expected more.  Most of the effort went into effects, not writing.  That is clear.  But should I really complain?  It was entertaining!3.5 Stars

Truly a sequel to all the movies, especially the first Terminator, in every way!  Incredible action worth watching again and again.  Special effects that make you question whether you are viewing Arnold or not.  An intriguing, believable,and thrilling story.  Plus, the acting could not have been better!  Arnold is at his best, with poignant expressions and smoothly delivered dialogue.  He is the Terminator evolved.  Very interesting.  And Jai Courtney's giant head never ruined one scene.  I think, while he is no Michael Biehn, Jai delivered a powerful performance.The story has so many memorable moments and twists!  BUY THIS movie if you love the series.  It has jaw-dropping turns, heartwarming revelations, and even some well-done comedy.  A robotic masterpiece.

Now this is a funny spy movie.  Terrific cast.  McCarthy and Statham steal the movie, though.  Both hilarious.  Quite a few zingers and bazingas and witty remarks to make you giggle.  Then the big laughs arrive in plot twists and visuals or in simple key conversations.The great thing with Spy is that the plot thickens and so do the laughs!  This movie builds, so that it is funnier in the end than in the beginning.  It ends well, and you will appreciate every weirdo character you have met along the way.Spy is also a pretty great action movie.  Even McCarthy gets it on tough guy style.  You're going to enjoy this fun, witty film.

Utter anime crap, complete with terrible voice-to-character animation, horrible stretchy action scenes, and Japanese haircuts for all.  I thought I saw Speed Racer characters pop up during this movie.  It was a sad, sad joke of a "Marvel" movie.  No one--I mean NO ONE--was in character.  They made Black Widow act like a sassy Voltron pilot.  They made the Punisher a weak, Pokemon herder of a man.How can ANY artists FAIL to understand the Marvel universe so COMPLETELY?  This movie is an abomination to comic lovers.  Terribly animated, terribly voiced, and terribly written!Before you make a MOVIE about beloved characters, READ THEIR COMICS.

Very good quality incense.  Actually smells like cedar!  Gives you that campfire feeling with a deep, rich smoke that is unmistakably cedar.  Very relaxing.  It's strong, though, so don't inhale with gusto on your first burn.

I have to say I am amazed at how far these babies stretch!  They came and I sighed in defeat, because they look so small.  But nope, they fit perfectly.  They are surprisingly sturdy.  Even stretched they do not become paper thin, ready to rip.  I used them to replace the pads on my Sony MDR-IF240RK Wireless Headphone System.

Two great coffees, perfect together.  These coffees are strong and never get acidic if brewed extra dark.  Valhalla Java tastes the best, has more nuance to it.  Death Wish is a sort of straight-forward dark deliciousness.  Nothing soft or sweet about these bad boys.  They make a tough cup of Joe that tastes good.  I will say that, if you make them too light, they lose a lot of their flavor, IMO.  Valhalla also seems to have a better caffeine punch in the face.Buy it.  Brew it.  Die happy.

Very neat paper.  The pages will never fall out of this tough little book, yet they rip out easily!  Maybe I'm lucky, but this one is well-made.  The paper is thick and coarse.  If you use a pencil on it, just be sure you don't need to erase too much.  It's like grooming a paper dog.  Strands come up.  But it's not messy.  Just . . . fibrous.  :)This is a great notebook for ideas or art or dreams, etc. that you want to keep for a long time.  It absorbs ink so well, that writing in pen is its own little pleasure.  But again, I'd only use this for writing you intend to keep.Also, the paper's surface is uneven, so drawing might not be a good idea.  Sketching would be impossible.  But who would want to cover the interesting strands of god-knows-what that give each page so much character?

They do not smell like pine trees, but more of a pleasant perfume.  Do not get this if you want that hardy, powerful tone of pine in your incense.  That said, it is very pleasant.  Not too "chemically" or cloyingly sweet.  It will set the mood to relax.  It's just not going to feel like you are in the forest.  More like in a well-ventilated perfume shop.

Very good book if you are seeking to make changes, but feel overwhelmed.  This book will encourage you to think small so that you can build BIG.  The paradox is powerful.  It works.  The book is well-written.  No real stuffing or boring parts.  It's useful.  Buy it now.  :)
Excellent app.  Excellent site.  Love it.  Good articles, comprehensive entries, clear speaking voices.  Nothing to complain about.  Frankly, it should not be free!  SHHHHHH!

Much better than you think it will be!  Well-done, enthralling Western.  The performances are amazing.  The settings perfect.  The story emotionally charged and thrilling.  This is a revenge story that pretty much hits all the notes it needs to.  Mads is incredible, as usual.This is an example of what true artists can do with smaller casts, great scenery, and good writing.  This is a damn good story, plain and simple.  The kind of story that leaves you wanting to know more about the characters, and sad that movies can only be so long.Watch it.  It's right up there with Slow West, Echoes of War, 3:10 to Yuma, True Grit, and Appaloosa.

This movie is pretty bad, but mostly because of its pacing and depressing atmosphere.  If you ever wanted to know why people hate or fear communism, watch this movie.  It is a slow and grueling and sad mystery which unfolds at the pace of a bout of constipation.Yet the acting is absolutely incredible.  If you're an actor, watch this.  Incredible performances.  More said in a facial expression than in a line of dialogue!  I find that beautiful and impressive.The settings and costumes were perfect.  This film really had the ability to be a major piece of historical entertainment.  It just drags on and on.  That coupled with the horribly depressing lifestyles of people under a communist regime make Child 44 hard to watch--hard to finish, frankly.But maybe it's just me!  I think you have to be "in the mood" for a film like this.  Try it.

This movie has a bunch of great actors, a neat idea, and an eerily 1981 feel to its settings.  I wanted to like it, but the plot moves really slowly, nothing much happens, and the soundtrack is an array of ANNOYING synthesizer sounds.  Seriously, the music sounds like it was played by a hobo who broke into a church late at night.  Just terrible.  Not spooky.  Imagine a mix between early horror movie soundtracks and early adult movie soundtracks, played with no skill.  Yuck.

Great idea, simply not executed well at all.  It's a shame too, because they had talented actors and a reasonable budget.  But this movie gets boring rather quickly.  If you want to see radical Islamic terrorists getting what they deserve, watch American Sniper and Lone Survivor and maybe the series Homeland.  The first two are TRUE stories to boot, so they are awesome.  Plus, you can read their books of the same titles.Bless America.  Support the troops.  Even a simple care package means a lot.  Just don't include THIS movie.

Fantastic post Civil War western.  The acting is perfect.  The settings beautiful and accurate.  If you enjoy learning about this time period, Echoes will transport you back to how it was for some people.You will not see what is coming.  The characters are interesting and reveal themselves layer by layer--which of course leads to some troubling effects.  The plot is well-written, interesting, and keeps you in this dull moment of tension that never ends.  Speaking of the ending, good luck predicting it.This is a thinking person's movie, but when the action happens it is gratifying--and bloody.Great movie.  Slowly paced, but full of tension.  With a thoughtful, emotional ending.A similarly great movie, just released,  is Slow West.

Incredible acting, settings, set pieces, and special effects during bombing runs.  Unfortunately, this movie just gets boring.  It drags on like constipation at a wedding.  This movie is like all of the slow parts of Saving Private Ryan scrunched together.  With flashbacks.  As we know, flashbacks kill momentum and get boring--even if they ARE sometimes about an Italian family.I hear the book is a much more valuable piece of history, and quite entertaining.  Check that out instead.

Low budget boring film with amateur actors.  Low budget, like this was done on someone's allowance.  The cover of this movie is way more professional than the movie itself.  I suggest you stare at the cover and imagine your own tale.That said, a few good ideas that simply could not be accomplished with the cast and money allowed.

Nice try, but this movie gets stale pretty fast.  Like a Mummy's armpit.  The acting is great.  It starts out strong, creepy, and plausible.  But soon we run into silly vermin that change sides later in the movie.  We meet with some SyFy Channel special effects that do NOT impress.  And of course a very LOOSE and tenuous connection to the Book of the Dead.  The hieroglyphs are redundant and child-like.  The plot really does not engage your mind.The story would have been better if they veered into the alien angle they threw around in the beginning.  Instead it gets very cheesy in a mythological manner.  And then the mythology is not really given any rhyme or reason for existing.  Furthermore, the movie turns an Egyptian god into a borderline mentally-retarded beast.POSSIBLE SPOILERS AHEAD, MATEYS!I cannot understand the super-strong kitty cats who live in the pyramid by eating each other.  How silly.  They attack the characters for half the movie, then attack the dumb god who is killing everyone too.  Then we have a god who cannot figure out his way out of the pyramid!  WHAT!?!  But an Egyptian soldier by himself, a bunch of nerdy scientists, and a pair of clueless film makers CAN?  Ughh.Sorry, but a three-sided pyramid does not make a right.  Only watch this if you are bored.  A better horror movie out now on video is Exists.  Check that out.

Wow!  This movie delivers a realistic plot, some oh-snap unexpected scares, a steady revelation of the creature, a third act that moves like lightning and scares the hell out of you, AND a final reveal that is frighteningly believable.  Great twist.  Great creature design.  Great ending.Really surprised how good this movie is.  It's not a Blair Witch headache camera bobbing experience, but a more acceptable and easy-on-the-eyes "caught on film" movie.  Well done creative camera work.One flaw: Don't have the black guy refer to himself as the black guy.  It's 2015.

This really is a fantastic gift for anyone who loves the WWE.  The book covers Legends from the days of WWF, as well as current WWE stars, and upcoming NXT stars.  The art is fantastic.  The factoids are entertaining.  The bios are short and sweet.  It's really a quick read for adults or an excellent intro to WWE for kids.  This book makes the athletes of the WWE seem like superheroes, and frankly some of them are the closest you CAN get to real superheroes.  Neville, Andre, Stone Cold, Snuka, Piper, Warrior?  I'll take those guys into a battle against aliens any day.Oh, and guess what?  Hulk Hogan exists.  No matter what the WWE says.  And he looks awesome in this book.R.I.P. Hot RodR.I.P. Ultimate Warrior

While the acting was excellent and the story is plausible, the movie never gets very exciting or interesting.  Penn is in amazing shape and even surfs for no reason in the film, and its great to see him in an action movie.  But the action is sparse.  The story drones on.I'd love to see Penn in a well-thought-out action movie, spy thriller, or even a superhero movie, because the guy is pretty amazing when the action starts.  And of course he's one of our best actors.  But this movie fizzles out like an old Alka Seltzer.  Boring.If Die Hard is a an exciting roller coaster, the Gunman is a Sunday drive with Grandpa.

Like a sexy night with the Wall Street Journal and a 40 oz, this one starts off slow and gets crazy.  The laughs build.  The characters change, but not in the corny hack writing ways of other comedies.  Also, a bunch of minor characters pop up to make you laugh.  There are a few twists you won't see coming, but you will die laughing.  These guys go on an adventure that bring them up close and WAY too personal with gangs, yuppies, gay people, the help, hired criminals, random people in the park, and prisoners.  It's all hilarious.  It all gets funnier and funnier.And Shonda.  Oh, dear Shonda.  You'll see.If you wanna see the best comedy team-up since The Other Guys or Step Brothers, check out Get Hard.Now the only question is, when is Get Hard 2 coming out!Get Hard 2: Get Harder.Get Hard 3: Harder and Longer.

Very good quasi-medieval action-drama.  Lots of great actors.  Believable settings, great costumes, excellent action.  This movie is a lot of fun to watch.  Paced a bit slowly, it explodes when the fights start.  Very realistic.Last Knights is very much like 47 Ronin in its plot and theme.  From the sword fights, to the intricate planning stages, to the questionable motives of characters, to the court intrigue, to the final epic battle--this one is a winner.  If you like Game of Thrones, check this movie out.

Very good horror movie.  Surprisingly engrossing.  I haven't been afraid of a dog since Cujo, but this movie makes a simple shot of a dog relaxing VERY creepy.  The pacing is perfect.  The dialogue is done well, able to convey character while dumping a little scientific or philosophical info.The mystery of what actually comes back from the dead is kept till the very end--an ending you might not see coming, by the way.  It will keep you thinking.The evolution of those that come back is interesting too, keeping us guessing if psychic phenomena or demonic entities are involved--or BOTH!Very disturbing scenes left open to interpretation.  Sort of a psycho-spiritual nightmare.The Lazarus Effect is a scary movie done well.  Watch it.  Don't let the critical reviews turn you away.

Oh MAN that was terrible!  When was the comedy supposed to begin?  Was there even a script?  Or did a bunch of people just meet on a Sunday to make a movie?  There is literally no point to this movie, no reason to watch.Hackneyed plot.  Depressing plot.  "Jokes" to roll your eyes at.  No laughter here.What an incredible waste of money, talent, and my time.  AVOID THIS PLOPPER.

Excellent film.  Thoughtful, creepy, and all-too-possible.  The pacing is slow, yet the gradual unfolding mystery of the plot keeps you on the edge of your seat.  Ex Machina is a psychological thriller with a few nice twists.  You will be questioning each character's motives and identity.  And the ending is likely to be a surprise.Plus, best android dance scene ever.Great movie.  Fun, weird, and prophetic.  Perfect acting.  Beautiful settings.  Intelligent dialogue.

Excellent sound quality and comfort for the price.  These are JUST large enough to cover the ear.  Not like studio headphones that are super cushioned and large, no.  This pair is cushioned JUST enough to be comfortable.  So, I would not expect these to stay comfortable for years of heavy use.But the clarity and sound quality are quite high!  Just as good as my studio headphones.  They do NOT block out sound, so you'll still here grandma fart.  But, that said, they are remarkably able to keep sound IN, so your songs don't get muddy.The cord long, like Stairway to Heaven, to listening anywhere is made real easy.BUY THEM.

Ugh.  This company cannot make tasty dark chocolate.  Too bitter and flavorless.  Better dark chocolates are made by Equal Exchange.  All of their dark varieties are tasty, balanced, and not too bitter.  So far I believe the ones from Colombia and Ecuador are best.

Good product.  You have a sweet cedar scent here that just borders on the edge of annoyingly artificial.  But there are strong cedar overtones and undertones that make this incense pleasurable.  Especially if you burn two sticks at a time, you will really get that relaxing cedar smell.

Excellent product.  Durable.  Heavy duty, but not too large.  They don't budge when clipping papers or files together.  Clip notebooks shut.  Clip sections of a textbook.  Works great and causes no damage.  You can clip your coffee bean bags or snack bags tight.  NO air or bugs getting in.Best of all, you can clip these to your hands and its kind of relaxing.  You can clip them to your coworkers' eyebrows and lips and ear lobes unexpectedly.  Or better yet, torment your family members in similar ways--like clipping your sister's hair to her seat, or the couch, the cat's tail, etc.Overall, GREAT product.  Will buy again.  Seriously.

This has a nice woody scent, like a campfire.  The incense smoke is thick and strong, which I like sometimes.  Even though the incense is pleasing enough, this does not smell like pine.  Or if it ever does, it has HINTS of a pine-like smell, in my opinion.My nose may not recognize the pine as well as yours, so if you want to give this a try, I can at l;east promise you that this is otherwise a very good quality incense.

This is a beautiful bowl.  The picture does not do it enough justice.  If you like the pictures bowl, buy it now.  It looks nicer in person, blends into just about any decorative scheme, and it has a nice mellow beauty.  Feels great to be around, works perfectly, and looks pretty.The stick incense can slip through the center hole if it is too thin, but usually the bottom of the stick will hit the surface you put the bowl on and burn only to where the hole begins.  Larger blocks or pyramids of incense balance easily on the upraised center of the piece.  So far I have not had any ashed fall out of the bowl.  This one is sized perfectly for burning incense.

This is one of the more delicious jellies on the market.  Conveniently packaged in snack sizes, these are great for the on-the-go mom or workaholic. Or toss one in your kid's lunch box when you're in a rush.  You'll be surprised at his or her reaction!  Thick, viscous, and oh so satisfying.  Virtually NO CALORIES!Plus, this unique jelly is a versatile product.  I'd like to see grape jelly heal wounds as well as petroleum jelly.  Good for the skin, good for burns and wounds, good for slicking your hair back.  Plus, if you have anal itching, rashes,or hemmorhoids, you're not going to find another jelly as soothing as petroleum jelly.  Cherry is a bit too tart for this application.  Grape is prone to give you sugar rushes.Overall, petroleum jelly brings out the best in you!  Peanut butter and jelly have NEVER tasted this NEW!  And minor scrapes and bruises--bye bye boob boos!  Need an ingredient to slather onto your favorite biscuits or maybe pancakes?  I give you petroleum JELLY!My jellies arrived packaged well, fresh, and in great condition.  Good vendor.

Solid 4 stars. Not perfect, but one of the better organized crime films.  A lot of characterization, a lot of brutal action, and a lot of fine writing.  No corny dialogue, no sped up action, no unbelievable stunts,  This is a story that makes sense and keeps you on the edge of your seat.  The acting is incredible.  Run All Night keeps the suspense high and manages to make you care for the relationships in the movie.WATCH IT.  :)

I like James but I love Bas Rutten a hundred times more.  It was an exciting possibility having these two in the same movie again, but the writing here is TERRIBLE.  Bas Rutten gets a small part that makes no sense.  He really should be a headliner like Bruce Willis.  He can do the action AND the comedy.  What a shame, seeing him play second or third fiddle to the untalented masses.  Speaking of untalented, James is constantly wiggling and rolling and making faces in a desperate attempt to be funny.  It never is.  If you naturally laugh at seizures, this may make you giggle a bit.There is a waste of time teen love story that goes nowhere for no reason.  There are a ton of cardboard characters that LOOK funny, but never get a chance to perform any comedy.  The funniest thing in this movie is one of Blart's associate's haircuts!I will say that the last fight scene was KIND OF funny.  It kept my attention.  But the rest of the movie is junk, time wasted, unfunny rambling.I don't get it.  So much talent and NOTHING funny for them to do or say?I want my hour back.  I feel like my brain was abused by Bill Cosby.  I didn't want this.  I didn't ask for this.  You misrepresented yourself, Blart 2!  I have been violated.

Incredible fight scenes, but the plot is a teenage James Bond fantasy.  Imagine an Ender's Game set in a spy school instead of outer space.  The kids will LOVE this movie, but there is not a lot of intellectual meat on the bones here.  The plot is hackneyed, full of the same old crap like an obligatory love interest, an underdog hero plucked from obscurity, a parent who did miraculous things secretly, schoolmate bullies who have to be won over by the plucky little hero's bravery, etc.This seriously is a young teen's James Bond film.  If your kids love the Hunger Games or Harry Potter franchises, rent it for them.  But be ready to read a good book between fight scenes.  Following the writing is like chewing the cud.  Old ideas in a shiny new costume.

Fantastic western.  Enough violence to please.  A heartwarming story that turns dark real fast and twists until the very end.  Beautiful vistas and forests behind every scene.  Incredible acting.  What's not to like?  You won't see the end coming.  Every fight is brutal.  And, though the pacing is slower than most films, this movie delivers big time!  It's a thoughtful, well-done story that will leave you thinking.  Very realistic too.

I'm not sure the movie ever started.  This film is a slow, meaningless drama.  I literally started reading a book while watching it.  Yes, it is that slow.  I'm not sure why they didn't just put commercials in the film, between scenes, because it felt like I was watching an old Little House on the Prairie episode.  With zombies.  Once in a blue moon.  Slow, boring, and pointless.Although, I have to say that Arnold's acting is very good.  He has matured as an actor.  Why the heck does it have to be in THIS dumper?  Oh well.Maggie is like a virus.  You suffer through it, vomit, have chills, and maybe a few Hershey squirts, then it's over.  You take a shower and hope for better days.

It is beautiful to behold, demonstrates a few interesting ideas, then descends into utter silly nonsense.  (Some spoilers ahead, mateys!)  Laser guns that sound like dogs barking.  Hover shoes that are such an obvious rip off of Back to the Future, the hero even grabs the back of a pick-up truck and hitches a ride like Marty McFly.  Then we learn the hero is half canine and the girl falls in love with him (for no reason) and actually says, "I Like dogs" when she almost begs him for sex.  The stupidity grows.  The universe has an unending bureaucracy that the characters navigate and it's supposed to be funny all of a sudden, as they follow an android lawyer through myriad offices.  What the hell?  And it gets worse.This movie is so bad that Mila Kunis looked like she was reading a magazine while reciting her lines. No passion.  But how can you blame her?  The writing was really foolish.  The movie is trying to be a mash up popular sci fi movies like Hitchhiker's Guide and Back to the Future and even the Matrix and Dark City.  BE YOUR OWN DAMN MOVIE!  Someone write an original film based on original ideas based on good research!Want some pretty good sci-fi that's different from the norm?  Watch these:1) Dark City2) Lucy3) Soldier4) Transcendence5) Oblivion6) Total Recall (New one)

This is a terrible representation of Batman and his world.  It is a cheesy and corny romp through some great characters, who are ruined with juvenile dialogue and a total lack of realism.  This is a little kids' movie AT BEST.  Do not watch this expecting any kind of intelligent design like The Dark Knight Returns or Batman vs. Robin or Batman: Assault on Arkham.  This is not for adults.  It's for kids who still think Batman is a Lego figure.  Which is fine, but disappointing.The premise had real potential, but it is ruined.  It's just a lot of animal robots and beloved characters saying very stupid things to one another.

This film has the worst title ever.  It is misleading and does no justice to a pretty interesting story line.  Robin is nowhere near as annoying as he was in the Son of Batman, which was terrible.  Here is he simply unrealistic.  A 10 year old kid who belongs on the Mortal Kombat roster.  Yeah, right.  Pretty ridiculous.  But once you get over that fact, this movie is a lot of fun to watch.Bloody, adult, and filled with intense action scenes and weird enemies.  The movie sort of rewrites Batman's history a bit with the Court of Owls idea--a bunch of rich people who think they should decide what's good for us all.  Kind of like the American government, just better dressed.Again we see that Batman and Robin argue over the use of force--where it should end.  With death or capture?  Of course, Bats is afraid of becoming evil, so he never kills.  Thus proving once again how inferior to the Punisher Batman will always be.That said, this movie has its fair share of violence and blood.  The bad guys get it good, but our heroes come VERY close to death as well.  It's an intense and suspenseful ride that Batman fans will appreciate.

This is an interesting movie.  A heist from a very different perspective.  The acting is great.  The characters are unevenly written but appealing.  The plot has a few twists you will not see coming.  So, all in all, this is an enjoyable film.  The problem is that the movie is paced very slowly.  This is NOT an action bonanza with special effects and people jumping around and doing gymnastics they could never do in real life.Black Sea is a very realistic, gritty, and claustrophobic tale told at sea.  The characters are tossed into a crock pot, ill-prepared and desperate.  Then that cinematic crock pot is thrown down a flight of stairs and we all wait too see who comes out alive and IF anyone comes out of this tale rich with Nazi gold.  You will be surprised.

This is one of the worst graphic novels written.  The idea of the Punisher going into space to kill bad guys is exciting.  But these writers RUIN every aspect of that premise.  First of all, the Punisher and the entire Marvel universe is re-imagined here and placed in space.  As if that was needed or even possible to do well in one graphic novel.  So you get a four-armed Incredible Hulk alien.  You get Punisher with a stupid cape and a hairline from the 1980's WWE.  You get silly scenes taken right out of the Star Wars bar scene.  Just embarrassingly bad.  Not creative at all.  Derivative and insulting.The Punisher is more of a Flash Gordon with a touch of DC's Lobo.  Nothing true to character.  It is a disgrace.  He has a Buck Rogers side-kick robot.  A talking ship that pretends to be a woman who he argues with.  Like an I Love Lucy relationship--with FRANK CASTLE!  This story is SO BAD!  As if some geek on heroine tried to write the Punisher into a prime-time comedy skit show.And the DIALOGUE!  It is the WORST writing I have ever read.  The info dumps are terrible.  The jokes are corny.  The conversations are confusing.  There are a million phrases that ARE NOT EVEN NEEDED--like when Frank talks to himself.  Everything everyone says in this book is STUPID.  Even the Marvel villains talk GHETTO!!!  What the hell is up with that?The art is good.  It has a Norman Rockwell meets early comic books kind of vibe to it.  But a good drawing of a terrible story will never do anyone any good.AVOID AT ALL COSTS.  This is so bad that I want my money back, your money back, my memory wiped, and a small coma to get over what these people did to the icon Frank Castle.

Three stars is gracious.  The acting was superb, but the movie is just a LIfetime drama on steroids.  For me, personally, the mystery dragged on and on.  And then the truth had to be unraveled like a sexually abused onion--piece by by gooey piece.  The ending is so convoluted that some will call this a masterpiece and others will be rewinding to see the hints in the film.  Me?  All I know is, I'm not buying a loft with a bunch of dudes.There is a moral here: Break up with your wives FIRST.  Then go horn around.  Loft unnecessary and, frankly, way too expensive.Second Moral: Women, if you meet a man with a loft he shares, RUN.Third Moral: You notice how there was no black guy doing this crazy, gross stuff?  No Hispanic?  No Chinese guy?  The only good white guys are Italian and Irish, ladies.  :)Oh, and the wives in this movie are just as bad as the guys, so enjoy this misanthropic romp through human sexuality.  I'd rather rock myself to sleep in a Walmart storage closet.If you enjoy this, you might also enjoy these features:1) Your local state penitentiary2) Cinemax late at night3) All of your parents' criticism

Excellent toys for Play-Doh.  The kids love it.  Lots of variety in shapes and tools alike keep playtime fun and LONG.  So, get ready to relax a minute or two, Mommy and Daddy.  There is a lot that kids can do with these tools.Very good toy set.  Yes, I know it looks like a serial killer's first tool box, but nothing is sharp or dangerous.  Each tool is perfectly sized for toddler hands.  The shapes and impressions your little ones can make will entertain them.  I promise.Although, my dog did disappear shortly after we purchased this . . .Buy it.

Love this thing.  Well-made, packs away easily, and looks nice.  Most importantly, the prickly sensations quickly give way to a warm and relaxing pressure that can cause you to fall asleep.  I cannot believe it.  Every part of your body can be exposed to this pokey delight and feel better afterward.  The only warnings I have are these:1) Don't move around a lot.  Find the areas you want targeted and stay put, letting your body press these tines into your skin to trigger pressure points and draw blood to the areas.  The more you wiggle or squirm, the more you feel poked.2) Try this out on a bed FIRST.  The pressure of your own body weight will do the trick, but the experience will be less intense than it will be on the floor.3) The best results come when you lie upon this mat and pillow without clothing.  If you wear a shirt when targeting your back, for example, you will miss out on the deep healing and relaxing properties this mat triggers.  But, some people need to transition slowly, so I understand.  Just do NOT stop at using this while your targeted areas are clothed.Excellent relaxation tool.  If you do fall asleep on it, the sensation you get after waking is weird.  Like the tingling of a limb that falls asleep.  As the blood rushes back into the prickled areas.  It passes fast.BUY THIS.  Use it nightly before bed and watch how your sleep is affected.

Incredibly adorable and well-made WW costume.  It has stood up to a few washes and some crazy activity so far, and it has kept its vivid coloring.  No rips, no tears, no stretching, no shrinking.Definitely recommended.  The cape comes off.  It's attached by velcro squares that have served us well so far.Buy it.  The sizing was accurate.  The look is great.  Your little one, once she sees herself in the mirror, will get a HEAP of self-esteem and excitement.  Wonder Woman rocks, I guess.  :)

Great game.  I cannot believe I enjoy this COD so much.  I thought franchise was stuttering and reaching its end point, but Advanced Warfare is a big improvement.  Pretty much an all new game in many ways.This was a gift, and I am so impressed that I am going to buy the Season Pass.The vertical warfare, new weaponry, futuristic abilities, etc. are so much fun and seamlessly integrated.  I also notice that the standard gaming setting is more realistic.  If I blast the hell out of some guy's head with a laser, he goes down.  Nobody survives more than two well-placed sniper shots.  And hitting airborne soldiers is a lot easier than you think, once you get used to riddling them with bullets by aiming toward the front their trajectory.  I love launching grenades from my wrist, using a temporary shield, using a temporary Predator-ish invisibility, and enjoying unlimited ways to get from point A to point B because of my exo-suit.And let me end this review with a promise: ZOMBIES mode with futuristic weapons and an exo-suit is the most fun I have had.  You will die.  But the voice-acting by these celebrities is perfect.  The new breeds of zombies are scary.  And the graphics are fantastic.  I'd buy this game just to play all the Zombie maps.ONE CAVEAT: My game has been freezing every once in a while.  I can play for an hour and then suddenly the thing freezes.  I can play for two and then it freezes.  Requiring a forced console shut-down.  Not sure why.  But I am not the only one, as I hear.  Probably an update needed.  Why am I not angry?  Because the game is honestly too much fun.5 Stars deserved.

Love this game.  One of the BEST turn-based strategy games in existence.  The PC version looks much better, but this version is great--especially if you are closer to the TV than not.Customize your soldiers' equipment, abilities, and even languages!  Lots of combat options to tweak.  The voice acting is great.  The story lines are entertaining and kind of creepy.  There are a few stand-out characters.
