The pacing was fast and the storytelling was tight but as the series went on, things really began to drag. it was as if the scriptwriters realized they were going way to fast through "The Cousin's War" novels and had to slow things down and drag things out to meet the ten episode commitment. As such, the pacing dramatically changed and we started to get bored with the series towards the end. We found the series to be worth watching, but it's not something we'd watch again or recommend for owning. Netflix it, rent it or wait for it to come out on streaming.

Our place is big and Wi-Fi seems to have problems getting through the house so we have more than one extender. Our best one is the TP-LINK TL-WA850RE 300Mbps Universal Wi-Fi Range Extender, Repeater, Wall Plug design, One-button Setup, Smart Signal Indicator as it extends and strengthens the signal enough that I can have my gaming desktop on the other side of the house from the modem and it performs almost as well as if it were plugged directly into it. That's why we were more than happy to go with another TP-Link product as we have great experiences with it.The little one is cute and compact and has less of a chance of hitting anything, but the range on it is very small compared to other extenders. Even in a hotel room, which this particular pocket router was designed for is too weak and slow to work as an extender. If however, you take an Ethernet cord and plug it directly into the Pocket Router and your laptop/desktop/whatever, it works decently as it's merely picking up the Wi-Fi signal and using it directly with the device trying to get online. it still drops on occasion and I've had to reboot it more than once. Compare that to our other TP-Link extender which I can move freely throughout the house and it doesn't require a reboot or any internal reconfiguration.As a travel router though, this is decent. I took it to my parents who have no concept of wireless internet and used this to get online without having to be a few feet from the cable modem. I should also point out this works with both DSL and Cable, which is nice to see. So as an access point or as a wireless modem, this Pocket Router does its job nicely (it still glitches up and drops things though), but it's better than other options I've seen on the market.All in all, a thumbs in the middle. What my family really need this for (as an extender), it didn't work very well at all. As something to give me wireless internet in a non-wireless location, it works decently. However, it's rare that type of situation really occurs these days, so its usefulness is limited and growing moreso.

I need a litter that clumps really tightly, and the first Arm & Hammer I tried just didnt fit the bill.  I wasnt expecting much from their new offering, but I can honestly say I was pleasantly surprised.This litter has a very fine texture, more like sand than most of the clay or clumping formulas Im used to seeing.  My cats really seem to prefer it, going to the litter box filled with the Arm & Hammer more often than the others (which still contain their usual Tidy Cat).  So I guess you could say they dig it?It clumps really well.  I havent noticed any clumps breaking up (yet) when I try to scoop them out.  Thats been a big problem for me recently, and Im not sure if the quality of the clumping litters has gone down (due to formula changes) or if its my elder cats medication.  I do know its a huge, smelly pain when it happens!It doesnt track more or less than any other brand Ive tried.  It is really dusty, and it has an odd smell that I cant describe.  But not so much on either count that I wouldnt buy it again.

First of all, you should note that the Secret Creepers Crypt isn't really compatible with the core Monster Hall products, which are the dolls. The Secret Creepers are a toy line for recording and passing messages. Cute ideas in the 80s and 90s, but in this date and age of cell phones and text messaging, the toyline comes off a little dated or retro, depending on how you view it. The animals, which make up the Secret Creepers line are much large than the versions that come with the dolls. The scale is completely off and so mixing the core doll line with the Secret Creepers line just looks weird and noticeably off.I bring this up because it's important to note that the Crypt playset is only for use with the Secret Creepers. The previous animals will either not fit or just look really out place with this set. That means to really get any use out of the Crypt, you're going to have to invest heavily in the Secret Creepers line and like myself. This is neither bad, nor good - simply a fact that means you'll ant two or three other Secret Creeper figures besides the one that comes in this set. Otherwise it will look pretty barren. Even the packaging it comes in has three extra SC cutouts in paper form to keep it from looking empty.The set itself is well made. it's sturdy and very colourful, which should make kids happy. It also comes with a Crescent the kitten figure. Unlike other Secret Creepers which store and share short messages, Crescent is a motion activated toy, which is meant to guard the other figures. So if someone broke into your room to read your other SC figures' messages, Crescent would go off and scare them away or alert you. Unfortunately the toy is neither very scary or loud. It's a cute kitten figure, but it also lacks any joints. It a solid piece of plastic meaning it will only ever hold the one pose.All in all, the Secret Creepers Crypt is a bust if you're a Monster High fan. it's not compatible with the majority of MH figures and the SC line is a bit lame, definitely out of date and overpriced for what you get. That said, if you ARE a fan of the Secret Creepers line (We won't judge you), then you might as well splurge on this playset as Crescent is the best looking of the figures and this gives you a way to display them.

My stomach really doesn't like regular vitamins, so for the past few years I've been using gummy vitamins, which taste better and go down easier. The Sundown Naturals versions are a lot smaller than other brands like vitafusion and other brands. These are low in sugar (2 grams per serving) but still taste good to your tongue. You get your full RDA on things like vitamins C, D and B-12, but only 50% of Vitamins A, Niacin, B-6 and Panthothenic Acid. Most gummy vitamins give you higher RDA percentages than these, which also takes into account why they are so much larger than this particular type.Twenty dollars for a three-pack of 50 gummies each (which is what Amazon.com is currently selling these for at the time of my review) is a big high-priced. The kind I usually get are ten dollars for a pack of 90, so I could actually by two packs of my regular kind and get more gummies and for less than the Sundown Natural three pack. As such, I'll probably stick my usual gummy vitamins, but this was an okay for a change.

I was really nervous when this case came out of the box with only a "Quick Reference" card rather than an instruction booklet.  However, setting it up was extremely easy.  I had no problems getting the device to pair with my Fire HD the first time.  I let it charge for about an hour before I tried to use it the first time.  After that, I charged it overnight.The case itself is plastic.  It doesn't look much like most of the leather and leather-like folio cases currently on the market.  That isn't a bad thing, really.  Those are just what I'm used to.  The Fire is held in place by a piece of molded plastic - that seems to be the new norm for a lot of the new Fire HD accessories. It has a flap with internal magnets that holds the case closed and functions as a stand when the case is in landscape mode.I challenged myself to write this entire review on my Fire using this keyboard and I did it!  Here's what I learned.First, the cons: I have had problems connecting once or twice.  It is a pain in the ass to have to turn Bluetooth off and on again, but doing that resolved it fairly quickly. I have no idea what the battery life is like.  You cant tell how much juice it has left.  At least once it completely refused to work, but I can't be sure if it was a dead battery or if I needed to reset the Bluetooth. The apostrophe doesn't have its own key and is in a stupid location.  For anyone trained to touch type, this is a huge problem. Because the screen is in contact with the keyboard when the Fire is in the case and it is closed, and because it is impossible to hold the Fire in one hand to read while in the case, I cant see this becoming a full-time storage case for my Fire. I'm a little concerned that the constant removing and replacing the Fire in the case is going to damage the plastic thing it sits in.  Or worse, that the plastic thing will eventually damage my Fire. It isn't easy to set up, really.  I've fumbled it more than once trying to get t to stand in landscape mode. It could cause a person to drop their Fire and damage it.There are pros too!  Just not as many, maybe: It takes some getting used to, but it isn't extremely hard to learn to type on. The main problem I have is the apostrophe, as mentioned in the cons. It is pretty.  Not a requirement for a keyboard case, but I felt it worth mentioning. I really like the soft, flocked lining in the interior.  It would be just perfect for protecting the Fire screen...if it touched it at all (it doesn't ). It isn't heavy.  I've been carrying it around in my bag for days and have barely noticed the extra weight.  Of course, it would be even lighter if I didn't have to continue to carry my Fire around in a separate case, but whatever.I will also address a couple of concerns I've seen noted on a couple of other keyboard cases:  The magnets are inside the front flap of the case and cannot fall off, and the case did not have a weird odor.This keyboard case is currently selling on Amazon for about $80.  I honestly don't think its worth that much and wouldn't be included to pay it.  Amazon sells several other keyboard cases that offer more protection and have keyboards that are much better laid out.  The cons just outweigh the pros, as far as I'm concerned.

My 7 year old has three of these 'everything kids' books and when my 8 year old nephew asked for a football for Christmas I grabbed this to go with it. He thought it looked awesome when he was looking at it during present time and I know from experience with this series that it's a good fit for their age ranges.

My 7 year old loves clown fish and webkinz so this was a perfect match for him for Christmas. He was so excited to have a water webkinz and have it be a clownfish. The code worked perfectly and the stuffy is exactly as pictured

Our J5Y football came packaged in a box as you normally see on the shelf... but almost completely deflated. The box did not say anything about not being inflated so neither my husband or I believe this is how the ball was suppose to be. We bought this for our nephew and went with a brand my husband liked when he played and remembered being a decent quality (spalding). We went out and bought a $10 pump and reinflated the ball then wrapped it up and hoped it would stay inflated. Luckily it did and our nephew loves it. Apparently it is exactly the brand and size used by his school/team to practice/play with =)

The versions of these we've bought before always had removable fleece lining so they could be worn as house shoes in the winter or play shoes in the summer . So if you got them for the child for Christmas they would fit well with the fleece in during the winter months and then the child's foot would have grown a bit to make the fit better by the time summer came around for when the fleece was removed. I thought all of these had the removable fleece so wanted to make a note here that the fleece is not removable in these in case anyone else thought it might be also. Otherwise, the shoes themselves are exactly as stated, diego character and look nice.

I received these 3 weeks ago and it was love on first site. The colors are gorgeous. But the real test was going to be if I could knit more then a few hats without something breaking. The first hat I knit was an Angry Birds Bomber character hat for my oldest. Went perfectly. I not have finished 8 more hats and am on a the 10th total with these needles. The last 9 have been more basic hats for my children's neighborhood friends for the holidays and my own co-workers. I am uploading a picture of the basic hats, including the one still on the needles half finished (the angry bird hat has already been wrapped for Christmas Eve). The length of these needles are perfect (not too long on the actual needle) for 16 inches and the cable is strong and smooth. I have experienced no issues with the construction of the needles at all yet.

At the time of this review the listing says chikd size hat 7yrs+. I was sent a toddler size hat by Hobby Hunters according to the tags on the hat. Much too small. The hat itself is very nice looking and wonderfully colored. I would suggest contacting the seller if not buying through prime to confirm hat size, as I was reminded why non prime sellers can be unfortunate when they make a mistake but you are expected to front the return shipping cost for their mistake (of course amazon took care of it, but they really shouldn't have had to- it wasn't Amazon's mistake). If this had been a hat for a toddler I would have been happy with the purchase as the hat itself was very nice.

Looks exactly as it does in the picture. It does not come in any real packaging, just a plain white box it fits in. I ordered it as a gift so I just took it out of the box and put it in a gift bag instead. It functions as is stated and looks very nice.

Very happy with the shoes. My husband is a size 12 and you can't always find nice dress shoes in his size in stores, especially not at discount prices. At the time of this review I noticed another reviewer said the shoes were not leather as described. The shoes we received are exactly the brand and material described in the listing at this time, Steve Madden Black Leather. My husband was very happy with thrm, saying they were much more comfortable then most. This is a serious compliment as my husband has used a LOT of dress shoes. He is hard on shoes, being a very hands on upper manager in a grocery store. He is constantly on the floor moving and is extremely involved with his departments from helping with truck unloading to display designing to cooking for 12-20hrs a day depending on the situation and season. He goes through shoes (and shirts and pants) every month or two because he must wear dress clothes. Dress clothes are simply not made in the expectation of the wearer moving a lot or doing manual work. So I will make sure to update with how long these hold up for.
These were a great deal when we bought them and made our angry bird fanatic very happy. No complaints
My seven year old loves this game and I like that it's educational. We actually have all the games from this developer to date and they are all well done.

Part of a gift set for my husband's parents. His mother likes willow tree but never buys it for herself so this was a perfect gift with the grandfather one and a framed photo of threm and their grandkids.

This is a fun thougha somewhat limited level up through choices and chance til you hit end game. You will run out of playability on this eventually just because of the limited scope of the game but it's still enjoyable up til that point. Plus, as long as it's been a while since you last played it out it can be enjoyable to run through again. Not disappointed with this game and would recommend for those boring waiting rooms. I think ot's equally entertaining for older (reading) child and adult alike, my 7 year old enjoys it.

My boys (4yrs & 7yrs) use my old 1st gen 7in Galaxy Tab. I had used a purple poly case similar to this one for it and bought a blue jelly case when I gave it to my boys. The jelly case, while great to absorb shock if dropped, was just two soft for little handling and got torn up after about a year. I was bummed to see how few choices were left for these tablets in case wear. Ours is still going strong and has no issues function wise for my kids use. So I ended up going with this classic black poly (my only other poly choice at the time of purchase was hot pink). This case fits perfectly and I know will age much better then it's jelly predecessor.

Both my boys have a genetic growth disorder so their sizes are a year or two behind their age-wise sizing. I bought a size 7 for my sz5/6 seven year old based on reviews(had to search for Urban Republic to find enough reviews to make an informed choice) that said this jacket runs small. I agree that the size 7 jacket fits small. I bought a size 4 for my sz2/3 four year old and don't feel the size 4 runs as small as the size 7. The size 4 is noticably too big on my youngest where the size 7 fits more or less the same as a size 6 might with just the arms maybe being a smidge farther down the wrist to the palm... or not.The outer material of the jackets feels like most boys sports winter coats. One review on another listing said they are not water resistant despite the fabric feeling like it might be. So I was just going to buy a can of water proofing spraythat is used to make hiking/camping gear water resistant. The inner liner is very soft and the coat feels like it will be nice and warm this winter. We are in Missouri so our winters tend to be milder then those farther north, 20-40s mostly and I think these coats will serve the boys well for our temperatures.I have no complaints about the quality for the cost. I paid $14 for each coat and think they are worth the cost. The stitching may not be perfect (as mentioned by another poster) but it isn't like it's squiggly lines instead of straight lines or something. In fact, we've been looking at similar coats in Kohls,  Macy's and JcPenney's for $20-30+ (on sale, original supposedly $50-$100+). In all cases the stitching is similarly not perfect. It's what comes from doing things more and more based on machine and quantity production versus by hand and quality. I found no major or noticable to the casual eye flaws in the stitching or otherwise on either jacket.Because of some of the aforementioned (not being water resistant, being made for milder colder temps, being 100% polyester and being made in china) as of this review I would probably put a price point of about $15 on this. The $14 we paid I feel was worth the product but not necessarily a 'deal'.  Personally I have no complaints with the coats/jackets we received.
Bought this as a Christmas gift to send to my oldest's Godfather for the coming holidays. It is a lovely looking frame and very elegant. No complaints.

This book is used in my oldest's homeschool curriculum so we bought the kindle version to download to his tablet. I asked him how the story was and his first words in reply were, "Really cool!" So it got a positive review from our 7 year old =)

Big fan of silicone vs metal or plastic for candy and baking molds. This was a gift for my brother's girlfriend last Christmas who is a cake decorator. She said it's worked great and we are moving into this years holiday season so can't complain about that.

We homeschool and use a trapper keeper to store all our worksheets. I copy them over summer and put them into the trapper as a large workbook to cut down prep time during the school year because my husband and I both work. However little hands (and elbows) are constantly tearing them out accidentally.  These little gems work perfectly and we could not do without them!
Lovely! Silicone is so much easier to use and get the finished product out of the molds then plastic or metal. This is exactly as described and pictured.
We use this paper with stamps and ribbons to create wrapping paper. It-s much cheaper, more personal and more fun for the kids to help with =) This works great for our purpose!

The weight was exactly what our normal scale put both my husband and I at. The body fat measurement was very off compared to a dietician's device and the estimate I could get through measurement (which was fairly close to the dietician's device measurment).
Great price. Nice to get 5 at a time so that there's extras. They fit and went on perfectly- no issues.

I got my husband a Fire phone as an early bday surprise and ordered this case to go with it. It gives a very nice, ptofessional look. My husband is an upper manager at a large store, so he is often taking pickers of displays and other work related things on the floor. This case makes it easy for him to use his phone to take the pictures while looking nice and professional to any customers around him. It also has some card pockets inside for an ID and debit card if he wants to leave his wallet at home for the day to cut down on items carried. Very happy with the purchase.

We bought several Bright Ideas Press curriculum books from a homeschool co-op. This is our first year using Bright Ideas Press materials and I've been very happy with them up to this book. I have already and will continue to give positive reviews for other Bright Ideas Press and Christian Kids Explore books and materials. We are Catholic so creation and evolution are not mutually exclusive for us. I was hoping for a Christian worldview book that presented a biblical view of creation to start our walk through general science. I wanted to start my kids from the christian creationist viewpoint, them move forward with God as the creationist in mind as we continued in science. There are scientific facts that back evolution to a point, but gaping holes that God easily fills. I was looking for a book that taught creationism, not a book that was set up to disprove evolution.If it was just some notes here or there, or even a specific lesson devoted to other theories I'd be ok with that, but this book feels like it is not teaching creationism except as a way to disprove evolution, and that is not how the book was represented. Some lessons are salvageable mostly as long as I bluntly ignore the continual assault on evolution (which is seriously in almost every lesson) and completely drop the last two units(out of a total of six units that are suppose to stretch over a year of teaching) which make no pretense at teaching creationism and focus wholly on discounting evolution.I feel more then half this book (and arguably all of it) could be billed as a book teaching 'why evolution is wrong'. If you are looking to teach why evolution is wrong, this would be a very good curriculum. If you are like me and want to teach creation science, this book may not be a good fit.

We ordered this book along with several other Bright Ideas Press curriculum books through a co-op. This is our first year using Bright Ideas Press materials and so far I'm happy with the quality and set up of the books. I really like the set up a lot. This book gives you a supply list at the start of a unit and 'equipment needed' at the start of activities. I've had curriculum books in the pas which didn't and it makes lesson prep much harder. Glad to have that here!The previous reviewer talked about the additional reference books- I like the 'additional reference books' broken down by lesson in back. I looked through our library's online search and we have a lot of the additional books. However, as they aren't part of any of the lessons, just suggestions at the back of the book for additional research- I'm not concerned about what isn't available. Where we want to do additional research we normally look up our own resources online or in the library anyways.I also really appreciate the companion cd included in this book, it is more or less the book in cd format and is realy nice to have right there on the computer.I'm very happy with this book and think it was a good fit for our homeschool family.

We bought this 5 piece set in size 6 for our 7 year old who's just moved into a size 6. The fit was good. Like most suits the pants legs were long, so I just hemmed them up leaving enough slack to take the hem out when he grows to increase the life span of the suit. The tie is an American Express tie which I've bought a cheap dress shirt off amazon that was the same brand and the quality makes me suspect it's something from overseas and not necessarily a name brand. The dress shirt sent with this suit did not have a tag of any sort on it. Not even to tell what it was made of- which is really suspicious to me. The fit of the suit was good and it looks nice.So I'm not complaining about much for less then $20 for a 5 piece suit. Really can't beat that price, but wanted to note some things for others who may be a little more discerning then we are.

My oldest is an angry birds fan and he is a size 12 shoe. So I was very happy to find out these do fit him like they claim they will =) The quality is maybe not the best (things not completely centered, stitching on the pads a little sloppy) but the feel solid enough and nothing seems wobbly to make me worry about his safety. They are really cute and with an added helmet I have no qualms about him playing with these. He's loving them and even using the pads from here with his bike now instead of the ones that match is helmet (hey, whatever makes him happy, lol). For $12 I think this was a solid buy.

My husband wears these under his white dress shirts for work and likes that they are thinner then other options. He gets overheated easily and these don't add as much in the way of trapping heat in like some other brands/versions do.

This is a GREAT buy for the price. We originally bought this for our 7 and 4 year old, but like other's mentioned the band was too long. We ended up buying them different watches and will be giving these as gifts to family/friends children who are few years older. The watch looks great. No bells and whistles but for under $10 it's amazing to find a Star Wars watch so no complaints on that. The book is a really nice touch to the combo, very happy with this purchase. Will update if there is an issue with function.

We replaced a steel shower head that had gotten clogged up (despite trying to clean it out) so that it actually hurt to be under the shower because of the pressure of the tiny streams of water. We have decent water pressure but nothing that ridiculous. The shower head is great. The pressure is perfect, good feeling but not painful at all like the old one. The price was great and I love the handheld setting for being able to give our dog a bath or help me rinse the tub when I'm cleaning it. Very happy with our purchase.

I have bought several Wilton silicon baking molds. I've used a round cake mold I bought years ago to make my family's birthday cakes. We moved last fall a few weeks after my husband's birthday and I didn't realize the round cake mold was missing until I went looking for it for my boy's birthdays coming up in June and July. So I went looking for a replacement. I ran into this and was instantly sold. The price, at the time I bought it, was about half of what I was expecting to find my replacement for and was a much cuter shape. Perfect for birthday parties! To my children's delight I did a trial run of a one layer cake the day I got it, because I was a little concerned about if the pan edges leaned outwards (something that wasn't an issue with my previous pan). They do a little, but after seeing the finished product I am confident I can easily make a two layer cake with this pan. I am really happy with the size and silicon material.

I bought our set from Amazon Wharehouse as an open box deal for $20. We recently moved and between what was broken, lost or down right forgotten we found ourselves needing a lot of these items. We are regular dollar store buyers, so the quality here was pretty normal for us. I would not expect this quality for the list price, which is currently more then 3 times what we paid. For the price we paid I am very happy with what we got. I would have preferred to get a apply core and slicer rather then the bagel holder (which actually came broken in the package). But I can afford to spend the extra $1 at Dollar Tree having saved several more with this package. We already have an electric can opener, so the manual one in this box will go in a drawer for in case that breaks at an inoppertune moment some day. It looks like the ones you can find in the dollar store and they are really only good for that one time save- they will break very quickly with any real use. The 51 piece is of course a tiny bit misleading. As expected it includes each separate measuring cup/spoon in the two measuring sets; as well as, each salt and pepper shaker.When breaking down the value of this (to decide whether it was worth it to us) I figured it out as if we actually went to the dollar store and bought the items each separately. There are 42 items here (when taking into account the salt & pepper set and 2 5pc measuring sets). So with my price of $20 that breaks the items down to less then 50 each. For dollar store quality we got half off. I certainly understand the reviews at the listed price being so negative. I am happy with what we got for the price. We only needed around half the items, which means we spent what we would have spent anyways for practically the same things at Dollar Tree but got lots of back up items for the same price spent (which, because of the quality we would be needing eventually).Something of note on the measuring cups is that the rings are useless. They don't connect and don't pretend to try. However, the measuring units are raised units. That means no print to rub off in washes (something we have dealt with befor). I'd rather have raised measuring units then working rings any day ;-)Overall I'm happy with my purchase. For the greatly reduced price we paid I feel we got a good deal and the quality is as expected. I would not suggest this product as a viable option for any price over, maybe, $35 at the most. I feel, for the quality, the price point worth of this boxed set is probably $25-$35, with the $20 we paid being an exceptional value.

I have no complaints on the quality for the $10 or less price for 3. Just purchase the size up from what you expect to need and everything is gold. This is the third pack of marvel 3pk tshirts we've bought and I've simply purchased a size up on each for the child they are destined for and everything has been fine. 1 star off for the sizing being off. The quality is good though. The decoration doesn't fade even after several washes and the colors stay bright. We've had one pack that's had constant use as my youngest's favorite shirts for 6 months now and the shirts still look good.

I have no complaints on the quality for the $10 or less price for 3. We just purchased the size up from what we expected to need and everything has been gold. We found this out befor purchase because our first purchase was of another set of these 3pk shirts and I was specifically hoping to find some spiderman shirts that were sized small for my 4 year old who has a growth disorder. We had scoured the stores in our town and found nothing spiderman in his size (he is the average size of a 22/23 month old, his body does not create growth hormone and we have to wait another year to supplement with shorts because of an growth on his pituitary we need to make sure isn't cancer). I read through the reviews on spiderman shirts on here and found that these packs were the cheapest option that sounded like it would fit correctly. Of course then his older brother wanted some too ;-)Since it was a review on another 3pk that helped me make our purchase decisions I wanted to leave a review as well to warn others about the size discrepancy.This is the third pack of marvel 3pk tshirts we've bought and I've simply purchased a size up on each for the child they are destined for and everything has been fine. 1 star off for the sizing being off. The quality is good though. The decoration doesn't fade even after several washes and the colors stay bright. We've had one pack that's had constant use as my youngest's favorite shirts for 6 months now and the shirts still look great. There has been no fading of the colors or image breaking (not sure what else to call it when you have the decorations break apart on the shirt fabric).We have been very happy with the shirts.

I always have some issues using plastic compared to silicon, but I got this for a good price and the trial run turned out adorable. Was very easy to use white almond bark and chocolate melting chocolate to make these cute. Pouring the chocolate and white in at the same(ish) time to meet around the hat line. I appreciate having the sticks, baggies and ties included and can't wait for winter to do the real use of making these as Christmas Treats for my boys. Solid 4 stars.

I bought exactly the item pictured here at Big Lots. I'm unsure why this says satin in the discription. It's certainly not satin, just a cheap polyester feeling fabric. The manufacter packaging doesn't actually tell what kind of fabric is used, but I'm confident in saying it's not satin, lol. As I'm sure if it was that would definitely be a selling point and on the packaging. The original manufacturer price on the box is $20, I spent $6 on clearance. These are adorable at a glance but not on closer inspection. I had to look through the choices very carefully to find one that had no obvious flaws (really sloppy paint, glue all over, missing pieces). Even though I'm very happy for the price I spent I still recognize that I will need to strengthen this with needle and thread and better placed hot glue (after I manually remove the glue strings left on the product). I think the quality price point on this as far as what they are reasonably worth is $10-15. I felt I got a good deal at my price, but would have felt cheated very far into the teens or above. The concept is great and these are absolutely adorable at a glance; however, these are cheaply made.

This belt advertises at 32 inches on the up side, which it technically does. However, because the hole that allows that 32 inches is so near the end of the belt tip, the look at 32inch isn't really appealing because the belt tip isn't long enough to slip under the loop unless the third or a latter hole is used. I do like the quality and look otherwise. I have lost almost 25lbs of baby weight and was wanting to use this to help cinch in the waists of some of my dresses to make them last a little closer to my goal befor I needed to spring for a new wardrobe. I'm not comfortable with the look of this on the 1st or 2nd hole, so I won't be able to use it for the intended purpose. I will be putting this in a drawer and hopefully pulling it out in a month or two as a fashion piece, though. Good price for it, but I wouldn't buy if you are in the upper end of the measurements for it.

We bought this at Walmart on sale for $5, normally $9.88 per the tag on the bottom and the sign at Walmart. I was walking around with my boys waiting for my husband to finish his eye appointment at an office across the street and saw these on sale, couldn't resist. My angry birds fanatic of a son had his choice between the black bird, red bird, blue bird, this king pig, another pig and one other I can't remember. They didn't have his favorite, yellow bird, so the novelty of a piggy bank that is king pig won out. Ceramic banks do break easily, as another reviewer discovered. I am a little concerned about that and have cautioned over and over that my son needs to only put money in this- not pick it up or play with it (we have hard wood floors everywhere but the tile in the kitchen and bathrooms and the carpet in the front room, so when he counts money it will be in the front room). The breakablitiy an issue with any ceramic piggy bank (the stereotype of dropping the bank or taking a hammer to it to get the money out isn't just a funny adage, it's real). I agree the paint job is a little sloppy, for the $10 retail mark or $5 sale mark we don't really care. It's still really cute =)

I do not know what the Rock N Learn videos do differently, but where so many videos confuse him and we have to really go over them to use them as learning tools, Rock N Learn is pure gold for my oldest son. On top of the autism and non verbal my son also has a growth disorder and some other medical conditions. For these reasons we decided that homeschool was the best option for him for now. This is another Rock N Learn video that hasn't disappointed us. We studied some of the concepts in this video this year and I ordered it as a fun, end of year refresher. He played the video 3 times in a row until I made him stop to eat befor going outside and play. As soon as he came back in he wanted to watch it again. Rock N Learn and Liberty Kids both seem to have a similar draw and catch on his attention, but just as important, his retention. He can (and will at the slightest provocation) repeat &/or demonstrate the information in these videos.

I bought this on clearance at Walmart for $10. If I had paid even $15 I probably would have taken this back as not meeting reasonable expectations. For $10 it get's the concept well enough. The concept is about as far as it goes though. The pegs on both models don't always line up. The directions are very poorly done in both pictures and wording. You are about as well off winging it on your own (in fact several times I doubt I would have been able to continue on directions alone if I did not have a medical background to fall back on). The plastic pieces not fitting together perfectly was especially frustrating, several times on each model as I was working on further piecing the model together I would have to go back and reconnect previous pieces. The finished model has pieces that are slightly off on the plastic because the pegs simply don't work on those pieces to hold them together. The sticky/squishy effect is neat, but is all that is holding the organs together on the body, which is not very effective. It also makes me wonder how long this product is going to function, how long befor the 'sticky' is gone. Once the sticky is gone the model will nolonger be able to to hold together. The plastic case on the body has a hole where the torso is, so the displayed model is open to air.The concept is great, the fun factor with this is through the rough and it does supply a visual, hands on model of the human body and head. The accompanying reading material for children is also well done. For those aspects I gave this 3 stars. For the poor quality of the construction of the actual pieces; as well as, the poor instructions for assembly, I took off 2 stars.If you find this on sale it's worth picking up. We homeschool and this is a nice little fun addition for my soon to be 3rd grader. However I could not imagine giving this to a child and saying, "Go!" This is an adult pre-assemble or a child/adult assemble together thing. It was frustrating for me to figure out putting together, I can't imagine a child trying to do it alone.

I'm not super-impressed, probably because the pillow is pretty much a cylinder and not flat at all. My head sinks to a good level, but the fabric pulls on my cheeks since there is so much drop. Maybe the king MyPillow pillowcase is too small, or it will improve with use.I purchased it because it is very light and packable, and will be taking it camping. My preferred buckwheat hull pillows are way too heavy! These pack down very tight in a stuff-sack based on a test, and fluff right back up.

Great jacket, but I would prefer a better zipper and was disappointed at this price. Even the packable-pocket zipper is not two-sided. At this price I'd buy another but will shop around a bit more first. The fit is good - I'm a 2X and this not only fits but provides enough room for some layering (shirt and sweatshirt).

Love the design, and this is GREAT for layering since it is essentially a breathable layer, but jeez, it's tight. This is a bit more than fitted, so if you have any fat on you at all be careful. You can't just order the next size up because the sleeves will be too long - these are made for lean guys.
Very comfortable and cool in SE Florida. I will order more. Not too tight - I'm a 2X and this fits fine.

I'd like to give this shirt a few more stars - the quality and design are good enough - but jeez are they tight. They push the limits of "fitted" and approach "squeeze." I'm 6'1" 260# with a bit of fat where there used to be muscle, so if you are skinny you probably will like these a lot more than I do.
Great alternative to the Columbia fishing shirts, which my wife is tired of - they're all I wear in Southeast Florida. This is a nice change and I will order more.

I am replacing all those stringy-web belts that come with shorts and hiking pants, and found these excellent replacements. In fact, I'm buying enough so that I can just leave them on the pant to wash - just cinch them up, snap the buckle to hold and wash/dry. Convenient and much more comfortable than those stringy "free" ones. I have a bit of a belly and these do not pinch.

Our family finds these luxurious and we prefer them to the Wigwam, which seems to tighten around toes. With a Keen boot it feels like your feet are in a mink-lined slipper... really. No slipping or bunching, just pleasure. They dry quickly and last a while (I think I'm on my fifth or sixth washing without noticeable loss in feel).
My wife really likes these for Florida hiking, basically about the weight of a regular tube sock but much drier than cotton.

I've now bought three for various uses and love these. They're a little complicated because of all the straps, but it's simple enough if you fill the bag. The XL is large enough to hold a king My Pillow pillow, three Florida-weight bags and liners, and regular pillows for my wife and son.

Great! Small enough for just a few toys - maybe 10 matchbox cars - and heavy enough that they won't rip. You get two (we ordered blue) and each has a pocket inside. Be sure to "melt" the ends of the tie-chord with a lighter because otherwise they'll unravel. For the price it's a no-brainer.
These have really lasted on our boy! Great prize!

I'm really liking the convenience and effectiveness of this product - being able to swim after only 15 minutes is great after a pool party, and the rapid-dissolving crystals don't harm the pool finish even though I target a spot-algae problem on one of the steps. We use a Floatron ionizer and PhosFree with just a couple of pellets in a sinker, and during the summer I need this little shock once a month.

I agree with others that this is great, but not 5 stars. The 2-in-1 is 5 stars. The only reason it loses a star is that the wheels are casters and not as low as a real creeper. I can't get under my Honda Odyssey on an 8-inch ramp-lift to change oil.That's not a terrible deficiency if you have a high-clear vehicle or are going to use this as a cart (although carts have upward handles).The table is heavy duty - not light enough that you would want to deploy it for light use but this works both ways - it's stable. I am planning to take it on scout outings for extra table space. You need stability with 20 kids in a camp.I don't like the leg-brace side locks. Nothing holds them into the seats but their weight and the table or scaffold's load. I will probably drill a pin hole to improve that so it doesn't jump out somehow.The caster bolts are not high quality. They're adequate but soft metal so the Phillips head strip easily. To get pressure you need a drill or T-grip. A straight screwdriver won't seat the bolts. The nuts are pre-welded and not far off or perfect. But, I couldn't use a retchet on any and a small crescent wrench on only two because there's no clearance. You should be fine unless a welded nut is significantly off. Maybe a needle-nose vice grip would work. The tension washers provided may slip inside the caster bolt hole since it's not a great fit.Still, even though the casters are too high and the caster hardware is third rate, this is a keeper. 4 stars all day long, but could be better.

Very happy so far. I've recently replaced a Sonicare, and this Oral-B has exposed some plaque that my old Sonicare allowed to build up.I'm not certain of which is "better" because I'm comparing an "old" Sonicare motor to a "new" Braun Oral-B. I've found that the Sonicare motors wear down with time and clean less effectively. I'd assume the same is true for the Oral-B.In fact, I remember feeling plaque exposed by the Sonicare when it was new very much like the feeling I have today with the Oral-B.What I DO like about this one is the Floss replacement heads - Sonicare has nothing like them. They seem to break up the plaque noticeably while the head that comes with the brush didn't seem to do as much, although that could be because it's a gradual process and started with the original head.I don't care much for the Bluetooth app, and am disappointed that this model has a NiCad battery - I seem to recall reading one review here that implied that it was replaceable (it's not). Charging required a full 22 hours, and to maintain NiCad there is the inconvenience of the "discharging and completely recharging" cycle periodically. All that battery-memory and discharge mumbo-jumbo is so "last decade" now that all the modern tools use lithium ion batteries without the worries. This isn't covered in the manual, so I'm sure a lot of customers kill the battery much sooner than necessary.

Very convenient and these look like they're arranged for hitting everything - surface, in between and gums. They might not be as effective as the floss action for me, though. I just don't notice as much of a difference afterward.

After one brushing with these I can feel the plaque flaking off. Seriously - I've been brushing with a regular toothbrush for a while after my Sonincare died and ordered these with a new Oral-B 5000. The brush that comes with the 5000 is great, but THIS one has exposed some plaque on the inside of my lower incisors that feels rough to my tongue. I can chip some of it off with a fingernail, where it was smooth before. I'm assuming that this floss-action head is breaking it up. One thing for sure - time for a cleaning!

This worked well for our yard on the edge of the Everglades in Southeast Florida!I "nuked" our yard a few days before a big 4th of July party out of desperation when I realized there were 40 people coming, many from California - where would they be all afternoon and late into the night for the fireworks show if not outdoors? The Everglades is on the other side of the interstate from us and we have canals through our neighborhood - LOTS of bugs of all kinds including nasty "teeth with wings" that I still have scars on my legs from bites 10 years ago before I knew better, hornets that pop out of nests in the ground, and the most painful "dirt" mosquitos (big, black and I don't know what they're using that hurts so bad when they get you).The California people stayed outside the whole afternoon and night - we had a blast - but the Florida people stayed indoors of course. In fact, the Californians spread blankets on the lawn for the show - we just don't do that here in the South. At the end of the night NONE of the fresh-meat from California complained of any bites at all. Floridians know not to even go barefoot on grass around here in July but after spraying with this it was a bug dead-zone and there were none left to feast on those know-nothing Californians. This spray saved them from pain and itch that they had never experienced.I'm sure it reeked havoc on the environment - especially our thriving population of assorted bug-eating lizards and dragon flies that depend on pests - and I feel a little guilty about that. Some of it might have eventually found its way into the canal at the back of our yard although I was careful to stay about 20 feet back. It worked so well that I feel guilty... but not TOO guilty.
Really cool but none of these last very long before the battery dies, and they're all non-replaceable. I wish there was a quality sonicare or braun oral-b option for kids with music.

Really cool looking, but this is just a padded bucket - it does not provide the side-padding or fit of a "normal" bike helmet. There's also no side-venting, just holes in the top. It's FAR better than nothing, and we all grew up without bike helmets, so we're going to let this one go because he picked it, but if you are guiding your child you might avoid this brand/style as an option.

UPDATE:  THIS IS NOT THE SAME QUALITY as the more expensive Sonicare brushes even though they look identical. This one died in less than three months (my third).Original Review:This is my second "replacement" for the same model and both have died after three to four months. I'm not getting the feeling that they are up to the same quality control as the others.

I just cleaned up after a nasty, nasty NASTY toner leak on the first one of these I tried! Until you've had one of these leak inside your printer you have NO idea of how bad it can be.TO FIX:IF you buy one of these and find "splotches" on your prints, you have a major leak inside. Go change your clothes (I should have worn gloves), place damp paper towels everywhere before opening (EVERYWHERE; plastic is not a good alternative because this stuff moves around), open ever-so-carefully, and slowly slide the cartridge tray out placing more damp paper towels as you go - don't carry this over carpets, desks, etc. without some protection. Remove all of the cartridges that are not yet leaking and place them aside. Now wipe-down the inside of your tray and printer. I did not use a vacuum because I could just imagine all that toner blowing everywhere. When you are sure everything is as clean as you can get it (you will NEVER remove all the toner - it will haunt you for the rest of the life of your printer), replace everything and throw any of these pieces of garbage remaining where they belong. NO savings is worth the price of ruining your printer, clothes, carpet, etc. SHEESH. Come on, HQ Supplies, WHAT are you thinking????

Everything about this order has been a pleasure from the delivery time and how well it was packaged through setup and use. The umbrella is fully assembled so you just need to attach the cross-section and then the umbrella brace ("sheath") with the eight bolts & washers (Allen wrench included too), slip the umbrella on the brace and finally hand thghten one last bolt.It is not too heavy but slipping the umbrella on the brace is best done by two.I ordered the Coolaroo weights and am glad for them. They are low profile and look a lot better than the big plastic one we used for our prior umbrella.That umbrella was probably in the $190 range and this one is by far a more attractive, larger and better quality.  I really feel this is a very good value.Everything works smoothly including the 360- degree foot petal rotation and the cover that comes with it.It is huge and can cover the pool steps as well as a few chairs. At the lowest height it's about 7-feet high. I'm 6-foot and don't feel the need to duck.This took a 20-mph gust without a problem and it is so easy to raise and lower that there's no reason to leave it up all the time anyway.

This contains four panels sufficient with just water to anchor an 11-foot offset umbrella in moderate gusts. Fine paver finishing sand will be heavier (instructions say just over 46 lbs. each) and when we are certain of the umbrella's final location that' what we'll use.I filled these easily in the pool lounging on all four like kickboards. Be careful with the caps- one seemed to want to cross-thred but I didn't rush and finally it gave no resistance.  My fear would be opening a slow leak, since the caps are on the side.I am also thinking about connecting the caps with something rust and rot proof so the umbrella's slight movement doesn't eventually spread these enough to let the cross stand break free. There is nothing keeping them together and they only weigh down a 1-inch strip long each side of the cross.The plastic is heavy and the top is braced so it won't eventually break open. They look good too with a low profile.

These are versitile and very well made. I was able to replace an old rusty branch swing in just a few minutes... hardest part was hauling a ladder over and removing the chain. I only needed one of the two so hung a tire too! I'll get another to keep with the camping gear too.

This should be a little more expensive because it is so well made and works great. I am looking at three other fails on my desk and wish this had been first. It will be my last for sure.ANDROID has a large bottom charger cable attachment, and since most of these desk stands are low they don't work well (unless you leave it horizontal, which isn't optimum).This is strong enough to support my Android (Samsung 3 note) and would hold larger phones (like in a case) and support much heavier ones but not a tablet. I even have the charger cable binder-clipped to it. With a little bending you can adjust the height, but I really like mine high, peeking over the computer monitor where I can even pull it closer to answer a hands-free call (like in the ad-photo where the girl is watching it from the sofa).This is probably not a good idea for a car, though, unless you'd wrap it around something - the cable holding it up is strong but jiggles if even 2" is not braced.

These are very good for a six or seven year old - easy to detach (serrated card) easy to put on, stays for a couple of days. The UPS box was very VERY hot when I found it on our doorstep (August in SE Florida, full-sun) but these were not affected.

I am surprised at how bright this is and how easy to install... just screw it into a wall with the enclosed screws, plug in and you are done.Two things - first the default setting lights just a couple of seconds and the screws are soft and strip easily so drill pilot holes large enough for anything other than sheet rock (drywall adapters included).

I purchased these at Costco a bit less expensive, but did you notice that the tins are not as large as the grocery store tins of competing products? There are a couple of problems as well - first, the pull-top seems a bit tighter and springs more, sending oil all over (directly at your clothes if you aren't careful). Maybe this is because of the smaller (narrower) tin. I also find the sardines relatively beat up inside - missing skin and often broken. This doesn't bother me, but clearly they've been processed a bit.
Very solid, fits any dive belt, and very functional for a reel.
Why are there different expiration dates on the bottles? New bottles are supposed to expire in two years - one of mine expires in less than a year.
NICE phone but sometimes not clear - can't understand why. I've had several complaints and disconnected it to find any issues cleared up. So, I can't say that this is working well.
Ho hum... the babies like this more than the older kids.

I'm getting better with this as I use it to measure clear height in industrial buildings and dimensions where a wheel isn't functional. I find it accurate and preferable to a wheel but it is difficult (and sometimes impossible) to measure to outside corners. I also saw errors trying to read a CBS wall 250' away, so it's not always going to work. The laser target (deWalt) has come in handy more than once but it's not perfect either. This isn't going to solve all of your problems, but as a commercial real estate appraiser I wouldn't be without it.

I purchased two for a pool party - they're OK although one of the batteries is weak and only goes a few hours (can't remember which though!). The biggest problem is that they are pretty much unnecessary - it's not like the light show is spectacular or anything.

I realize that this is probably much more expensive than it needs to be, but if I somehow lost mine I'd buy it again. We are finally rid of "the duck" and I don't worry about the pellets making my skimmer-bucket brittle (as they will do), and when this floats to the surface it's an instant reminder. Occasionally, somehow these develop an air bubble that brings them up, but this is toward the end of the pellets anyway. I usually place three inside plus whatever is left over. No matter where you put it, it will eventually find its way to the deepest point but no problem with that.

I already reviewed the other type (non-recycle bins). These are great and I'll always keep them around for parties, but the top does tear occasionally and the cardboard isn't cut out deeply enough so that it doesn't always set up correctly. BUT, better with them than without when they're needed even considering the cost.

I measure exteriors as often as interiors, and only sometimes can I find something magnetic at a wall-corner for this. I'd try tape but don't want the mess - especially around paperwork. This needs something... may be a clipboard-like clamp with small teeth capable of holding a corner? Otherwise, yes I can see the laser better with this than not and I always have it with me.

Not too impressed - the mallets are a little light from what I remember and so the balls don't roll well unless you have just the right grass (and you won't find the right grass at most public parks). Also, why couldn't the mallet-handle screws be made of something a little more durable than rough-cut wood? The mallets don't fit in the bag unless you take them apart each time, and sure enough they're going to strip.

I thought we'd use one of these per party (also bought the recycle set), but when 40 people showed up for a Fourth of July party I'm so glad we had the ten-pack. They're fairly sturdy - the tops could be better because some ripped and the cardboard wasn't properly pre-cut on several, but overall we were far better off even considering the price than if we didn't have them. I think the best part was that with so many distributed around our yard nobody left trash anywhere - it was easy for them to just drop trash and recyclables in the right containers.

No clickety-click because it doesn't rotate - the vents are angled instead. The white-noise is nice and steady and on medium I can feel the breeze about 15 feet away on the other side of my wife. You don't get a direct occasional blast.

They're correct - these are extra strong BUT if you leave any gap between the plate and magnets or the plate isn't flush with the magnets it reduces the strength considerably. Say you just mount the plate with a piece of strong tape - it's not the same as a direct connection. This is actually a plus in case you don't want to have to fight to open something because the magnet and plate stick together so well that my six year old can't separate them.

I love these in spite of a little problem with my speaker wire, which has thick connectors and doesn't fit through the poles. Also, at the speaker, the wire connector is so thick that it doesn't fit the bracket holding it to the pole. Both of these problems are with MY wires, not this product, and the product is so simple and well designed that it deserves five stars for the price. It is well balanced and looks good.

The other reviews here are great so I'll compare the Cumberland and Togiak for you. I purchased both. Both have "backpack" straps for short hauls (unpadded). Both are roomy! The Cumberland seems a little like overkill - really roomy but a bit heavier. Cumberland pockets are larger but the Togiak pockets have more chambers. There are no rod holders on either, but the Cumberland has two drink holders while Tojiak has none. The Cumberland has a large storage pocket net on the seat-back while Togiak doesn't. The valves are different - Togiak deflates slower but is idiot proof while the Cumberland has better valves but keepers that may break eventually. Inflating with the Classic Accessories Hand Pump is equal.I'm 285 6' and while I can't lay back comfortably on either to sun, my bottom rides above the water on both. The Cumberland is much higher, however. Don't count on back support from either but the Cumberland probably wins by far if you are lighter than me.All this said, we aren't using these for fishing - we use them for snorkeling at the Lauderdale by the Sea reef park. We rarely get on top because they both pull easily through calm water (if it's not calm or there's much of a wind, we don't go). Neither has a diver-down flag (required here) slot but with the Togiak I can use medium size office binder clips on the side of the seat. With the Cumberland alone you'd need to let the flag float too. There are no tow-rings so you have to use the d-rings on the bottoms (not a problem). With a long bungee, rope or backpack strap you can make a side-handle for each to hang a game bag, spear and lobster snare. This will also support tanks very securely with a hookah setup and probably a pump as long as its heat doesn't melt anything. You'll have to bring extra bungees as tie-downs though... don't wait until you are on the beach!We are never in surf so can throw our gear into the front mesh bow on our way into or out of the water. It's easier to gear-up chest-deep. My wife and I wear standard web dive belts with reels to tow the tubes - we do not kick out on top (we might miss a turtle or tarpon). Our son gets to ride.We tie them to stay together while resting. A light kayak anchor will keep them in place, and there's plenty of room up front for small ice chests (they get wet though).I thought we might be able to relax in these on the beach but the seatbacks just aren't comfortable enough and the sun will expand the air in the tubes dangerously.Bottom line, I prefer the Togiak because it is smaller yet still very functional

Nice, smooth action fills any of the float tubes with little effort in just a few minutes. My six year old can do it. I wish the connectors didn't have to be hand-held while pumping though (minus one star).

The other reviews here are great so I'll compare the Cumberland and Togiak for you. I purchased this and the Cumberland. Both have "backpack" straps for short hauls (unpadded). Both are roomy! This is a little smaller and rolls into a smaller bag (not included), is lighter, and has more though smaller pockets. There are no rod holders on either, but the Cumberland has two drink holders while this has none. The Cumberland has a large storage pocket net on the seat-back while this one doesn't. This will also support tanks very securely with a hookah setup and probably a pump as long as its heat doesn't melt anything. You'll have to bring extra bungees as tie-downs though... don't wait until you are on the beach!We are never in surf so can throw our gear into the front mesh bow on our way into or out of the water. It's easier to gear-up chest-deep. My wife and I wear standard web dive belts with reels to tow the tubes - we do not kick out on top (we might miss a turtle or tarpon). Our son gets to ride.We tie them to stay together while resting. A light kayak anchor will keep them in place, and there's plenty of room up front for small ice chests (they get wet though).I thought we might be able to relax in these on the beach but the seatbacks just aren't comfortable enough and the sun will expand the air in the tubes dangerously.

Fits my wife's odd size Trek in a variety of places and positions without any tools and can be changed or re-angled on the fly. I think all water bottle cages should be made with these. This should fit any bike.
Fits my old trek 7700 hybrid circa 2005 (I think). Good materials and easy installation.
This holds two pair of large sunglasses securely, pivots to make it even easier, and is easy to load/unload. I have no complaints - just wish I had found this years ago.

I am not yet efficient at loading/unloading the cell phone from this mount, but once clamped in it's solid and prominent right next to my steering wheel so I don't have to move my eyes much. I have a galaxy note 3 and there's plenty of room for a wider (or narrower) screen.Minus one star because it's so difficult to load and unload, but I'm already getting better at it.

We do not eat a lot of meat in my house so we probably do not obtain a lot of the antioxident CoQ10. Since CoQ10 is not known to cause many side effects and is thought to improve heart and lower cholesterol, we've added it to our daily diet. Since antioxidants are a supplement that works long-term, I didn't expect to see any immediate positive effects.The pills are about 5/8-inch, medium-sized, easy to swallow softgels. There is no aftertaste or smell, and I have not experienced any side effects. These are 100mg pills, so I only need to take one per day.There are not a lot of extra fillers although the capsules do contain the addition of black pepper, which aids in absorption. This bottle of aCoQ10 is ubiquinone which is less expensive than ubiquinal but not as easily absorbed without a boost, ie the BioPerine (black pepper). That doesn't affect the quality and is more cost effective for those who can use this formula.

The Transformation Ultra is a thick, creamy lotion with almost no unpleasant chemical odor that I find with some self-tanners. Instead, it had a cucumber melon scent. I found it a bit too sweet and strong, but far better than the smell of chemicals.The lotion is thick and easy to apply. However, it goes on sheer and does not provide an instant tan like some of the other XEN-TAN products, and I ended up missing a spot the first time I used it. I applied it with the XEN-TAN Deluxe Tanning Mitt. It is not necessary to use the mitt, but it did a nice job keeping my hands clean and was easy to rinse out. The mitt is sold separately and lasts through multiple applications.This tanner reaches full color after about 10 hours. It takes about an hour to dry and does not rub off until it is rinsed with water. I waited the full time before rinsing it off and the result was a deep, dark color tan which lasted almost a week. It faded naturally until the last few days when it became a little splotchy.I tried again, this time only leaving the tanner on for an hour before rinsing. The color was much nicer this time and more in line with my normal skin tone. And this time it faded evenly.I've tried many tanning products over the years with varying levels of success and find that XEN-TAN makes some of the best.

I go through a lot of disposable gloves cleaning cages and toys at an animal shelter where I volunteer several times a week. I prefer nitrile gloves for their strength and resistance to tearing, so I was happy to try out the Ammex gloves.These are higher quality and much more durable than the standard all-purpose gloves I had been using. They are also much thicker, which makes them stronger and tear-resistant. The extra-long cuff (12 in vs the standard glove at 9 in) is perfect to keep water from  splashing inside the glove when my hands are in the wash tub.While these are a little more expensive than standard type gloves, they are  strong enough to survive more than one use. Plus, I would often go through more  than one pair of standard gloves in one day, making these more economical than  they at first appear.These gloves run true to size. I wear a medium if I want a tight, close fit. Because I'm cleaning cages and taking the gloves on and off a lot, I went with a size larger. These slide on and off easily, yet still have a good fit.

After many hours, I have come to the conclusion that this camera or its software is not compatible with my tri-band router. I consistently receive the response: Connecting failed, try again.I began by installing the latest version of the app on my Samsung Galaxy 4 and scanned the QR code. The software sees my network. I enter the password and after a minute or so receive the response: Connecting failed, try again.I have tried many times and it never connects. The quickstart guide and webpage are useless. Troubleshooting instructs me to be certain DHCP is enabled; it is. Next, it says to press the reset button on the camera and try again. I did that several times. Oddly enough, after it fails to connect the software offers an option to use a wired connection. This camera does not have a port for a wired connection.Thinking of more things to try, I thought perhaps it needed an SD card installed to connect (even though according to the quick start guide it is optional). So I put in an SD card. Didn't help. Still no connection.I am using a new (several months old) TP-Link tri-band router with 2.4 and 5GHz bands. Since the specs for the camera say it works on a 2.4GHz band, I verified that it is detecting proper band; it is. I then set my phone to only use the 2.4 band and not roam to the 5GHz band. Then I rebooted the phone, the router, and reset the camera and tried again from the beginning. The app sees the network, but gives the same response: Connection failed.Not ready to give up yet - I really wanted this to work - I decided to rule out a defective camera and tested it on a family member's network. They have an AT&T 2-wire combo router/modem. The camera connected instantly. We played with it for a while and it worked fine. The picture quality was good but broke up at the highest resolution, probably because of the low bandwidth connection. The sound was also good although only one direction.Unfortunately, I can find no way to make the camera work with my router in my home. However, if you have a router that the software likes, it may be a good, inexpensive option. On the down side, there is no way to know unless you buy the camera and try it out since there is little to no support.

A very gentle makeup remover that did a nice job melting off mascara without a lot of rubbing. I have sensitive eyes that get irritated very easily so the less scrubbing I have to do, the better they feel. And I only needed to use a small amount of the remover to get results.The real test for me is how easily it removes waterproof mascara, and this did a superb job, better than any other product I've tried. It did leave a slight oily feel but not too bad. I wash my face with a mild soap after tissuing it off so there is no reside left the next morning.

We do not eat a lot of meat in my house so we probably do not obtain a lot of the antioxidant CoQ10. Since CoQ10 is not known to cause many side effects and is thought to improve heart and lower cholesterol, we've added it to our daily diet. Since antioxidants are a supplement that works long-term, I didn't expect to see any immediate positive effects.The pills are about 5/8-inch medium-sized, easy to swallow softgels. There is no aftertaste or smell, and I have not experienced any side effects. These are 100mg pills, so I only need to take one per day.There are not a lot of extra fillers although the capsules do contain the addition of black pepper, which aids in absorption. This bottle of aCoQ10 is ubiquinone which is less expensive than ubiquinal but not as easily absorbed without a boost, ie the BioPerine (black pepper). That doesn't affect the quality and is more cost effective for those who can use this formula.

Crow Made a Friend is a picture book designed for very early readers. Pages are brightly illustrated in watercolor with short, simple sentences that young children can easily follow. Crow himself is an iridescent rainbow of colors rather than the usual solid black, giving him a cheerful, inviting look. Drawings of trees, leaves, a nest, and birds are easy for young children to relate to and are words they can associate and remember. A downloadable activity sheet with cutouts is available so children can make their own crow friend, adding some fun to the reading experience.

I go through a lot of disposable gloves cleaning cages and toys at an animal shelter where I volunteer several times a week. I prefer nitrile gloves for their strength and resistance to tearing, so I was happy to try out the Ammex gloves.These are very nice all-purpose gloves and do a great job protecting my hands. They are strong and tear-resistant. I can often use them more than one time, a definite plus. They have a very light texture which is good for gripping objects when my hands are wet.I wear a medium if I want a tight, close fit. Because I'm cleaning cages and taking the gloves on and off a lot, I went with a size larger and was happy that I did. These slide on and off easily, yet still have a secure fit.

In the spring I tried to fill in some patchy areas in the lawn in my backyard with a sun and shade mix. I have no idea what kind of grass is back there - I think a little bit of everything. Problem is, I now have lots of different patches that don't match!To solve the patchy problem, I had yard aerated a few weeks ago. Then I overseed with the Kentucky Bluegrass. It's a little late in the year and a bit chilly at night so the seed is took a little longer than usual to sprout, but I prefer the slow, cooler germination rather than summer when the lawn dries out and the grass dies.One other thing to note: It is helpful to do a seed germination test if one is concerned that the seeds are not sprouting. Mine are slow because of the cold, but I tested them anyway by placing a layer of seed on a moist paper towel and putting it in a baggie in a warm sunny window. Seeds sprouted within a few days. The window provided ideal conditions but it demonstrates the seeds are healthy.I have the 7-pound bag which is more than enough for my yard . Be aware that the seed comprises approximately half the total weight with the remainder being the water smart coating. Nice to have as I don't have to worry about watering every day.

I suffer from dry skin much of the year but it gets worse in the winter. Problem areas like the back of my hands, finger nail cuticles, and heels of my feet suffer from a lack of moisture. And worst of all, the back of my legs get very itchy in the winter and I am constantly searching for a product that will provide relief for more than a few minutes.The Excipial lotion is unscented - which is nice because it doesn't compete with my scented lotion that I use on the rest of my body. It's not greasy unless you use too much. It is absorbed quickly, within a minute or so. It immediately stops the tight itchy feeling and makes my skin feel softer and smoother, and my skin feels good for hours.

I have used enzyme supplements in the past and they work great to aid digestion and a reduction in gas. I take them before eating foods that I know will cause problems and they cut down the bloating and discomfort by at least 50%.The product I actually received for review was for gluten digestion, not gas. I don't have a problem with gluten, at least not that I am aware of. Friends tell me my headaches and sinus problems are gluten related, so I tried the Jarro-Zymes for Gluten Digestion that I received. No real changes to report. However, I can say they didn't cause any adverse reactions or ill effects and are probably worth a try for those with gluten problems.

I have a pair of oak bar stools that have raw wood legs and without some kind of padding on the feet, they will scratch my floor. The legs of the stools are at an angle and the plastic protectors that I've tried constantly fall off, as do the stick-on type felt pads.These silicon gel chair leg caps stay put and do not fall off. The caps easily stretch to fit over the one inch diameter chair leg bottoms, firmly grip the leg, and stay in place even when moving or lifting the stool. And the clear gel, rather than a color, looks really nice too.Disclosure: I received a free sample of this product for my honest and unbiased feedback.

I was pleasantly surprised that this tasted so good mixed only with water. And it mixed quite easily. No clumping or grittiness. It will start to separate if you don't drink it quickly, but a quick stir and it is good to go again.I usually have to mix powdered supplements with juice to get a decent taste, but not this one. It has a mild citrus taste, a little on the sweet side, but not too bad.  I like it, and it's an easy way to hopefully boost my immune system.

I admit, I was skeptical that this product would work any better than an air freshener. Well, it works. It works amazingly well! Two or three sprays into the bowl and onto the water was all that was needed to stop most odors before they started. Any more than that and the spray itself became overpowering.The Poo-Pourri is a blend of essential oils and uses all natural ingredients. It really does trap odors in the water and leaves a fresh smell. I tried several different scents and liked the Juniper Woods the best.It's packaged in a cute bottle, pretty enough to leave out on the top of the toilet tank. The only issue I've had is that the bottle uses a standard pump sprayer which does tend to leak a little.

Both my husband and I have been taking these in the evening before dinner and are pleased with the results. As we have gotten older we have begun to experience digestive issues with many more foods and find that these pills help cut down on bloating and gas.Previously we had tried Beano, ginger, or papaya. This is a better solution. In addition to containing natural digestive enzymes like in Beano, it also contains pre and probiotics plus papaya, ginger, pectin, and peppermint - all good things for the tummy. I keep the bottle out on the dinner table so we don't forget to take it before eating.

I have been taking probiotics for years, ever since I had pneumonia and the antibiotics I had to take left me with some serious digestive system issues. The probiotics worked and after a few weeks restored the good bacteria to my body.In my search for a good brand of probiotics I found a wide variation in quality and effectiveness. The common drugstore type with 1 billion CFUs probably won't do much. The more good organisms the capsule contains, the better it is. Many are destroyed while navigating the digestive tract, so the more organisms the each pill contains, the greater the odds enough will make through the stomach and into the lower intestine.I am not sure why this would be considered a "men's formula". The strains of bacteria would benefit women as well as men. As both my husband and I take probiotics daily, we both tested the pills. Each capsule of The Garden of Life Probiotics contains a proprietary blend of 50 billion CFU, making it necessary to take only one  per day.  The capsules are medium-sized and are easy to swallow. There is no aftertaste and we did not experience any side effects.

Resveratrol is a compound found in the skins of red grapes, and through it's antioxidant properties is thought to have an anti-aging effect on the body. I have been adding natural supplements to my diet that have antioxidant and cholesterol lowering properties in an effort to improve my overall health.There has been a lot of hype surrounding resveratrol and few clinical trials confirming any benefits. However, preliminary research does show the possibility of some benefits.It's difficult to evaluate after only a few weeks whether or not the capsules are having any positive results, however, I can say they have not caused any side effects. They are medium size capsules, are easy to swallow, and there is no aftertaste.I am taking these capsules as part of an overall strategy along with a healthy diet plus other vitamins and herbal supplements.[I received a free sample of this product for my honest and unbiased feedback.]
