And it's small enough to fit inside my tablet bag, a Solo Storm Collection Universal 10-Inch Tablet Sling.Let's face it, I love it.Just a quick recap below:Positives:SmallLightBack lit keyboardDevice standMouse buttonsOFN sensorAble to pair up to four devices and switch between themNegatives:(Small)

The Turtle Beach "Heroes of the Storm" gaming headset is a fine headset for either gaming or just listening to music. It comes with 50mm speakers, a high-sensitivity microphone, and in-line controls. The mic is detachable and you can plug it in and pull it out of the socket as needed. The only disadvantage to this feature lies in the danger of misplacing the mic.Because I previously reviewed the Turtle Beach X12 amplified stereo gaming headset, I will compare the two here. Keep in mind as I do that the X12 is available from Amazon for $40.99 while the Heroes headset, also from Amazon, is $79.99. I suspect quite a bit of the price with the latter is attached to the aesthetics and adaptability of the headset.The X12 is engineered for XBOX 360 but is also compatible with pc gaming. The X12, like the Heroes of the Storm headset, features 50mm speakers and inline controls.  The advantage here is with the X12 controls, which allow you to  control both game and chat volume and bass boost, as well as muting the mic. The Heroes of the Storm controls,on the other hand, allow only the control of volume and muting the mic. I do think it is nice to be able to separate chat from game volume.The X12 mic is not removable but you can just swivel it up out of the way when not in use. I don't see one as superior to the other in this regard; it's really just a matter of preference, though as I say, I don't have to worry about losing the X12's mic.The biggest difference between these two headsets that I can discern (besides price) is that the X12 headset can be used for XBOX 360 but also with the pc, while the Heroes of the Storm headset is for pc/Mac and mobile gaming and lacks the XBOX 360 Talkback cable. Because the X12 is for console gaming, it also has a much longer cable, 16 feet compared to the 8-foot Heroes cable. I have to admit the 16-foot cable, while nice to have depending on how close your TV is to your chair, is often annoyingly in the way while using it with a computer, forcing you to gather it up and bind it with the attached Velcro strap.The Heroes of the Storm headset is also a licensed Blizzard product and can be used with various character ear plate skins available from Turtle Beach for about $25, in case you prefer Spiderman or Thor or another game to Heroes of the Storm. I don't personally care what is on the ear plate but if you do this might be a selling point for you. I'm just interested in ear sets that work.Quality-wise, there seems to be little difference between the two headsets. I do think I detect a little bit of static or background noise with the X12 that is not apparent with the Heroes headset, but the quality of the music/sound effects seems to be about the same. My ear, at any rate, cannot discern any other difference except in the level of bass, which, as I say, cannot be controlled with the Heroes of the Storm headset. As I'm not big on lots of bass, this isn't a big deal to me. Overall, the balance of treble and bass in the Heroes headset seems very good.I do think the X12 headset is more comfortable on top of the head. The headband is broader and feels like it has more padding, or maybe the pressure is just more broadly distributed. I am barely conscious of its presence, while I can always feel the Heroes headset atop my head.The Heroes headset does have deeper ear cups, an inch of padding compared to a half-inch on the X12, which I think blocks out room sounds better, and there the Heroes headset is definitely more comfortable. It's a trade off and you can't have everything, apparently but comfortable ear cups are a must if you game for long periods or listen to music while doing homework or even reading.One big plus is that the ear cups on the Heroes headset rotate far more than those on the X12, which barely wiggle at all, making them more comfortable to wear around your neck when not in use (they won't dig into your neck like the X12's ear cups do). This latter feature is no small thing if you need to pull them off to answer the phone or have a conversation.If you're a gamer these are a very nice pair of headsets to have, and they're not terribly expensive when you consider how much you could end up paying for high-end headsets. These suit all my gaming needs and then some and yes, the X12s are cheaper, but I will probably pass the X12s along to my son and keep these for myself simply because they are more comfortable when everything is taken into account.

I absolutely love this House of Marley Liberate speaker. I mean, it's awesome, and for so many reasons. The sound is pure and clear, and without the slightest hint of distortion, even when the music is turned up very loud.It took a matter of seconds to make the Blue Tooth connection between my phone and the speaker (and after you turn it off, just pressing the power button hooks them right back up again) and proceeded to listen to some music I had stored on my phone, and then to watch some music videos online. The sound was incredible, just as it was for the movie trailers I watched next.The Liberate is small and light but has a good solid feel to it, and because it's so small you can put it about anywhere, which means I can take it from room to room and always have music with me. It has a rechargeable battery, a USB port hidden in the back on one side (an auxiliary jack for audio devices on the other) and comes with a cable for charging.It's an attractive unit and I don't mind the idea of it sitting on my shelf or desk (or anywhere else) making beautiful music. It is easily worth the asking price.Highly recommended.

This is truly old school history. By that, I mean the author, Gordon Corrigan, is English and has clear anti-French biases which he never denies (he writes, for example, that "I cannot hide my conviction that England's demands on France were lawful and justified"). I'm sure many a French historian would disagree, and it is difficult for a historian to make such claims and hope to have his claims to be impartial in the telling of the story taken seriously. I mean, this is a man who has never quite gotten over the loss of France. A real eye-opener for an American.Also, this is not a modern history from the bottom, a story about individuals, about civilians or private soldiers. It is a history written by a military man of military campaigns told from the top down. It is full of heroes, mostly English (Joan of Arc gets short-shrift from the author). A Great and Glorious Adventure is an unapologetic flag-waver of a history book: Consider his statement that "the Hundred Years War as a great adventure, and a great and righteous cause." People don't talk like this anymore. Especially about war.For me, sitting here in the United States, this is like an American author writing about the American Revolution not in a detached way as a straightforward history, but damning our English enemies for their infamy. It was over 200 years ago. I wasn't there. No Englishman alive today was there.For Corrigan, the events he writes about are half a millennium the past. Part of me wants to shout, "Get over it!" But I recognize that we in America lack the long history between our country and another, especially a history so bitter. The subject is, after all, a series of wars that went off and on for a century or so.For all that, this book is a splendid read and a rousing good yarn, even for an American like me. This is true not only because of the exciting events he describes but the way in which Corrigan describes them. He writes well and provides a wealth of interesting tidbits along with the accounts of battles and campaigns (like the fact that horses are unable to vomit). So I smile, absorb it, and read along. It is difficult to not become enthused like a schoolboy. It made me want to watch Kenneth Branagh's Henry V again.If I have a complaint at all it is about the maps, which are rudimentary at best and not worthy of a military history. Several of the regional maps are mostly blank and white, with a river or two and some scattered towns thrown in. Yes, the towns marked match references in the text, battles, sieges, and so forth, but could we have more detail? Routes of march? Castles? Deployment of forces? Or even more geographical features? It is difficult, looking at them, to get a sense of how the campaigns played out. The battle maps, at least, are better.In the end, if you are interested in the subject, want a recent analysis that is also a gripping narrative, and are willing to put up with the historian cheering one side on over the other, I dare say you will enjoy this book. I did.

This is a Steampunk story filled with mystery and intrigue, not to mention some magic and romance. It is not, however, in your face Steampunk. There is the requisite airship, important to any Steampunk adventure, but magic comes more to the forefront. I am a fan of Steampunk and I will say up front I am not disappointed. Magic is fun too.The main character, Octavia Leander, is a medician, a healer, and a very gifted one at that. She is in the middle of a war between civilization and the wild, less refined parts of their world. Octavia thinks that she is being put on assignment by her mentor at the academy to a city that has fallen to a wide spread plague-like disease. They are desperate for medical assistance there, which calls to her on a personal level. She embarks on a trip in an air vessel and suddenly encounters Clockwork Daggers, or assassins for the crown, who claim they are only trying to protect her against those that would kidnap her for their own reasons.During the journey her roommate is brutally attacked and nearly dies, and she herself is nearly killed as someone pushes her out of the window.  The air ship is taken over by the "bad guys" who want her to help their people in the wild areas, rather than proceeding to the town she was assigned.In the end there is attraction and love, friendship, hatred, death, destruction, heroism, secrets, lies, betrayal and truth that is hard to accept. Enough, in other words, for any fan of speculative fiction.The characters are sympathetic and well developed. The story is gripping and engaging and it is difficult to put aside once it is started, and that is, after all the best measure of a book, the inability to set it down and the impossibility of leaving it there once you do.

I love this light. I have night lights throughout my house because I have a two year old and we are just bed training and he wakes up at night sometimes and I don't ever want him to feel scared if he can't see. So I have this light right next to his bed. I have it stuck right to the wall next to his bed, so when he gets up it turns on immediately. It's bright enough to light his whole room. The sensor on it is very sensitive which I like because it picks up the motion from across the room. This way he never has to walk in the dark if he is going back to his bed either. The light is pretty bright and dim at the same time. I like the shape of it to. Izyk calls it his little star. The light comes with a self adhesive sticker that sticks to the light and the wall. It would come off easily without messing up the paint to. All in all we both love this light and I would absolutely recommend it. It could be used in any room of the house. I will be getting more of these in the near future. Disclosure: I received this product for free in exchange for my honest review. As always all opinions are 100% my own.

Carbon Monoxide detectors are so important to have in every room in your house. Especially if you live in a older house or if you have gas to cook with like I do.. We have one in every room. We started out with those cheap ones that didn't have a screen on it to see what your actual levels are. So once I found these I was happy and had to get one. These are great because like I said it shows you the levels right on the digital screen. I really love this feature. I now have a digital one in every room. About three days after I got this one we had a scare when it went off. I immediately called the fire dept to have them come check it out. We live in a super old house. They came out and said the levels were high because of the stove. So we had to get it fixed. I am so grateful for this detector. I really couldn't stress enough how important it is to have these in your house. Disclosure: I received this product for free I exchange for my honest review. As always all opinions are 100% my own.

I use this for my business cards. I needed something bad for them. I had piles of loose cards. So I use this. Before I couldn't find a girly card holder that I wanted. They were all to manly. This is just perfect. It's light weight, girly, and holds card perfectly with a snap to keep the book shut. It's well made and can be carried anywhere. You could use it for your ID, credit cards, social security card etc. I would totally recommend this card holder! It's great! Disclosure: I received this product for free in exchange for my honest review. As always all opinions are 100% my own.

My son and I absolutely love this! We use it almost every night. It lights up the whole living room bright like the nights sky. The process of putting it together was a bit of a task. It took me about a hour and half. It did come out looking good but my only complaint is, is it doesn't spin like it is supposed to. Other than that it is great. We love it. It's very educational and fun. I would recommend it whether it spins or not. Disclosure: I bought this product at full price. As always all opinions are 100% my own.

I bought this for my husband. He absolutely loves it! I definitely scored some wife points the day it got here! He desperately needed a new one! His was all beat up and just needed to be retired. This one is just what he needed! The board folds up so he can keep the pieces inside when not in use and it is made from wood. The shiney finish is a nice touch. His last one didn't have that so he loved the new and improved set! The price was great to! I really couldn't beat it. I would totally recommend it & so does the hubbs! Disclosure: I bought this product at full price. As always all opinions are 100% my own.

I know I'm not the only one that needs a million USB cords. I have one in every room in the house just for myself & I keep one in the car. I gave my husband one out of the pack. He got the black one. That is his designated cord. I need mine. I love that these are flat and super easy to take with of you need to. They work great & fit snug in my phone and the port. I was SUPER excited when I got these. Maybe I am just a dork but I love them and would totally recommend them! You just can't go wrong! Disclosure: I received this product in exchange for my honest review. As always all opinions are 100% my own.

This diffuser is amazing! I have a couple others and they just can't compare. The quality of this diffuser is amazing. When you pick it up you can just automatically feel the difference in the quality. It's not heavy but it has weight to it. The plastic is thick and very well made. The shape I just love because its like abstract. It goes with every room. The colors are so pretty and relaxing. Just turn it on put in your favorite scent and your good to go for a relaxing day or night. This diffuser just looks high class, it could be used at home, the office or even given as a gift. I would absolutely recommend this diffuser. It is the best of the best! Disclosure: I received this product in exchange for my honest review. As always all opinions are 100% my own.

I absolutely love this! Elephants are my favorite animal & it seems that my two year old son is quite keen on them also. He pulls this elephant around with his all day. He has even brought it to bed with him a few times. I just love wooden toys. Not only do they last a lot longer but they are nicer than plastic toys. This elephant could be set on a shelf as decoration or just played with as a regular toy. I would absolutely recommend this wooden elephant! Disclosure: I received this product for free in exchange for my honest review. As always all opinions are 100% my own.

This is great! I actually got it for my two year old and daddy but I'm the one that ended up doing it! I will admit I absolutely love stuff like this! This particular set was super easy to put together. Well, not super easy but easy. The pieces went together well I only had to sand down the steering wheel price so it would fit correctly. Other than that it went together with ease. The directions were easy to follow step by step and I was done in a bout a hour. I am in the middle of painting it now. I will update with photos whne I'm done with that. I am painting the body red and yellow for my son. This set also came with a piece of sand paper and paint with a paint brush. It has everything you need to finish the job just the way you like it. I glied the wheels on when I was done and the side mirrors but the whole body stayed tightly fitted. I would absolutely recommend this 3D puzzle. I absolutely plan on getting all of the sets! Disclosure: I received this product in exchange for my honest review. As always all opinions are 100% my own.

I was really excited to get this utensil set. I threw away all my others and was thinking I wasn't gonna need new ones for a very long time. I was wrong. I use the spatula in my house probably more than any other utensil. The first time I used the spatula from this set. It melted on me. I was so upset. The black plastic just started melting right off into our food. No, I wasn't sitting there holding the spatula on the pan. I was literally just scooping fairly quickly and flipping the burgers. I had to throw it away after that. I couldn't just let it keep melting. I do have the rest of the set still. Everything else works great and hasn't melted on me. It does its purpose. The stand doesn't rotate very easily either. But it does if you have a good grip on it. Would I recommend this set? Probably not. Disclosure: I received this product for free in exchange for my honest review. As always all opinions are 100% my own.

I love love love this scent! LOVE IS ON has a beautiful floral rose scent with a very slight vanilla undertone. I do not like musky or herbal scents, and much prefer a clean, floral scent, and this Revlon product fits the bill. The presentation outer box is a bit of a let down - simple red clear plastic walls - but the bottle itself is quite lovely and feminine. I had a bit of problem getting the bottle open originally, because of the shape of the vessel itself. The spray is fine so you are not deluged with the scent. Overall, a lovely, feminine scent in a lovely, feminine vessel. This would make a very nice gift.

I helped redecorate my grandson's room, and we wanted to put his 18" flat screen up on the wall, but it did not have the correct set up on the back to do so, so this shelf was what I chose as an alternative to a wall mounting. The shelf is well made and sturdy, and held his 16 pound television set without problem (we did tie the base of the TV to the back of the shelf, just to ensure safety). On the second shelf we placed his cable box. The stem of the shelf hides all the cords! It looks great! The sleek, modern look and smokey glass shelves appealed to my grandson. Overall, I highly recommend.

This is my third Kindle and probably my favorite to date. The addition of the front and back camera and SD card slot is a great improvement! I also appreciate the size of this 7" -- it "plays" big but fits in my purse perfectly. My one and only complaint is that the touch screen is a little less responsive than the older Kindles -- I often have to tap a link two or three times to get it to connect. Also, I'd like to see a "clear all" button on the screen that shows you what apps are currently running. But hey, it's a GREAT tablet and it's pretty much replaced my laptop now! And you sure can't beat that $49 price!!

Because my grandchildren often play with my Kindle Fire, I have to have a sturdy case. This Amazon Fire Case fits the new 7" Kindle Fire HD perfectly and protects it well. I use my Kindle to watch TV or movies while doing housework, so appreciate the way this case allows the Kindle to "stand up" for easier viewing. I highly recommend.

Very simple and easy app that my 19 month old grandson can do on his own - and does so often! A swipe of the finger brings up another picture with a cute photo and audio word. Very simple and age appropriate.

My 19 month old grandson loves ALL the Kissta toddler games, but this one seems to be his favorite. Several coloring options and just swipe your finger back and forth to color the picture in. Very simple and age appropriate.

I purchased this portable bed for my 4 year old granddaughter's visit. It's OK, but nothing I'd want her to sleep on for more than one or two nights. There is no mattress or even padding of any kind on the flat sleep surface. I went out and bought foam padding (another $27!) to put underneath the "sheet" that comes with the cot, just to soften it up a bit for her. The bed seems sturdy, but unless the child is laying on it, the legs do not actually "lock" into place -- it's the body pressure that keeps them down. And be sure and check the bed's measurements! It's smaller than I anticipated and I don't think anyone over the age of 5 would fit on it. We'll keep it to use for a camping cot for the younger grandchildren, but I certainly wouldn't want to put a child on this for any extended period of time.

I'm so pleased with this 2-in-1 Tool! I own a Hoover Quiet Performance Bagged Canister Vacuum, and the tiny brush it came with is all but useless. This Home Source Combo attachment fits perfectly and is a great multi-use tool. I use the brush side for quick cleaning of blinds, top of baseboards and air flow registers, and flip the brush over and use the upholstery brush -- which actually does an amazing job. For me, this was money well spent!

We have an 18 foot daysailer, and this cover fits beautifully. Husband has used all kinds of tarps and bungy cords, braced in the middle to prevent sagging, but the don't even compare to how well this HydroPro boat cover fit and protected our boat. Even on the windiest days, the cover stayed tight and the interior of the boat stayed dry. It took two people to put the cover on, but it went on quickly and securely. We haven't had snow yet, so I can't comment on whether the cover sags under the weight of snow, but I will come back and edit if it does. Boats are not cheap, and this rather inexpensive cover is a great way to protect your investment.

Until reading about this product, I never gave a thought to the effects of hard water on my face. But now that I've used this product, I understand! What a difference. Most soaps and facial cleansers dry my face, especially my cheeks and forehead. This product leaves the skin feeling smooth and clean, with no noticeable dryness! A very small amount goes a long way, and when you add water it foams beautifully. My skin feels more clean and definitely less dry. I'm not sure I'll ever use another facial cleansing product now that I've tried this and understand the difference. If you have hard water, don't hesitate to buy this product.

I picked up this set for my 4 year old granddaughter, and I do think she'll like it, if for no other reason than it comes with so many accessories to add to the walls of the studio you build. The magnetic pieces are easy to put together and stay in place, which was a worry, since 4 year olds get so frustrated with pieces that don't stay put. The set is quite vibrant in colors and quite large overall. It is easy to see how imagination will come into play with this toy, but I would have liked to seen just a few more accessories that can be placed in the "rooms" rather than just on the walls - ie some furniture or sinks or a table and chair. But overall its a nice toy for your pet-loving child.

This style shirt just looks so good on my husband! This particular shirt runs just a bit large - he normally wears a 1x or 2x and this XL fit him very nicely without being baggy. The color is a dark smokey gray. Sleeve length is perfect - not so long it hangs over the hands, but long enough to cover the wrists. I've washed and dried the shirt twice now, and shrinkage was negligible. Overall, a high quality shirt that I'm sure will get worn often during the cooler months.

I purchased the new 5th generation Kindle Fire recently. It is so light and so thin that I knew immediately I would need a case to protect it. This NuPro case is very sturdy and provides the protection I was hoping for. It closes with a magnetic/invisible closure. I very much like the fact it has a stylus loop, which so many cases do not. I tend to watch either cable TV or Amazon Prime shows on my Kindle Fire while doing housework, so the horizontal stand is very useful and easy to use. This case has a look of one far more expensive - especially this Navy blue. Overall, I am very pleased and highly recommend this product.

This Melissa and Doug Tabletop Puppet Theater is wonnnnnderful!! Easy to set up and just as charming as it can be, with reversible backdrop. It's not huge - about 24 inches across - so it's definitely a tabletop puppet theater. I do find it unfortunate that no puppets were included, but you can buy them separately at a reasonable price. For any child that loves puppets, this is a great way to let their imagination soar. I highly recommend this product.

This little can holds an amazing amount of laughter and fun! I love having games that the entire family, including young grandchildren, can play and enjoy together, and RING IT! fits the bill. If your child recognizes numbers and colors, they can play this game. It's simple enough for even the youngest to play, but so much fun it holds the interest of even adults. Since it's in such a small container, this is perfect for camping (though your camping neighbors may come to find out what on earth is going on). Easy to understand, flexible to make it harder or easier depending on players - it's all good. I highly recommend.

This game is great fun for the younger crowd, and as a family game night item when you have kids in age ranges 5 to 10. I especially liked that the kids really have to focus on the task at hand (if they want to win, of course) and that the youngest in the group has as good a shot at winning as anyone else. It's very fast-paced, which is also good when it comes to younger children's attention span. If your child knows numbers 1-10 and colors, they'll be able to play this fun game.

Rosacia seems to be genetic in our family - my grandmother, aunts and mother had it, and now I do. I was looking forward to using this cream as both a daily moisturizer and sunscreen. However, I find this cream to be VERY heavy and dense - more like a pancake make-up than a sunscreen. Yes, it covers the red and pink in my cheeks. But it is SO thick that it also spotlights any wrinkles or indentations anywhere on your face, especially around the eyes and mouth. Not a plus in my book. Does it do what it says? Cover up spotting and discolored areas on your face? Yes it does. And I believe it also acts as a sunscreen. But this product may not be for you if you don't like a heavy, thick makeup.

This At-a-Glance 2016 Monthly Planner is OK, but not great. The planner cover is a thin coated cardstock, and bends very easily. Will such a flimsy cover used on a daily basis, will the Planner make it through a year? I'm not so sure. Each month is done in an open 2 page format, and allows for a fair amount of space for each day, but these pages are also of a lesser quality paper, and if you bear down with an ink pen or write with a Sharpie, the writing is going to be seen on the next month's page. The "Contact" area is very no-frills - simple lined boxes to write names and addresses. Overall, I'm just not that impressed with this product. It's not terrible, but it's definitely not a high quality product.

The organizer in me just loves this Planner! The perfect size - approx. 8 1/2 x 5 1/2 - to fit in my purse to keep with me. The perfect set up - one two-page spread to see the entire month, followed by a 4 page section to make notes or to do lists by exact day. Lots of "Notes" pages in the back to write down things like gift ideas, clothing sizes, etc.  I am a List kind of person, and this planner really meets my needs to keep me organized. The cover is a faux leather-covered thick cardstock. Pleasant in appearance with its white lettering and blue edging. My only reason for giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is that I feel for the price, the quality is lower than I expected.

I wanted a Surge Protector for my sewing room, and this Woods 6-Outlet Surge Protector fits the bill perfectly. I use it to plug in my Janome sewing machine, Brother serger, laptop and TV. I needed a surge protector that had an on/off switch so I can turn all the machines off easily. It also offers sliding covers over the outlets, which is perfect for when the smaller grandchildren are in the room with me. And of course, the equipment warranty (up to $100,000) would be much appreciated if necessary! Sewing machines and electronic equipment are not cheap to replace! I also like the fact that the surge protector isn't the standard blah beige. The medium gray color is just a bit more modern than the nondescript beige protectors, and suits my sewing room better. Overall, I recommend this product.

I gave this STORY BY ME set to my 9 year old grandson for something to do this summer. He's VERY artistic, and had just finished going to "art camp" for a week. At first site, he wasn't thrilled. He's a 9 year old that likes to pretend he's 14, and the baby-ish colors of the box turned him off. But once we got the box opened and I explained how to use the kit and that he would get his illustrations put into a "published" book, he was all in. Unfortunately, I can't review the final product, as he is still working on his illustrations ("Have you finished your book yet?" "No, I haven't started. I'm trying to think 'out of the box.'") but I will return and edit my review if the final book is  not acceptable. I can't imagine Crayola would do anything but provide a quality product, however.If you have a budding artist in  your midst, this is a perfect gift!

I am absolutely turning into a big fan of Belkin products. I have several and have always been pleased with how easy they are to set up. I am NOT technologically advanced, believe me, so the Belkin's products ease of use is important to me. This little keyboard is no exception. Within minutes of opening the box, with just a short time to plug the keyboard in and charge the battery, I had it up, running and connected to my Galaxy S5. It is important to read the directions (actually, just a few illustrations) and do the set up in the correct order as given.The keyboard is small, but not uncomfortably small. I find it very comfortable to use. It is also lightweight. It is protected by the hard cover that "snaps" into place, which is also the way to turn the keyboard OFF and ON. As other reviewers have mentioned, I do wish it came with some kind of case just for storage purposes.This product has given me a whole new way to use my Android smartphone! In the past I would put the phone down and move to my laptop if I wanted to type anything more than a few words in response to an email, or message, etc. No more. I keep the keyboard handy and just pop my phone onto the keyboard, and I'm all set.To me, the keyboard feels quite sturdy, and I'm more than impressed with the battery life (the box says six months between charges!). I highly recommend this product.

VERY easy to use and very easy to get your picture hung straight. I used this because I have one piece of art work that drives me crazy. No matter how we've hung it or try to balance it, it just will not stay straight on it's wire hanger. I kept the art work on the wire, but added this Velcro product on the back of the frame - and haven't had to straighten it since! I love it. The strips are rather long for some use, but they are easily cut with scissors. Overall, I highly recommend this product.

If you've not read how easy it is for someone to steal your credit card info using a simple and inexpensive RFID scanner,  you need to Google it and read the information. Scary stuff. One news reporter bought a scanner for under $100, went to a mall and promptly scanned 39 credit cards in under 3 minutes! These sleeves prevent your credit card from being scanned by any such rogue scanner.My credit card(s) fit snugly in the sleeve, but are easy to take out when I want to use them. The envelope itself is made of a stiff cardboard and lined with some type of foil material. I can't vouch on how well they work -- and guess I won't unless I have my cards scanned and identity/credit card info stolen. That's a tough way to find out. But from everything I've read, these sleeves should protect your credit cards just fine.

Very basic nylon net bag with two extra large clamped suction cups. It's not fancy, but it certainly does the trick. An interesting feature is the "hook" on the suction cups, which allow you to hang washcloths. Very useful. The bag has a nylon zipper and is easy to zip and unzip. The toys drain while in the bag - hopefullly eliminating some of the mold problems inside plastic toys. Overall, this is a useful item for anyone with small children who love bath time!

I use headphones several times a day, usually for listening to audio books, and occasionally for music. I normally have the cone-shaped ear buds that fit more firmly into your ears and provide more noise cancellation than these round ear buds. That said, I find I like wearing this type during the day when I actually need to hear what's going on around me. The tone with these is very good, and my audiobooks never sound raspy or garbled. They have a clip at the base of the ear bud, and the package shows a picture of the ear bud clipped to a shirt pocket. I tried this and, while it might work for music you want to hear in the background, it made listening to my audio book difficult at best. Overall, though, I recommend this product.

This Fisher-Price toy is absolutely adorable, and my 16 month old grandson took to it right away. It is bright and colorful, which always gets his attention. This is his first toy that has moveable characters, and he enjoyed putting them in and taking them out of the building - over and over and over again. His first love is all things music, so once I showed him how to play the many songs, he was enthralled for another 30 minutes. The Activity Zoo is well built and durable, and seems like it will withstand the test of time (and throwing). Overall, I'm very pleased with this toy, but more importantly, my grandson is very pleased to sit and play with it!

I love cloth napkins and have many, many sets. This set is has quite a luxurious feel to it, and a modern appearance. They are actually quite beautiful and will be a wonderful addition to any formal table - such as a well set holiday table. The napkins are soft even before being washed, but are 100% polyester, so should not have to be ironed. (I haven't washed mine yet to find out.) I do wish they came in a set of 8 rather than six, but I still highly recommend these beautiful napkins for anyone who likes to set a beautiful table.

These Bosch Wiper blades were SO easy to install that I did it myself, rather than waiting/asking my husband to do it for me. The old blade snapped off, the new blade snapped on, and I was good to go. It couldn't have been easier. I actually wasn't sure what size blades were correct for my Ford Five Hundred, but I simply googled it and found the 20 inch and 24 inch were what I wanted. The very next day I was driving my grandson to summer camp, and we had a hellacious downpour. What a difference these blades made!! The wipers seem to "fit" themselves on to my windshield, leaving no gaps. I was really quite impressed. Easy to install, works like a charm - what more could you want from a wiper blade?

I am so grateful for this product! The day before the package arrived, I looked out my kitchen window and literally saw swarms of Japanese Beetles in and around some tall shrubs we have, and within 15 feet of my vegetable garden. I assume they had just hatched, and they were everywhere! The Safer Brand Japanese Beetle Trap arrived the very next day, and I placed it about 15 feet from my vegetable garden and 30 feet from the said shrubs. Within 24 hours - no more Japanese Beetles! I have seen exactly TWO of these pests since putting the trap up. I am so grateful for a product that actually works. This is definitely my "go to" product for the pests that almost devoured my vegetable garden last year!

All-Clad is a name I trust, and this extra large kitchen towel does not disappoint. It's truly extra absorbant and extra large. The design has teals, dark browns and light browns with a coffee motif. I've washed the towel and do not notice any fading or shrinking.However - my reason for giving it 4 stars instead of 5: The towel came with two of those plastic T-shaped clips on each end, obviously to hold the towel together at the store. I used scissors to clip off these plastic pieces, and lo and behold, they both left a rather obvious hole in the weave of the fabric! After washing, this hold enlarged very slightly, and the white cotton threads of the under fabric now show through the dark design. For the price of this towel, those fabrics should have recovered and the hole closed into the weft of the threads. I am slightly disappointed, though the holes are not noticeable if you don't know they are there. But still... this shouldn't have happened to a quality cotton towel like this.

This is actually my second set of Melissa and Doug PlayDoh stamping set. I bought my first set 7 years ago for my now 9 year old grandson, and we used it several times a week. The best review of all - it was used frequently and we still have the set and it's in as good shape as it was the day I bought it. VERY DURABLE! No cheap parts! Takes the banging and rough play of a 2 year old.I've picked up this second set to send to my granddaughter. It's nice to know the toy I am sending will last for years and years.I highly recommend this product!!

I'm a vegetable gardener and flower gardener and have long heard of the benefits of using Neem Oil in the garden. Last year I had a terrible problem with aphids -- clouds and clouds of aphids on my potato plants, tomatoes, green peppers and more. This year I started using this Miracle-Grow organic NATURE'S CARE product, and have not had any insect problem at all. I spray my plants once a week and, so far, it seems to keep the insects away. It's still early in the growing season (early June as I write this), and the bugs hit harder as the summer goes along, but I'm hopeful. I am pleased with the ingredients and the fact that you can spray right up to the day of harvest. (Personally, I will have a week between spray and harvest, and wash my vegetables well!) Easy to apply in the spray bottle, but I will be looking to see if I can purchase this product as a concentrate. Overall, so far, I recommend this product.

Poorly written, badly edited, no illustrations, and absolutely no usable information, even for someone new to sewing. These other reviewers who give this book 5 stars are either paid, fake or crazy. A complete waste of time. Glad it was free so I can just delete it without guilt.

I used this Artscape Window Film on the two long, narrow windows I have on each side of my front door. We've owned this house for 28 years, and for 28 years I have hated the fact that people at my front door peer inside while they're waiting for me to answer the door. This window film absolutely solved that problem! I'm so happy!A few tips. Use a VERY sharp craft knife or razor blade to cut the film to fit, and expect two to three passes of the knife to get all the way through both the film and the thick backing.Don't "soak" your window down with the soap/warm water mixture as instructions lead you to believe. Give just a general overall light coating of spray.Before using the squeegee (or credit card, which I found worked better), use one hand to hold the film in place at the top, as you gently squeegee downwards. Then use a cotton towel to wipe down edges and bottom.Once you're happy with the placement and see no bubbles, let dry for about 30 minutes and check your window from both sides. Those little bubbles hide in the design. Go back over gently with the squeegee if you see any bubbles.The instructions are correct - you need to cut the film about 1/8th an inch smaller than your window measurement. The film needs that small area between edge of film and window to emit the excess water. It's OK. You won't even notice it once the film is up.I will say, the included squeegee is flimsy and fell apart before I'd finished even one window. I used a stiff credit card and it worked fine.I have double pane windows. My one disappointment is that from the outside, you can barely see the pretty design of the film. But no matter - people can't peek in my front door windows anymore, and that was what was important to me.Overall, I highly recommend this product!!

I have a 9 year old grandson who has been through a real difficult year. When this Worry Eater arrived in the mail, he opened the package with me and I explained that if "someone" had worries, they could write it down on a slip of paper, and put it in the Worry Eater's mouth and the Worry Eater would take care of the worrying from that point on. Since my grandson is all boy and 9, he's not prone to liking stuffed animals anymore. But when I asked him if we should give the Worry Eater to his Mom, or if he'd like to keep it, his little eyes lit right up and he asked if he could keep it. Sometimes kids have stresses they either shouldn't or don't know how to deal with... This Worry Eater is perfect for that situation. He is soft and lovable, but without a "baby-ish" look to him. He is well made with what appeared to be quite a sturdy zipper/mouth. If you have a little one that just needs a chance to have a better day, this might just be the ticket.

Although this HONEY CITRUS PEPPER sauce was not what I expected, I do like it. I expected a sweet honey pepper flavor. What I got instead was a very soy sauce-based product that is very Asian inspired. In reading the ingredients, I can see why. First, water. Second, third, and fourth ingredients are sugar or a form of sugar. Fifth ingredient is soy sauce. "Dry Honey" is next, then a thickener and then orange juice concentrate, lemon concentrate, vinegar and further down the line spices...  So the flavor is a sweet soy sauce flavor. I get NO pepper taste at all and very very limited citrus flavor.That said... I baked skinless chicken thighs in the oven, and when they were about half-way cooked, I basted them in this sauce. I basted again 10 minutes later and again at serving. They were good! I'd planned on having potato salad with the chicken, but because it was SO Asian tasting, I switched over to rice, and I'm glad I did.Despite the misnomer in the name of the product, it's still tasty and would make an excellent dipping sauce for chicken wings. I do wish they'd increase both the honey and citrus flavors, but it is what it is.. and it is still good. I'm looking forward to trying it on pork chops or ribs cooked on the barbeque.

I waited to review this toy until my 9 year old grandson visited, to get an "expert's" opinion.First, the instructions are TERRIBLE. Even for an experienced Lego builder (where instructions are illustrations rather than words), putting this together was difficult at best. It took the two of us about 30 minutes, and I think that's a lot for such a small item with so few pieces. There definitely needs to be more explanation about the warm water/cold water method of getting these cars to change color. We both found it confusing, having never used the color change cars before.Of course, the launcher never works the way you expect it to. The pieces don't release easily to launch the car. That was a disappointment for my grandson. I've actually come to expect it from modern toys that promise a lot -- they rarely deliver.The cars, once we figured out the icy water vs hot water thing, were fun - for about 20 minutes. I left the set out for him to go back and play with on his own, and he  never did.The set is messy. Do yourself a favor and set it up outside. Water gets everywhere no matter how hard you try to contain it.If I had to buy this set, I'd buy only the cars and use some plastic bowls to change the colors back and forth. The "lab" seems superfluous to me, and held no interest for my grandson.

I gave this to my daughter, because she is notorious for NEVER putting her phone down and ALWAYS losing her bank card and/or ID. This is just perfect for her. She doesn't like to carry a purse, so this Wallet Case carriers her bank card, license, and a bit of cash. The fabric of the case has a nice leather-like feel, and the case is sturdy. It fit her Galaxy S6 perfectly. She liked the small slot at the bottom of the credit card pocket that allows you to easily push the cards out without having to pull at the pocket. I would have liked to see either a second pocket or a slightly deeper pocket that would allow her to carry a bit more cash, but she thought it was fine as is. The "kickstand" is a tiny disappointment -- you place one of your credit cards in a slot and use that to stand the phone up. Surely a slide-out kickstand would not have been difficult to include.Overall, a great concept, a quality product, and good protection for the Galaxy S6

I have wanted a security camera for awhile now. I have a grandson who feels he is ready to stay home alone for short periods of time, and I want to be able to check on him if and when I decide to let him do so. This Motorola Home Monitoring camera was unbelievably easy to set up right out of the box. Plug it in, turn it on, download the app on your phone and set up an account, hit the "pair" button and poof! You're done and receiving the video directly on your phone or on your computer. It couldn't have been easier. The phone features are great - the app lets you pan left and right, up and down, or lets you speak into your phone to be heard at the camera site. It let's you snap a picture or video, and save the same. The camera's video is clear and easy to see, both on the phone and on the PC. This is exactly what I wanted. I highly recommend this product!!

For starters, I needed something for a quick pick up ever since we got rid of the carpets and changed to wood floors. Our vacuum has rotating brush so I was afraid it would scuff the floors and besides, the pet hair would sometimes float away until I catch them in the corners. I saw this on sale in a popular red dot logo place...so for 10 bucks why not! Here's the run down...Pros:- light weight- easily converts from stick vacuum to hand held- dust filter easy enough to clean and/replace- not terribly loud, not whisper quiet but I heard louder from similar vacsCons:- would like a little more power to it- only cane with I'm the crevice tool but then again what do u really expect for this price and model- cord could be longer but adequate enough- if they put a little rubber sweep on the bottom of the wide floor attachment,  I think it would help with the power but also be a better floor dust or fine particle sweeper/suckeredI would buy it again if I had a coupon or sale price. Then again 20 bucks isn't that bad for this either. U think for an added 5 or 10 bucks the other similar competitors may suit the needs depending on what gives the edge....the major point for me is I would've have love a little more power either from the motor or just that simple rubber strip underneath the floor attachment.

I was upgrading my desktop wireless internet so I began to look around for economical solutions. I originally am upgrading from an old Beklin G usb adapter which served me well and is still functioning. However, with the change in my job and need for faster uploads/downloads of bigger files, I needed to capitalize on the max speed of my internet service. After looking around and comparing, I decided on this. True there are plenty of generics out there for cheaper however I have also read mixed reviews. It looks like if you are lucky, your generic will perform awesome and not fizzle in a coupe months. Then the unlucky ones, had horrible issues. I went the middle ground. I have used and still use TPLink products and I have to say I am happy with their products overall. The brand is solid yet the prices are not inflated because of the "big name tax". So let's get to it:Pros:- nano size, barely sticks out of the port when plugged in. I'd say it was just enough to get your fingertips to grip onto to pull out of the port if needed- good signal strength. I was concerned about the signal from such a tiny adapter but surprisingly, this got better (if not the same on bad days - other wifi, vacuum running etc.) signal than my old full sized USB adapter.- gold plated contacts- comes with a mini install disc, easy install and even my older desktop recognized it and ran the wizard for it...no fussCons:- nothing earth shattering...depending on how your USB port is mounted, you may or may not be able to see the "thinking" light. I don't know if it bothers you or not but I prefer to since I like to know if it is working or frozen during downloads of massive files. Again, not so much this nano's issue but more of your device's design. If it was me I would've put the light at the top/end so one can see it easily vs the side where it is now.I would buy this again if I ever needed more. My neighbor now had trouble getting around so I actually will be ordering 2 more so I can give them the freedom of access anywhere in their house and not risk falling and breaking his neck to do so.

The paint did not match well. The first batch did not seem to mix well and the dark and light tints just swirled. I did not apply the paint to the damaged areas. The second attempt was closer and was a closer match but not exactly. I applied it to a test spot and it seemed like it covered and dried like any other touch up paint from the local auto stores but I did not apply anymore since the color wasn't an exact match. Credit where credit is due, the customer service was no problem.

Need to get rid of piles of papers? This is it! The Neatdesk scanners cost 4 times more and essentially do the same thing. I will say that the loading tray angle is better on many of the other full size scanners but when it feeds and scans, this thing keeps up with the rest. How good? It's good enough that I shut my wife up with the constant nagging about "let's hire a maid" but it still doesn't resolve the documents and paperwork we need unless we want a stranger sorting through our stuff...DuH. It's about the dimension of a carton of cigarettes and just heavy enough not to tip over yet not fee like lugging a bar of gold.So let's get to the breakdown:Pros:- compact size...the lid flip around to wrap itself in a easy, clean portable form- capable of wireless hook up!! It was easy and quick...I ditched the USB cable and it's as liberating as going commando- touch screen menus- quick and quiet operation- the price in comparison is awesome (range about 150 give or take) vs 400 bucks- feed lid has sensor (magnetic?) so when you flip it closed it can go into sleep mode/standby- overall build feels sturdy enough, I was concerned the lid would be flimsy and break easy but noCons:- The software is ok, not fancy and intuitive as some of the others but certainly not rudimentary or overcomplicated. Not a deal breaker at all- the the 2 little guides on the feed tray, can be tricky when trying to hold a 20 paper load or batch of wrinkled/fluffed papers. I found this out when I had to scan 4 months worth of daily daycare reports which are the carbonless couble copy type, so wrinkled they gave a little trouble feeding- no output tray/adapter - it will literally just spit out the documents just scanned..not a deal breaker but if you draw a face on the front it looks like it's throwing up paperSorry, didn't try the card scanner yet but it feeds from the back slot. Asides from that, I think if they readjusted the feed tray angle and gave it a better set of paper guiders, it'd be perfecto. Otherwise, a great bang for the buck.

works just as well as the OEM only the fabric is gray vs white. No big deal, it still collects (seemingly) the same amount of dust, pet hair and crumbs as the other did only at a fraction of the price. The seal material fits snugly into the vac with no problems. The fabric is just as thick and about the same stiffness (perhaps a tiny bit stiffer) but that's fine with me. When I bang it against the trash the fabric doesn't flop all around and fly more dirt and dust about so that's agood in my book.

Update: 9/20/15 this thing just stopped working. One day it sputtered but after a few more presses of the button it worked right. By the end of the week, no response when you hit the button. I changed the batteries and all, the music works, the motor makes no noise what so ever. I emailed the company and still no response. It didn't last long did it? The kicker is that I didn't even use it everyday. It was when my son got a cold or runny nose. I changed 3 stars to 1 until I see what the company has to say.Original review:I have my reservations about all the nasal aspirators out there, but this one faired better than I expected. I am in the healthcare field and I can use the blue bulb syringes pretty effectively. However, when the baby is sick (and since daycare, he has been sick believe you me!) sometimes he just gets the never ending thick goo of mucus that only a strong suction can remove. I have tried the babycomfy (looks like an egg) and the ever popular baby Nosefrida and believe it or not, I and my wife have gotten sick from it a couple times each! Well, just look at the "filter" element...so I decided to try this. Let's get down to the nitty gritty:Please note: look at the pic, the suction part does separate as a whole "pre-unit". It then can be futher broken down into the silicone nozzle, the housing, the waste reservoir and then the o-ring seals if needed. You'll understand why I explained this when you get to the consPros:- plays 4 or 5 tunes- soft yet firm enough silicone tip to create a decent seal without hurting- removable parts for cleaning (but this will also be a con)- 2 AA batteries, no special button cell or whatever- love this: good and quick suction right from the press of the button! I was really worried about this aspect, I thought it maybe weak and needs time to build and by that time you know the baby's going to be unwieldy cranky but no! I'm surprised about this...this is a good procons:- limited waste space. By the time you get some boogie in there then try to flush it for a next pass...even a quick sip of water will already fill the waste container...which leads to...- removable to clean, nice, but you will be doing it often if you plan on more than one pass with a super quick flush to clear the suction way for a good second pass. I suppose you can just keep going for it but depending on the thickness of the boogie, it can clog or really diminish the next go.- the idea is novel, but when you hold the baby it angles the container. the waste (esp with water flushes) easily angles back into base of the 1st part of the aspirator. Again, fine if you just try to go at all attempts without a flush of water in between but as I have a habit of the flush from decades in healthcare, the small reservoir annoys me a little- cannot reposition or swivel to side if need be so if you can't suction baby close to vertical position, then you may not want to flush/clear in between...too meddlesome- kind of loud, can startle the baby...unless he/she is a really good sleeper, he/she will probably wake up if you try this during a napOverall, would I get this again...yes BUT ONLY if I didn't recently invent droplet filters for the babycomfy and nosefridas. With the babycomfy and nosefrida at least I can control the amount of force, duration and minimal noise (no motor rumbling by his face) - and now with my filter inserts I can protect myself from germy microdroplets/aerosols. Hopefully you may have better luck with this.Update: 10/10/15 So the manufacturer read my email, I must've pulled all the right serial numbers and viola! Next thing I knew, there was a tough gray shipping bag on my doorstep that had me wondering what in the world did my wife order. She didn't....Graco sent me a brand new replacement! I am happy to say *knock on wood* I'm back to cleaning his snot out in half the time and more efficiently than the bulbs. If this lasts the year, then I'll update the stars but for now, it's bumped to a 3. Thank you Graco customer service if you're reading this. It is very appreciated and just in time for cold season!

great set. It has tweezers from the finest point to curved. So far I have used these on chips and diodes but also on my expensive watches for battery removal. I am very happy with this set. The finish is durable enough so far and the quality/thickness of the material is not flimsy. I would buy another set if I needed to.

I had my fingers crossed on this one when ordering but I think this is a good pick! The ad states colors may vary, I got the one I wanted Yellow. I think for the most part they follow the yellow, unless you ordered the blue specifically. So let's get to the breakdown:Pros:- it was shipped in a adequately sized box so it got here in one piece with no dings/dents- surprisingly decent quality! The seat maybe a tad bit thinner than I'd prefer but not a deal breaker. Has storage under it! Also comes with 1shovel, 1 rake and water can packed in that compartment- rolls smoothly, note it has "tread" pattern wheels of hard plastic so good and bad - I'll state the bad of this in cons- surprisingly articulate claw- steering wheel controls are easy to hit and speakers are louder than I thought - don't play this at 2 am- more sounds than I expected - there's a con see below- back rest so child does roll backwards and hits their head- swing arm clicks when turning- black lever is to raise/lower arm, yellow/metal lever is to activate grabber claw- steering and axle link is actually a think metal U link with a metal rod that you put a screw and bolt through when connecting the steering wheel- there is a tow loop underneath so I imagine you can put a leash on it and tow him/her aroundCons:- minimal assembly - need phillips screwdriver - not a deal breaker, the rest (claw unit and back rest) is click/snap in place.- no batteries included, you need to screw open the compartment under the steering wheel so put in batteries before assembling the wheel 2 AA- seat is thinner than i'd like but ok- raise/lower range is fairly limited since it is so close and adjacent to steering- The manufacturer apparently has no discretion when it comes to sounds categories. One of the backup sounds is an emergency siren...huh? The best one is the fact that one of the songs it plays, is "frosty the snow man" - yes...Frosty....the...snow....man....- also 2 buttons play the same songs. I wonder why one had a different icon that meant music tooOverall, considering these features and fun will probably not come close to this price point in your local stores, this is a great deal. Most ride-on toys are 20 bucks more with less features. My son loves this thing, even the accessories that came with it. He tried eating dinner with the hand shovel...yes, I know. It would be perfect if it was free shipping or just 5 or 10 more to offset that charge then the price point would be perfect (all things being fair).Update: he's still playing with this and it survived multiple operators at his 2nd bday party. A couple of "those" kids dragged it outside and even began trying to shovel real dirt and rocks with the grabber. Poor thing. I even had to cover the steering wheel, hose it off top to bottom, dry it and lysol it - oh yea, vacuum the inside since they stored dirt inside too YAY....and the thing is still alive. One of my top toy picks so far.

I'm not sure about the expectations of such a toy but you have to be somewhat realistic about the price and simple fact that it is a child's toy. I got it less than 40 bucks so that's not going to break the bank per say. Also, I would think you would expect such toys to be made of plastic that wasn't like a resin shed from home depot. I'm not sure if some people expect that type of build or what but realistically, it's not "cheap" plastic - it's appropriate enough. Yes, it will require a screwdriver but it's not rocket science. Perhaps I'm a handyman about it and some minor imperfections do not bug me as much but my set was delivered just fine, no issues with the assembly and all the parts fit like they should. My son is having a blast with it!  dimensions 25.9 x 13.9 x 9.8Pros:- fun, decent accessories with the set, 1 set of burger buns, a burger (no cheese?!), 1 hot dog bun, 1 hot dog, a spatula, tongs, plate and ketchup- at least for my kid, he's about 34" tall and this set comes up to mid chest range so he's not stooping or reaching up.- countertop is thicker plastic and is in 3 pieces. The 2 sides get screwed onto the main (burner/grill) piece so it is secure.- cabinet storage is much more than enough room for the accessories and other stuff. Thick about the dimensions of say a small/medium-ish paper shredder or a carry on luggage - a tad less all around.- the sink faucet swivels and the on/off handle does as well- the burner knobs click when turned- stickers are crazy sticky so position them carefully the first time!Cons:- doors are flimsy in thickness of plastic compared to the other components but not a deal breaker. I can see why some people complained about the plastic nubs that are supposed to be the hinges but mine works...they're still in place after a night of opening and closing.- the plastic retaining push clips were slightly larger than the factory holes so I took the screwdriver and just took a few turns to enlarge the hole a tiny bit...guess what - perfect. Not a huge deal- I too had a little bit of looseness on the top grill cover...easy fix, take a hairdryer, warm the plastic and then push the plastic in a little. When the plastic cools, it retains the new "tighter" alignment and pop it back on. Snug as a bug in a rug - not a big deal at all- burger and hotdog buns are stiffer plastic so the patty does slip out easily, hot dog can fly out too but my son hasn't exactly tried to keep things on the plate either.I don't get overly critical with kid's toys. I expect that so I won't be overly critical given the price. The toy has got to be over priced and pretty cheesy for me to blast such a thing. That being said, I wouldn't pay over 40 bucks for this but I will say 30 is about right. Save a coupon or something and get it for about the 30 dollar mark. Otherwise, we find this reasonable and my son enjoys it. He stopped trying to play with the actual kitchen cabinets (for now) so that's good for me.

If you want a dump truck toy that isn't the size of a real one in his/her room, then this is fine.Pros:- durable, sturdy plastic not flimsy- wheels roll nicely although can make a rumble on hardwood since it is treaded hard plastic wheels - shouldn't stop you from buying though- nice bright yellow colorCons:- maybe a design/dimension flaw but rolls around too easy if you are one hand lifting the bed to dump out (at least indoors on hardwood floors)- no edge to the back of the bed and no incline to the bed so if you are playing with sand or dirt, it will just spill outThose are kind of nit picking cons. Overall the toy is solid ad the price is right. My son likes it, loads his mega blocks in there and zoons it around.

it's basic and my 20 month old has fun with it.Pros:- no too big and not too small- durable enough- minimal parts to break (just the roof/hinged)- fits more blocks and little people in there than I thought- mega blocks pieces stack onto roof (kids like doing that for some reason) makes no sense to adults but so far my son wasn't the only that felt compelled to start stacking blocks on the roof.Cons:- wheels not as smooth rolling on hardwood esp for engineered wood floors or those with the factory protective coat- odd plastic hitch/piece in the middle under the bus, unsure why but if you have plush carpeting it will impede rolling on mid/high plush carpeting- the grille sticker was already peeling when out the box. Not a deal breaker but my son ate that lifted corner piece that didn't stick, thanks for his extra fiber MattelOverall, it's not bad. I think for the price compared to others found in the store, it isn't bad. If you intend for this to be played with with plush/fluffy carpeting in the room, think again.

Do not get this! I am in the field of healthcare and a father myself. This simply put, is just too darn stiff and non-functional. Compared to the ones we use on patients, this bulb is made of such stiff material that it will not easily suction anything out at all. You actually will have a tough time even squeezing the bulb even with the full hand. The bulb is not resilient and actually smaller in diameter than the hospital/ambulance type ones. I am surprised Red Cross would even put their name on this garbage.Honestly, don't even get the baby starter kit they sell. The better kit is the Safety First kit which has better quality tools and not to mention a better bulb. If you have a friend that works in the medical field or find it on ebay, buy the blue bulb syringe (Briggs or othe major medical brand ones). It should be just squishy enough but resilient enough to draw out the thicker strings of mucous.If you really need some suction or then there is also the Freida nose sucker but just mind that the "filter" is literally just a cylinder of sponge material. If you think about the micro droplets of moisture you would be sucking out of the baby's nose/sinuses from your own mouth....well, has anyone thought that before? The concept is nice but think about it. If the baby is sick and say has a chest cold, wouldn't you be sucking the germs into your own mouth? Sure you'll be spared from the green boogies...but the droplets?

I've also seen some mixed reviews but this was on black friday special so for about 50 bucks or less, I sure gave it a shot. I need one in case the baby, not so baby anymore, needed to be entertained while in the stroller and maybe some other times where tantrums aren't recommended. Given that I wasn't sure how much use I would get from a portable since we already have the dual Insignias on the truck's headrests. I wasn't prepared to spend 80 or 150 bucks on one. I did a lot of research and here it is:Pros:- Battery is up to 4 hrs it claims, I've gotten a Wall-E and some sesame streets out of it...not bad- comes with charger for the car and home- decent screen, 9" is a good compromise if you don't want a larger than headrest 10" or tablet to lug around- lightweight- RCA jacks on the side, power has 3 settings (on/off/standby)- swivels all around to a flat position (however, it swivels only one way so don't break it going the opposite twist!)- simple enough functions, no added bells and whistles for it to break or malfunction. Workhorse...- sound is actually decent - surprisinglyCons:- no remote- screen is matte which the view and viewing angles are fine, I think a nice gloss screen may have enhanced the picture though but for the price, not bad- buttons are basic, cheapish but not deal breaker cheap- loading is a lift lid, thinner than I'd like but I've felt cheaper- case not so insulated: loud, sounds like robocop's coming to get you when loading and playing a discOverall, I can't complain like it was the end of the world for this. I paid a cheaper price on average for a workhorse player. I think if it was more than I paid, then I'd be a bit more sore at it. I think the fact that it has no case for the car/headrest, it may leave you wishing for a remote or a longer movie for convenience sake but again, not a dealbreaker. Don't pay towards the 80 dollar range though. That being said, I am satisfied with this and it has been about 3 months of bouncy car rides and freezing winter nights. Still ticking...I will update

I bought a RCA portable player 9" during black friday but needed one of these so I wouldn't have to keep pulling the head mounted ones from the truck all the time. So let's cut to the pros and cons...Pros:- fit the RCA 9" snugly.- does have multiple elastics all around with a velcro latch on top- openings do not interfere with speakers on most units- made of pleather? or some vinyl type material which is sturdy- strong elastic fastening for the headrest (which is also a con...see below)Cons:- can be a pain if you need to reach the DVD controls if it's on the front face on clam shell units, you have to slide the player out again so put in a 2 hr movie or something- Can be a pain if on/off is not side mounted- pain if power or rca inputs (if needed) is not mounted on the sides of a player- My biggest gripe: The elastic is very strong which mean it is bad for head rests that are elongated (i.e. Honda Pilots) or  if they are about 8 in in height or so. The strap is so strong you will have to give a good tug to lock the velcro. However, at the end of the day, it can crease or leave marks on the head rest because it is so darn tight. If you have a head rest hole, you can slip it through to decrease that pressure which I did with the pilot but my Acura TSX can't do it. I sandwiched it under the rest and lumbar and stuffed a washcloth between the strap to keep it from sliding through. Not the prettiest but it works and the player doesn't fall. I just needed something asap since the change of vehicles going to daycare. If you have a freely sliding head rest,, that idea probably won't work.Overall, for the money it's not bad at all. The design is not far off from the others so you will encounter most of the front panel access problems with them as well, but this is made with better materials in the 20 dollars range. If you have an older car (5yrs +) or simply have short headrests, this will work just fine. If you got funky, trendy ones, then you will have issues with strapping this. Can you find a creative solution? Sure...for me, the hand towel or a cylindrical foam cut to size and placed inside while sandwiching it down works for me. Otherwise, if you have some extra velcro strip or something like that to extend the strap length, that will do even better.

I have used many simply because of my job. I have used anyones from the ever popular Omron to  generics. First off, I prefer the arm vs finger or wrist because they tend to be more accurate and less prone to inaccurate readings due to positioning. This s oscillometric method, ranges 0mmHG - 300mmHG, pulse range 30 - 180 beats/min, claims accurate +/- 3mmHG and about 5% of pulse rate. Cuff is 8.6" to 14.2". Long story short:Pros:- lightweight, has rubber feet- good length of air hose- large numbered easy to read screen- simple functions, not overly complicated so you know it's a BP machine not a iPad- medium cuff, strong velcro and easy enough to strap with one hand- stores multiple users (up to 4)- FDA CE - claims it can detect irregular beats and WHO Classification indicator- nylon zip up carry caseCons:- no AC adapter included - uses DC 6V, 1000mA positive in, neg outside 2.1mm coaxial joint- 4 AA batteries claims to last about 2 mo at 3 tests per day- battery lid a little thin than I'd like but not a deal breaker- air line connection is just a plastic friction push-in type not like a twist lock or anything more secure but it holds so we'll seeOverall, consider most others charge the avg 20 to 50 bucks more and they do not claim FDA-CE. This is not overly complex and not bottom basic either. I think the complaints of inaccuracies must be taken with a grain of salt. Arm machines are more consistently accurate than wrist or finger but you need to make sure you place the cuff on properly and sit with arm relaxed and about heart height. The brachial artery (inner part of the bicep/arm just underneath the bicep muscle) should be in line or between the indexing lines marked clearly in white on the cuff. Otherwise you would get bad readings. So far it seems good surprisingly from a company that isn't as mainstream as I've known.

My older conair finally went kaput when i tried to dry off the dog after his bath. In all fairness, that thing lasted years even after I buzzed my head and passed it on to the Mrs. I have had a couple (Vidal, smaller travel conair and other)since but they didn't work the same. Either they weren't hot enough on Low (and too hot on high) or most commonly the flow of the air was too weak. My dog farts more forcefully. This one is the one...let's break it downPros:- lightweight but sturdy plastic housing, not too hot to the touch on low, decent insulation on high- cool shot button to help "freeze"  the curl or whatever you're trying to do- ergonomic handle, comfortable- protection plug (outlet breaker)Cons:- not a foldable handle for compact travel- no cord reel/retractionOverall, the Mrs. likes it and I will be using this to blow dry the dog a lt faster than the previous ones I had.

Best bang for the buck. I use these to backup some my favorite DVD movies and make multiples of my son's favorite DVDs. Thus, you can imagine for all those who have kids - lifesaver! I leave backup copies of his favorite DVDs in each car. These blanks seem to work just fine with all my different DVD players and burners. For example, my older Compaq Desktop burner, 3 yr old Gateway laptop, 6 yr old HP laptop, and HP elite have no issues reading and burning onto them. Reading: my XBox 360, Original Xbox, Insignia DVD/TV combo, Insignia portable DVD player and Pioneer in dash player read them just fine. I think maybe a few times the older xbox sputter a few places here and there but never froze on me. Considering how many Memorex blanks I used and ripped through, those are very low odds. I have been using this media for a while now and this is my 3rd spindle. There is a reason why I couldn't justify the price/performance of Verbatim, the fail read rate of Fuji (greenish hue) and very surprisingly Sony (I think they were too "blue" on the recording face and the more basic or older laser lens seem to have trouble reading those). Memorex is by far the best bang for my buck for my purposes.

After my wonderful cat decided to chew through my trusty nicad/nimh charger, which is kind of ok since it was time for an upgrade, I found this. I searched and compared and this seemed to be the most versatile and reviewed good consistent reviews. I also have purchased a lot of Tenergy nimh LSD batteries and they have been solid so why not give this a shot as well. Here's the low down:Pros:- Big blue status display- shows the battery in each compartment and the levels at present. Blinks each bar while charging and when done it stops blinking- good charge rate, no humming or buzzing- can charge each battery independently! Also of different size!!! Freedom!!!- Did I mention freedom to charge independently and different size in each compartment?? Yes? Good - thought I'd stress that again - Love that!- separate backlight button- separate discharge button for conditioning- will tell you if battery is suitable for charging or notCons:- flip top cover is good but mine seems finicky, it can "stick" even though I'm pressing the release button but perhaps it will break in after some more usage- like some of the other users said, USB takes over charging when in use so you can't charge usb and batteries at the same time. No biggie- sometimes when you first put the battery in, you may need to tap or give a little turn to the battery and then it'll seat and start charging. Not a big deal as other chargers of this type do it too, all my prior ones did too- does not charge nicadOverall, I am very happy with this charger! I would most definitely buy it again. Sad to see my old workhorse Radioshack charger go but this is a great upgrade at this price! The overall build is good, yet lightweight but I would try dropping it from a tall dresser too many times though. Compared to some of the others I've tried, this is one of the better ones in build.

Ok, you really can't beat this price for a 4 pk! It fit like oem althought the rubber around the filter is black, the pk sent to me was blue. Makes no functional impact, just cosmetic but nobody sees it anyways. It seems just as thick and the mesh over the material feels just as sturdy. It fits as oem nice and snug. The vac works just like new again. I recommend if it's been a while for the hepa and thr vac has that funk in the exhaust, go and buy the hepa filter at the same time. Its worth it, like giving the vac a tune up.

I wish I found this years ago. It comes with the hardware to wall mount. You screw 4 points into the wall and thats all. It holds all typical size batteries just fine regardless of alkaline, nicad, nimh, or lith. The top also has a little caddy that pivots to hole larger flat button batteries like cr2032 and similar. The battery tester is included and it slides up and out of a molded in holder....it can be tough when new. Just shimmy otherwise you may grip and slip and break the tester arm. My only real gripe....also the tester isnt as sturdy and accurate as say the digitals or the red slider type with a more elaborate guage display but it works nonetheless. Not a deal breaker and not necessary to go out and buy a fancier one, this works fine.

I bought it for a friend as a simple gift for his father's old service revolver. It fit, it was simple and inexpensive. If you have a pistol you just want to have a better case for than a nylon bag or a degrading case, this will do for the price but don't expect to abuse it. If you plan on having your pistol survive in there while you and it fell off the cliff...both will be mangled. LOLThe latches are simple plastic clasp on tab where I can see if used on a daily basis, they can break off (sort of like taking a plastic strip and constantly bending/flexing it until it turns white at and snaps - that type).

My son's mobile and other toys were eating up batteries like crazy. Enter these puppies! I noticed the weight and they weren't flimsy like some other generics (i.e. HFT, etc). Long story short....Yes, they do store well (I've had them in a cold closet over the winter...little energy drop if any), feels solid/quality, no memory (had one empty in his swing for 3 months, recharged just fine) and the price was good - better than main brand in local stores. I ordered more with all assorted sizes. I am that satisfied with them.Type: CellChemistry: NiMH (Nickel Metal Hydride)Nominal Capacity (mAh): 10000Nominal Voltage (V): 1.2Weight: 160gDimensions: 33 x 61.5mm (D x H)
