My favorite Kenneth Cole watch has a difficult back plate to remove. It is squarish and concaved with the pry point along the top instead of the side...who the hell thought that was a good idea. Of course, they also made the pry point "sleek" to match the match's cosmetics which means any case knife or opener barely fit in there. Thanks KC...So every time, I would have to overpay for the watch place to try and open it which sometimes they slipped and scratched the plate too. Enough is enough, I invested in this monster. It is compact enough but darn versatile. The center piston is for the watch itself, it has a nylon or plastic (green) positioner and the piston itself is spring loaded so the working height can adjust with the thickness of the watch. The side delrin/nylon holder has a notch with it does also rotate if needed. What you do is you put the watch in the center, insert the pry insert (which it comes with a few more different size/shape) and start cranking the "jaws" closed. As it closes, you make sure the height and the tip of the insert is aligned. Eventually when it's all in place and the insert bites on, a another turn of the knob will dig in and pop up the case plate. Viola!! It's open. Now if this worked on my KC watch then it's good.* note: depending on where the maker put the pry slot you may have to remove the band for an easier open. Otherwise side slots were quick and easy.Would I use it on Omegas, Rolex and such? No! Those are a totally different class of craftsmanship and require a more professional tool but this baby can surely handle the rest.

This is cut to size so be aware of that. That isn't a negative though, it gives room to cut however you want. The strip does not have to be siliconed and it fit my EASI glass door snugly (1/4"). The hard plastic base and drip rail can be trimmed easily by a little handheld hack blade or sheet metal snips. I recommend the hack blade, it just cuts cleaner and it really isn't bad - cut through quickly with minimal effort. Do have a blade handy to slice the dual weatherstrips after you cut the hard base. Otherwise, I am very happy with this part!The Pros:- plastic base rail is thick enough that it doesn't flop around and snugly grips to the glass (silicone or not)- The silicone dual strips on the bottom are not flimsy- Drip rail has a good angle to it - not angled too closely or sticking out but enough to keep the water from flowing onto the bottom frame railCons: (nothing I can think of now)

If you want an inexpensive yet versatile saw...this is it. I can't believe I got it for under 20 bucks! It fits most other blade types and I have used the living daylights out of it and it is still chopping away! Life saver for downed trunks/branches and such during Sandy and other super windy days. Actually, I used this to chop out a fallen smaller tree because the city was too damn slow so I took this and did their job for them! DO yourself a favor..go to HFT, sign up for the members news - take the 20% coupon and freebie coupon and get this thing for cheap.PROS:- not any louder than the brand name saws- the handle does rotate (note not 180)- safety switch- rubberized grips- has a twist lock knob for quick blade changes but can be locked down- Mine did come with a multi use blade, it was inside the cardboard wedge for the front. Do yourself a favor..open all the wedges to find those properly packed parts! I got a blade, a hex key and a manual.Cons:- the rubber front grip did shift when going through heavy vibrations which only happened a couple times cutting through some super dense/knotted wood beams - hell it almost shook my fillings loose for god's sake - no big deal, I just smeared a thin layer of rubber cement glue and slide back down the grip piece. No problems with that again - yet

True I am addicted to Harbor Freight, but that's because if you know what you are checking out, their tools are quality. I had a Porter Cable 2 in 1 nailer and when I saw this CP version in HF for half the price, I decided to try it. I built my friend's daughter's room when their baby was on it way - no problems. So I figured what the hell...worst thing is I have to return it. I bought this guy to help me repair/replace...hell, I not only replaced some of the floor planks but I redesigned and built a sturdier (more up to code) railing all around. My neighbors compliment on my work even though it was my first solo full rail. It worked beautifully. It is true as with some of the other CP nailers that the design is slightly bigger, sometimes it can spark and perhaps a tad heavier...but i think for the deep price difference, it is a minor issue at that. #1 - it nailed fine at an angle as long as you have the point as flushed as possible and slightly more umph #2 sparks are only from the nail fills that are held by a thin metal wire and lacquer - otherwise, the only lacquer held is fine #3 build some muscle...it ain't that much heaver for christ's sake and the dimensions are not far off if anything, they compare with the rest if not a tad slimmer than some. It's metal housing and rubber insert grips with a non-marring nylon or hard plastic/rubber front.PRO:- pretty decent build quality- back vent that rotated so you don't shoot air in your face and fall off the roof or something- price- comes with an allen wrench, oil, manual and tethered cap to keep inlet dirt free- safety feature as all should need to push the front tip on surface to enable the trigger to engage and fireCons:-  after some usage..check the nail reservoir screws as the vibrations after all that usage may loosen it. Simple fix, I dabbed a tiny smear of blue locktite but it took repairing a medium sized front porch, side deck and other misc repairs for them to finally vibrate loose so this is a very nit picky point- non-marring tip can be slippery at angle shots but not a stick point either. I did see some nailer with a knurled tip for grip..maybe an upgrade for this if I can find one but if you really need to I'm sure you can figure something - again - nit pick- loading slide is easy, although the instructions could be better. Loading different gauges and length go in a few possible ways and if you're not familiar, I can see people wondering why it isn't nailing, jamming or closing.- perhaps it's only with HF nails, don't wait until the very last nail in reserve, it can jam. I usually keep a healthy reserve and it's smooth nailing all the way. No biggie.IMHO - my cons were a nit pick list. I really have no complaints so far and I've been rocking away all sorts of projects. Easy maintenance - just one drop of oil in the inlet before airing up. Otherwise, air puff the outside and a quick wipe. One of the best money I spent...I obviously returned the porter cable since.update: 7/30/15 - still firing. Did doorway mouldings, stair rails and side mouldings and eventually will be getting to the crown moulding all over the house. Built a little step stool, mini deck box and some porch repair/reinforcing and this is still as day one. Love this freaking thing!

True I am addicted to Harbor Freight, but that's because if you know what you are checking out, their tools are quality. I had just bought a Porter Cable 2 in 1 nailer and when I saw the CP version in HF for half the price, I decided to try it. I built my friend's daughter's room when their baby was on it way - no problems. So I figured what the hell...worst thing is I have to return it. I bought this guy to help me repair/replace portions of a deteriorating front porch...hell, I not only replaced some of the floor planks but I redesigned and built a sturdier (more up to code) railing all around. My neighbors compliment on my work even though it was my first solo full rail. It worked beautifully. It is true as with some of the other CP nailers that the design is slightly bigger, sometimes it can spark and perhaps a tad heavier...but i think for the deep price difference, it is a minor issue at that. #1 - it nailed fine at an angle as long as you have the point as flushed as possible and slightly more umph #2 sparks are only from the nail fills that are held by a thin metal wire and lacquer - otherwise, the only lacquer held is fine #3 build some muscle...it ain't that much heaver for christ's sake. It's metal housing and rubber insert grips with a non-marring nylon front.PRO:- pretty decent build quality- back vent that rotated so you don't shoot air in your face and fall off the roof or something- loading slide is easy, has a lever to keep unused nail from just dropping out when your finished...slide down and push in a lever  and a shake will slide it out.- price- comes with an allen wrench, oil, manual and tethered cap to keep inlet dirt free- safety feature as all should need to push the front tip on surface to enable the trigger to engage and fireCons:- body is slightly wider than few on the market but not a deal breaker. I've seen other major brand with bodies just as wide or awkward-  after some usage..check the nail reservoir screws as the vibrations after all that usage may loosen it. Simple fix, I dabbed a tiny smear of blue locktite but it took repairing a medium sized front porch, side deck and other misc repairs for them to finally vibrate loose so this is a very nit picky point- non-marring tip can be slippery at angle shots but not a stick point either. I did see some nailer with a knurled tip for grip..maybe an upgrade for this if I can fine one but if you really need to I'm sure you can figure something - again - nit pick- perhaps it's only with HF nails, don't wait until the very last nail in reserve, it can jam. I usually keep a healthy reserve and it's smooth nailing all the way. No biggie.IMHO - my cons were a nit pick list. I really have no complaints so far and I've been rocking away all sorts of projects. Easy maintenance - just one drop of oil in the inlet before airing up. Otherwise, air puff the outside and a quick wipe. One of the best 60 bucks I saved...I obviously returned the porter cable since. Oh yea, if you buy from Harbor freight, don't forget your coupon and it'll be cheaper plus whatever freebie is for that month!

I have a 4000W Sportsman Propane generator that did not have a wheel kit and I could not find one for it either. I saw other kits but the price range varied greatly and I sure as hell was not paying 100 bucks for a wheel kit! For some reason I really had a hard time trying to find a specific kit for it so I looked into all. This was actually the closest match and the sturdier one. Forget the other universal ones..they were much cheaper in quality and they needed the same amount of modding to fit my generator! So for under 40 bucks and a trip to Homedepot for some parts...it fits nicely.What I needed from HD:4 = 1-1/4 or 1-1/2 length cap screws (widest you can fit into the axle's bracket holes) I think it was 30mm or SAE equiv4 = washers (thicker ones)4 = nuts1 = step drill bit1 = optional, locktite blue or teflon tape (just to keep nuts from shaking loose with the vibration)2 = mending brackets with the same holes spaced out or same functionWhat I did:I found a corner bracket of decent thickness that had the same hole alignment. I used a dremmel to cut it in half. I know I know...why didn't I use a straight plate..the ones that were thick enough would probably have ruined my drill bit if I tried to drill through it 4 times. It was easier to cut through with the dremmel's cutting disc making that 1 L braket into 2 straight pieces with perfect hole alignment. I then simply created a U bolt like setup and wrenched on the axle (which spans the width of the 4000W generator perfectly). Note...I placed the axle on the cross bar that was closer to the rear of the generator....the other bar is about 1/4 in and you don't want to use that point to support the wheels and weight. The support bracket for the front will need a hole tapped in with the step bit, otherwise the other hole will line up nicely! Half the work saved for that! The only gripe is the lift handle, but then again it was designed for a champion gen not a Sportsman. I used a wood shim and black duct tape to create a wedge point to tighten on so even if it rotates a little on lifting, the handle can still provide leverage for me to tote the thing around on the back wheels. For the price, I'll deal with it. It feels sturdy and I can move it without breaking my back now. Certainly more sturdy than the harbor Freight universal or other universal kits and in most cases, plus was the cheaper route. BTW the home depot parts only cost me an extra 6 bucks. I will try to post a pick in a bit.

I have a craftsman weed wacker/trimmer with the "easy pull" start. "easy pull" is easy to pull but whether it starts on the first few goes is another story! Just to clarify, "easy pull" means that it is a smoother and light tension to the string/handle when tugged at so that is certainly a welcome relief compared to trimmers or even mowers without that. Kudos to Craftsman on that - but again, it doesn't mean it will start on the first cold start. I would imagine as with the other similar trimmers' designs, the plastic housing for the air filter is right in the direction of where you are pulling to start so I can vouch for some scraped knuckles there. Enter this baby: the start chuck! I wish I bought this first out. This design is a one way bearing so it won't screw up your trimmer if operated the wrong way. Also, the red plastic spacer/depth guide has the arrows to point the way. It just inserts into any drill (the red guide also noted drill side or not) and lock in the chuck. Set your drill on hi and insert the key. Squeeze the trigger and in less than 2 seconds it was putting to life and cutting away! This time no scraped knuckles!! It's been fine so far with a handful of times and plenty more to come for the season.PS: I just used either my 12V older black and decker drill or the 12V craftsman LithIon drill set on hi speed. Anything weaker may not do the job so plan on that. Also, yes, I used this on my Craftsman so it is compatible with their easy start system.

I have a couple older can and a newer EPA can. However the spouts from the old ones are taking a beating and not as user friendly and the new can's spout just plain stinks. I tried one of these to see if they are better than the ones I've seen in local stores and I must say, I am glad I got this full kit. It comes with 2 different threaded /sized caps so that was good. The spout is stiff enough and not flimsy so it doesn't flop everywhere when you are using a larger can like 5 gallons at a weird angle (I have sports cars and motorcycles so imagine the odd designs on those things). Also worked great filling mowers and weed wackers on the ground which I couldn't do before without some decent spillage. The replacement vents seems fine, I don't need to replace mine but I did add it to one that did not which is great - it stopped that surge flow of gas when the gas can is gulping for air leading to splashing/spillage. Although I would've liked it as a few bucks cheaper, all things considered, if you are unsure about what fits and maybe what needs replacing etc etc - just get this kit and have it all on hand. Save the trouble. I'm sure you know how it goes, intend to replace the one thing and the replacement does fit or isn't as compatible with pieces that you haven't planned to replace etc etc. Everything you need in one bag plus extra pieces to MacGyver with just in case.Pros:- quality spout - not too flimsy and decent build- seal ring in base cap is included and does a good job to- all parts in one kit plus probably can use spares for other application or improving older cans i.e. the vents- spout cap has latch cord so it doesn't get lost or fall to ground to gather dirt- mesh filter in base (not a fine one but mesh is about 1mm or so grid)Cons:- pricier than most kits but I think can be overlooked considering the completeness of the kit

I have a 50 ft hose in this and in about a year it broke in an essential place. The connection of the hose to the inside drum is a 90 degree elbow and you screw your hose on to it. I guess after some use, the weight and pulling/dragging of the hose was too much for it and the elbow broke from the base. One day I just turned on the faucet and it gushed out from the hideaway. I had to unroll the whole length and of course the problem would be right where that main connection point is. So needless to say...it's done. Not happy with the price you pay and the less than stellar durability of it. I gave it 2 stars - 1 for each year, the second really should be half of a star. It was ok when it didn't break but I can certainly think of better. I was just waiting for this to be done then buy the others I had my eye on...ironic, now I can do that. FuNnY

Great bang for the buck. I have had the brand name Kingston, Sandisk, PNY and more. This is just as comparable but still slightly cheaper. It is being used in my camera right now. So far no issues either from still pics or movies. It can be read in my laptops, printers and my desktop via adapter. It has the standard mem lock switch to keep you from accidentally deleting the content. What more can you say? It is a good card, reads and writes info as quick as the rest of them and slightly cheaper to boot!

This is not bad. I was concerned with some reviews stating they could not connect because the power lines needed to be on the same circuit etc etc...however I decided to try. What's the worse, I return it? I needed to run an ethernet line from the Fios modem located (of course) down stairs to a security DVR upstairs in a remote closet in a room other side of the home...double whammy there. There was no way in hell someone would be able to run a line clean from downstairs to upstairs on the other side of the home without the walls gutted or drilling more holes from outside/in. Definitely didn't want more holes/issues so why not try this. Now I can't speak of the same circuit thing but I will say that I have 2 fuse boxes, the 1 is original to the orignal side of the house and the 2nd is more into the newer part of the house. I can't confirm how the wiring is but I am sure that the outlet upstairs is not in the same fuse panels and it is on different switches. So asides from that, I am not an electrician and I cannot make a theory of why this should/shouldn't work. All I know is - different fuse panels, different sides of the house, different floors and different breaker switches. The only common element is that the master switch in panel 1 - shuts power to ALL. Otherwise, the signals works and I have tried hard wiring the laptop to it upstairs to setup the security DVR settings, and then I plugged the DVR into it and all seems working. I think for the price, it's worth a shot over the more expensive ones - if you plan on just non-insane tasks like emails, surfing, searching etc etc. I haven't tried internet gaming like XBOX live or anything so I can't comment on that either. The others, it seems like it loads in good time. For what it's worth, I'm happy. Note: they are the size of a pack of cigarettes give or take but relatively unobtrusive. The ethernet plug is on the bottom so plan on that. Either you will be using the bottom outlet or turning it upside down and plugging it from above.  Either way, you can still gain access to the other unused outlet so that's good. Some of the other more expensive ones can partially block the other outlet making it impractical. Not so with this one.

If you are looking for a fast charger, skip this. This was not meant to be a fast charger (or at least this model). I was looking at similar products because I have cars I just didn't have time to use as much as I wanted to. After the pain of replacing those batteries much earlier than it should, I figured let me maintain and recondition them and keep that are less than 3 yrs old. Why keep the old ones? I use them as battery packs for portable jumps, power failures, and now I will be installing them in line to start my own solar energy farm in case another Sandy comes along. Hence, the reconditioner function to save my older batts(can also be called other names but same process of dephos-ing the plates inside). I still thought it would be faster with charging a car battery if the darn thing wasn't dead or aged out. The manual had a approx time grid for battery types/size vs hours...so for the average size 30-40 type battery, it's 18 to 24 hrs! SO anyways, I thought it took a little longer than it should for my regular type 35 battery off my 350Z but I cut it slack because it was probably ~ 30% or so charged. That took 20 hrs. The motorcycle battery on my CBR600RR which was more than 50% took 1 overnighter - figure 8 hrs. Now the Mas which is a 2012 - I'm sure the battery is above 75% has sat at 2 leds (50%) overnight...it sure doesn't sit in storage that much! It is still on as I type this and this was from last night so it is going on 15 hrs now. It SHOULD be done by the time I get home from work at 5pm today....should...Pros:- lightweight, not too cheap feeling- good about including connectors you usually need- plug/connection points are solid- in line fuses are solid feeling, have resistant covers on them- not a overly complex display - simple, to the point- standby mode, no sparks when plugging in the unitCons:- comparable to others at a cheaper price- can a smart charger be too smart? Sometimes, I think it over analyzes and take much longer than it need for good/newer batteries. It feels like it goes thru the full analysis process if you need to or not....that's what it feels like.I honestly am debating if the long drawn out process is necessary for all batteries it gets hooked up to dead or not. It is for that reason why I am on the fence with returning this product or not. I have a schumacher manual charger anyways for the bulk charging but I guess I really expected different from this one...much like "it's smart enough to know to skip the conditioning if unnecessary" and all that - I have to wonder if it really is that smart though. I will update and see if it takes the same time for all regardless of charge - if it does, then you know the "smart" is bull and it just puts all batts through all phases regardless of what it needs and how much charging it just needs.Update: 4/28/2014 - So the Mas battery is done that day I came home from work. Still took longer than should've IMO. Another thing I noticed: not sure if that's a good thing, I have 2 older motorcycle batteries so I wanted to try and recondition them and see if I can save them. I clipped them on and within 5 mins, they showed at full LEDS (100%)..WTH! These are older batteries that came off the bike obviously because they were not holding up through a season from age or sitting there so there is no way they are 100% and they should need reconditioning! So does that mean the Noco doesn't know it's old and maybe the capacity is questionable at this point? Shouldn't a "genius/smart" charger know that when it supposedly analyzes it? I state the facts of the situation, you guys determine if my questions are valid or not, I'm just trying to stay objective and see if this does what it says and is worth the money since I never dealt with this company before. Feel free to let me know if you agree or your experiences...thanksUpdate: 10/21/2015 - it's still alive. I have been using this to maintain my motorcycle battery and my 12V car batteries but I still find the longer charge times annoying. This will still take an overnight session to charge my weekender's 12V to 100% when it isn't sluggish to start in the first place. That battery is still the newer one of my cars yet takes much longer than my older ones? In theory the older ones would be more of a target for the whole de-phos process and then recharge so they would expect to be clamped on longer. For what it's worth, it still turns on and is charging. I stand behind my 3 stars rating.

my 03 Honda Pilot had NGK but this seemed like a good product and I have not had trouble in the past with Bosch so I decided to try them because they didn't have enough NGK plugs. OUt the box, they were very polished - clean and solid feeling. Looked similar if not very very close in dimension to the NGKs I pulled out. I needed something for the DTV converters. I wanted to put on in the basement instead of trying to run cable down but at least have something to watch like news while in the basement doing whatever. I hated those bunny ears so I decided to try thins. It was cost effective, neat looking and unobtrustive all things considered.Pros:- worked just as well as the 60+ dollar ones surprisingly- better quality than I expected. It feels like the flat ant is sandwiched in 2 stiff/thick laminated that so far lasted with sun exposure by window- price is not bad compared to those cheesy rabbit ears or dish looking things- worked no worse than even the powered ones (instead of 2 or 3 channels with rabbit ears I got 14 no including audio only channels) - not badCons:- DTV is dependent on area so if your area sucks, powered or not/cheap or expensive - no signal is no signal- cable is kinda short, definitely could be longer. I guess if your TV is by a window then it is ok and just enough ~ 3-4 ft- suction cup mounts...works as expected...will fall but that's suction cups vs mounting other waysTIP:Check this site before you order. This will help you check to see if DTV is really an option to try or will it be more trouble for nothing.[...]

Just like OE carts but much cheaper. My main issue with refurbed carts was if there was a chip and/or problems with the printer recognizing the carts like my HP did. Even cartridge world had to replace my Canon cart once and my HPs never worked properly after a month so I stopped going there! I had my hesitations but I decided to try Sophia (I had LD in the past too). Sophia was just as good as LD in the case of my Canon carts. I am happy with that. Although I did notice that it didn't last as long but I'll teach you a trick.Take a dropper and flip the cart upside down. There is the ink pad, use the dropper to drop and let drops of water soak in the pad (which happens fairly quickly) in. I forgot what the weight of a full cart was but I usually put in maybe ~ .5 fl oz max of water. Flip it back up right and let it sit. If the cart doesn't leak out then you're fine (which it should be fine b/c you never messed with the seal, just reverse absorbed the water back into the reservoir). Give it a gentle swish around and then reinstall. Let the printer test print and cycle the newly mixed ink soak in and saturate the cart felt. That's all...still on my 1 replacement cart after 2 more swaps although it is starting to lighten but it sure gave me a bang for the buck!!!! ENJOY!

Gates as per my mechanic is a good company and has been an OE supplier from some cars makers as well. He is particular about parts he installs for his customers so he knows sometimes cheaper is not better and also he is aware of quality from manufacturing origins. He did note that this was China but we checked over everything (roll/play of bearings, belt consistency etc..) and it seems virtually identical to the OEM Honda parts we took out (of course except in new condition). Bearing were smooth, belt was tough with the same feel - minus the grime, fit and finish were just fine. So they are in and the truck is awesome again at 10 - 2-% cheaper than having a dealer do it. Keep in mind, there are "technicalities" when listing as "made in ------" . My understanding is that the label can be from the point of final assembly so many parts can be made in China but if final assembly was made in USA or where ever, then it can be labeled as such. Hence, knowing that nowadays almost everything is made in China, we physically checked over all the parts and made sure it felt quality. I am happy with the purchase.03 Honda Pilot EX-L major maintenance order list: Just FYIBosch 6707 Platinum Plugs (x6)Honda Genuine OEM A/C Compressor Belt - 38920-P8F-A02; 2003 to 2004 Honda Pilot, and 1999 to 2001 OdysseySold by E-PartsProsAisin BTH-002 OEM Timing Belt Tensioner Aisin BTH-002 OEM Timing Belt TensionerSold by Amazon.com LLCGates TCK286 Timing Belt Component Kit Gates TCK286 Timing Belt Component KitSold by Amazon.com LLCGenuine Honda 56992-P8A-A01 Power Steering Pump Belt Genuine Honda 56992-P8A-A01 Power Steering Pump BeltSold by Amazon.com LLCGMB 135-2380 OE Replacement Water Pump GMB 135-2380 OE Replacement Water PumpSold by Amazon.com LLCupdate: 7/30/15 still purring!!

I already reviewed it under the 3 pack. I since have found so many more uses and it is convenient enough that I bought a 6pk for even more stuff. Again, the design is trendy yet functional. The plug only stands out about an inch more so unless it is being squashed behind something that will be close up to the wall...keep that in mind. Otherwise they are great! I use them for a couple of my guest and baby's room where they have the "auto-sensing" nightlights but the room maybe slightly darker because of positioning in the house/windows - I no longer have to keep unplugging etc etc..if I need them on auto for a while, then flip the switch. That's all...guest room nitelights - same there...I also use it on  my charger plugs so I don't have to wear and tear on the outlets or the plugs. Did you know that "standby" and plugged but not charging - chargers can still use a minute amount of energy? Have any electronics that do not shut off totally but only go on standby? Well - here you go. I have not had one break (knock on wood) yet and the button lights green if on, off if the switch is off so you know. Oh, it is a grounded plug too so that 3rd round prong is there just FYI if you were planning to plug it into a 2 prong outlet/adapter of sorts.

I have a 7 mo old and we got this about 4 months ago. We figured he would like the sounds and lights which he did. Lately the pad has been quirky. When i say quirky I mean the lid can sense if open or closed and while opened (it has preset points that hold lid open) the little shake will set it off and it thinks the lid is being opened/closed. Now it just beeps or blips or repeats words/phrases without anybody playing with it. My son liked that one during nap time..I finally put him to sleep after being cranky and scout goes ballistic and woke him up. I think it's safe to say it is broken. We never dropped it, wet it or anything. We were always holding it and pressing the buttons while he sat in our laps or during tummy time. Considering it was never abused and it only lasted 4 months, i'd say that's some horrible quality. Maybe we got the lucky lemon of the group? Too bad, it was fun when it worked and he liked it I tried emailing the company, maybe they'll send me a free replacement..who knows. I'll let you know how their customer service is and re-rate if needed.3/17/2014: Contacted the LeapFrog company via email and they were good about responding. I sent them a description, Item #, Serial #, color and where I bought it from. They said they would be sending a replacement! I am waiting for the mail. Yay! Hopefully this one won't break and flip out in the middle of his sleep like that last one...Yikes.3/20/2014: LeapFrog Customer Service came through! They kept it relatively easy and my baby had a new one to play with. It was properly packed and spotless when I got it. I really appreciate Leap Frog's customer service and although they were pleasant enough, I hope we don't use them again. Nowadays, proper service can be tough to find. It is nice to know they were courteous and helpful when we did need them. Thanks again Leap Frog CS.  - Since the other was broken anyways, I opened to take a peek. It turns out that the trigger switch that tells the electronic if the lid is opened or closed is pressed by a raised portion of the plastic ridge inside the base. The parts look like it does not meet flush hence one half of the seam does not meet the height of the other which barely hits the trigger when at the raised threshold and closed. Thus, any shaking makes it flick the trigger right at the point where it thinks it is opened/closed and it must've fried the board from the constant surges when it does. It seems it's a matter of manufacturing QC issue.

I have ordered 16" and other 19" but different manufacturers. My friends wanted backups so I too to Amazon to find more and it seems the others that I previously bought were not offered anymore. So I came across these and I figured they look ok - no rubberized grip or window smasher on the butt plate but it's still fine as a back up right? I ordered three and if it was my money I think I would've returned it. When compared to the other generic batons, this was certainly "rough". The weigh was good considering and it was slimmer than the other rubberized grip models which is fine. The bad part is the craftsmanship when extending and collapsing. If you flick out too hard, the section will get stuck and I mean I did have to give it a few good hard thumps to collapse it. With my others, it was not like that. Even if I flicked it out really hard it would feel like it was out of alignment or "locked up". This feels like it needs to be broken in or something. I offered my friends to return it but they said it was the backup to the baseball bat so it should be fine. I personally wouldn't have kept it but then again I would use it more for duty or bumps in the night on a more regular basis. I guess you have to really weigh the cost of under 20 bucks vs level of craftsmanship. I will ask them to break them in and see if the action smooths out. If it gets better I will update but if you don't hear from me on this again, my review stands 100%. The seller was absolutely fine and I've been a return customer, I'm sorry this purchase was not up to par as the past orders. A+ seller (Doro) but less than stellar baton - this one.

I needed a backup tank not only for my BBQ but I have a propane generator that runs off 20lb tanks. Since this winter's been pretty crappy and I have a new baby, I need the extra piece of mind. I went to local places and the prices were crazy - about 20 bucks more for various brands. This was a new tank and it is vacuum purged for you and ready to fill. It feels just as the other tanks do and the edges are not sharp. I was able to hold the base without shredding my hand (when tank is new of course) not like one of the other ones I bought from HD and it wasn't as refined. It has the safety overfill valve that I believe is required now. Otherwise, it's a tank. Check your local garden center/yard store - they may sell it there so figure the tax vs shipping if you buy online and buy accordingly. otherwise, prices local vs online seem close unless someone marks it up more than usual.mine came with a black and red wrap around label - not that that really matters but it was more presentable so I was pleasantly surprised.

when compared to the videosecu cables, it is lighter in material. It still transmits fine but remember that it is only wired to the nest room and not near a power line. My only gripe is the power line. It fits lighter (but not loose that it will slide off) or not as tight as the other cables and the plug is slightly longer for my cam's power connection so it does have some metal showing instead of having the plastic base touch with the other plastic base for a "closed" connection point. If you have the full 10 ft dangling or will be tucking the connection point in the cutout/hole inside the walls then I would electric tape it or something to keep it from separating and some insulation for the exposed metal but that's probably more from me being extra cautious. I do that anyways for the ones that fit seamlessly. Overall, not bad for the price but it will do fine. It's better than me using a 60ft cable when this 10ft is enough.

not sure what to say about this. Still need to go to the range to see what is the issue but both the USP compact and USC carbine are HK and use .45 ACP carts. According to the carbine, this seems spot on with the stock sights. The usp compact shows that it is slightly off to the right and a twinge high but it could be from the tug on the case extractor but last i knew both were shooting straight.I gave it 3 stars b/c the instructions are basic and how is the laser mounted in side from the factory - any possibility of adjustments at all? I think you "can't" unless someone figured out how with no adjustment screws and the on/off is just screwing the back cap until it turns off. On the brighter side, it was sent with 4 button batteries which it only needs two even though the instructions says 3...can't see how I won't break it jamming 3 in. Until I hit the range (hopefully soon) and see if my theory is right about the extractor tugging to the right, I can't truly say if it was send misaligned from the factory. I will update and change the rating accordingly so for now, I leave it at a 3 as a warning since there are others online that look the same but have gotten so-so reviews as well.Just out of curiosity, anyone know if they can adjust these somehow? I wish I could find it again but someone on I thin Amazon reviewed a similar if not same sighter with the same common issues. I know there was mention of putting this on a drill and adjusting it until the circle stops whirling and centers but I did not catch how they "adjusted it" - interesting thought though.

it's a pretty comprehensive kit. It seems like it has rod ends and loops that would fit into anything from .22 rimfires to larger calibers like .45 +. I've had Hoppe's kits before and they've always lasted a decent amount of time/abuse. My only gripe with this is that the base T-Handle-rod feels cheaper than in past years. I still have my older T-handle and it feels more comfy and sturdy than this new one's t handle. The kit has enough metal (aluminum?) extension rods so it can clean out most carbines and rifle barrels to the end.  The case is better than plastic but don't expect to smash it with a hammer and survive. The plastic insert tray where it keeps the brushes, rods etc is flimsy though but I don't expect it to break soon since it really just a place holder for the contents. It more than does it's job keeping all the parts in and has 2 latch locks. All in all...good kit for the price. Too bad there wasn't extra room to keep the lube and solvent in there with it but maybe if the flimsy plastic tray breaks, bag the stuff and they'll be room for the 2 bottles.

Quality enough. It is a polymer and edgy enough but don't think you'll cut anything like you would with a metal knife. Really..if you think that then don't play with "toys" that you don't understand. Anyone who knows what this is, knows it's capabilities and what it really is meant for and not misconceptions of what the inexperienced think it should do. It is sturdy and I am satisfied with this purchase. Check dimensions in the specs area but it will fit in a average mid-ankle boot, sock/ankle strap or back belt. I just keep it on my duty belt.

This is a great set. Obviously not really used for "cutting" like traditional knives so those who think so really have no business trying to buy such items. Although edgy enough, you won't be chopping veggies for soup with this so don't rate it as being compared to a real metal blade - DUH. These polymer/composite "letter openers" or whatever you want to refer to them as is basically a tool for those who understand how and to what capacity they can be used for. The knuckle/punch slips on comfortably and has enough base to the palm even for larger hands. The tip has a tapered tip for more focused impacts (may puncture). The throwing knife design feels closely modeled to it's metal counterpart in dimension but I wouldn't expect to do movie dramatic hits across the room with it but it still carries a little more weight than I anticipated. The triangular and the boot knife are straight forward as well. All solid enough.Overall, a good set for the price. Hopefully never will be used but on my duty belt as a last resort.

I bought this so I can declutter my counter and that means that hideous dishrack needed to go. Still need something unobtrusive for a few things. I hoped this was the solution...yes and no. It was ok for baby bottles and stuff but even that was "ok" . Bottle and caps you can jam into the fingers - silicone nipples not so much so if they were one the edge, they'd roll off eventually. Certainly couldn't put regular dishes in a pinch - or not plates - saucers at best. The "grass" is actually one whole stiff grid of fingers that you can lift up  and drain/clean the bottom tray easy enough. The grass fingers are surprisingly pointier than I would expect - not that it pierces skin but normally baby anything would have some rounded out or softer tip to it. Not a big deal but somethign else to note. Didn't return it (probably should've) but I found a super replacement that gave a great balance of baby/regular stuff yet unassuming and just as "trendy". OXO makes a compact dish rack that has thick but thoughtfully spaced fingers (with a soft tip coating on the tips) that is rectangular in size. The tip coatings gave optional colors (green, red, white and grey that I've seen) and it's overall rectangular shape is just enough for dual function. I can place larger flat dishes, bowls or baby items there no problem! I'd say go for that instead. I even bought a foldable travel version for the baby bag incase we get stuck or sleep over somewhere. Awesome stuff oxo - check it outhttp://www.amazon.com/OXO-Bottle-Drying-Rack-Orange/dp/B0038JE60U/ref=sr_1_5?ie=UTF8&qid=1391186071&sr=8-5&keywords=oxo+dish+rack

I compared these to major brands like Energizer, RayoVac, Duracell and even Chicago Electric (Harbor Freight) and I am happy with these. They mosty certainly last longer than CE's brand and fair better than my Duracell and RayoVacs. They're close performers with Energizer. Overall they feel heavy not cheap and sturdy. This brand works with any charger I've had which I have a RAdio Shack, Energizer and an older Tyco? For the price, they are a good bang for the buck. I even bought more sizes - AA, C, D. I have these in my mini work light which is subject to all temps to my remote controllers and they're great. They seem to keep most if not all even in chilly storage. I am not disappointed.

The trailer is fine but the music is horrible. Did they get Nick Cannon to do it, because it sounds like some corny stuff he'd write. They should've tried to get Kanye to do it. Maybe they did. They should've tried harder.

My freezer is old & weird and ice cubes would literally evaporate and disappear on me, so I needed an ice cube tray with a lid or cover. I didn't expect for this to be a MAGIC TRAY that magically seals water in. I can't get enough of this thing. I can literally sit it on it's side in the freezer door! Amazing. It also works for what I needed; I can have ice in this tray for months with no evaporation. Thanks Oxo!
There is no CM measurement, which I didn't even realize I wanted until I needed it one day. Other than that it's fine.

Three things you need to know before buying this bra:1. It's in Asian sizing, so a 32 is a 75. If you're a large 34, buy the 36. It will still be tight though, which is what you want & need for good push-up power. Beauty is pain.2. This is designed for small busted women to have a pushup that works for us, with no gapping. If you're a C cup, this is not the bra for you, go to Victoria's Secret or something. There is so much padding in this bra that your boobs will have nowhere to go and you won't be able to close the bra.3. The shoulder straps are too short for the average American woman. Again, this is for petite Asian chicks, so if your torso is longer than a lilliputians, you'll need to buy separate straps. Even on the longest adjustment the straps are painfully short and restrict movement for me (I'm 5'9" & 32A, bought a 34A).Keep in mind that this bra is supposed to be tight and it's supposed to pull your boobs up under your chin. The straps are supposed to be tight, that's why it works so well. I have apple/orange sized boobs and I could walk the VS Fashion Show runway in this bra, that's how good it is! This is a special occasion bra, not an every day comfort bra.

Daiya did it again. This tastes EXACTLY like Velveeta Shells & Cheese, a pantry staple for my mom that I grew up eating as a child. I didn't know I missed it so much until I tasted this. Even the pasta tastes perfect, which shocked me since I hate gluten-free foods. The only way you can tell this isn't "normal" pasta is that the water turns opaque white while boiling; otherwise there is no difference. I recommend this, but definitely price shop. My local Kroger has these for a lot cheaper, but I'm happy Amazon is offering it for people in vegan-food-wastelands.Pro tip: Use the cheese sauce packet as emergency nacho sauce. You know, for those nacho emergencies.

I hanger shopped for literally 2 months before settling on these. I knew I wanted "huggable" type hangers, but I wasn't about to pay huggable prices, if you get my drift. I decided on these after reading the Amazon reviews. THANK YOU AMAZON REVIEWERS. I had initially passed these up because I don't like or need the accessory bar and find it cluttered looking, but wound up being totally frustrated with the other hangers I found. My requirements were:1. Sturdy2. Low cost3. Pretty color4. Not too wideAll the ones I found in stores were either super wide suit hangers (17" and up), flimsy, or ugly. The others I found online had ridiculous hearts in the middle of them, high prices, quality issues, ugly colors, or unknown widths. I'm glad I settled on these "Cresnel" ones! (I put Cresnel in quotation marks because the box they came in has no brand listed on it at all, just a plain cardboard box straight from the Chinese factory)I don't mind the minimalist shade of gray, and the felt flocking on them does not come off. I really rubbed the heck out of one on my white duvet when I first got it just to make sure, and nothing came off at all. I bought 100 of these things and so far I've filled up my second clothes rack with all 100 of them: Whitmor 6071-1947 Supreme 36-Inch Clothes Closet, White and Clear. That's 100 hangers in 30", including some thick sweaters and blazers (the other 6" have about 10 pairs of pants on pant clip hangers). Not bad.I recommend these to anyone looking for good quality hangers to invest in for wardrobe organization. I only wish they came in more colors, I really would have liked soft pink or ivory!
I can't believe my mom used to let me watch this! At least now I see where I got my sense of humor from....

If you're looking for the squash scent of the Air Spencer, this isn't it, but it's still a GREAT scent. I quickly got over my initial disappointment once I popped the tab on this little can. It seems to be lasting longer than the Air Spencer did as well, so that's a plus. Every time someone gets in my car they comment on how nice it smells. It's not overpowering either, just a pleasant, noticeable scent. Fruity, sparkly (if sparkle had a scent), and fresh.
It smells like chai tea. Gross and ineffective.

At first I thought it didn't fit my cigarette lighter, but I just had to jam it in harder. It's shaped to not be wobbly and loose in the hole, so you have to just use elbow grease. I like that, actually. It does fast charge as well, just as fast as the Samsung charger that came with my Note 4. Sometimes it even seems like it goes faster than the home one, but that may be because at home I'm not concerned with how long it takes, versus when I'm on-the-go.The only reason I give it 4 stars is because a car charger should have a retractable or coiled cord. This regular USB cord is a ridiculous mess in the car, and I get annoyed at having to wrap it up and stuff it in the console all the time. I usually end up just shoving the tangled mess in the console and dealing with the aftermath later.
I used these to hang a curtain rod bracket set and they work great!

I bought this to use with a light-switch-linked socket, where the top plug is activated by the light switch and the bottom is free to use for anything 24/7. I use it by my bedside and keep my phone charger in the USB port and my laptop in the plug. A lamp is in the top plug. It fits perfectly behind my nightstand and doesn't hum, get warm, or have any annoying lights. I love it, especially for the price!

I was tired of paying out the neck for Venus refills so I decided to give a cheaper brand a try. The Quattro feels good in the hand but it does not give as close a shave as Venus. I can go several days without shaving my armpits before it gets out of hand with Venus, but with the Quattro I had to shave every other day. On the plus side, I had MUCH less skin irritation and hyperpigmentation with the Quattro, but that was probably because it wasn't actually getting close to my skin, so that's the trade off. So now I have black armpits but no hair. I may alternate between the Quattro and Venus to spare my skin. One thing I will say, the little suction cup holder actually works! First time ever in my life that I've seen a suction cup actually stay up on something without popping off 2 seconds later.

This thing ruined my kegel muscles after only one use and I cannot in good faith recommend it to anyone. It took 3 weeks of nonstop kegel exercises to get back to normal. I was completely unable to hold my urine once the urge arose. I suddenly understood what my grandmother goes through when she sneezes. I will never put this thing back inside my body, and if holding your bladder is important to you, I'd exhort you to not take the risk either. Twenty-five bucks is a lot to just throw away.

I am a light bulb color-temperature snob; I hate orange "warm" light with a passion, but also don't like harsh white light anywhere but my kitchen. I bought this bulb to use in my bedroom to replace a bright white LED in a bedside lamp. I loved the brightness of my old LED bulb during the evening & night, but first thing in the morning it felt like I was giving myself LASIK eye surgery. I screwed this Neutral daylight 4250 - 4500k ChinChin bulb in and it's perfect. It's still bright, but not so bright that it's painful. It's warm but not too warm that it looks orange. It really is how the description says it is. It is definitely "instant on" as well.I love that it is a normal light bulb shape too. Usually for bright lights you want to go with a corn bulb, but those don't fit in my kitchen ceiling fixture or my stove hood light. These do, so my next purchase will be the "Pure cool white" ChinChin bulb. I may get one of those for my fridge as well. I love the price - not too high for a single bulb, but high enough to say that you're getting something with more quality than a 5-for-10 pack of cheapo orange-y light bulbs from costco.I will update after I've had it for a while to review the longevity.

I got the "12-Inch Multi-Level Organizer, Clear". Love this organizer, but know that it is not shiny, clear acrylic. It is an orange tinted plastic. If this will clash with your bathroom decor, you might want to find something different. Luckily I don't care that much so it doesn't really bother me. It does look weird though, so orangey.

If you are looking for a super bright bulb, look no further. I can't even turn this thing on in the early mornings because it actually physically hurts my eyes! Love it, going to stick it in a living room lamp instead of my bedroom lamp. I love the color tone though, such a crystal clear white that's perfect for reading, makeup, etc.

I am 5'8.5", 135lbs, 34AA and usually wear a medium in shirts. Based on the measurements and some of the other reviews I went with a 10, because Asian sizing is usually way too small for me. The model is wearing a 6 and her thighs don't even touch, so I figured there is no way I could fit that shirt, especially around my large hips! Well, I should not have done that. The tag says L and it definitely is a large! It looks like a nurse's scrub shirt on me. A medium would fit well but still be roomy on me; I could have even gone with a 6 (S). I will be returning it, because unfortunately they don't do exchanges. I would have to just buy a whole 'nother one in the right size. It is a good shirt though! It's long, the front is lined so it's not sheer, the back is super cute and the shade of gray is exactly like the picture. The tag does not say V28 though, it says "YTOSIZE". Go ahead and order one, but err on the smaller side if in doubt!
I love these! They work great and look so cute. I wish Panasonic would come out with more designs soon, and make them available in the USA!
It's way too stiff to work properly. I always revert back to my donut bun maker instead.
Love the batteries, so pretty. I wish Panasonic would come out with more designs soon :/

I've had this for a week now and I loaded the bottom bar with jeans and hoodie jackets. So far it's holding up well! I was worried it would fall down but so far so good. I have it on the lowest possible notch; my shirts on top do still hang over the bottom bar, but I expected that. It doesn't matter to me as long as I have some extra space. I just push the bottoms of my shirts over behind the bar. Also, my jeans I have to fold & hang horizontally in order for them not to drag on the floor, but again, not a big deal to me because at least I can hang them. I will have to buy more of the clamp-type pants hangers instead of the pinchy-type hangers. These sort: http://smile.amazon.com/Whitmor-6026-342-Natural-Collection-Hanger/dp/B002YH4N4GI will say that when I got it, it was missing one of the white clips that hold the bottom bar up; there were supposed to be 4 but I only got 3. You only need 2 though, so it works fine. For the price, I can't complain!

Love these pens. The 0.7mm is nice but the 0.5mm is nicer. The pearl white barrel is lovely and I love the fact that I can buy refills. Pentel makes the best gel pens out there, even better than the G2 in my opinion.

I am 5'9" with hips and this shirt in Medium fits me amazingly well. It completely drapes over my hips! No rolls or clinging in sight. The front of the shirt stops at my crotch and the back falls 1-2 inches above the back of my knees. If I were shorter, I could wear it as a dress with a belt. I will definitely wear it with leggings, denim shorts, and even skirts for a layered look. I got it in Vintage Pink and it's a beautiful mauve color, just right to wear any time of year. I am back to buy more right now!

I had the privilege of feeling these towels in person at my local The Andersons store. I could not believe how fluffy and soft they were at first touch, until I read the tag on them and discovered they were pima cotton. I am a lifelong pima cotton fan; my favorite bed linens are pima, and I jump on any opportunity to buy anything else pima because I know how soft and comfortable it is. I still hesitated to buy these towels because they have pearl powder in them (why hurt oysters for no good reason) and were thirty bucks. But I can tell you they are worth it. So thick, so fluffy, and so soft. These are top of the line, premium towels, not those thin flimsy things that usually pass for premium. I don't even care for turkish towels, they are too thin for me. These are THICK.

People are complaining because they are not informed. Anyone who has ever been to an Ikea knows this pillow is only ninety-nine cents and made of papery material. That is the whole point. Most people use these for their pets, toddlers who wet the bed/drool, travel pillows for planes/hotels, and some people (like me) use them for comfort kneading. They do not last forever, they are not made to. Why Amazon is charging 7x their usual price is beyond me, but Ikea never claimed the Slan to be high-end. They have the Lilja and Raps pillows for that. This pillow doesn't deserve 2 stars. That's like going to the dollar store and wondering where the valet parking is.

Yes, these pillows go squishy after a couple months.... and I love it! I hate hard pillows, and hard pillows are the only pillows that don't go lumpy after a few months. These are still so incredibly soft and squishy; I love them even more than the day I bought them. I plan on going back to Costco and buying 2 more so I can have 2 firmer/puffier ones and 2 flatter/squooshy ones. I love hugging my lumpy soft squishy pillow, and it's still big and puffy enough for me to use as a head pillow too. Even once they deteriorate down to pure lumps, I will still love them because I have that weird thing where I like to scrunch slippery/lumpy pillows; it relaxes me. (In the interest of full disclosure I suppose I should let you know that I am actually a cat.) I love these and can't recommend them enough! If you want invincible pillows that last forever, sleep on a hard brick pillow like the kind Serta makes. I can't stand those things and only use them to prop myself up to watch TV in bed, or sit my plate on while I'm eating in bed. YES I know beds are for sleeping but who are you to judge me? I like to create mountains with pillows on my bed and get all snuggly in them, and these Charismas are perfect for that. So very soft! If you're anything like me, you'll like these pillows. But for Pete's sake please don't spend too much on them, Costco has them for twenty-something flat, no shipping.

I have needed a new mattress for years, I was still sleeping on the one I got when I was 10. I picked the "ask chuck" option but it wasn't really necessary because we wound up going with my original firmness guess, #6 (which is the standard one they offer; not sure if it's "cushion firm" or "plush medium" on here.. probably cushion firm). I don't have back problems or anything like that, but I can say that this mattress is comfy all around, and even if I had gone softer I would be happy. I don't think you can go wrong with this mattress. There wasn't even any off gassing which amazed me because I just knew there would be since there is foam in it. Nope. It was easy for one person to get out of the box, unwrapped, and onto the boxspring. For the price, there is no reason why anyone should procrastinate on buying a new mattress if you need one. Just do it! You won't regret it. I am sleeping like a baby. 3 days after I first got this mattress I took 3 naps in one day. Oh what a beautiful Saturday that was! That beat my old record of 2 naps in one day on my old mattress, lol.

If you have a giant, super thick boxspring, this cover will.... have you covered. No pun intended. I have a normal 6 or 7 inch "full" size boxspring and there is so much extra fabric it's not even funny. I rolled it up and tucked it into the bed frame but it still looks messy. Plus the material is super stretchy so it's not like it was difficult to slip on. A minor complaint, but I thought it was worth mentioning. For the price you can't go wrong, I do recommend it!

I have very fine hair that's also layered so it always looks feathery and damaged, even though it's not. I use this stuff and suddenly it's like an herbal essences commercial! I look like a hair model, right down to the ends of my hair. Amazing.

I bought this model because it has a retractable cord, which works great and I love it. The only downside are the clips. They look like breast cancer awareness bows and have fishtail ends that stick way out from your head. I was hoping to be able to put these rollers in, throw a shower cap over them and take a shower/get ready to leave the house. Not happening! No shower cap in the world is big enough to cover the giant clips that come with this. I also don't think the clips hold the roller well enough; they flop around on my head, they're not very tight or secure. Also, Conair gives you a drawstring bag to keep the clips in, which is nice, but then you have to find somewhere to put the bag. I have it hanging on my bathroom doorknob. For a compact machine with cord reel, they sure didn't think through the rest of it. I will try the metal pins, but in general I do recommend this hot roller set.
I love big glasses but these are way too big, even on my big, round face. If they were only a half inch smaller I would definitely get my prescription put in them. Oh well.

There is beige and even neon bright pink, but not one single shade of brown. I am so sick and tired of bra companies forcing deeper toned women to show their bras off through their shirts! Unacceptable and Hanes won't be getting my money until they make some brown bras for non-white (or neon pink..?) women.

I've been coveting these boots for 3 years and finally bought them for a reasonable price on Amazon this spring. LOVE THEM TO DEATH. It is hard to walk in them because they're so puffy that your legs brush/bounce off each other, but in deep snow that won't be a problem. Plus, I already walk like a penguin on ice in the winter, so I will only have a hard time indoors. But who buys these for the practically anyway?! THEY'RE HIDEOUSLY CUTE!

I see a beige called "Naturally Nude" but no shade of brown. I must have missed the memo about brown skin not being nude. I suppose when I'm naked, I should be called something other than nude? So sick and tired of bra companies forcing deeper toned women to show their bras off through their shirts! Unacceptable and Wacoal won't be getting my money. It's a shame too, since it's very hard to find AA cup bras.

I see a color called "nude" that is nowhere near nude, more like beige, but not one single shade of brown. I am so sick and tired of bra companies forcing deeper toned women to show their bras off through their shirts! Unacceptable and Lula Lu won't be getting my money until they realize that every woman on earth can be "nude", not just caucasians.

I see multiple shades of beige but not one single shade of brown. I am so sick and tired of bra companies forcing deeper toned women to show their bras off through their shirts! Unacceptable and "Barely There" won't be getting my money.

I can still find the black versions of these nylon one-piece hair elastics in stores, but never EVER all brown packs. I'm glad I stocked up because these things have a way of growing legs and walking off. Thank you Cosmetic Solutions for still selling these!

I have super dry skin and Korean face creams are the only kind I use. They leave my face hydrated without looking greasy, unlike American brands I've tried like Aveeno and Olay. I have never tried Nature Republic products but figured I'd give them a try since 1, EXO advertises for them and I'm a sucker for anything they sell, and 2, the price for a jar of this stuff was less than ten bucks (on ebay).I absolutely love it! This is a gel-type cream, if that makes any sense. It's lightweight, smooth, and a beautiful shade of baby pink. It has a TON of ingredients, which would normally turn me off, but around 90% of them are natural plant extracts. It comes with a spatula, but honestly, it spreads so well and you need so little of this product that 80 mLs would literally last me 3 years. I threw the spatula in a drawer and bought an airless pump bottle instead. After transferring 50 mLs of this cream into one large bottle, I find I only need one pump for my whole face. The original jar still sits on my shelf with 30 mLs still inside it. It smells lightly floral and sinks right into my skin.Nature Republic proves yet again that most skin care companies are ripping us off. Biotherm, Elisha Coy, Shiseido, etc. have products similar to this but sell them at over twice the price, and they have less natural ingredients. Many competitor's products even have harmful ingredients like parabens and denatured alcohol. For the price, you absolutely can't go wrong with this Super Aqua Max! Two people can even use one jar and it will still last for months. Give it a try!

I am not a Jehovah's Witness, so I'm unbiased here, I just want to post a "review" to say that the New World Translation is actually a more literal, direct translation than the KJV or NIV. Particularly the Greek scriptures (new testament); all of Peter and Paul's letters are pretty much word for word from the Greek. It might not read as easy as the NIV, but you get more out of it, in my humble opinion as someone who studies the bible. If you're doing a Beth Moore study or any in-depth bible study, I recommend you visit a Kingdom Hall to get one of these for free.To exemplify what I mean:NIV 2 Corinthians 6:14 "Do not be yoked together with unbelievers. For what do righteousness and wickedness have in common? Or what fellowship can light have with darkness?"NWT 2 Corinthians 6:14 "Do not become unevenly yoked with unbelievers. For what fellowship do righteousness and lawlessness have? Or what sharing does light have with darkness?"Same scripture, more accurate wording. Paul used the greek word "heterozygountes" which means "unevenly", not just "together". You get used to it after a while, it's not as difficult to understand as it might seem at first.

I have black brown, fine, naturally curly hair that I color light brown. I use this at 30 vol, goldwell 8na, ash mix, and some purple dye to create the perfect ash brown. It's gentle on my hair even when I leave it on longer than 30 minutes. It's a huge bottle too, so using only 60-100 mL each time, I will have this for a good while longer! I bought it June of 2013 and I'm not even halfway through it yet. Great value, great product.
This stuff gave me irritated red bumps on my skin, which is disappointing because I LOVE Naruko's Lupin Anti-wrinkle gelly and was hoping to find an alternative since I can't find it anymore.

I've been using this for months and haven't seen any difference in wrinkles... then again, I started using it because I wanted to avoid deep wrinkles in the first place, so maybe I just can't tell. Still, I would expect to see some diminishing in the fine lines I already have, and I haven't. For the price, it's not worth it... there are probably better serums out there.

I love this tray, the ice freezes fast, cubes pop out with a couple good whacks and twists, and the lid lets me avoid making a mess after whacking the tray; just flip it over, bang bang, flip it back over, and dump the cubes out into a ziplock bag. Refill, start again! Well worth the money, which I was initially apprehensive about paying because who in their right mind pays double figures for an ice cube tray, amirite?

I've tried almost all of the Rexona roll on varieties for women, so I was surprised to come across this one on Amazon. I quickly bought it and am LOVING it! The scent is amazing and the antiperspirant lasting power just as good as the Rexonas from Thailand (which I usually buy) even though this one is from the UK. I will definitely be stocking up on these as my new "standard" scent from Rexona, replacing "Cotton".

After watching this, I fail to see how or why this family has been singled out as special or interesting. They are just like any random, low-income, inner city family of hustlers, except instead of inner city drug dealers they are rural drug dealers. This story of short lived fame in dance/music, addiction to drugs/alcohol, unwanted pregnancies, unwanted education, and crime can be seen in any city in America. It's been well documented already in movies like Losing Isaiah, etc.

What an amazing concept for the first episode, splitting up the girls into 2 "teams"! Thanks Ru, for always keeping the show fresh, because everyone loves fresh fish~ I've already picked my favorite (J'adore Adore)!
I've had this since September '13 and it's great! Easy to clean, doesn't stain, and still on the original bulb. Sometimes I leave it on for nearly 8 hours and it's still good to go.

I came to Amazon to buy some new ice cube trays and lookie lookie what I find, my current cheapo set that I got form Walmart years ago for literally 2 bucks. I don't use ice that often so I put up with these for ages, but now I've decided to upgrade my ice life. All of the reviews from other people are true, don't you dare click "add to cart"!!

I have US Women's 10 size feet so I was worried these wouldn't fit. They fit exactly perfectly; maybe a size 11 could stretch in there too because there is a lot of extra material at the top of the bootie bag. If you're size 12+ I would definitely go with the larger size in the blue box. I uploaded a picture with the bootie bags next to a measuring tape so you can see the exact length.Overall, it works exactly as described, the peeling process didn't take forever either. I thought I would have to hide my feet for a month or more but it's 1 day shy of a week since I did it and I'm basically done peeling, except for the tops of my feet & toe crevices. I only spend about 30 minutes picking at them every night since the 3rd night. My feet are so smooth, and it even peeled away some of the thicker parts on my callused areas. It didn't peel the whole callus, but it got several layers off; it feels much better and smoother. I don't have any corns or bunions so I can comment on those.I did not soak my feet every day or even moisturize them after the first day. It was completely low maintenance, I just picked at it in the evening as I watched a video. There was no pain at all during the peeling process, no tender spots where the skin held on. I even peeled my big toe cuticle off with no sensitivity at all.You will probably want a good exfoliating cloth for the tops of your feet to get those peels off, because they don't really peel off in sheets like the bottom of your foot. I recommend the following:Aquasentials Gentle Weave Terry Bath Cloth (2pk)Salux Nylon Japanese Beauty Skin Bath Wash Cloth/Towel - PinkI will also take a pumice stone to my toes to scrub the skin away, since it's hard to peel in between them. Overall I would buy this again, it's worth the money!
I really enjoyed reading cooking with weed I'm a bit skeptical due to a cooking is new for me but I feel like this book will definitely give me a good foundation to start with so I can grow into it!!
The characters are the best part about this book. All of them. They're so fun and fresh that none of them feel like a stereotype or a cliche.
Everything about this story is delightfully original and flawlessly executed. Kudos to the author for delivering such a wonderful read.
This is an amazing book! I enjoyed reading it and learning about what I can do to better my health. This book is easy to read and to follow.

The words are beautifully expressed. I love the play on words. I love the stories. I also got a lot of quote from this book and tweeted it. The analyses seems like from a different planet entirely. I wonder where on earth the author got this great wisdom from. I actually concentrated more on the poems and stories  only as I skimmed through at first.No one thought me to reread to read every detail. I reread slowly and then noticed I was missing a lot at first.I would gladly tell all my friends about this book.

This book was lent to me...the skinny delicious diet beats everything I have read about other diets hands down...it is informative, objective, fun, straightforward and moreover it even covers eating behaviour...I have waited a long time for an all encompassing book and the author is very authentic because she has tried it on herself....I can't wait for the recipe book and the skinny delicious over 50 book because I will buy them all

No spoilers but I hated the sad ending. I wanted to throw my kindle into the wall. Where is book 3??? This was a groundbreaking, engaging and powerful novel with an ending that just takes the air out of the room.
Certainly a must have. Quick and easy great for vegetarians. I just had to add this to my collection of recipe books.

Well put together with some nice pictures of the soups with clear instructions.There is the sweet potato with carrot soup which is absolutely delicious.  I hihgly recommend getting this one, its jam packed with wonderful recipes.

Firstly, while the center of attention and focus is Amun and his tribe, lets not overlook Annie's suffering. The hopeless romantic, desperately in love with her Edward, whom her family will never accept, thus forcing her to marry a rich man, John Palmer,  to save their necks- making Annie chose a life of unhappiness. We all came here to be happy and it was so sad that she didn't get this and ended up turning cold and bitter towards humanity. I do hope with all my heart her soul gets a redemption in the upcoming sequel.

Life is what it is, the author clearly explores this theme strongly in this book. We are faced with make-it-or-break-it hard and fast decisions everyday and what we ultimately do results in what we achieve or not. We see Dizzy, a struggling musician facing this strongly, being controlled, manipulated and used as a cash cow, it was heartbreaking and moving because a lot of people go through this sort of thing everyday. Thank you for writing this book, it will free a lot of people fighting their demons.

This book sweeps me off my feet, overtly sexual descriptive in its instructions, some mind-blowing techniques to have your lover toes curling and knowledge on how to tap into the deep corners of the mind and become the greatest at your passions. Pick up your copy!
This is some serious spine-tingling romance that erotic readers will revel in. Luke and Malik are so charming, so in love, I can feel their passion through my kindle and its so beautiful and hot.

This book literally kept be turning the pages until the middle of the night. I would recommend this book to anyone a fan of looking into the darker places of reality. I gave this five stars since I swallowed up the story quickly and felt pulled by the horror. I've read some of the negative reviews and all I can say is that everyone has different taste. I didn't find this story lacking in any way. Easy to read and certainly captivating. The entire novel from start to finish is well written, thought provoking and weaves complex emotions into a fascinating story line.

I'm interested in the forex market, but articles on the internet are so complicated, so I've never understood a thing. I downloaded this book to give a new try, and now I understand a bit more and for sure i'm going to buy some pairs
It's not a rainy day, but I found the cake on the cover so delicious, that I bought the book.The recipes are well writtein in detail. It guides you along step by step.
I bought a crockpot, but i didn't find any good recipes, so I forgot it until I saw this book.The recipes inside seems so easy and now i'm trying a recipe.
I bought a crockpot, but i didn't find any good recipes, so I forgot it until I saw this book.The recipes inside seems so easy and now i'm trying a recipe.
"I didn't make soap, I downloaded this book because I was curious. But in this book it seems so easy to make soaps, that I'm going to try tomorrow !

This was a very fascinating read, this well written book is filled with romance, suspense, and drama. This is a must read for all those who've conquered love and who knows what challenges you had to go through concerning that love.It will keep you pulled into the well developed plot. I guarantee you will not be disappointed. Certainly worth the five stars in my book. Kuos to the author for delivering such a wonderful read.

The title of the book pretty much summarizes it. There is a lot of material covered in the book by the author, but it's very informative and gives good references for further research on bilingualism. There are a few technical aspects included. Definitely an eye-opener. I never really took notice to the fact that there are more countries dealing with bilingualism. For my generation in my country (The Netherlands) its something very natural, and something I very well look forward to happening more rapidly around the globe. I enjoyed reading this book. Overall a great read on a very interesting topic.

The words are beautifully expressed. I love the play on words. I love the stories. I also got a lot of quote from this book and tweeted it. The analyses seems like from a different planet entirely. I wonder where on earth the author got this great wisdom from. I actually concentrated more on the poems and stories  only as I skimmed through at first.No one thought me to reread to read every detail. I reread slowly and then noticed I was missing a lot at first.I would gladly tell all my friends about this book.

Broken Souls is a tender romance and a high-speed adventure thriller at the same time!I love a good action flick, the main character Sandra is very sympathetic. She is strong, talented and a very determined woman. She is fighting for her life and her love. This is a really an enjoyable read!There is a cliffhanger at the end of the story, so it looks like the door is open for the next thrilling adventure.

Very good book with advice on controlling spending,and making a budget for those never having had a budget. AND a better way of accepting a budget in order to have the things you want at the time you can afford them. Great book for young people with debt...how to do away with it. Recommended.

This book is full of ideas, for kids. These ideas, and suggestions, are great for the adults to know. It will cause better relations with the kids, because they will be happy, not BORED. All grandparents, and parents alike should have this on hand, at all times. It will teach through example, that money is not required, for true happiness.

I discovered this book because of work, and thought I was interested in reading it, I didn't anticipate it being particularly relevent to my life. I'm already a healthy eater, athletically active. I felt healthy. I felt skinny. After trying this out, I felt even healthier. Highly recommend getting this one.

Overall, this is a great book with a fresh perspective that can help loose weight the healthy way. I don't give many five star reviews on amazon... honestly usually very critical, but this book deserves it. I can't imagine how much time is put into it, but there were some recipes that were eye opening even for me.

I bought this book for my daughter. My intentions were to flip through the pages and see what it was all about. 10 minutes later I was still reading and enjoying the beautiful illustrations. The author has done an amazing job delivering such an informative book. My daughter is a pretty tough one to please, but this book does it somehow.

Most of us are not educated when it comes to surviving, though we can learn through experience. This book covers all of the great information to know about survival. Provides checklist and produces for any type of disaster. Recommended!

A very easy diet to follow, which explains the recipes very well. If you are interested to lose weight using Ketogenic diet, this book is a must read for you. Includes lots of tips to get started. Nice book!

This book is full of great information on how to help a teenager who is struggling with depression. The author gives many tips on how to speak to the depressed teen and how to help them. Inside this book you will find the difference between teenage and adult depression, which is extremely helpful when trying to figure out if the teenager is depressed or if they are just going through hormonal changes.
