If you know someone who is struggling with depression and are trying to find ways to help them, buy this book; you will be so happy you did.

Weight is one of the main concern of many people. This ebook guided all the great tips and tricks to lose weight using coconut oils. Not only that,  it also explained lots of other helpful ways how coconut works in different aspects. Great book!

Absolutely fantastic story this would be a great idea for a movie I especially loved the ending. The author couldnt pick a better title for this book. This is the second book Ive read by this author and it wont be the last. Definitely worth the 5 stars in my book.
I love it because it has many great ideas and very good directions to beautiful patterns. Very simple and easy to use. I recommend it for everyone who loves to crochet.
This a great book on self hypnosis, very easy to follow. I would recommend this to anyone looking to learn how self hypnotize themselves for the first time. I like this book!

This book is helpful. I easily learned preparing and canning foods just in case of emergency. I really enjoyed reading this guide on food storage. If you want to take precautions against natural disaster, I recommend this book!

Such an informative book! This book clearly illustrates to you how to start with a vision, and end up leaving a legacy. In the following chapters youll learn whether leaders are born or made, how to lead with your heart, and most importantly how to manage change in your life with poise, and discernment. So sit back and relax and finally learn how to lead the way you want too!Great book!

A good way to start learning Spanish fast. It is reader friendly and can easily absorbed by the brain. This book is well-organized. If you are interested in Spain and wants to know their language, this book is for you. Give it a read!
An intense, powerful novel. Fast-moving. With strong characters. This book kept me guessing all the way until the end. Excellent story.

Every individual, especially mothers, have issues regarding in cleaning up their respective homes. This wonderful book gave widely usable information to obtain or to make every house worth living for. The ideas for a 7 day cleaning are easy to understand and apply. Thanks for sharing!

OMG where should I start? This was a lovely journey along the wonders of a mind that is truly amazing, a story that grips you from beginning to end. This book is by far a must read and one of my favorites. If you're into Romances, then this is the one for you!

I bought this book for my daughter. My intentions were to flip through the pages and see what it was all about. Fifteen minutes later I was still reading and enjoying the beautiful rhymes and illustrations. Great for the kids!

These recipes have been thoughtfully put together for maximum flavor both bold and subtle. The photos are great too. The book is almost too pretty to use in the kitchen, with our greased or sticky or wet hands and fingers. We enjoyed it so much we bought additional copies for our out of state children. Kudos to the author for delivering such a delicious cook book. Its worth every penny.

Reads like a homework assignment from my 11 year old son.I really dont understand how one could sell a brochure as an eBook and make somebody pay so much to read it. Books like these are giving kindle a bad name. Im lucky I wasnt one of the people to fall for this.I read this on my friends kindle, and I must say this is one of the worst if not th worst books Ive read in a very long time.I wont make this into a long review but here are just some of the things that really got to me.-Its only for people residing in the bay area and who are familiar with the area, and some of the reviews are from restaurants I know for a fact dont serve good food.-The illustrations look like something out of a 6th grade culinary class. The pictures of the restaurants on the other hand are well taken.- Badly written descriptions, to drawn out talking about  well, this goes on for pages, like the author is just filling the pages with sweet nothings, here is an example: It might even feel like a bit much, but youll find yourself smiling as theyre so jovial. This restaurant is classically Italian in aura, service, music, and-most especially- the food. Homemade pastas and dough, and the use of completely fresh ingredients make all their dishes as authentic as eating at someones home in the Tuscan hills.-Probably the most disappointing piece for me throughout the book is the drastic omission of facts. No maps just pictures of places and youll have to see for yourself how to get there.-History of the region is just copied and pasted out of a history book, again a history book form the 6th grade.Overall, this book is far from balanced in its approach. Maybe Im just angered by the fact that this was the only new book available at the time. On the other hand I feel its my obligation to give readers an honest review. If you feel like wasting your cash, then this book is for you.

I tried reading this but didnt even reach half way. Its a very long book, I expected it to have some boring moments but the thought that came into my mind while reading was: Omg when will it end. Dialogue between characters was a little drawn out. I forced myself to read on but just couldnt after page 70. I feel betrayed after reading books 1 and 2.  Maybe Ill let some time pass and try reading again.

What a way to start off a series. Sometimes you come across a book that's hard to forget one that keeps lingering in the back of your mind wondering what if. Well this is one of those books, not often am I so profoundly moved by a work of fiction. Alta Hensley has done it again I first fell in love with Ruby Rose, which is a fantastic story that I still often think about.In The Palace of Lazar is a Dystopian Erotic Adventure that is no different, it's in a class of its own: Aboslutely fanctastic. I usually don't read book one if I can't find book 2 of a series, but in this case I'm still very happy I took the chance to read it. Now I can't wait for book 2 to come out. Kudos to the author for delivering yet another captivating story.

Some reviewers say that they cannot put a book down, once they get started into it. I have not understood this compulsion until last night, for the first time I had a hard time sleeping. it had a great pace, great plot and discovery, As well as character development. I thoroughly enjoyed the story and the idea behind it. I'd say 90% believability, which is pretty good!
Once I was able to read the story it was quite oke. I'm rating this one three stars for the oke story,nice try.

What a way to start off a series, this book is in a category of its own: absolutely fantastic. If youre like me and just love a good romance story then look no further. The characters are extremely well defined the story is steady paced and the character development and dialogue are realistic. Book one is definitely worth the five stars, Cant wait to start Book two in the morning.

This story gripped me and didn't let go. The author does an amazing job of letting you step into the shoes of Job. This was one of the most spectacular works of fiction I have  read in a very long time.  It's very good at grabbing your attention, I didn't think much of it until I started reading.Now that Im finished with it, I felt I just had to let the world know, so thats why Im rating this book 5 stars its definitely a must have.
Battery was dead on arrival. What a complete rip off!!!! I will report it to Amazon and see if they continue to sell this bogus piece of  .ZERO STAR RATING!!

I always say I can rely on Amazon reviews and should have followed my own advice.  Unfortunately the regular Walkers chocolate chip cookies were in short supply this year and I have a British husband who loves (the regular type) cookies.  Crumbs arrived as though smashed by a mallet arrived in time for his birthday.  Unfortunately they also tasted like sawdust.  No flavor whatsoever!  Next year I will go to the local bakery.  No,  it won't be Walkers but it will better than this nasty mess.

When visiting my husband's family across the pond years ago Louisa always brought us this book to be read at bedtime. A friend's granddaughter was having a mild bout of shyness and I thought immediately of how Louisa loved this book.  I purchased a copy for her and she loved it.

Not since "Boss" has a show been equally riveting and cringeworthy.  My husband and I sat transfixed trying to distinguish the good and evil characters under a guise of God given instructions via a young man who while in life support appeared and communicated with his father.  A father racked with guilt and despair over his son's botched suicide attempt.  In his grief the father, who is a prominent judge, turns to a manipulative pseudo-religious minister, who happens to have been an actor on "Young and the Restless" apparently in lieu of more formal theology education. Much to the frustration of the judge's wife and long term mistress equally.  The judge's inability to discern full blown visual an auditory hallucinations and reality has a major impact on his business and personal life as you can imagine.  The storyline is well paced with unexpected twists and turns.  Never a dull moment, just when you think you solved  part of the plot it veers into a totally different direction.  Loved that it was so memorizing and unpredictable in the age of retreaded plots. The actors give believable-difficult when one of the major characters appears only as a figment of his father's distorted mind(or is it distorted?), nuanced performances that flesh out the story beautifully.  Special kudos to all even the secondary parts.  Phenomenal job all!  Traditional television should be quaking in its boots.  Netflix and now Amazon have given the viewer a better alternative especially when you consider an entire season is available at once.  We cannot wait for the second season and will peruse Amazon for further fine programming!

This is a great incentive for your young child to sit at the table!  Disney has always been a winner at this household and this product keeps the win going.  The placemats are easy to clean and large enough to hold all the plates, cups and utensils to keep your little one happy.  I agree with another review about potential mess due to them being slippery.  That cost the product a star.  Otherwise a five star product.  Worth the worry to see the delight on the the children's face!

Although this cable charger arrived just in the nick of time as the Belkin we were using died after less than six months usage.  I was happy to see this one has a one year warranty.  It has a secure connection to my IPAD, no jingling is necessary to make a charge.  The major drawback is the super short cord.  It makes utilizing my IPAD while it is charging completely impossible.

This is my second Shark after a long line of Orecks and Hoovers.  Due to having two cats and asthma (I know my pulmonary MD gives me heck about the cats too) I have to stay on top of the cat fur in my environment.  The Orecks were a step up from the Hoovers in the cat fur pick up, but even with their Hepa Filter I coughed my head off vacuuming and changing the bag.  Enter my first Shark approximately three years ago.  It was as if I entered a new orbit.  I love not having a bag to change and emptying the collection chamber was a snap.  This newest Shark has the same terrific pickup, I may say even better.  The same swivel head makes cornering a breeze.  I think the light on this model is even more brighter than my previous model.  You can easily clean under beds, low furniture and kitchen cabinets.  Dust bunnies and fur balls can no longer hide.  Getting close to baseboards are tricky no longer.  The cat fur on the furniture doesn't have a chance especially with the True Pet portion of this vacuum.  I could not believe that Shark could make a better vacuum cleaner than my original but they have successfully  reinvented the wheel.  This one is a monster!!  My carpets and wood flooring looks new.  I could wax on about this Shark all day but just give it a try!  Using is believing!!

It has been a number of years since my husband needed dress shoes for work as he is retired.  This does not mean he is a slob but golf shoes augmented by the occasional dress shoe suits the bill nicely.  That is until recently when golf but wedding shoes wouldn't do.  Rockport has a stellar reputation for quality, great fit shoes.  These shoes can be used as a casual driving shoe when we are on a long car trip, a nice evening out with friends at a good restaurant, or graduations.  The shoes are stylishly elegant and fit my husband's foot well.  Roomy enough in the toe box and no blister causing heel rubbing.  Great look and fit.  Recommend!

It has always been said you cannot really cook without a good set of sharp knives.  Look no further then this basic entry set that won't break the bank but supplies you with all the necessities.  These should last for several years as they are made by Chicago Cutlery which has a stellar reputation especially in my kitchen.  This is my third set as I have added more over the past 15 plus years and my original knives remain in decent shape.  My only "cons" to this set are they are very lightweight and I prefer knives that have a bit of heft to them.  However, the steak knives are very nice and functional.  The bright stainless steel is attractive especially in the jet black blocks and add a modern touch to my kitchen.  In fact I have them setting out on the counter to add some pzazz to my kitchen.

Don't even think about doing yard work or playing golf without this little item!  I have another TENS unit I bought a year ago and this is so much more practical and effective for sore backs.  There are two fairly large pads, the TENS unit, and the cord that easily snaps on the pads and connects into the unit, even the batteries are included.  These pads seem much more durable and can be used 150times and even washed as compared to my previous TENS unit with four small pads that have a much smaller usage time.  Also a pad storage case comes with the package.  As I said this TENS unit outperforms my first unit and I would recommend it to anyone with muscles aches! The t

This otterbox is the ultimate protection for your HTC phone!  The foam cushions your phone into the the hard shell that is the encased into the rubberized covering.  There are easy to use, flexible rubber tabs on the side that correspond to my phone.  What have I been doing without one?  Taking a lot of chances with an expensive phone!  Although I have phone replacement insurance I need never worry about using it now unless I misplace it.  Granted this much protection makes the device bulky but it still fits neatly into one of the front pockets of my purse.  If you need a belt clip it is also provided.

Shaara captures the essence of war told by four characters whose lives it impacts.  The dialogue is realistic, the storyline well paced and the book simply ends too quickly unlike the war it depicts.  Sherman's march to the sea ends this saga and I must admit although I am a historical fiction fan I am lukewarm about Shaara until this series.  For fans of historical fiction this book is a must read!

i have been trying to find a new dry cat food that was nutritionally sound and the cats would actually eat.  I think we have finally found it!  I am so pleased especially with the mixed reviews I read on this site.  My fur babies are picky and turn up their tiny Siamese noses at several well reviewed dry cat food recently.  Give this a try if you are trying to find a grain free dry cat food in the smaller bag size. If your babies don't like it then pass in onto a friend with fur children.  If you don't try it, you will never know!

My frizzy, dry, frizzy hair needs all the help it can get!  Chi has been a go-to product line.  Silk Infusion keeps the frizz away without weighing down my fine hair and giving it a nice shine.  Careful how much you use as a little goes a long way.  I put it on damp freshly washed and conditioned hair and then blow dry and style as usual.  Very, very pleased with the results especially with the hit humid months of Summer on the way.

Good potholder and double duty as a trivet.  It works wonderfully in high degree baking and top of the stove cooking without any discomfort to my hand.  Part of the Ritz All Clad Kitchen Textile collection I really like the other products esp in this pewter colour that blends well with my kitchen.  The pewter colour is classic and really hides all the potential kitchen stains.  I will be purchasing more of this collection as it becomes available.  Check out the kitchen towels I highly recommend them also.

Periodically I like to update the look of our kitchen and this towel is my inspiration.  It blends well with our gray/white/black kitchen and comes in a variety of complementing colors.  This towel washes well and the dark gray color helps hide stains.  Even better it resists bacteria.  The All Clad brand name is well known for its quality (we have a set of All Clad cookware for over 25 years and is as nice as the day it was purchased).  I will be shopping for other kitchen accessories like this one.

I had hoped this would improve my aching joints or at the very least improve the hydration of my skin.  Even though I am in main steam medicine I take other supplements and have found some to be extremely effective.  No ill effects from the supplement but no benefit either.

My husband and I have patches of red skin we have treated with multiple over the counter and prescription meds with varying degrees of success.  This lotion has decreased the patches and their accompanying itchiness and embarrassment.  So far so good.  We will continue with the Curel with fingers crossed.

i am always a bit leery of Fibre supplements as the taste can be off putting and bitter from the sugar substitute.  This was too tasty for my and my husband's own GI good.  I recommend one a day and no more.  Smooth, pleasing flavor.  We have since bought another box of the brownies and a chocolate chip bar.  The fiber will help your GI function, is highly recommended for heart and B/P and to maintain glucose levels.  Please give them a try but as in all things moderation is the key!

i am totally paranoid about cat odor from our two fur babies.  I use a high quality multi cat litter that works incredibly well.....but still there are times.  I have used electric and battery operated odor reducers without being impressed plus they were much more expensive than the Tea Tree.  The cat box is in the laundry room and there was always a vague musty smell that the cats did not make.  I placed the jar of open gel on a shelf beyond kitty reach really not expecting too much.  BINGO! I cannot believe how fresh the entire laundry room is now.  I plan on using one in my husband's bathroom and place a couple in the infrequently used basement.  Highly recommend!Update:  Since I have written the above review I have purchased two more of these products.  Placed in bathrooms I no longer notice the musky smell in my husband's bathroom.

Great light fragrance without overpowering sticky sweet.  That said I worry about the after effects on my husband and pets.  Basically water with a load of chemicals the trade off may not be worthwhile.  Although it only lasts a few hours instead of days as advertised it still is on the carpet, sofa and pillows where my family hangs out.  The price of $25/bottle makes it beyond the reach of the average household.  Love most of the Febreeze products but this one is only mediocre due to the above reasons.

Great tasting pasta!  Would never know it was whole wheat except my blood sugar reflects it!  Much lower than with the same amount of white flour pasta. As a diabetic any of the regular pasta would spike my blood sugar reading so high that eating it was not possible.  I have tried other whole wheat pasta but the taste was not worth the carbs.  This has changed my future in pasta carbs as it is do-able in allotted amounts.  Highly recommend especially for anyone limiting or watching their carb intake!

I have two similar organizers and this one added to my useable vanity space while reducing clutter.  My daily hair products such as cans of mousse and spray, glosses, and curling brush all fit easily.  Great addition to my bathroom organization!

I have used these to take out numerous oven items that are 375 degrees and not had any problems.  Remember they are Potholders and not oven mitts so even though there is a place to slip your hand into it is not practical to protect you from high temps.  My husband cooks with them too without incident.  We are so impressed that oven mitts are in our future by the same maker.

This is my third but probably not final purchase within the last six months from Safavieh Rugs via Amazon.  All three have been high quality.  No permanent creases, no odor, no shedding.  The colors of this particular rug are gorgeous with a vibrant blue with varying shades of brown design.  It is not garish nor is it washed out. It fits perfectly in the entryway in front of a credenza and a wall of pictures. Pulls everything together into a cohesive group without the colors or pattern being overbearing.  Another great buy!  You will need a skid proof mat underneath if it is on a wood floor like mine. I also purchased the mat through Amazon too and am also very pleased.  Highly recommend!

Why Does The Civil War Still Matter?  This Pulitzer Prize winning, well known historian failed to answer the question satisfactorily for me.  I found the description of the growth of Lincoln's military savvy to make this book worth the read.  However, the majority of the material that makes up this book has been previously published.  This always makes me think it is just contractual obligation and not inspired thinking.  There is one essay about the Reconstruction but it did not address the the years to date.  Why is the racial divide so prevalent in today's society so many decades after the Civil War?  Although the nation remains indivisible what have we exactly learned to keep it so? I have read and admired Mr McPherson's previous works this simply did not add to his reputation as a consummate historian.

This is an excellent hot air curling rod.  Why only four stars?  You need to have longer hair than mine(shoulder length), have thicker hair than my fine frizzy mess, and not be scared to death of burning yourself.  Also be more coordinated than myself, in fact, it may help if you are an octopus so you can wear burn proof gloves while using this, the rollers and curling iron.  I have read the glowing reviews and marvel at their skill.  Cirque du Soleil candidates all.  If you aren't the scaredy cat I am please this a try.  It just needs someone with steady hands that I just don't possess.

I am always on the lookout for any food or supplement that will improve my two cats' health.  My cats eat Greenies Hairball and Digestive Health daily with a massive decrease in the horrible regurg cough all cat owners dread.  Prior to Greenies they were crazy for Temptation treats.  They know the rattling of cat snacks and respond excitedly.  Unfortunately, that was the only thing they liked with this supplement.  Turned up their feline noses completely when served this and would eat around them when mixed with Greenies or regular food.  This would be an excellent supplement for my cats if they would just try them.  Bummed!

Great rug for high traffic area, entry or under kitchen/dining table. Reasonably priced, vibrant but not garish colors with traditional design this was what I purchased to put on my hardware floors under my kitchen table.  If it was not weighted down by the table a non-slip mat would definitely be necessary.  This is my second rug purchase from Safavieh this winter.  I am so impressed with them although totally different as other is super plush wool one.  Purchased for different specific functions and areas in my home.  Both have been clean, odor free and arrived well packed.  No shedding.  Will purchase others from same company for entry way and master bedroom in the coming year.  Having shopped online and in person for over six months I am thrilled with the quality of these Amazon purchase.  Highly recommend!

Great for mixing and drinking noontime protein shake!  I have one at work and one at home.  Cleans easily.  More importantly it helps me maintain my state of health!  If you know someone who drinks protein shakes buy it as a stocking stuffer.  They will appreciate it!  Merry Christmas!

As a diabetic 25 grams of protein really caught my attention especially after a coworker (runner who only eats healthy) recommended it to me.  I am on my third can and use it faithfully as a lunch meal replacement.  As a Registered Nurse/Diabetic I am extra careful with my daily protein and carb count.  Mixed with almond milk it blends well, tastes great and is helping me great blood glucose readings.  Highly recommend it to all!

I was impressed with the nutrition that Purina had provided in this cat food.  I slowly introduced into my two cats' diet when I give them a three ounce can of food between them while supplementing it with dry Science Diet Hairball for Mature Cats the remainder of the day.  Day Three on new Purina canned only and the vomiting  after food time.  Not hair balls but the color of the Purina food that was partly digested.  UGH!  I like idea of using a balanced, nutritionally sound food but this one won't work at this house.  Will be switching back to Science Diet canned tonight.

Great fresh fragrance!  Not overpowering or underwhelming. Gardenia is not my favorite scent so will try the lavender next time.  It didn't even bother my asthma it was so light and clean.  I put in the bathroom but will put next one in bedroom I liked it so well.  The votive burns clean thanks to the soy.  Will get one for a friend for Christmas.  Recommend for all candle lovers!

Flesh and Blood was a nice reunion with Kay as I haven't read Patricia Cornell in several years.  This book has drawn me back thanks to the quick pace, fleshed out plot and the clever Kay, Benton, Marino and Lucy.  It was nice to catch up with the characters.  I have added  the books I missed to my winter reading list.  As ever Scarpetta is well written with the ending whetting the reader's appetite for the next installment.Enjoy the read!

Amazingly creamy yet long lasting.  Loved the was my lips feel.  The brush really is different and I had to practice before I felt confident.  The 04 shade works wonderfully for my light complexion.  As a am an RN I must look professional under harsh lighting in an extremely dry environment.  This met and surpassed all my criteria.  Also as a "mature" women I didn't feel twenty years too late for the prom.  This will definitely be on my Christmas list for myself and my friends.  Highly recommend!

My handyman has one of these and while using it in my house earlier this year. I was really impressed.  I cannot believe I wanted a tool.  First of all I must admit I (nor my husband) are NOT DIYers--hence the handyman.  However, this gadget was so simple to use even we can measure anything we choose without a problem.  Much easier than a tape measure.  It recharges via a standard USP.  If it this easy and accurate for me think what it can do for the DIYer in your life

The saving grace of this book is the main character, Fiona, who can solve murders in a near telepathic way.  To describe her as quirky is a gross understatement.  I kept picking up the book to find out more about her.  The plot is convoluted and difficult to follow as it goes off in numerous tangents.  This is the second book in a series.  I won't be trying the third.

As a fan of psychological thrillers I was eager to try out this author as she was new to me.  Unfortunately this book did not offer anything I could sink my teeth into.  It was dull to the point of tedium. I must have picked it up and put it down half a dozen times.  Never a good sign.  The characters could not even qualify as one dimensional, half dimensional is more accurate.  The plot was a hodgepodge of starts and stops without any forward progress.  I was hoping that I had a new author to follow and gift friends at Christmas.  If I did that with this one I might lose some friends.

I have two "mature" feline friends that I have hunted the perfect dry and canned food for their advancing years.  As they are Siamese I know they have special renal and digestive needs.  Plus they have to like the food enough to eat it and this Science Diet canned food fills the bill.  Nutritionally sound yet yummy to their tummies they race to their bowel when they hear the can open.  Recommended by my thundering herd!

My printing needs are not high volume that will tax this little gem.  This is my first wireless multi function printer setting the bar for the future.  It was a simple enough set up for my technically challenged husband, let alone myself.  Beads of sweat in a tension filled atmosphere did not appear for the first time in our sixth printer setup history.  High quality black and color prints have been produced by it so far.  Scanning is a breeze.  As for the cost and frequency of ink cartridges I have not owned it long enough to say.  Possibly not high enough end for a true blue techie but it is good for me.

I love good reads about history, fictionalized or real.  Unfortunately this book is not one of them.  The Chinese to English translation is so wooden it leaves the book unreadable.  Sentences have no flow lending to the book's nonexistent plot.  As an avid reader I have finished some really poorly written books thinking it would be worth my time by the end.  I could not rationalize that this time.  It may be the first time I have quit reading before the last page.  Let my experience forewarn you.  Sadly, this book is not worth your time.

This tried and true formula by the author made a easy, cheery read over a gray weekend,  I have liked Becky's adventures on a scale of one to ten, this entry was a solid seven.  Becky was at her most exasperating, spendthrift self rationalizing her expenditures as " work" purchases in a non existent job as a stylist to the Hollywood stars.  Her best friend, Suze, husband and family make the trek to sunny California for an extended holiday.  I thought it creative to reinvent Suze's husband, Tarkie, into a film mogul and New Age devotee via a spa owned by Becky's nemesis from previous books.  Naturally Becky overdoes it, leaving a tangled mess with husband, Luke.  Thank God for Luke's ability to see beyond Becky's selfishness and immature behavior.  The story is left dangling with Becky's Dad joined by Tarkie off with a nefarious spa instructor to parts unknown.  Becky, Suze, Luke and others are in pursuit of the rogue Dad and Tarkie prepping us for the next Becky adventure.Enjoy the read!

Purchased the 6x9 rug last week and totally LOVE it.  Rich, warm colors true to my computer screen.  I have been shopping in person and on the net for the past six months, determined not to regret a hasty purchase.  This rug is perfect in every way.  It keeps my furniture from scooting around, protects my hardwood floor, adds pop(without being garish) and warmth to my living room, well made, and cushy under foot.  I had read so many customer reviews complaining about rugs being dirty, poorly packaged, emitting a foul odor, permanently wrinkled and not the correct size from a number of online sites and various manufacturers I was a bit worried.  No need to be this was a terrific buy!  Pair it with the recycled felt pad also bought on Amazon.  Highly recommend!

Purchased the 6x9 to go under a new wool area rug and protect my hardwood floors.  Perfectly sized to fit under the rug and makes the rug feel even more luxurious under foot.  Arrived via Amazon Prime rolled up and protected in large, seal plastic wrap.  Well done!  Will recommend this purchase to others!

1920's Egypt teaming with archeologists, adventurers, and their families.  The first hundred pages of this book were breath taking.  Descriptions so realistic  I could feel the desert sand blowing in my face.  The story is told through the eyes of a young girl recovering from Typhoid Fever and the death of her mother.  Unfortunately the remainder of the book is uninteresting, populated with one dimensional characters and falls completely apart at the end.

A hectic morning turns into a nightmare for this Social Worker mother with three young children.  A miscommunication with her husband leads to near tragedy in this excellent novel.  As an RN I kept nodding my head throughout the book while I identified with the characters and storyline.  As it have looked on with horror at children left in cars that quickly become ovens throughout this summer, this story made me realize how easily it could be me.  I found some sympathy in my heart for the too frazzled parent it could happen to. The characters are fleshed out, interesting and relatable.  The plot trips along at a good pace.  The subplots are nicely entwined making the main story even more interesting. I have read all of Heather Gudenkauf's previous books and find she is really growing as an accomplished writer, one who i put on my short list of "can't miss".  Also, I really like the way the paperback book had flaps on the front and back covers that could easily be used to mark my place, not that I put this book down for long.Enjoy the read!

As a diabetic I am always looking for a low carb treat.  Especially one that is tasty.  I found one in this South Beach snack bar.  Crunchy, chewy and sweet it is loaded with nuts with a coating of toffee that is sweet without being overly so.  I will continue to snack my way through other South Beach bars.  Enjoy!

I am thrilled this is being offered on Amazon!  I use it daily with an angled short brush to fill it my brows.  Never found anything I have liked so well.  Combine it with a good brow gel for a finished look.

This is the best hair styler!  I use it daily whether in conjunction with my hair dryer or alone on dry hair that needs a bit of a help.  Easy to use and does not tangled my hair.  Even in the midst of summer my fine, frizzy hair was shiny and full of body.  I am giving it to a couple of friends for Christmas!Enjoy the great hair!

I know my local supermarket stocks a clear brow gel for just a couple of bucks, unfortunately it made my brows look like I had applied a two dollar gel to them.  I have used this brow gel for a few days and am so impressed with it.  It tames my unruly brows without a pound of goop or flakes.  Definitely makes me feel better when I look in the mirror.UPDATE:  It has been over a year and I am on my third tube of the clear brow gel!  I have also on my second jar of eyebrow pomade.  These items are more costly than the drugstore but they are definitely worth it!  High quality and long lasting.  They are a great finishing touch to my look on a daily basis!  Yes they cover grey and make your brows fuller and more youthful!

Not thrilled with supposed thriller.  It never hooked me but I kept trundling on to the "surprise" ending.  It should have been a short story as it was bloated with uninteresting characters and a plot that never progressed. Do not bother.

Cascade is always a winner in my dishwasher but when I compare this to the Cascade Platinum pacs I really think the Platinum wins.  My glasses and dishes come out sparkling even after a Thanksgiving dinner using Platinum.  This Cascade cleans well but not as sparkling clean.

This is the best most versatile paper plate I have ever tried!  Big enough to hold an entire meal with the square design that makes it much stronger.  Small enough to hold dessert or better yet desserts. Great for slices of pizza when you don't want to dirty up your own washable dinnerware.  I have never been a paper plate design freak but these are very festive to suit a variety of occasions from birthday to summer holidays.  Speaking of summer holidays Labor Day is just around the corner.  Time to stock up!

Working in a vascular surgeon's office I educate my patients on the importance of wearing compression hose.  Whether their problem is deep vein thrombosis (DVT) or varicose veins compression hose prevents a number of serious complications.  I also practice what I preach and wear some of the big name, expensive hose daily.  This brand had been mentioned to me by a couple of patients who thought they provided the same benefits as the kind purchased in a medical supply store via prescription.  So I thought I would give these a try.  Granted they were men's compression hose and easily came up to my knee I was pleasantly surprised at their compression strength (20-30Hg) and fit.  At a faction of the cost these would be great for our male patients who do not need firmer strength or have long legs.  I will consider this brand for specific patient needs in the future,

Rebecca of Amazon clued me into this cat litter.  Even though I highly value her opinion I had doubts due to my health.  As a severe asthmatic I had found a litter that provided adequate, but not great odor control in my multi cat household, the plus for me that it was 99% dust free.  Still I would wear a mask and do poop continually.  The thing that threw me over the cliff was the tracking, tracking, tracking on my hardwood floors.  Major yuck!  I ordered this and there is truth in advertising.  This litter makes the box completely order free, has no tracking on my wood floors and does not cause an asthma flare.  Hurrah!  I use this in conjunction with Omega cat litter box and the two make the easiest way to maintain a clean smelling, wheeze proof litter system.Enjoy the clean smell in your house!  Rebecca's nose knows!

A lonely bartender regarded as odd and slow, a nice enough guy but not someone with whom a close friendship is likely to be made, a damaged woman and Chechen Mafia.  These elements are stirred by Denis Lehane into well paced novel reminiscent of  his earlier Mystic River.  As usual with Lehane's novels they are far from being conventional thrillers but have at their core characters who appear to be created specifically for the screen.Lehane never fails to intrigue, largely because his stories are usually so character driven.  I can only recommend this novel to those unaware of his talents, and am confident that his fans will not be disappointed.Enjoy the read!

My husband took over cat box duty four years ago when my asthma worsened and I was a huffing puffing blob tethered to my oxygen.  Forget about the cat box I could not walk across the kitchen floor.  I am happy to say the last year my health has had a dramatic upswing.  My husband was reluctant to let me resume the litter box duty and I  could easily see the reason.  He had been using a crystal "trackless" litter in a huge box (for our two cats), did not scoop and lined the box with a giant trash bag that he dumped weekly.  The dust from this operation was tantamount to a storm in the Sahara.  There was no way my lungs would tolerate this plus I hated the mess and expense of the crystal litter.  I knew Amazon reviewers would have the answer.  You did not let me down.  I purchased this box two weeks ago, ditched the crystals for World's Best that is 99 percent dust free and have not regretted my decision.  More importantly my asthma has not raised it's ugly head.  After reading all the reviews I incorporated some important tips that have added to the success of my experience.  1.  The clips that hold the box together are flimsy.  So I duct taped its upper and lower segments together.  You really don't need to take off the top to add clean litter.  2. Rolling the box across the floor hurt my back, but it is light weight enough even with used litter in it for me to lift up on my washer/dryer top.  3. I roll and shake the box all the way onto its top two or three times.  This loosens the clumps and other material which easily fall into the collection drawer.  If the clumps are stubborn I hit the outside of the box or use my scoop and roll it over again.  4.  When the dirty litter has been removed I spray the inside the box with some Febreeze Clean Scent.  Refill with World's best clumping litter for multi cat home.  5.  Yes, Worlds does have some tracking issues but I place an old large towel underneath the box for the cats to exit onto and by the time they leave the laundry room their feet are clean enough not to show on my hardwood floors.  6.  Then I spritz the laundry room with a bit more Febreeze.  My cats are happy and use the box without leaving me any little "presents" elsewhere.  My husband gladly relinquished his cat box duty.  Most importantly my lungs and nose are happy.  Thanks to all who review and give tips.  The outcome has made me happy.

"The City" is a shiny jewel of a read based on the oral history of a 57 year old rambling into a tape recorder about his eight year old self.  This character driven plot is rich with details making the young boy, his family, friends and experiences only the more real and interesting.  Hooked in the first few pages of this book I simply could not wait to find out more.  Mr. Koontz wove a multi-layered story that delighted this long time fan.  If you are a fan of his more paranormal fast paced thrill rides this may not be the Koontz for you.  I can only say this read shows Koontz flexing his incredibly talented writing muscle.  He is a true master of his craft.Enjoy the read!

This is a stand alone book and also a third in a series about Keye Street an ex FBI profiler who not only finds and fights the evil that strikes others but must battle her own demons.  The author weaves a tightly wound plot populated with interesting characters.  Neatly paced to keep my attention it was difficult to put down well past my bedtime.  As an avid crime thriller reader I am rarely surprised by who is the big bad guy, however, I was wrong in this book making it even a better read.  I have already recommended this to several friends.  Amanda Kyle Williams has joined the ranks of Lisa Gardnera, Lisa Unger and Gillian Flynn on my short list of never miss authors in this genre.Enjoy the read!

In this, the second book of a projected series, the relationships between the Brilliants (as the name suggests, these are people with enhanced capabilities) and the normals become evermore strained.  The main characters from the previous book are, once more, the leading figures in this story.  The plot follows the attempts of some to avoid strife between the two sections of society, and is a natural extension of the first book.  One of the more interesting elements concerns the ethical issues associated with the actions of the central character.  What on the face of it appears to be righteous action is, in retrospect, called into question.If you have read and enjoyed the earlier book, then I have no doubt you will enjoy this.  If you have not, a word of caution, it would be best to ensure that you read that one first.Enjoy the read!

I have tried numerous water devices for my furry family.  This one is the best after many years of disasters.  Water bowls tipped over that we're guaranteed not to do so, costly automatic electric ones that they loved to play in but not drink from and simple plastic ones that were pushed over in seconds.  They drink eagerly without fuss and muss.  Finally!

Not just a quick beach read this story needs to be savored on a sun porch near a lake lined by tall trees.  Ev, the haughty East Coast daughter from old money rooming with Mabel, the scholarship kid from Oregon, oil and water until Ev invites Mabel to the summer compound on Lake Champlain.  Mabel is giddy over the prospect, only to find everything is not as fine as it seems.  The storyline was impeccably written, the characters 3D, dialogue and plot line feasible, and pacing even and perfect letting it envelop the reader.  This author will be put on my short list and recommended to my reading friends.Enjoy the read!

This novel would appear to be the first of a proposed series of books developing the story begun in "Wolf".The head of an international crime syndicate finds the goals of his, and allied organizations, at odds with international terrorism.  His reaction to the effects of terrorist attacks becomes all too personal when his wife and daughter are two of the victims  of a terrorist  bombing attack on a plane.  The plot unwinds as the  Wolf and his allies search for the terrorists who planned and carried out that specific attack.  There is a great deal of action throughout the book, an almost breathless quality pervades each succeeding chapter.  Lorenzo Garcaterra can certainly write about action sequences with a sure hand and the growing complications of the plot do not confuse the reader.I look forward to what I am sure will sequels, and recommend the book to all lovers of action.  I am pretty sure if you enjoy the adventures of Jack Bauer you will find this novel engrossing!!Enjoy the read.

I have used Tide HE Clean and Gentle (that I still highly recommend) since my asthma reared it's ugly head a few years ago and a no fragrance dryer sheet.  As my wonderful husband gets the clothes out of the dryer and carries them into bedroom to be put away as I have been on lifting restrictions due to my breathing problems.  He absolutely hates the dryer sheets that seem to fly all over the house.  I was reluctant to use the Tide with Downy as even pleasant aromas can set off my asthma.  It has been three weeks with numerous loads of April Fresh (but not overpowering) laundry and not once did it set off my asthma!  Better yet no flying dryer sheets scattered all over to make my husband crazy!  I will definitely switch to this type of Tide.  Thanks!

I use the big bottle at home (Type I Diabetic) when I need my BG needs a bit of a boost.  They do not taste chalky and the orange flavor really is pleasant but I would not serve them as a party treat.  I put a tube of them in my purse and a tube in our emergency drug box at work(I am an RN).  Recommend!

No Jim Jams in reading this book.  Lisa See weaves an tight interlocking, multifaceted story about Grace, Ruby and Helen.  Each woman carries a heavy secret history.  These three make a pact that no man can break their friendship apart.  Bitten by the show biz bug they start as ponies and rise to headliner status at the Chinese Nightclub, the Forbidden City.  The thirst for stardom coupled with personal tragedy against the back drop of WWII tear the women apart.  This read has remarkable 3D characters with solid back stories, dialogue that fits like a puzzle piece,  a steady perfect pace and a plot line that made me unable to put the book down.  Lisa See has always writes fascinating, perfectly researched books.  This one is a crowning achievement!  I highly recommend it to newbies and firm fans!  A solid contender for "Best Book of 2014". A hundred star book!Enjoy the read!

My hair is fine, fried and fly away.  This brush really does cut down in drying time, is lightweight and easy to use.  I wished I had realized it was hair longer than mine(not quite shoulder length).  Since it decreased my drying time that earns it four stars.  Had it had a smaller barrel it would have earned five stars.

This is a tried and true product for me.  The granules are easily dispensed and last most of the summer.  Works great on variety of outdoor flowering plants and trees.  The container and handle are easy to use.  No more excuses get an early start on watching your garden bloom!

The heading may seem less than complimentary, but I should explain the the golf season has barely got underway here in tropical Illinois.  As a result my swing has yet to achieve that effortless fluidity to which I am accustomed in mid-Summer (other 17 handicappers will smile knowingly at that description).  What is more, the golf ball has yet to be designed and manufactured that can possibly improve my game.  Consequently, I can only say that these balls were fine (not your partners "fine", but really ok.).  Not too hard, not too soft, a perfectly serviceable ball at a good price.

Chevy Steven's debut novel, Still Missing, is one of my all time favorites.  Unfortunately, she has never been able to replicate the phenomenal plot line, lightening fast pacing and 3D characters since.  This book did not capture me in the beginning and was put down several times.  That is not a good sign with a book I really wanted to be great read.  The plot never grabbed me, the teenage scenes read like a poor quality YA book, none of the characters were like able, fleshed out or believable, the conclusion was totally out there.  This book cheated the reader.  The author needs to hone her craft with the help of a good editor prior her next publication or she will risk her reading audience.  And that would be a real waste and shame.  I really wanted to love this book and give it five stars, instead  of only two.  It is worth only one star, the other is a pity star.  Will I read her next book?  Yes, fingers crossed.  I wish her good luck in finding her original writing Muse!For a really great book by her tryStill Missing.  Then you will see what a great read by her should be!

Verdun is an iconic battle.  Lasting for 10 months, with little or no clarity of objectives, and the slaughter of tens of thousands, it almost stands as a classic example of the horrors of WW1.  Quite what the strategic goal might have been is unclear.  In an attempt to justify the slaughter, the German General Falkenhayn, retrospectively labelled the battle as a war of attrition, an attempt to bleed the French army dry.  It is clear from the records of the time that this  was a somewhat self-serving  explanation of a battle that had completely lost its point.  As the author puts it "prestige filled the void left by strategic enigma."Somehow, because the very name Verdun, symbolizes the War.  I was slightly surprised to find that I actually knew very little about it.  Perhaps because many of the popular histories of that war are written in English largely for Britons, Verdun, a wholly French and German affair has not had so much of the spotlight for Anglos.  Consequently, I found the book to be extremely informative.  Admittedly given my newly discovered ignorance, that was not a high bar.The battle itself is difficult to describe since it consisted of a whole series of attacks and counter attacks over a ten month period, with ground taken and retaken over and over.  This can lead to certain feeling of dj vu halfway through the book.  Nevertheless, given the constraints on reportage imposed by the very nature of this battle, the author does a good job.I recommend this book to all who think they know about Verdun, but have yet to discover that they really don't!Enjoy the read.

My hair has been through hell the last four years thanks to a ton of ill health and having to take ongoing  steroids and other meds.  Granted they saved my life so I cannot complain too much but left my hair and skin incredibly dry no matter what product I used.  I had given up my days of shiny healthy looking hair.  No more.  This product really helps the texture and look without weighing it down or turning it into a grease ball.  My hair is above my shoulders and I use only a dab on my wet hair working it in thoroughly.  Dry, brush and go.  I don't need to flat iron any more which only dried my hair more.  I must admit I had used some of this product line and was not favorably impressed, not so with this one.

I am a diabetic with ultra dry skin.  I also have white chicken legs during the entire summer.  Add to this beautiful combination I am cheap.  I had hoped this Jergens product would eliminate my need for the much more expensive body moisturizer.  Unfortunately it will not but I will be able to decrease my dependence by one more expensive product in the summer and use this BB cream instead.  Since this is the depth of winter in the Midwest I don't think this was the right time of year let alone my special skin needs.  Will be looking forward to using it again this summer.  Nice light  fragrance.

As a boy, too many years ago to contemplate, Masefield's poem with refrain consisting of the names of three South American volcanoes, made an indelible impression on me.  Hence, I think my interest in volcanoes, although I must emphasize, a dilettante's interest and not that of a scholar.  Overall, I found the descriptions of the volcanoes and related geology, interesting but not fascinating.  The book has the air of a handy textbook, and, to be critical, contains a great deal of repetitive information.  For those with an interest in the subject it will prove a passable read.  It is unlikely to convert others however.

This book deals not so much with the course of the Normandy invasion itself, but more with the planning , preparation, and politics leading up to it.  As such, I found the details fascinating.  The broad picture is, of course, well known to all who have taken an interest in the course of the Second World War.  However, the details dealt with by Craig Symonds, truly enhance an understanding of the course of events.  Perhaps among the most fascinating elements is the relationship between the UK and the US, essentially between Churchill and Roosevelt.  As with so much about the War the Diaries of Lord Alanbrooke have already shed a lot of light upon this and other things.  However, the recounting in Neptune contains none of the inevitable bias of those diaries.  It is interesting that the author's views of the relationships between the High Commands of the Allies and the prejudices held by both very much complement those of someone (Alan Brooke)who was himself at the centre of events.I recommend this book wholeheartedly for shedding further light on a on the logistical issues that had to be dealt with.  As usual in wartime those issues were often the keys to some of the major decisions that had to be taken.Enjoy the read!

How can I possibly add anything worthwhile about a book that has been reviewed over 1700 times?  Although loaded with scientific jargon it boils down to a planet held spellbound over the fate of a botanist/mechanical engineer left on Mars after mistakenly assumed dead during an emergency evacuation.  Even the Chinese government chipped in to help with the rescue!  The book could have been dryer than the Martian surface but it is loaded with suspense, plot twists, drama and even some comic relief thanks to the wry observations of our deserted hero.  The story was so successful because it connected us on the human level with fleshed out characters from all aspects of space travel whether the highest level of NASA to a lowly technician.  If I ever blasted off into outer space(not going to happen) I would want these people behind me and guiding my journey. The true glue that held the storyline together was the solitude human being on Mars, Mark the geeky astronaut who quickly had every reader rooting for him.Enjoy the read!

We live between barren corn and bean fields in the middle of America.  In case you have been ignoring the Weather Channel the last couple of months we have been battered and bruised by a Polar Vortex and far too many negative degree real temperatures and hateful Wind Chill.  My husband chooses to consider himself impervious to frost bite and wears his golf cap.  This Winter I bought this cap for him and he hates it.  He will pull it on only in the worse possible conditions.  Why?  Because he lives in a state of denial about this cursed weather.  Actually he will put it on when venturing into the Tundra especially when he thinks I am not watching.  When I comment on it after he comes back inside he grudgingly mutter something to the effect his ears did not fall off.  Words of praise!

I must admit I read Julia's newest work first and liked it so much I immediately ordered this.  If you are a fan of well written, perfectly paced suspense loaded with 3D characters then look no further.  She is in my short list of contemporary authors who know how to turn a phrase or highlight a nuance.  Think works by Gillian Flynn, Lisa Gardner, Lisa Unger, Tami Hoag and Chevy Stevens then add Julia to that short list who know how to make you read to the very end even if it is 4am.  Terrific read!  I will definitely recommend both of her books to my fellow reading-a-holics.Enjoy the Read!

The minute I finish this review I will be ordering her previous novel and put her in my rotation of favorite authors whose books I never miss. The storyline is good, the characters fleshed out, a brisk paceis set all combined with realistic dialogue made this book a winner for me.  Julia is well on her way to be in my fave list that includes Lisa Gardner, Lisa Unger and Chevy Stevens just to name a few.  Was the book perfect?  No, but the fact that I read until 4am and finished it off regretfully earlier today speaks volumes.  If you are planning to move to Texas you may want this as a primer.Enjoy the read!

Okay....okay.....okay I know I have concrete ideas about dental hygiene (brush 4 times a day; rinse your mouth with every brushing and floss twice preferably midday and prior bed in conjunction with the last brush/floss combo).  Perhaps a bit of OCD peaking out but I have inherited rotten teeth and have spent hundreds of hours and thousands of dollars at my dentist.  I also use a potent asthma inhaler twice daily that will give me painful mouth sores if I am not thorough with my dental hygiene.  I have used variety of brushes but was never WOWED until this one.  I have been using it daily and have the cleanest mouth!  My family will be finding it in their gift bags and I have been bragging about its cleansing ability to all my coworkers.  Problem teeth, gums, or tongue?  Grab this brush!  You won't be sorry!

This is a really good toslink cable in my opinion.  It screams quality, very good construction and sports a nice look and feel.  It's certainly of a professional grade without the high end price tag commonly associated with such things.  I use this to pipe my TV's audio to my DAC in order to prepare the digital signal for my Hi-Fi/theater audio system.  I really appreciate the braided cable, it really takes things above your typical plastic/rubber coating that you'll find on most inexpensive cables.For a test, I set it up on my true "hi-fi" system, for which I typically use a (high end) coaxial connection that "supposedly" has better audio production capabilities.  With a fairly high end audio setup, I was barely able to discern a difference from the DAC's optical input and coaxial input...and what difference might exist is probably in my head or more likely, has more to do with my DAC's inputs than anything else.  I would be totally happy using this is a fairly high grade Hi-Fi application, especially considering optical connectivity isn't something that will degrade all that much unless the cable is truly poor quality.  Admittedly, I have nothing to measure the bits across the wire, but perception is most important in audio applications anyway.Overall, high value and reasonable price...what I look for in a purchase!

I'm using this table as a computer desk, probably not the intended purpose, but it works well enough for the application.  For the price, it's difficult to find something in the six foot range that can handle a decent sized dual monitor setup, a pair of monitor speakers and all the other items you might want within arm's reach on a computer desk.  I really like the black color, it doesn't scream "temporary table" in the office and provides plenty of storage underneath for computers and such.  The working height is comfortable for this application, not too high and not too short...just about perfect.  I can kick my feet up on it without feeling like I'm doing yoga.  The surface has held up to relatively heavy use, seems like it's going to last until I'm in the mood to buy a real desk.I can confirm that the table's top isn't perfectly level on both sides of the fold.  This does cause a minor issue in my application where my two monitors don't line up absolutely level.  No big deal for me, really, eventually I might just cut a nice oak board or something to act as a level plane.  If you're looking for something with absolute flatness on both sides, though, this table might not fit the bill.I liked the unit enough that I purchased a second one for it's intended purpose...a temporary table.  We occasionally get some big cooking projects going on and find it really helpful to add additional food preparation space since our kitchen has limited counter space.  I like that we can just fold up the table and store it, taking up minimal space when it's stowed away.  For this, it's absolutely perfect...plenty of working space and places to put things when you need to.

I was apparently an idiot when I decided to purchase this item.  I thought, wow, what a good deal for a decent quality, name brand tape!  The problem isn't the tape, actually...it's a fine tape that did the job I expected it to do.  The problem is that I purchased the 54 yard rolls and was expecting the more substantial, and clearly a better value, 109 yard rolls.Overall, I can say that the Duck brand tape is really good.  On my recent move from Montana to Alaska, I had a number of boxes that failed well before the tape did.  The AlCan is a punishing road for a move, and let me tell you, this tape held up...in at least a couple cases, it was the only thing standing between a full box finding it's contents inadvertently emptied.  I really didn't need a low temperature application, as I see they make specific tape for...but we'll see how this "sub standard" version holds up to our punishing -50 degree winters for the stuff still left in outdoor storage.  If it holds up, consider me me a fan...otherwise, it's just tape.Oh, and make sure you get the bigger rolls for a moving job.  You'll go through these faster than you'd like.

I recently moved to Alaska and needed something to transport ammunition via common carrier flights, as our Canadian friends frown upon bringing these items through their country.  It was somewhat difficult to find something reviewed for this particular application and I wasn't quite sure whether this unit would fit the bill or not.  I can happily say that these utility boxes have been safely used without incident to transport 49.5lbs of ammunition from Montana to Alaska.  (50lbs is the maximum you can transport on most carriers, check your carrier's rules before committing to a flight!)  There were no issues from TSA transporting ammo in this box, I've successfully made multiple transports without a single objection.  I did remove the "Ammo Crate" sticker, which was easily done, so as to not draw unnecessary attention.These things are very well built, no major concerns about loading them up with 50lbs or more.  The handles are probably a bit underengineered to carry the rated weight comfortably by hand, but at 50lbs, it can be lifted without issue.  Most of the time during transport, you'll want something to assist - a cart, over the shoulder, a hand cart, something - the handles just don't provide much room for grip when manhandling the case about.  Important for me, I was able to secure the box with two padlocks and felt like this was adequate protection for the relatively short period the box would be in other people's hands.50lbs of ammo will easily fit inside the case, I would suspect 70-80lbs would be fine depending on the ammo stored.  I used packing paper to secure the top of the case as 50lbs will not quite fill the entire space and this adequately prevented things from moving about during the flights.  From there, these units make nice storage compartments to keep things relatively secure and organized when stored up.If you're looking for this application, I can heartily recommend them and they should suit you just fine!

I've been into Hi-Fi audio for better than 20 years.  My current main audio system consists of a 1978 pair of Klipsch Lascalas using custom ALK crossovers, a Cary Audio preamplifier, a BelCanto amplifier...connected by relatively high end balanced uplinks and RCA cables.  All of this is driven by Toslink via a media PC I built.  It's about a $11k audio setup and one that will reveal any substandard equipment.My previous high end DAC decided to give up the ghost after 7 years of use, $2 grand down the drain.  :(  These days, I just don't have the carefree budget I used to for audio gear, even though long standing "wisdom" in Hi-Fi dictates you should pair reasonably similar caliber equipment together for best results.  I really wanted to see what a "lower end" DAC replacement could do for this system as I just didn't have the budget to throw another expensive DAC at my system.  My extensive research brought me to Schiit Audio's line of DAC's, I liked that they seem to focus on connectivity and solid audio instead of trying to be just another expensive alternative.  I was torn between the more expensive Bitfrost and the Modi 2 Uber, ultimately settling on the Modi to really push the "low end" concept to its maximum potential.  Considering the Modi 2 Uber is billed as a lower cost, non-upgradable Bitfrost alternative, it seemed worth the shot.Thoughts after burn in?  Just wow.  The Modi 2 Uber literally puts my old $2 thousand dollar DAC to shame...maybe not shame, per se, but it's certainly on par.  I can't even believe that a sub $200 DAC can outpace high end audio gear, musically and with an incredible soundstage!  This DAC is musical, offering a semi analog feel without the lazy, somewhat muddy side effects of analog gear.  The soundstage makes my Lascalas sing like they can, allowing the speakers to resolve clarity and detail like few other drivers can.  I was a bit worried that the DAC might be a bit bright from my research, which can really be a problem on Lascalas...but I'm happy to report clarity without overabundance on the tweeters.  (I will admit my custom crossovers are set to -2db on the tweeters, my preference after extended listening on my old DAC.)  Bass is tight and fast, another problem substandard equipment will reveal on the Klipsch speakers...maybe a little less than my previous high end DAC, but almost better to some degrees.  The midrange, however, are the Lascalas strong point and this DAC makes the horns sing like I expect allowing vocals to come through strong without getting bogged down by anything else.  24/96 recordings really shine with this DAC, something my previous DAC really didn't reveal as much as I had hoped...this was probably my biggest point of happiness.  Compared to my "not all that old" DAC, I can hear things now that used to be lost in translation.  I don't know if it's a matter of design, or that audio-centric capacitors and such have significantly improved in the last ten years...but I would say that this DAC is overall maybe 10-20% better than my older one as far as audio quality.  For one tenth the price, that's a sure-fire win for me.Drawbacks?  The supplied power wall wort is a little on the short side...I wish it had a couple more feet of range.  I would have appreciated a slightly higher end power input, but also can't say that the supplied power supply is inadequate for the unit considering its size.  The input selector switch floats a little bit, this isn't an issue to speak of, but some people expect a solid feel on selector switches.  For me, it works and I'm betting it won't be a long term issue.  Other than that, I'd have a hard time coming up with flaws.  I'd prefer a larger footprint, but for a budget DAC designed primarily for headphone use, the smaller footprint makes sense to me and works for the application it's designed for.Overall, I'm totally happy with this DAC and am super pleased I gave Schiit Audio a shot on my system.  Big picture, this DAC will eventually be replaced by a Bitfrost and sent up to my office system...but it solved an immediate need and allowed me to hear Schiit's sonic signature without breaking the bank.  I wouldn't hesitate recommending this DAC for either a headphone setup or Hi-Fi audio scenarios, it's a solid unit for a really fair price and likely better than anything else you can get in a similar price range.  In my opinion, I've thoroughly debunked that price is a considerable factor when it comes to DAC's.  Thank you Jason Stoddard for bringing high end audio at an acceptable price!

I've been working towards getting fully automated watering systems going for our gardens this year.  We use water timers and standard garden hose for our water distribution.  I needed a few hose filters to protect the sprinkler systems as we're on a well and sometimes get a little bit of sediment that makes it through.  I was a little bit dubious as to how well these cheap hose filters would actually work, but I can now confidently state they do an excellent job.Just a couple nights ago, I noticed that one of the hose/sprinkler combos was performing extremely poorly.  I took a look at this filter and found a bunch of organic material that had gotten caught by these filters and was blocking the flow.  I would MUCH rather be able to clean out a filter than I would unclog a sprinkler system from any organic debris that happens to make it into our plumbing!  After a few moments, I was back up to full flow and very happy this cheap investment had protected the rest of the system!I definitely recommend having one or more of these installed on your hoses, especially if you're using well water and don't have a whole house water filter inline with your water supply.  A little bit of cheap insurance goes a long way!

I've tried several of the alternatives to Nikwax products and every single time I keep coming back.  Although I have probably a half dozen stories to tell about my experience, I only need to relay one fairly recent story to tell you why I trust this (and the other Nixwax products) for most of my waterproof gear.In 2014, we set out for a month long road trip to Alaska in the middle of summer, planning to tent it all the way up and back.  Unbeknownst to us, we made the trek in the wettest summer that pretty much everyone alive could possibly remember, it was wet!  For 30 days straight, it rained 27 of them.  This wasn't your average drip-a-bit then blow over type of rain.  No.  It was torrential downfall followed by a downpour followed by a steady drench thereafter.  It was an unreal bout of rain, like we were living in a rain cloud for a month.All my gear, including my tent, footprint, rain fly and gear's duffel bags were treated with this stuff or other Nikwax products.  It's never a cheap preparation, but in hindsight, it's always worth every penny.  Night after night, my aging camping gear and waterproof clothing were pounded from all sides with unrelenting rain, put away wet only to be brought out into more wet.  What little breaks in the weather we could get usually dried things out just enough to get wet again a few hours later.  We could barely get a break, except for maybe once every 8-10 days or maybe a lucky clearing during setup or teardown of camp.The point?  We stayed mostly dry.  Our clothes, our sleeping gear, our camp gear.  Dry, all of it.  Every night.  Every storm.  It kept one pretty lady awfully happy, and that's no easy feat faced with constant rain!  To be certain, some of it was probably technique as I cut my teeth camping in Oregon where you learn how to deal with rain well before you can afford technical preparations.  But from one rain master to another, the secret to maintaining technical gear for whatever gets thrown at you is Nikwax.  Bottom line, it's proven itself to be my trusted waterproofing material and probably always will be.Is it perfect?  No, it's not going to make Goretex out of nylon no matter how you slice it...but it'll be better than pure nylon, for sure.  Does it help?  Without a doubt.  When your gear is starting to see it's age, will it revive it enough to keep it going?  Yes, and my 20+ year old used and abused Cascade Designs tent that I'd take anywhere, anytime proves it.  Do you need to augment your preparations for rain otherwise?  That's probably a good idea, at a minimum a solid seam seal on all rainfly seams and liberal use of tarps, when needed.I've used this stuff for years and that's only the latest reason I keep coming back for more.

I'm a somewhat experienced home brewer, wine maker and about five years ago, added soda making to the repertoire.  The soda making has been the culmination of years of trying to eliminate high fructose corn syrup from my body completely, preferring natural sweeteners overall.  With the addition of a kegging setup to my brewery, I had a lot more options at my finger tips than my previous "add yeast and drink before it blows up the bottle" methods used to provide.  Specifically, I wanted to start looking into syrups that I could add to carbonated water, similar to a "SodaStream" but at a "pro" level, if you will.I had read a couple recommendations about this book providing syrup recipes, so eventually decided to pick it up.  I was surprised that it didn't only provide syrup recipes, but alternative methods as well such as the traditional yeast/brewing methods for most of the recipes.  This was really nice as it gives you a bit of flexibility in how you want to approach making the soda, particularly making things accessible if you don't have a CO2 setup.This book doesn't disappoint with quantity or variety of the contain recipes...from modern to old, classic to bleeding edge, you're sure to find something you'd enjoy.  I was surprised, compared to other soda books I own, with regard to the diversity of the recipes.  Just a whole lot of options, some of which I would have never thought of and probably make a fine tasting fizzy drink!  It's always a joy to crack open the book when we're planning out a new soda and so far, haven't duplicated a single recipe.  (Not because they're not good...but because there's so much to try!)To be entirely honest, I don't feel I'd be a good judge of the quality of this publication in actually teaching a person how to make home made soda.  Reason being, I'm well versed in transferring liquids, steeping materials and pretty much all the techniques used to bring a batch from material to quality drink.  I skipped over those sections almost entirely, but did note there was some good info on sweeteners and other basic topics.  It might be OK?  I don't honestly know.I can probably say that of the three books I have on the subject, this one is my favorite.  Certainly other books offer some recipes that I wouldn't want to go without, so I appreciate them all, but this one is the most accessible, current and fully featured of them all.  If you're looking to dive into the deep end with home made soda, I wouldn't hesitate recommending this book!  Cheers!

I purchased this refill kit for the two-pack DampRid containers, also purchased here on Amazon.  I was originally anticipating needing to change out the material every couple months or so, but I'm thrilled to report that I haven't even had to change it once after 6 months.  So, while I haven't technically had to use the bag I purchased as of yet, the original material outperformed my expectations by a long shot.I use the stuff to maintain the moisture levels in a freezer based fermentation chamber.  Prior to it's introduction, I was constantly battling moisture buildup, mold problems and other issues that were directly related to high humidity.  Afterwards, zero problems.  Better yet, I've gotten at least six month's use from the original container, so even on a maintenance schedule and near daily use, one of these bags will easily last me well over a year or more.For the general cost of this stuff, it hardly even makes sense to try and research a DIY alternative...probably wouldn't save you much at all.  I like that...it's not an overpriced chemical that can be bought in bulk for pennies on the dollar, just because you don't know what it is.  (It's calcium chloride, by the way.)  Sure, it costs a bit more than the bulk stuff...but you get a free, identifiable bag and can be relatively sure it hasn't been exposed to the air.It's good stuff.  Their little containers are a pretty good value too.  If you're looking for a way to keep moisture in check, this (or the bulk alternative) will work out just fine for you.  5 stars!

After fighting humidity, constant wipe-downs and significant cleaning efforts in the freezer based beer and wine fermentation chamber, I finally decided to look into something that would help control moisture over the long term.  I looked into the electric units but wasn't quite comfortable with their long term reliability and considered this consumable option for a trial run.  Well, I'm into 6 months on my first unit with about 6 10-gallon batches run through the chamber and it's still running well on the original crystals.  The chamber stays dry, whether I'm lagering at just above freezing temps, doing an ale around 62 degrees or even saisons at higher temps.I was most worried that I'd have to constantly be changing out the DampRid material, but so far, that hasn't been a concern.  Even if I went through a 42oz bag twice a year, that would work...but looks like I'm doing much better than that.  At six months, no moisture to report and the stuff looks good, no pooling water or anything.  May just replace once a year or so on a maintenance cycle, certainly economical enough and works out to pennies a day.I did have to reduce my air circulation on the internal fan a fair bit when adding this as it was causing my bubblers to dry up within a day, something that would quickly expose the beer and wine to air.  (At least I know it's working!)  Once I dropped air circulation down to a trickle, I can easily maintain a batch's bubbler for the 2-3 weeks it'll typically stay in the fermentation chamber.  Other than bit of tweaking, they pretty much just sit there and suck the water vapors right out of the air.I don't know how well they'd work in a really humid environment, but these units have saved me a lot of cleaning time and other efforts related to brewing beer...so for that, it gets a win sticker!

We decided to do our garden starts indoors under artificial light this year to try and get a good jump start on our northern climate.  In years past, we've had to get the timing down just right and after a couple close calls with late winters, it just made sense to bring things into where they can be better controlled.  Amazon, of course, made it easy to get in everything we needed for the right price, too!No indoor system is complete without appropriate ventilation and I was quite relieved to see the old days of squirrel cage fans were largely over.  This inline fan absolutely hit the right price point for me, allowing me to vent the generated heat with ease.  Although we're running a Sun Blade 6 lamp 4' fixture, the heat generated is still someone significant, raising temps to above 90 degrees in no time with no ventilation.  Hooked this up to an STC-1000 temperature controller (cheap temp control, if you're willing to wire it) and was able to evacuate the heat and maintain a specific temperature with just a small bit of work.
