Each character weavers their way through danger in the hunt for the truth on many topics. The author has done an outstanding job keeping the reader interested as she sets the plot for many books to come. She gives you little hints just do not think you will work out the complex story she will keep you guessing to the outcome. So many lives has been torn apart just as they find away to deal with the past it comes back to smack them in the face. Not only are they dealing with the lost of funds but a returning mother from the grave that has so much mystery has to where she has been and how she got back. Jaces sister seems to have her own mystery going on as someone is watching her. Bos stepmother is a mystery to it makes you wonder if she had something to do with any of this. No one can pull you into a story like Ms. Daniels can giving you answers but leaving you with more questions.This could be a standalone read but I doubt you could stand not knowing what is going on with Sarah. The why and how of her disappearance and her return from the dead, why would a woman fake her death when she has six wonderful little girls with the twins only being a few months old.  As this series unfolds I am sure we will find the answers to this question along with many more. This is a wonderful romantic suspenseful read with a wonderful ending that leaves you wanting more. So many questions answered as she leaves you with many more to be asked. I for one cant wait for the next installment in this wonderful series.Review copy provided by NetGalley/book tour/author/publisher

This is the first book in this series the author had me hook from the first page which intrigued me with a new twist to the Paranormal. It is bad enough losing both of your parents on the say day at the tender age of 6 but to lose them to a fire only to find out many years later that one might have killed the other to keep you safe is mind blowing. To be sent to another country in your middle teens to go to school far away from the only home and family you known to a place that looks like it should have been from another century is just to much for any teenager. Than to find out you will come into some kind of powers that scares the crap out of everyone that you come in contact with is just mind blowing. It does seem there are to many strakes against Rae everywhere she turns someone wants her gone. It does seem the family tree holds lots of secrets as Rae works her way through untangling them. I was expecting this to be more of a romance which it isnt, the author gives you a touch of it with more to come as the series takes off into other books. This is more about Rae finding her way as she finds out who her parents are and what might have happen to them. Not knowing who to trust with what is mind blowing. If she puts her trust in the wrong person not only will she but the rest of the world could be in for a lot of trouble. This is a story of so much more than powers, teens, hate, family it is a powerful read of finding out who you are and what you will become and how to use it for the best or worse.I really liked Rae she is finding her way through some tough times. Being a teenager is hard enough to overcome the normal every day to day issues but to know there is a whole another world out there that you are part of and no one really wants you around because of your parents is the worse feeling. Heck just finding out she isnt a normal teen is blowing her mind. She has to deal with issues most teens would not even dream of and lord help her if she make a wrong turn they are watching.watching very closely... I could relate to her being an outcast not knowing where she fit in my heart really went out to her in so many ways. Than to find they do not believe in two people with powers having a relationship is really hard when you fall for the boy who is the one helping you find your way. She is pulled in so many different ways with little or no answers to the how or why of it all. To find her father was a very evil man and everyone thinks she will take after him is wrong. They just do not see her as her own person but a product of her father. Will the sins of the father be the sins of the daughter? Not if she can help it.  She feels lost just waiting for the next shoe to drop. For me this was a powerful listen so many different ways this story could have gone. Life is just so hard for Rae who will always be her mother Rae of Hope.This is the first time I have had the pleasure of listening to Sarah Ann Masse as a narrator she is outstanding as she pulls you in and you become one with this story. I could not tell when she stopped and started the audio it sounds like she did it all at one setting which I know she could not have done. Her voices are lovely and smooth as she takes you to another place and time. She gives wonderful voices to all the characters you have no trouble knowing who is speaking whether that be male or female. I feel I got more out of this story listening to her than I would have reading it. There are no background noise and I saw no different from one listening device to another. I thought she gave wonderful life to each character as she pulls you in and you get lost in the story. I thought she did an outstanding job and cannot wait to listen to more audios by her.This is the first book I have read/listen to by Ms. May she has a very vivid imagination that comes out in her story where she gives it a different kind of twist. Her characters are very easy to relate to and very believable with normal day to day issues that she puts a twist on to. I could almost believe this was a true story, she really has a knack with pulling you in and giving you a pleasurable read. She gives you twist and turns that you will not see coming as she spins a wonderful story of the pains of growing up feeling lost and alone. Each character is wonderful as they each find out their new power and working on what they mean and how they work. The author gives you humor that will keep you laughing at times she leaves you with your heart in your throat as you race to see what the outcome will be. This could be a standalone but I feel sure you will want to see what the author has in store for these great characters I know I do. I do have to say the author kept me laughing over and over again with Rae sassy attitude that I came to love.You can pick this audio up as a box-set that has other book of different series in it or one with just this audio in it. Me I love the box-sets where you get a taste of all the author has to give you. The next in this set is Seventh Mark Part 1 - The Hidden Secrets Saga it sounds to be as interesting as this one is. I am really not into teen books but I do have to say I loved this one and am really looking forward to reading or listening to other books my this author. I recommend you pick up at least this audio/book if not the box-set I am sure you will enjoy Ms. Mays writing style as much as I have.

I have to say this was a very intriguing story that at times I got lost in. You have children all found unclothes on the same day at the same time that just appeared out of nowhere. Some in locked cars others in top secure places no one knows where they came from or how they got there. The absorb knowledge like a sponge. None saying a word until they hear the first words spoken, after a few words they can speak the language they have never heard. Years later they are grown this is where the story starts with some very intense action of the military trying to find one of The Found who has been kidnapped. When they find her there is nothing pretty about this scene and what these people do to this woman. Sam who is in charge of this military mission is also one of The Found with special gifts that make him the best at his job. Each child of The Found has special abilities that have grown overtime as they excel in their chosen jobs to better the world. They are adults but still do not know all they can do as the work through what coming together as a team means why finding more of their group before those that hunt them can find them, kill them or use them to whatever cause their sick minds wants.Kelly is a delightful character who just feels out of place she feels she has no abilities like the others. She has no idea why they are hunting her or what they want with her. She is a very strong willed person at times very stubborn as Noah will find out. She is on the run for her life with Noah trying to find others that were found that day with no memories before the day they were found. She is a very caring and giving lady who has helped many students become better students bring out their best as she brings children and their families together to better understand what the child needs to grow to become the best they can. As she grows and learns more of what she can do with the help of the other founded children. Once she is rescued she has a hard time and feels she is a danger to those around her. She has some touch and goes as she works through her issues to find maybe things arent as they seem. In walks Noah and her whole world changes from what she knows, they have a past she thought she made up in her mind. What she finds is a passion like no other, the love of her life that has always been there even before she became one of The Found.Noah is a very bright man who has risen in ranks very fast in the military. He has an ability to know danger, feel things and find things as he has saved his units behind more than once. Now he is on the hunt to find Kelly as he feels her pain as if it is his. Knowing they do not have much time she wont last much longer he rushes to her secure. Noah is a very strong character in many ways, he is very alpha and takes control as he leads his team to their common goal to find The Found before others find them. I really liked this character he puts others first as he gives orders and works through their past bring them together and protecting them. His only goal is to protect, help and love Kelly as they bring memories of the life together from before knowing they were made for each other from a time long ago.The author gives you a very intense read as Sam pulls Kelly out trying to bring her back to him. Her last words are Noah as Sam finds they have a past before they had a future. There are a lot of wonderful character each finding their way to out run the evil that is hunting them. Bring together a team who are learning their abilities but find that together they are more than if they are apart. The author gives you some hot passionate scenes as she builds a plot of books yet to come. It will be interesting to see how this group grows as they find out what they can together to make this world a better place. They have much to learn as they work through their past and remember a life from before. There are some grammatical and editing errors nothing that really bothered me. Lord knows I need an editor for my reviews I am the last one to judge on this issue.  At times the author lost me but always brought me back with a very interesting plot with characters I could relate to. The ending will shock you as you say WOW REALLY that is why you did this, I would have to say the ending was so simple but with such an impact that it shocks you. I really love this ending. I am looking forward to seeing how this series unfolds as each learn more about themselves and other of The Found group.Review copy provided by NetGalley/book tour/author/publisher

Fun costume accessory.  Feels fairly durable, and the little pockets are functional.  My only complaint is that this is adult sized.  Way too big for my elementary aged child to wear with the batman costume.
Bought this to use in various body care recipes and cooking.  Makes a great sensitive skin deodorant when mixed with coconut oil or glycerin.  Thickens pies and sauces quickly and easily.

This is a great formulation for someone with normal skin.  It goes on nicely, blends well, and sets quickly.  My favorite thing about it is that you don't feel like you are wearing makeup.  No irritation or itching.  I would call this sheer to medium coverage.This color was lighter than I expected, and won't really work for me, unfortunately.  I haven't bought Covergirl recently, so I wonder if the colors have changed somewhat?

Love this stuff!  Much better tasting and more calories than the more readily available nonfat dry milk.  Great for adding to backpacking recipes, emergency food storage, or for adding calories in the diet of an elderly or ill person.  Mix up backpacker's pudding, scout recipes, cocoa mix, whatever you like.I've split up this giant can and have portions stored in the freezer to help it last longer.

I really wanted to like this.  Really really.  A read through of the ingredients list means I won't be using it.  Artificial coloring and sucralose are two automatic NO ingredients for me, and I definitely wouldn't want to give it to my children when they are ill.The package I received was boxes of the individual tubes of powder, meant to mix into a water bottle.  THAT is genius.  Easier to store, easier to use, easier to mix up a smaller amount at a time.  Rumor says this is the drink of choice to help with a hangover, and this packaging would be excellent for that.I would love to see a more natural formulation.  We don't need artificial coloring, and something like stevia would work better for a sweetener than sucralose.  Or coconut sugar? Or better yet, crystallized honey.  Abbott Laboratories, you can do better.  We won't be drinking or using this.

Be careful buying sized items on the Internet, especially something like this.Our (small for a) border collie doesn't come close to fitting in this. Your mileage will vary, but who's to say which way, or by how much.

This is a comfortable, good-sounding set of headphones, with a removeable, standard cord.  The Removeable boom mic is easy to adjust and sounds great to my friends.The inclusion of a mic adds all sorts of complexity which is addressed by the collection of cords that comes with this set. You've got a PC connector for devices that have separate mic input and sound output connectors, a mic boost and in-line volume control, another cord for devices that use a single TRRS connector (like a iPhone) to handle the mic and sound circuits, and an audio-only cord with a single-button remote.  The mic comes off easily so that you can use these headphones for anything.  These are comfortable enough, and sound good enough that you'll want to.Weaknesses:- They are a little heavy, but (for my head at least) they are comfortable and well-padded enough to be comfortable for several hours.- I would have appreciated a 3-button (iOS) remote cable.- A bag or something to keep all of these cords together is really a requirement.

I didn't pay for this case. The company who makes it sent it to me in exchange for a fair review.This is actually pretty good for the money. I like the super-loud yellow & black color combination, it's easy to reach the ports and mute button (the others are molded-in, and work fine).  There is good shock absorption potential and there is a 3-4mm lip that stands proud above the screen.The stand seems fragile, but it comes out when you want, and stays out when you don't.In addition, the box it comes in has some fairly comical translations which gave me a giggle.I was pleasantly suprised by this case.  I'd have given it 5 stars, but it doesn't stand head and shoulders above the crowd of other inexpensive, perfectly decent cases available in the market today.

I have a lot of headphones, and review a few dozen per year here, most of which (like these) I get for free.These are super-discount feeling and sounding headphones. There's no way that you should pay more than $10 for these including tax.
These are relatively heavy weight wicks that burn well in soy wax.  I've only tested soy wax in a standard size small canning jar, but its perfect for that.

Handy little frother.  This is lightweight, easy to store, easy to clean.  Runs on 2 AA batteries (not included).  I was skeptical, but happy to be wrong.  This milk frother does a great job frothing milk for lattes, but it also is perfect for quickly frothing and mixing cocoa in mugs for the kids, chocolate milk mix, and even a quick mix on protein drinks.I haven't had to replace the batteries yet, and am pleased with how long they last.Its super easy to clean.  Just whiz it under running water and you are good to go.  Not the battery portion, just the stem end!Received this free in exchange for an honest review.

I installed this memory on a Windows 10 desktop machine.  The RAM installed easily, was recognized, and passed Microsoft's memory diagnostic tool with zero errors.Once installed, check that all of the RAM is listed as being installed, and then run mdsched.exe, to make sure that you have no errors.On Win 10, to check quantity of installed RAM, right click the Windows button, and then left click "system."  The amount of installed RAM will be displayed in the middle of the page. To run memory diagnostics, left click the Windows button, type in mdsched.exe (it's a dead-simple Microsoft utility that comes with Windows), and run it. You'll get a dialog asking you if you want to restart and run the test now or later. If all goes well, you'll get ZERO errors. If you get ANY errors, send it back.

I have close to a hundred pairs of headphones, and I review a few dozen per year on Amazon. Most of those (like these) I get for free.These are kind of odd, because the manufacturer has piled in a ton of features for not much money. Nothing is free, however, and trade offs were made.  I'll try to point those out and you can decide whether these are right for you.  My bottom line opinion is that some of the bells & whistles were promoted in favor of the basics, and these aren't for me.The bells & whistles (lights & vibrations) all work as advertised, and are switchable, along with the mic.This is the first USB-only set of cans I've used. They connected immediately to my Win 7,8, and 10 PC's with no interaction required from me. They also connected to my Mac, but I had to go to settings and select these for playback (that's normal).  The bottom line is that the USB cable works great. It's thick and heavy, but not enough to worry about, and may help durability.The mic is a different story. The sensitivity of the mic is off.  It's not unusable, just not nearly as good as my Plantronics set, which costs 3X what this set does. Maybe I'd get used to it for 1/3 of the price.  One nice thing is that it folds completely away when not in use, and won't snag on things in your bag.So on to the downsides. These are wicked inexpensive, so some things had to hit the curb, and in this case, they're biggies.Cut#1: Sound quality - These sound dead and boomy compared to my favorite Plantronics gaming headset, and absolutely awful compared to my favorite Sony headphones for music (but at 1/3 of the price of either of those).  If you only listen to these and nothing else, you could "get used" to them, but I wouldn't want to.Cut#2: Comfort & noise isolation - These have a nice, infinitely adjustable, comfortable headband, but there isn't enough tension to seal these to my average-width head, and the ear cups don't swivel at all, so you're going to have air gaps and pressure points around the pads, which negatively affect comfort, sound quality, and noise isolation.

My son really likes this. I can't really speak to it except to say that he's seven, and has gotten (so far) about 10 great hours with it over athe last few weeks. If your kid likes video games and Legos, you can't go wrong.
This is:Cheaply madeMade in ChinaPoorly fittingIt's going back tomorrow.

A few tips:1.  These stink the first time you run a tankful through these, but after that, much less, or no odor.2.  A full tank will run you about 10 hours, and a partial fill is hard to figure. Put the warmer in a ziplock bag when you want to shut it off.3.  The bag is important. It regulates airflow to the catalyst.5.  Catalysts last a year for me, but sometimes they conk out at what seems like random times. You can buy them separately. If you're going to count on these for a while away from a store, you should have a couple of spares.6.  The plastic filler is a pain, but it's helpful if you care how much fluid gets into the warmer. If you use a ziplock to shut it off, just soak the cotton straight from a squeeze bottle.7.  The first time you fill one of these, you'll make A MESS.  Do it outside.8.  A red Coleman funnel from the camping aisle anywhere has a nice little integrated filter. It's handy for refilling your lighter fluid bottle with naphtha/Coleman fuel/zippo lighter fluid (all the same stuff).

These are lightweight, perfectly molded, and easy to adjust to a reasonable range of head-sizes. The field of view is outstanding.I really appreciate the minimal and mostly reuse able  packaging.  These come in a plastic case that is fitted to a piece of cardboard.  Once you pull off the cardboard and trim away the hang tab from the goggle case, you've got a decent place to store your goggles to that the seal doesn't get mashed in your bag. A really nice, well thought out design.The design favors a low profile, light design over durability, so if you use the case to prevent seal distortion between swims, you should expect to get a season or two of use out of these.Another reviewer mentioned some adjustment difficulty, but these are really easy in my opinion. Pull the strap to tighten, and pull the temple tabs to loosen. The strap adjustments are as fine as anyone should ever need.I think that these are a reasonable to good value at $30, and certainly a better price than you're likely to find at a mom & pop swim shop.

This is a nice, soft throw with the advantage of electric heat and a slit to allow easier use as a cape when seated.There's nothing wrong with the blanket. It gets three stars vs. five purely on value. You are likely to pay 1/3 to 1/2 of the list price for a similar item at any big box store.

I give this 2-3 stars, my son gives it 5.One bright point is the packaging. You do not have to open the box to get the toy out. A pair of side-cutting pliers (dikes) to cut the two nylon zip-ties at the body and tail are all that's required to get the dino loose.  Don't forget the tail tip.  It's blister packed at he head end of the package.I was suprised to see that this toy doesn't run on the ground or even across the ground while you hold it's tail.  It's difficult to get the Dino to stand up (but it can be done).  Also, I'm concerned that the gear-train will be short-lived, as it strips, pops, and crunches routinely during play.My son, on the other hand, loves it. He just doesn't care that the advert is deceptive. He loves the roar, voices, and running motion, and really wants to go see the movie (opening night is coming up).The bottom line is that toys are for kids, not for me, and my youngest son absolutely loves it.

I have more than a hundred headphones, and review a few dozen per year on Amazon, most of which, like these, are sent to me at no cost (free).These are not "music" headphones. These are for video gaming, and for $20, they excel at their job.I wore these For 7 hours on Saturday with just a break for lunch, and these over-ear phones are as comfortable as anything I've worn within $50 of this price-point. The pads are big enough to fit over even unfortunately-large ears, and there is enough swivel to accomodate any head shape short of a grey alien. The strap pad is just as nice as the ear cup padding. I was really amazed at the comfort. Good job.The mic isn't as adjustable as I'd like. It swivels down like a jack-knife, so you can't put it right in front of your mouth. Fortunately, that's unnecessary. this mic is perfectly adequate for in-game coms and Skype.  As long as you don't sing or pod-cast into it, you'll be OK.Just in case you're tempted to use these for music... Just don't. These are simply not voiced for that use. They roll off very noticeably from low to high. The bass is HUGE, and the highs are kind-of missing.  These are for games or explosion-rich movies only.

Lightweight and powerful, this is a much nicer dryer than a cheapie from the big box store.  I have thick curly hair, so I only use the diffuser.  It goes on and off smoothly and stays secure while you use the dryer.  The long cord is a very nice feature, and the velcro strap attached makes it easy to wind it up neatly to stow the dryer.  So far, I am very pleased with it.  Haven't had it long enough yet to talk about durability, but it feels solid.  The only thing I can see to nitpick about is the buttons.  They are small and out of the way on the back of the handle(good thing!) but would probably be difficult to push with long nails.  Not an issue for me, but it could be frustrating.  The press and hold feature to turn it on and off will also help prevent accidental button pushing.

This will frustrate you (because of the impossible, far worse than average sticker sheet).This will frustrate your kid, because one of the wings keeps falling off, and the whole thing collapses in on itself if you touch it.My son and I had a long discussion about the ethics of building a total crap product and then shipping it anyway.

I found this sitting on a shelf in my son's room today as we were doing some fall cleaning. This was a disappointing Christmas present from last year. It's a pain to pair, the battery life is terrible (2-3 hours) and it sounds bad.

These have a few good things going for them.1.  Attractive design2.  Well made, non-sticky flat cord with a narrow 90 degree end that will clear most any phone case3.  Single button remote for Android fans4.  Nice priceOn the other hand, these fall flat in enough areas that I can't suggest buying them1.  These are uncomfortable to wear  A.  High spring-rate band puts the squeeze on  B.  On ear design puts pressure on the ears  C.  These only swivel flat, not to fit your head  D.  The crown pad is uncomfortable plastic2.  They sound bad  A.  Poor seal hurts bass  B.  Midrange is muddy, or fuzzy.3.  The band is all-plastic, and doesn't look like it will live very long4.  These are too bulky to use as portable, travel headphones, and there is no bag included to keep them in line.5.  No budget for a three-button iOS remote.These were clearly "made to a price" far lower than the $20 they are listed for. I imagine that you will see these in the $5-10 bin shortly, and then they'll disappear forever.

The good:  this smells fantastic, a little goes a long way, it adds shine.The bad: the bottle is too full to use the pump; I wasn't paying attention when I popped the top off and stuck the pump in... and it glopped out all over the counter.  Its thick and slippery, and hard to clean up.  Its a little tricky to tell when is the right time and how much to use.  That is just operator error, I think.  This isn't nearly as frizz reducing as I had hoped, or maybe my hair just didn't like it much on these very wet humid days.  I will definitely try again in more "normal" weather and update the review.  So far, its ok, but not amazing.  I'll stick with my Potion 9.

I've been buying Brainwavz for a while because they sound GREAT and they typically don't cost much.  Perhaps because of this, their marketing department occasionally sends me a free pair (like these) when they come out with a new product.These are different than what I've seen from this company so far. They still sound GREAT but now they cost at least twice what a great-sounding cheap pair might, but these certainly don't look or feel like cheap headphones and match up with others that I have that go for $80 - $110.I get the sense that Brainwavz is feeling a little timid about this higher pricing idea, because they've thrown in everything but the kitchen sink:-Shirt clip-Double-zippered case-Some kind of next-gen Velcro to bundle them up (This new Velcro is pretty neat. You can't feel the hooks, and the loops are polar fleecy)-Comply foam tips (coated open-cell type)-Really nice quality single, double, AND triple-flange silicone tips.The headphones themselves are really well made (as good or better than you'd expect at this price). The buds themselves have a well polished aluminum body, the printing is very well executed, and there is good strain relief for the flat cords. The 3-button remote isn't up to Apple standards, but nobody else's is either.  I've taken apart several Apple remotes, and they are astounding.If you have trouble with anything, it may be the plastic TRS jack (headphone plug) housing. It's kind of a fatty and may interfere with some phone cases. Mine isn't affected, but yours might be.

I've purchased several pairs of Brainwavz in-ear phones over the past few years.  They initially got my attention because the Wirecutter (a website) recommended some of their ear buds as a great value.  Since then, the company's marketing arm has occasionally sent me new products (for free) to try out and review (like these). So far, I've been impressed by two things in all cases:1.  The build quality for money is very, very good.2.  The sound quality for money is possibly even better.These particular headphones really are sized for kids.  The package is easy to open, and they are easy to pair. iOS devices don't require an access code, but if your device does, it's 0000.The Bluetooth sound pressure limitation to 85 decibels is a welcome feature, and it seems to work (these don't get loud with a Bluetooth connection).The design and materials appeal to me. They are well padded and use quality materials.There is one design choice that may bother some:One of the end caps says "Kidwavz" in large type.  If the recipient is at the stage where they no longer like to be associated with the word "kid" then this may be a problem.Any kid would like these. They sound great, last 6-8 hours on a charge (and can be used as wired headphones if the battery dies).

Whole nuts and dried cranberries in a mold with very nice quality, smooth milk chocolate poured over the top.This was a big hit at our house. Pricing wasn't available at the time of review, so I can't comment on value, but this is every bit as good as the stuff our neighborhood chocolatier makes, and is maybe a little bit better.  if you like milk chocolate, there's no doubt that you'll really like this.The quality of the packaging is very good, and is certainly up to gift giving standards.

I already have one of these 10' Monoprice 30 pin cords for an old iPad, and was thrilled to receive this 10" Lightening cord. It seriously made my week.It charges and syncs just fine, although the plastic part of the Lightening end is beefier than the Apple part which may cause problems with some close clearance cases (but not mine).The cord itself is a heavier than the apple part, which I don't mind since it may have helped my old 30 pin cord last as long as it has.  If I get similar service life from this new one, I'll be happy.

Considering the packaging, which is well-done, this is a good value at $25.These are very nice-looking chocolates with good descriptions and there is a taste for everyone.My wife found the chocolates to be a little sweeter than she would have liked, but the boys and I really liked them all.

This is another great mouse from Logitech.I've been looking to go Bluetooth for a while now to free-up a USB port, but the mice that I've tried so far have either miserable battery life or disconnect too frequently.  This new one from Logitech is different. It stays connected and just works like you'd expect.This is a two button scroller with scroll wheel tilt switches (rock the wheel right or left) and a bonus button behind the wheel.All of the buttons are programmable using Logitech software and can be set to a myriad of functions including a family of mouse gestures like pan, zoom, multi-media control, app switching, and several others.This mouse is just the ticket for me. It's low-profile, works great, and has all of the buttons that I want without the USB dongle that I don't.

I got a free pair of these to try from the folks who make these.We normally wear welding gloves for tasks that call for more dexterity than mitts, or when working outside with the Dutch oven at home or camping. These are quite a bit lighter and packable than welding gloves with the added benefit of being washable.These insulate against heat and grip well. The size is a little loose on my wife's size 6.5 hands and are right at the ends of my fingers (I wear a size 7&1/2).

The folks who make these offered to send a free pair to try out and review, probably because I listen to A LOT of headphones. Compared to the best, comparatively priced in-ear headphones that I have, the midrange on these is a LITTLE bit weak, but these also have flat cords, a mic, and a remote. Getting all three of these things right at this price point is rare.  I'm happy with these.

This is a handy set-up that handily beats the pants off of the internal phone mic, and it's super easy and quick to get plugged in and ready.The kit comes with an XLR mic with hi/low gain switch, and a cable that connects XLR to minijack and allows for monitoring with earbuds or headphones.This set-up is a winner.

I got this at a heavy discount from the manufacturer, and passed it off to a vineyard-owning neighbor to try out. He really liked the packaging, fit and finish at this price point and is thinking of carrying it in his gift shop. As far as function, he prefers wall, bench, or cabinet-mounted openers in his resturaunt but says that this is a good option for the home because it is compact, easy to use, and requires little hand strength.

The folks that make this sent me a discounted one to try.I'm fortunate enough to live in wine country and my neighbor has a vineyard that pours lots of bottles in the attached restaurant.  The feedback that I got was that this is a fairly ordinary foil cutter, nice-looking, and a good price for the look, packaging, and performance. I believe that they plan to carry these in their store.

The company that makes this offered to send me one for free to test. I agreed because it looks like my Logitech M705 (my favorite mouse).It's not an M705 (it couldn't be at this price) but it is similar, much less expensive, and has Bluetooth which eliminates the USB plug on my thin and light, but USB-poor ultrabooks.This mouse is pretty basic. It's a 3-button scroller with fwd & back thumb buttons.  It tracks well, and is a nice shape if you like the M705 that it copies. The thing is the Bluetooth, and what you lose in trade for a free USB port:1.  Pairing is easy and doesn't require a code.2.  Power management is an irritant. If you don't use your mouse for a minute, you have to push a button to wake it up, and then do whatever it was you wanted to do. That's a deal-breaker for me. I'd be happier with an even shorter battery life and a longer idle period.2.  I wish this had a lithium battery and a micro USB charger like every single other Bluetooth device, but nope. This one uses lots and lots of AA dry cells (but only one at a time).3.  If you don't turn it OFF with the hardware switch, you'll be in dead-battery-ville.  I don't know how long the batteries are supposed to last in standby, but a fresh Costco AA lasted for one session of relatively frustrating use and just a few days of sitting with the switch on.

I somehow lost the short part of my RockSmith cable. I was afraid I'd need to spring for a new cord until a little Googling turned up this part.  If you're here for the same reason, this is it, and it works great.

This keyboard was described as a mechanical keyboard with Cherry MC switches. Absolutely Nope.I bought one of these with a $10 discount, and it's a great $20 keyboard. What it IS'NT is a super deeply discounted keyboard with Cherry MX switches.The product description has been recently changed to "mechanical feel" keyboard. Wrong again. This is a dome-switch membrane keyboard, and it feels like one.It's just a heavy keyboard with pretty lights.

My whole family likes minion movies (and the penguin movies) and we have a 7-year-old boy, so this set was a no-brainer.  It's a fun game, and the pieces are well made, cute, and durable.We don't typically allow throwing in the house (three boys) but we made an exception for this.  My youngest son and the neighbors played with this for about two hours before gravitating to the video games, which is a very good result in my house. You need about 15' by 7' of free space to play.

Good fresh seed, sprouted quickly with frequent watering under a thin layer of compost.In North-Central NC, fescue and bluegrass both do well, so this is a good mix for my area. I have slightly acidic timber soil with a fair amount of clay.

Have only tried this on our stainless sink so far, but it worked beautifully.  Just wet the sponge, add a small squirt of dish soap, and scrub lightly.  It made an amazing difference.  I hadn't really realized how cruddy the sink was until after giving it a quick scrub.  Plan to try this sponge on our cookie sheets and some other pots next.  This is a quick and easy way to really improve the looks of the kitchen without a lot of work.We received a free sample, so I'm not sure how easy these would be to find.  Will definitely want to keep one around.This is a standard sponge size, made of foam, with one side as the "scrubby" side.

This is a poorly made device (the ground prong should not wobble) and the packaging is the opposite of "frustration free" consisting of lexan folded on itself and then riveted in four places to cardboard.I can't comment on function as the device that I received is not safe to use.
This is a great lightweight read for the pool, or your car line bag.  Realistic characters, well edited and entertaining.
My kids love this show.  It seems to do a very good job of sneaking in important life lessons along with the exciting and sometimes silly cartoons.

These are a great way for a little guy to be discreet and still have some overnight protection from leaks.  This L/XL size says it fits 60-100 pounds.  They are fairly loose on my 61 pounder, but they are still fully functional.  This pack has two pairs of reusable underwear.  They have a pocket to hold the absorbent inserts, so they wouldn't be comfortable as regular underwear.The packaging says they are normal machine wash and dry, but should be replaced after 30 washes.  They won't replace "regular" pull ups for kids who wet every night, but they should be great for kids who might have an occasional accident.

Was a little skeptical of the Warm Buttered Bread scent, but it really does smell like fresh buttered bread.  Lights easily, burns smooth and clean with no soot, no popping or sparking of the wick.  Burns evenly from the double wicks.  It does seem to burn fairly quickly.  The scent spreads nicely without being too strong.This is a nice, warm and soothing scent that would go well in the background of your kitchen.
I saw this the other day at the RCR shop in Welcome, NC and thought that it was cool enough to buy a couple tiny copies. The flat yellow color is right on.

I have an "I Fix It" bit and driver kit that I use all of the time, and it's GREAT and I use it all of the time, but it has one big problem; the box. The bits are stuck in these little elastomer sleeves that are fiddley to get out, and fiddley to get in. This kit has just the right box (as long as you don't tip it).The bix has a little mechanism that stands the bits up when you open it, and it's spring loaded so that the lid stays up. Also, the bits are loose in their sleeves so they come out easily.  Just don't tip the box when it's open, or you'll have a bad day. The decorative driver machining on the (free) sample that I got was a little less than I've come to expect, but it isn't a safety hazard, or even something that a non-machinist would be likely to notice. The I Fix It has one thing on this kit, and that's the cross-drilled driver that allows the extension to be used for leverage.My advice is to use the I fix it kit for for field work where dumping the box is more likely, and this kit at the bench where the box design really shines.

This was our first time trying these, and I wasn't sure what to expect.  The refill pieces are just a rectangle of absorbent material.  I really didn't expect them to work, but was pleasantly surprised.  Far more absorbent than expected.  Easy to throw away, and not a lot of bulk in the pants or in the trash can later.  My one complaint is that they are a little bit tricky to get in and out of the Tru Fit pants.  Nothing too complicated, but you will most likely have to do it for your little one.

I was able to get these at a steep discount (about $5 for the pair) in exchange for a product review.  The manufacturers description and other reviews miss a few details, like:The cap is high quality. It's a hard, glossy black plastic with a silicone seal. It looks easy to clean and should be durable.The bottle itself is absolutely plain, crystal clear, and colorless without bubbles or inclusions of any kind.The neoprene-type sleeve fits tightly enough that it won't fall off but is loose enough that it goes on easily. It's a nice fit compromise. It's also well stitched and well trimmed. I received one pink and one green as indicated in the photo, and the colors are (to my eyes) exactly as expected.

This is an amazing machine. I brush 2X/day and floss 4-5X/week, but I still "get the business" from my hygienist every four months. She has recommended that I buy one of these for a few years, and now I know why.  This isn't your fathers "spin brush" and it's way beyond grandpa's waterpik (which may explain the dentures).  My mouth feels dentist's office clean every time that I use it.Some details:This Brush has settings galore, and comes pre-set to what are probably the most sensible ones, which are "clean" (runs for two minutes at a reasonable intensity) and a time-minder that helps pace your brushing.  You can easily change the settings if you want but I haven't, and probably won't.On value:  if this is the thing that pushes me over the hump to a bi-annual vs. tri-annual cleaning, then it's easily worth the retail price.

These are true completely-over-the-ear headphones, and have remarkably soft head band and ear cup padding.The volume control is a thumb wheel rheostat, with an on-off slider for the mic. The control is low enough on the cord that you can look at it while wearing the headphones (a detail others miss).The sound emphasizes the bass-end, but there is good detail across the range.I like the mic. It has a wind guard, so your friends won't hear you breathing, and it's a plug-in type so you can remove it if you want.Other than the bass emphasis which I don't mind while playing games, the only quibble I have with these is that there is one wire to each can, and I prefer a left-only attachment for comfort and convenience.I'm happy with where Turtle Beach decided to spend their build budget, on nice big drivers, lightweight construction, and comfortable padding.

This was a major hit at my house. I think every 7-year old I know has a favorite Minecraft video maker, and mine's no exception. This is a well thought-out kit with lots of set pieces, four backgrounds, and a free app to make it all come together. This seems tailor-made for the iPad mini. The angle is just right to match the camera and lens height.  It works well with an iPod touch as well when the camera stand is raised with a few books.Some things to keep in mind:1.  Take care to keep track of the three small pieces (sword, pick axe, and torch).2.  Put the water and lava on postcard paper. You can reuse them if you do.3.  Make a few very short videos first to get walking speeds right.4.  These are "silent" films. We had good luck with a desk nameplate holder and strips of paper for dialog.5.  A Bluetooth selfie stick or headphones with volume control (the up-button) make for a nice, shake-free shutter release.

This is a pretty great (plug-in, no battery) Wifi/Bluetooth/Aux speaker with good sound and outstanding range.  You can stream music over wifi from a (currently) limited selection of apps (Spotify, Pandora, I Heart radio, or Deezer).  There is also a wide selection of internet radio stations (including all of my favorite local Winston-Salem stations) built into the app. Once set up as presets from your phone/tablet or computer, these can be controlled directly from the speaker, the app, or the included remote.  I'm disappointed that I can only control Amazon Music and iTunes over a Bluetooth connection, since these are the music services that I use most.Prerequisite equipment: The sales pitch indicates that you can easily control your music and listen to whatever you want, all over your house, without complicated set-up or expensive gear.  In order for this to work, your wifi network has to cover your house. You can also control stored music from a NAS (Network Attached Storage) drive attached to the same wifi as the player.  You'll also need a phone or other computer (again, on the same network) to get the thing set-up, and to control non-supported music services like iTunes/iMusic over Bluetooth (no AirPlay support).Overall, this is a very cool thing, that works well with minimal hassle.The performance and sound is very good with plenty of power, and a nice, flat signature.  It is well matched to the 20X20' room where I'm using it.I received a pre-release version of this speaker, so I couldn't see a full product description or pricing information.

There are some good things, and some not as good things with this cooker.Pros:Easy to cleanHeating elements on top and bottom both make for even cooking and more versatile useLarge enough to easily make a one pot meal for a family of fiveDoes a nice job with stir fries and other similar one pot mealsSeems like it would make a great but very basic oven replacement to make pizzas, cakes, casseroles with the paddle removed, but I haven't tested that out much yet.*haven't tried it this way yet, but it seems like this would be nice to set out on the back porch for baking things when its really hot and we just don't want to heat up the kitchen.  Testing soon!  This could also be nice for campsites with electricity or tailgating, need to test that idea too.Cons:Large.  It takes up a lot of storage and counter space.Noisy, especially when the convection fan is runningSomewhat superfluous for us in day to day use.  Currently have a functional stove/oven, so this will go to the basement until a party or holiday comes up when the oven is full.

The best thing about this kit is the booklet that comes with it. It's well-written with some fun, phone/tablet centric activities in it.This is a good rainy-day boredom-beater for a kid between 9-13 who's interested in science. Even my jaded kids thought the spectrometer expires ment was cool.I knocked it to four stars for overall value. It's not bad (my kids got an evening out of it) but I'd have been happier if this was priced between $12 and $15, rather than $20.

The folks who make these sent me a sample for review, probably because I have A LOT of headphones.There are lots of choices for this kind of money in a set of Bluetooth ear buds. These (like most) pair easily and have a nice, flat frequency respond as long as you can get a good seal.The thing that gets you when wearing Bluetooth earbuds is the bulky electronics and battery. These (again, like most of this type) strike a good balance between long enough to reach the ear canal for a good seal and not so long that they lever themselves out.These have one outstanding feature that mist miss, and that is Braille-like protrusions on the volume controls. That's a big plus because you can't see the buttons when these are in your ears.I like these.

This is listed at $70.  I would expect proportional steering, a rechargeable battery, 50 yards of range, some kind of suspension system, and 50 yards of range for that price. This toy is overpriced by half, at least.  This would be 4 stars at $35, and 5 stars at $25.
Classic toy, great fun.  My eight year old was fascinated with the idea of an old school toy.

Circling the Sun, is by the same author (Paula McLain) of  The Paris Wife,  which I really enjoyed.  This tells the story of Beryl Markham, and is another work of historical fiction. I'm not always crazy about the idea of embellishments on a real-life person, but this is so well written I got lost in the story regardless of the "truth" of the tale, versus an interesting work of fiction.It begins with Beryl's unconventional childhood and  traverses her life, including some not-very-pleasant details, but realistic all the same. It's a very  engaging story, richly written. Her writing style is such that you feel you are there, dropped into the time period as well as the various settings. The conventions of the times play a big part in her life story and her frustrations are evident. Beryl is a strong-minded and interesting person, and every other "character" in the book is also well-developed.  She may have been prone to repeating mistakes, which could be frustrating, but don't we all learn our best lessons that way? This is, after all, about an actual person with flaws, not a character who can neatly wrap things up.  She may have simply been a bit ahead of her time for that.Entertaining and enlightening- worth the read.

If you are wanting to have only a brand-name kitchen, including the textiles, you will be happy that All-Clad has come up with a cute "dish towel". It's appearance is quite nice, not a stamped on picture, rather dyed in (apparently, that is what the Fiber Reactive is all about?) so it seems it will not fade. It's also a lovely velour-like texture, soft with a nice hand to it.The downside? The softer weaves, including tiny loops on the back side of the towel, are lovely to look at but do not absorb well. When wiping up a water spill it really did not pick up much without a lot of passes. So, pretty it is- effective, not so much.If you are looking for something with a nice picture to decorate the kitchen, it's got a bit of a 50's vibe (the percolator type coffee pot gives it a bit of a retro look). It's also a bit larger than the average kitchen towel (nearly twice as big as the ones in my kitchen) if that is a deciding factor for you.

This is a tiny, fun book (about 4x4 inches) full of little bits of wisdom from around the world. It's like the gift books you might find on all types of cute subjects, but a tad more grown-up. It would be perfect for  giving to a traveler, a lover of different cultures, or anyone who could use a smile.It could have been a bit bigger for use as a coffee table book, but I think the contents & message are really nice for gifting, and easy to add to a package as a fun surprise.The contents are unique and it's only 125 pages long, each page with a different thought/tradition/holiday that is described and an accompanying picture on the opposite page. The book is divided into three sections of Mind, Body, & Spirit and reflects things that are good for you to practice, try or contemplate. It's interesting and  informative while rather light-hearted.Multiple contributers gave it great variety, yet overall it's cohesive and has a nice flow. Never preachy or smaltzy, It's simply a sweet read.

This is a terrific idea, but it has one hurdle to overcome. It was not initially obvious to me how the magnetic system works, which was my first mistake. The reality is that you must attach the large magnet to the back of your phone somewhat permanently. You can put your case over it, if your case is thin enough on the back side, and not too snug. The overall system itself is very easily adjusted.The problem is that nobody in my home is willing to put a strong magnet on their phone, no matter how much it might be stated that this will not harm the phone or its function. The idea that you are sticking something to the phone is the one hurdle that can't be fixed.It does appear to be well made and may provide a convenient, and safer alternative to holding the phone or stuffing it in a cup holder. Unfortunately, those of us in this house will never know.
Great quick and easy to use fasteners. Nice, finished look on the license plate.

I took this  giant box of Ropes into a classroom and gave it out to 20 high schoolers to get their response. About half the group had tried Kazoozles in the past and they felt this new version with a new name was much better.But, they still admitted that they only "liked" the Ropes, and couldn't see going out and getting them, versus buying Twizzlers or other plain red licorice. The SweeTarts middle of these hollow red Ropes is probably supposed to be the flavor boost that makes them unique. It's not very strong (sweet or tart) so it didn't make them much more exciting. Overall, the teens said these were only Okay.Myself, and the other adults who tried these, found them a bit too sweet and artificial tasting...which is ironic, since the packaging emphasizes that they are naturally flavored and colored. Perhaps they are a slightly better candy treat than others which are made with a plethora of chemicals, but they certainly aren't health food and don't have an improved natural taste in my opinion.For the SweeTart lover...there is not really enough of that tangy taste. And, for the red licorice lover, there is tastier red licorice out there. Not sure this combination is a winner.

Karma is  what you would get if you crossed something like War, Rummy and Uno. It's best played with a group, as you compete to end the game by getting rid of your cards, and the more the merrier.There are not a lot of directions, as it is a fairly simple game, yet luck certainly comes into play regardless of how well you strategize. For some in our family, this was a bit of a bummer, but overall, we had a lot of fun. While you may be sure you are about to win, Karma cards let another player force an opponent to take the entire discard pile, or make the next player play a card with a value of five or below, which may be impossible. Just as you think you have it made, everything can be turned upside down, much like Uno's Pick Up Four card, etc.Game play takes around 30 minutes and will suit a wide range of ages. You can play until the sole winner is left, or when the first person is forced out if you have limited time.Lots of fun!

This cute little toaster packs a punch!We have had a Kitchen Aid toaster for quite a while with very similar features. The B&D version is a bit sleeker and shinier with a nice compact footprint so it takes up about two inches less space (width).The nice part about using it is the speed. It really is faster, yet it doesn't burn the outside without heating up the inside of even frozen items like waffles or bagels. The freezer setting is a nice touch. It has a bagel setting to only toast the inside and a regular setting for your average piece of toast, too. The extra lift bar is great for popping your toasted food up high enough out of the slot to easily grab it without getting your fingers burned.You won't find any real directions in the box, but the buttons were pretty self-explanatory. Clean up requires popping the drop down hatch on the bottom and shaking the whole thing over the trash. I do miss the simpler slide out/off tray of my other toaster since that was a bit easier.Overall, It's a quick and cute little addition to the countertop.

Love this stylish watch and I  get compliments every time I wear it. It can work dressed up or dressed down. It's subtle, yet the large face and shine looks impressive.Nice price for great quality, too.

Awesome slow cooker with a nice, tight, secure lid. The top clamps down securely for cooking and for taking along to gatherings safely.I use my crockpot all the time and have found this one safe, accurate to cooking time/temp, easy to clean (removable crock can go in the dishwasher) and the perfect size for most recipes.

Great way to protect the trunk of my new Camry. Unpacked easily from shipping and fit perfectly. I placed it right over the existing carpet and it covers nearly completely.It's a nice medium thickness rubbery plastic, flexible enough to easily lift if I need to access the spare tire, etc. from the cubby under the carpeting.

I've been using wipes for nearly 26 years now (since the first baby and well after the last). We keep them in the bathroom for personal use but also for quick cleanups, as they are super-handy and less expensive than pop-up canister wipes.I kept the nicest of the "decorator" tubs when they came out a few years ago, and use replacement packages regularly. The average tubs need to be replaced from time to time since they are lightweight plastic and get too much use. The pull through aspect is fairly useless, as it tends to catch or tear the wipes. I needed a better way, so...This system intrigued me, and I am so glad I tried it! The overall tub is much more substantial and a nice weight and sleek look for keeping in plain sight. The rubber pads on the bottom keep it in place on any surface. You simply press the top and it springs open, then closes easily, keeping everything fresh.But, the best part is the weighted top piece that lays on top of the wipes. It sits atop the wipes, making the individual wipe quick and easy to dispense. No more clinging multiple stings of wipes sticking out of the top or falling to the floor when you simply want to pull out one or two.It is also a great, compact size, however....my one disappointment is that it does not hold a full replacement package of my favorite brand of wipes. It will hold about 3/4 of a full 250 pack of wipes, just barely.  If you are buying the small packets of flushables, it probably holds the entire thing, but the wipes that I buy come in larger bags, so I have to stow the remainder under the sink in a ziploc until there is room in the dispenser. If it were just a tad taller it would be absolutely perfect.Once again, OXO has come up with a smart, cute solution. I have never found a product of theirs that disappoints and have them all over the house...now in the BATHROOM, too!

I could not resist the price on a Canon printer compared to other similar brands, knowing the name is well respected. I have always owned HP products (which were generally more expensive, but very long-lived) and decided to try one. The first model that I purchased lasted only about 8 months, before it had so many bugs that we replaced it. We needed another printer and decided to give Canon one more try.First, it does require a download and/or use of a CD for  installation and this was not as simple as it could have been, but doable. If you are going to link it up, you will need to purchase a cable (not included). So far the print quality is good and it  functions just as well as more expensive brands, with one caveat. It goes through ink quite quickly. The idea that having multiple color cartridges saves you money is simply not the case. You may only have to replace a yellow, or magenta, etc. but the small individual cartridges are not inexpensive. I've found that I have spent more money on the replacements than I did with combined color cartridges for my HP printer. Although, I have also found that the warning sign for ink replacement is very premature and you can print at least 50-100 more pages before the color is actually out.Like most similarly priced printers, the paper tray is somewhat limited in capacity, which is a bit of a pain. I would like to be able to load a ream or close to it, and forget about it, but they are simply not large enough to accomate that much paper. I do have to admit I have had less jams with the more limited trays, so perhaps that is a good point.Overall, I would consider this an average printer for limited use. If you are going to be using your printer for a business or with great frequency, the ink replacement cost will be a negative. I haven't had this model long enough to see what the longevity is compared with my other Canon model, but I am hopeful that this one will have a longer lifespan since we are now using two printers in the household and this one does not take on the biggest jobs.I will admit that my HP Officejet Pro 8600 is still my favorite, as it was easier to set up and has an overall sturdier quality to it, is quieter and easier & cheaper to maintain. However, the Pixma is smaller and less obtrusive, and certainly less expensive by about $100 dollars. If you are after a bargain, this might be it, but consider the ink cost as well. Functionally, it's a good choice, plus it has the scanner/copier which can come in handy. Too bad it doesn't go a step further and include a simple Fax.

Super light and wide coverage of the eyes for my science class!So inexpensive, it was worth having my own pair to slip on during high school labs that I assist on with my students. I've even recommended to many of them that they go ahead and order their own pair if they hate using the glasses/goggles that the school has on hand since many of them are grossed out by sharing.They have stayed clean and clear and fold up pretty compactly so I can throw them in my backpack.Great buy!

This 3M weatherstripping tape is super easy to use and just what we needed for a couple of drafty doorways.The measure, cut, peel and stick was very simple and was quick to install. The adhesive is stronger than average, and I believe it will stay on for a nice, long time...on doors that are not continuously opened. We've tried this sort of tack-on weatherstripping in the past on our busiest door and a temporary fix just can't keep up with high use. I would expect that we will get one winter out of it if we are lucky on that one door.However, for the rest of the drafty areas (doors and windows)... what a difference!Good, quick, reasonably priced product that will end blustery leaks.

Great system for keeping my glasses safe!I do not wear my glasses continuously, so it's important for me to have a sturdy case to carry along. The medium size was just right for my light wire frames, as they fold down pretty compactly. The pouch that's included keeps the glasses from jostling around, though the inside of the case is soft and cushioned as well.It does snap shut tightly and requires a firm grip to open the case because it is so secure. The outside of the case has a smooth, leathery feel to it, with a simple, classic look.Now, to find a larger size for my big, chunky sunglasses!

This a sweet looking corkscrew, with nice heft and obvious quality. The packaging is quite nice as well.In order to give a truly thorough review, I had a friend who is a professional bartender give it a try. Her opinion on first glance was that it was something she and her colleagues would love to have on  the job.It very quickly and smoothly opened our bottle of wine and the cork easily slid off. She was impressed with the form and function with one small criticism: the foil cutter is just not super sharp. In her opinion it would work well for quite a while as a personal opener, but for the pro, it would need to be much sharper in order to keep up with heavy duty, continuous use.So, it will remain a classy addition to my kitchen for those bottles of wine between friends,  and it might just become a giftable purchase for my wine loving friends &family as well.

This is just the cutest apron, and practical, too!The fabric is soft with a slight silky sheen to it. Easy to wipe off, with a handy pocket and totally adjustable neck and waist.Nice, modern style keeps me from looking frumpy in the kitchen. Love it!

This is a softening and non-greasy lotion, with lots of all natural ingredients, but...the smell.This lotion is called Green Apple, which might lead you to expect an orchard like scent. Unfortunately, it doesn't even have a natural smell, despite the many naturally fruity contents. The first thing that came to mind upon smelling it is artificial lemon-scented dish detergent.It may very well be good for the skin and have some fine ingredients, but It's so unpleasant, I can't see myself continuing to use it.

This perch is described as small, but it's really a pretty good size for little birds. It's about 5 inches wide and a little under 2 inches thick, sticking out about 5 to 6 inches when installed.The surface is rough for beak and claw maintenance, but not too tough for standing on. My conure likes to wipe her beak on it when it is placed near her food dish and hops on it while cruising around her cage, but does not really use it as a long-time perch, per se.Definitely nice quality and worth adding to your cage.

This lid by Charles Viancin is pretty much as described and pictured and does seem to seal reasonably well on my ceramic and glass dishes. Do be advised however that the product that I received is not 100% pure silicone. When I was looking into purchasing silicone lids I tried to find a brand that labeled their products as "medical grade", "no fillers" or "pure silicone". After much searching I couldn't find any with that description so I considered the good reviews, and asked a few questions of other customers and also the company.I asked customers who purchased this lid as well as other Charles Viancin products to try the pinch test to see if the product/s they received were pure silicone or if they contained fillers. Some came back saying their product appeared to be pure while others found out their product likely contained fillers (this revealed inconsistencies in the silicone quality of Charles Viancin products). When I contacted the manufacturing company the customer service representative did not seem to know anything about the quality or purity of the silicone used in their products and did not bother to track down more information.Despite the discrepancy in quality I placed an order to see the product for myself. Upon receiving my sunflower lid I opened it up and pinched it at which point the yellow color whitened. This is an indicator that the product is not pure but contains fillers. Good quality silicone is 100% silicone with no fillers. Lesser quality silicone may use fillers up to a certain point that is deemed "acceptable". The lesser quality pieces may not work as well (heat as evenly or be as non-stick) or hold up as long. More importantly however, the safety of silicone products that contain fillers isn't known.To test if silicone contains fillers, pinch and/or twist a portion of the piece; if you see any white or whitening in the stressed area then it's not pure silicone. If you don't care whether or not your silicone contains fillers these lids are both beautiful and functional. Personally, I will be avoiding purchasing any more Charles Viancin products and will be searching for other companies that use higher quality silicone. I hope this is helpful to you!

We bought this play pot and pan set for our daughter just under six months ago. We wanted to find something that was not plastic and we liked these since they looked realistic. Initially we loved the product except for some annoying product stickers that Kid-Kraft felt the need to stick on almost every piece. To remove the stickers we found cooking oil works best (we used coconut oil).The food that comes in the set is solid wood and finished with oil-based paints. We would have preferred a water-based finish on these pieces since it is found to be a safer alternative but the food is still cute and a nice addition to the set. The pots and pans are made of stainless steel and seem to be pretty sturdy in there overall construction. The problem is that the stainless steel used is a fairly low grade and with gentle play several of the pieces are beginning to show rust spots.  Now the lower grade can be considered both a good and bad thing....the lower grades usually contain less of the heavy metals chromium and nickel but too low a content of these metals and stainless steel rusts easily. Do keep in mind also that we have not used these pans with liquid or for any purpose other than that of which they were intended and my daughter has been fairly gentle with them.If you purchase or already own these pots and find that you have the same problem, small rust spots can be removed if they are caught before they get too bad. To remove rust make a paste out of equal parts baking soda and lemon juice. Rub the mixture on the rust spot and then scrub with a soft sponge or brush. Do not use anything abrasive that might scratch the surface of the pots as this may make matters worse later (NO STEEL WOOL!). Rinse the surface clean and towel dry. If the rust is still there try letting the paste sit on the rust spot for a few minutes. Once the rust is removed be sure to keep an eye out for more spots in the future as more will likely develop with time.If you do decide to go with this cookware set for your child you could also try keeping the rust at bay by "seasoning" them as if you would real steel or cast iron cookware. After you have removed all the stickers and adhesive from the product, and have dried them if you washed them, coat the entirety of the metal surfaces in a THIN layer of cooking oil. To help avoid using excess you can apply the oil to a rag or paper towel first and then  wipe the cookware with it. Once they are evenly oiled place all the pieces in the oven at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for about an hour. This process fills the pores of the cookware's surface with carbonized oil, which blocks the oxidation process and therefore keeps the surface from rusting. Once this is done and they have cooled any excess oil can be wiped off with a paper towel. Do keep in mind however that seasoning can leave a slightly more coppery tone to the metal. Coloration may also be uneven as places where oil pooled will be darker. If you think this look will bother you, don't even try it, just keep an eye out for those rust spots.I hope this is helpful to you!

Overall, I like this puzzle. It is smaller than most children's puzzles you see in -stores...the wood box that the snail comes displayed in measures 6" long, 5" high, and 1" deep. The box is constructed of solid beechwood, the puzzle pieces are cut from rubber-wood, and the snail is finished with water-based colors. I really love that this puzzle is constructed entirely of solid wood and is void of particle boards and plywood unlike most children's puzzles today. I was however a bit disappointed in the quality of the sanding, hence the loss of one star.Several of the pieces in the puzzle that we received are very rough around the edges. I almost wonder if they sanded the pieces at all. It looks like they just cut the wood out and then proceeded onto the paint. Perhaps we got one that missed the sanding step of the manufacturing process since no one else seems to have had this problem.Other than the rough edges we like the puzzle and so does our two year old daughter. It is a bit tough for her to assemble on her own with out a little help from an adult but I expect that she will master it soon enough. We will probably try and take some sand paper to it in the near future to smooth it out so that she doesn't get any splinters...unfortunately though this will also take off some of the beautiful paint colors.---- UPDATE 2/12/2014 ----When Begin Again toys became aware of the quality puzzle that we received they offered to ship us a replacement puzzle at no charge or hassle to us. The replacement puzzle they sent was much better in terms of quality and sanding. In light of the improved quality of the second puzzle as well as the good customer service I received from the manufacturer I am upping my review rating from four stars to five. I highly recommend this company as I have found them very easy to work with.

This bear stacker is just as adorable as pictured and it's bright colors have captured the attention of my both of my two children (ages 2 yrs and 9 months). My two year old daughter at points finds this stacker a bit frustrating since it is a bit more challenging to correctly line up and stack than her other stacker (you know...the kind that fit together in any order).  I have no doubt though that the challenge is good for her since it teaches her problem solving skills and perseverance.  I expect that she'll master the concept soon since she loves puzzles and it is very much like a puzzle in the way that it assembles.The stacker has ten pieces total, the feet (base), the head, four solid wood shapes, and four colored "PlanWood" pieces that in conjunction with the shapes make up the body. "PlanWood", as Plan Toys calls it, is high density particle board that is unlike what you have come to expect from typical particle board. It is made by using the wood scraps and shavings that are leftover from producing Plan Toys solid wood toy options and then mixes those scraps with organic water-based pigment powders and 1% of a formaldehyde free glue, called E-zero glue. The material is then molded under high heat and pressure to create a smooth and durable product.  The outcome is not only smooth and nice looking but also highly durable, easy care to care for, and thanks to the lack of formaldehyde content it will not harm the health of your little one like more typical, chemical laden particle boards and plywood.The feet and four colored PlanWood layers are each molded as a one piece design but the bear head on top is molded as two pieces and then pressed together. Since the head is manufactured this way there is a seam running through the middle of his head that is not really noticeable in the pictures. The seam doesn't really bother me but it does give the head piece a less smooth/finished look than the other pieces. I also wonder if it might be a weaker point if the head is ever dropped.Some reviewers I have noticed seem to have the idea that PlanWood is a dishwasher safe material but according to the company it is not approved for this. They recommend cleaning any of their PlanWood items with a wet cloth and soap and then towel drying.If you have any pets in the house do watch out initially that they don't try to eat this toy. For whatever reason one of my family member's dog, who is normally very well behaved (the dog I mean), found the PlanWood material very attractive and tried to steal the pieces away from my son who was playing with the toy on the floor. Just keep an eye out until you are sure you can trust your pet with it lying out and about, I'd hate for any toys to get eaten.Overall, I like this stacker and I highly recommend it. I hope my review is helpful to you.

Natural rubber is a material that I have become very familiar with over the past 3 years since I had my two children but I must say that initially I was a bit nervous about these particular toys.  When they arrived they had a very strong odor unlike any other natural rubber toy we've owned (they didn't smell at all like latex to me). They also had a different texture/density than I expected. They reminded me more of my daughter's EVA foam Crocs shoes. These two things considered I questioned whether or not these toys were indeed composed entirely of natural rubber.  After a few emails back and forth with the company my mind has been put to ease.According to Kim Greenlee and Chris Clemmer of BeginAgain Toys this bath toy set is made entirely of natural rubber except for the addition if their "organic" pigment powder. They also stated that all of their natural rubber toys are free of nitrosamines, BPA, Phthalates, and petroleum (except for a petroleum jelly that may be used to free the products from their molds). Due to the possible use of the petroleum jelly I'd recommend a good washing, just in case, before handing them over to your munchkins.They also stated that while their products are indeed manufactured in China that they are independently safety tested for USA, Canada, Europe, Australia, and New Zealand safety standards.The strong smell that I noticed initially has already begun to dissipate after only a week of use. When the toys first arrived I could smell them all the way down the hallway from the bathroom whereas now I have to be within about a foot or two. I'm guessing the smell will continue to decrease with time. Typically I don't buy any bath toys with holes in them to avoid mold and mildew growth but the holes in these toys are large enough that I feel I could clean them out easily enough with soap and water using a small toothbrush.My two children (2 yrs and 9 months) both love their new bath toys. We paid $16.48 for the set (so about $3.30 per piece) and for that price I highly recommend them.

This drum rattle measures approximately 3.5" x 2.75" and has several components to attract your little ones attention. It has a musical mouthpiece on one end, a dial that clicks on the other, an interior (caged) ball, and 3 beads on one of the cage bars. The musical mouthpiece produces more of a squeaking sound than it does a whistle but the sound can be produced both by blowing air out or by sucking air in. The "clicking" dial is the reason that I have withheld one star from my overall rating of this rattle. The dial on ours broke in under a few minutes when Gramma was trying to show baby how it worked. The dial now just spins freely. Despite our disappointment, our son still finds the free spinning dial interesting so in the end it isn't too big a deal. I'm not sure if the problem with our dial is due to a design flaw or if we were just "unlucky".Despite the broken piece I feel that these bio-plastic rattles from PlantBaby are an excellent alternative to conventional (petroleum-based) plastic. They are composed of Natureworks plant-based polymer and although they have both the look and feel of conventional plastic they are completely free of petroleum as well as common plastic chemicals. Natureworks makes their polylactide polymer using sugar from corn but other plants such as pine trees, coconuts and soy can be used to produce this material as well. The sugar is converted it into lactic acid, then lactide, and then eventually a polylactide polymer (PLA). According to PlantBaby all the dyes used for coloring their rattles and teethers are plant-based as well (botanical and vegetable). I am guessing this is why the colors tend to be more subdued.The rattle can be easily cleaned with soap and water just like conventional plastic. Do be informed however that bio-plastic has a lower point at which it will melt so it should not be boiled, sterilized, run through the dishwasher, microwaved, or left in a hot car. Natureworks recommends on their website ([...] that their biopolymer be stored at temperatures less than 105F (40C).Both my children (2 yrs and 9 months), as well as me and my husband love this rattle & I highly recommend it. If you have a question about the product feel free to leave me a comment and I will do my best to respond. I hope this review was helpful to you!---UPDATE 4/28/14---Today I am dropping my five star rating of this toy down to two stars since we have been less than impressed by the durability of this particular rattle by PlantBaby. Since the time of my initial review we have had two of these rattle break on us.
