The calibration process was a bit tedious which should have been documented in the user manual or on the website.After the proper calibration, I did a couple of test prints which all turned out nice. Finally a happy camper.Overall- the Robo 3D is a nice budget 3D printer which can handle nice print volumes. There are quite a few rooms for improvements in their packaging, wiring assemblies, and calibration procedures. However, the support team is great and knowledgeable.  If you are mechanically inclined and don't mind to work through some tedious process to get the printer properly calibrated, this would be a good product to consider.

The  Panasonic ES4815S Pro Curve Compact Mens.shaver is compact and light-weight which is great for travelling. It runs on 2 AA batteries which is convenient as we do not need to carry a charger and finding an outlet while we are on the go. The shaver provides a nice and smooth shave for my light beard and works well in shower. It is also easy to clean by simply removing the cover.The only drawback of this shaver is that is does not come with a pop-up trimmer which I often use on my other shavers.

I have been using other models of Dymo label writers. The DYMO Label Writer 450 printer bundle comes with 4 rolls of labels for folders, appointment cards, and shipping labels. The installation of the printer to my PC is pretty straight-forward and the Dymo label software is quite easyto use and user friendly. I tried test prints  with all of the rolls. All came out fine without any problems with alignment and feeds.What I also like about this product is that we can use it for printing prepaid postage stamps by downloading the Dymostamps software. Very convenient and saving our trips to the post office.

The Wagan (EL2886) Travel Charge Series provides a nice and non-messy way for charging multiple devices on-the-road with its cup-holder design. The charger fits nicely on my car's cup holder's compartment with two 2.1 A and two 1.0 A USB charger ports which are ample enough for charging various phones and tablets. The 12V DC plug comes with an indicator light which includes a 12 A fuse inside. The unit also has a 12V 6A DC socket in case we need it for portable DC devices.The power cord's length is about 34" measured from end-to-end which is good enough for many cars.The travel charger works quite well so far with pretty fast charging for my devices on-the-go. If you are not a heavy coffee drinker who needs those cup holder spaces in your your car , this would be a great charging device to consider.

I have read numerous guide books on Raspberry Pi and Arduino. The Programming the Raspberry Pi, Second Edition provides a comprehensive coverage of both the programming and practical application aspects for the novice and intermediate level users of the Raspberry Pi.The book is structured with an overall introduction of the Raspberry Pi hardware and proceeds to provide a thorough coverage of the Python programming language with numerous examples. It then moves on to cover the GUI and hardware interfaces. Rather than presenting the typical boring projects like blinking LEDs and spinning some motors, the book provides some interesting and fun projects such as a LED clock and an object avoidance rover robot. The back of the book also provides excellent reference sources for the Pytho programming language.The Programming the Raspberry Pi book is certainly one which I would keep on my Raspberry / Arduino reference books library.

I have been using the Chamin brand toilet paper for many years. I did a side-by-side comparison of the Charmin Ultra Strong Toilet Paper with the Ultra soft version. The Ultra strong toilet paper is clearly tougher and works great particularly for general cleaning purposes in the kitchen. It also uses less space due to the small roll size and fits well with my toiletry roller.In terms of toiletry usage, I believe it is a matter of preference. The Ultra soft version provides a fluffier and gentler feel but it does use more sheets as compared to the Ultra Strong version. The Ultra strong uses less sheets but it has a slightly rougher texture. Both have the great signature quality of the Charmin brand with great water absorbent power.

Hershey's chocolate has been my favorite treats since my childhood  and I am still enjoying them nowadays as my favorite snacks and soul-fulfilling treats. The Hershey's Snack Bites Assortment Canister comes in a large box with an appealing display of an assortment of the chocolate and caramel bars with crunchy nuts. Both taste deliciously with the the Hershey's signature flavors. By the way, the candy is not in one piece and they are packed in individual smaller pieces which make it more fun to chew on and share with others.This nice canister would be great for parties and office areas.

I have been using quilted Northern bath issue for years. The Quilted Northern Compressed Core Bath Tissue provides the same softness, feels and quality as the regular non-compressed tissues. The condensed pack makes it very convenient for storing them in my garage storage cabinets which takes much less space. However, due to the compression, the cardboard tubing is basically flattened during storage. Although it is quite easy to put it back into the proper shape after taking the toiler paper out of the package, it does not form an even circular shape which would make the dispensing of the toilet paper a bit awkward.Overall, I believe the Quilted Northern Compressed Core Bath Tissue has its potential market for those who see storage space is important.

I have been using Charmin's soft toilet paper for years and it is one of my favorite toilet accessories (on top of my stockpile of books and magazines). The Charmin Ultra Soft Toilet Paper is nice, soft, and fluffy. It feels like heaven as compared to the low-grade toilet paper at the public restaurants and airports. The pricing on Amazon is also quite competitive as well.  Highly recommended !

I have used several non-Apple brands of  Lighting to USB cables. The AmazonBasics Apple Certified Lightning to USB cable works perfectly for charging and syncing my iPhone with my laptop. It works just the same in terms of reliability and functionality as compared to my iPhone cable. The cable is only 4" long but it fits the bill as it is easier to carry this around on trips.High recommended

I have another BLU Smartphone which I have been using for over 1 year which has been working well. The BLU Studio C 5+5 Smartphone comes with the more recent Android OS and it works well with my existing AT&T sim card.There are several things I like about this product. It has a nice large screen display, pretty decent video and sounds, and the dual sim slots which makes it convenient to switch between different services provider . So far my frequently used Android apps are running smoothly without any problems. The camera is not as nice as my Samsung S5. The replacement battery also costs higher than my Samsung.Overall, if you are considering a reasonably priced unlocked phone with decent quality display / sound, this would be a good one to consider.

I have been using SSD and hybrid SSD drives for upgrading my laptops for many years . The OCZ Storage Solutions Trion SSD drive provides a nice cost-effective upgrade for older versions of laptops and desktops PCs.The installation is pretty straight forward and it works well after imaging my existing drive from my laptop to the SSD drive. The performance is noticeably faster in boot up time and starting the applications. Overall data transfer rate is not as great as the higher price models. We can also use this SSD drive as an external backup drive by using an external SSD enclosure.This product comes with a 3-year warranty. One nice thing about this model is that it is under OCZ's ShieldPlus warranty coverage with free shipping for warranty repairs.For those who are looking for a cost-effective solution to upgrade their older model PC and laptops, this would be a good choice to consider.

The use the Ozeri Pronto kitchen scale for my kitchen. The AmazonBasics Digital Kitchen Scale provides very similar functionality with four different measurement units. The display is easy to read and it provides pretty accurate measurements. One thing I like this unit over the Ozeri is that it is about 1" in diameter larger than the Ozeri Pronto scale. This makes it more convenient for measuring larger sized items.Highly recommended

I use the TC Electronic PolyTune Clip mainly for tuning my acoustic guitar. What I like about this product is that the unit is portable, easy to clip on, and has a nice display of the tunes with + / - indications . It provides pretty accurate tuning with the three different modes. I use the unit mainly for individual string tuning which works very well. The polyphonic tuning also does a pretty nice job.For those looking for a portable and accurate polyphonic tuner, this is a good one to consider.

I have used many different brands of  Micro SDHC cards for my cameras, phone, tablets, and GoPro equipment. The SanDisk Ultra 32GB Ultra Micro SDHC card performs very well for my applications particularly for shooting / playing videos and action-type photo shooting. I tested it by taking full HD videos which turned out very nice without any jiggling effects. It is also one of the reliable brands which I can trust for storing my precious collections. The product also comes with a standard SD adapter.

The Dell DW316 External USB Slim DVD R/W Optical drive works quite nicely with my Dell and other brands of laptops. Installation is easy and the unit is powered through the USB port with no external power required. I have tried using the unit for installing my existing software on DVD and for backing up data. Both works well with different type of DVD storage media. The pre-loaded Cyber Link Media Suite software is also convenient for providing data backup and playing DVD videos.For those who need a reliable and portable DVD R/W optical drive on the go, this is a nice product to consider.

I have been using the Hoover SteamVac carpet cleaner for many years for cleaning my carpets at home. I like the Hoover SteamVac lines of products as they are easy to use, reliable, and do a nice cleaning job over the years. The dispensing of cleaning solution is consistent with good suction power for lifting up the dirt. The rotary brushes can be easily detached for cleaning.The Hoover Commercial C3820 Spotter and Carpet cleaner has similar solid construction as my existing Steamvac with a 2-year warranty as compared to the 1 year guarantee for my non-commercial version. It comes with a 3-prone plug with heavy duty cords and provides a solid performance for heavy duty cleaning. The only thing area might not be as ideal is that this product does not include the hand tools as I have got for the other non-commercial model.

The Scotch-Brite Stay Clean Non-scratch Scrub Sponge does a very nice job for the general cleaning of my kitchen counters, sinks, dish washing, and bathroom. It provides a nice absorbent power and is gentle on the materials being cleaned. The sponge has two sides with one side with a harder surface for cleaning tougher spots. I have used it for these sponges for quite a while and quite pleased with its results. However, these sponges are probably not for cleaning tough stains.

The Remington PR1285A WetTech Lithium Rotary shaver works quite nicely for my daily shaving. What I like about this product is its light weight and that it operates quite quietly as compared to my existing electric shaver. The shaver provides a clean cut for my light beard. The shaving heads are also easy to maintain and clean.  The water-proof feature provides an added value for shaver during the shower. One drawback with this shaver is that it does not seem to glide as smooth over my face as my other shaver.Overall, the Remington PR1285A WetTech Lithium Rotary shaver would be a nice shaver for in-home and travelling use.

I have used many different brands of portable chargers including some high capacity ones like the Energizer 18000 mAH charger which cost many times the money over this product. The Monoprice 16,000 mAh Portable Charger works very well for charging my phones and tablets with its dual USB ports.The unit is charged through a micro-USB port. The power levels are shown with the LEDs located on the top of the unit. The USB output ports provide separate 1A and 2A charging currents which is good enough for charging many of my portable devices. However, the ports are not labelled clearly which makes it a bit difficult to identify which output port carries the higher current. I have tested this portable charger with a variety of Android tablets which worked quite well .The nice selling point of this product is its price which is hard to beat as compared to other portable chargers with similar charging capacity. For those who are looking for a high capacity portable charger for a reasonable price, this is a good one to consider.

I has used a variety of wireless bluetooth headsets for driving and sport activities. The Mpow Swift Bluetooth 4.0 Wireless bluetooth sport headphones works very nicely with its sleek design and sound quality. It comes with all the necessary accessories including the USB charging cable and ear pieces of different sizes. The ear pieces fit nicely and securely with very good sound isolation which is great for sports activities.The charging of the device is straight-forward by plugging the USB power cable to the micro-USB port of the headphones. Pairing to my Samsung phone is a snap without ant difficulties. The volume can also be adjusted by the control buttons on the headphones. I also tested with phone calls which works very well.The only minor drawback with the headphones is that it doesn't seem to have a labeling for right / left side.For those who are looking for a reasonably priced bluetooth headphones with decent quality, this is one to consider.Note : I received this product for testing and reviews

I have used several brands of Bluetooth keyboard cases for my Android tablets. The Belkin QODE Slim Style Universal Keyboard Case is well constructed and performs nicely with its slim style keyboard. What I like about this product over the others are as follows :- it holds with tablet quite nicely with its spring-action clips. The other cheaper units use elastic bands which do not securely hold the tablet in position- nice sensitive keyboard with specialized media playing function keys- holds standby power much longerThere are a couple of minor drawbacks with this unit :- the case is a but more heavier than the other units I used- the access to the micro-SD card slot for my Samsung Galaxy Tab  is blocked by the  top holding mechanism

I have a previous version of the Eton American Red Cross unit for my emergency survival kit some years ago. The Eton American Red Cross FR1 carries a lot of improvements over the previous version. It provides many essential features including duel power (with a built-in 2000 mAh lithium battery), bright 3-LED lights, clock with alarm, USB port for cell phones charging, and a 3-band (AM, FM, Weather band) radio with Weather band alert.I am also impressed with the quality of the speaker which provide loud and clear broadcasting. The FM reception is also excellent as I was able to receive strong local FM channel signals in my area.This is a great addition for our home emergency survival kit.

The Cuisinart CPSB-1515 Rustic Serving Board is thin and light which is great for placing hot items (not just pizzas) at the dining table. The wood materials are not consistent and it seems that some pieces are a bit on the rough side. This has a nicer appeal as compared to the plastic serving boards I use. It is not meant to be used as a cutting board.

The AmazonBasics Griffen 3-Seater Sofa Patio cover fits perfectly for my Outdoor  Chaise . The cover is made of high quality woven polyester fabric which withstands sunny and rainy weather well. The furniture cover slips on effortlessly and with loop handles for easy adjustment. The cover also comes with click-close straps to keep the cover in place even in windy condition.

The Belkin Road Rockstar charger fits perfectly for those who travels on the road with family members. The 4 USB ports works perfectly with the 2.4 A which provides rapid charging of my phone and tablets. It also makes driving long distance more peaceful without worrying the back-seat passengers constantly begging for using the car's USB ports for keeping their gaming and phones going. I used this product for a couple of road trips and it works as advertised so far.This product is a perfect fit for the family on-the-go.

The Phantom Aquatics Impulse 1500 LED dive light provides very bright lighting with a rugged casing which works very well for diving activities. The product comes in a hard plastic case with the charger, batteries, and carrying case. The dive light is powered by two 5000 mAh 3.7 V batteries which provides adequate lighting for many hours. The LEDs are very bright and covers a pretty wide area with upto 150 meter range. The construction is solid with heavy metallic materials.There are a couple of draw back with this product. There are non instructions on the how to operate and maintain the dive light. The cap is also  pretty tight which requires a lot of force to open for inserting the batteries.

The VTech Kidizoom Action Cam packs with a lot of features and accessories for the active kids to take photos and videos. It comes with a waterproof case, bike mount, camera holder, wrist strap, and micro USB cable. The setup is pretty easy with the on-screen display. We can take photos with self-timer and time-lapses photo recording. It also supports stop motion video which takes a series of photos during video capture. The battery would last for 2 - 2.5 hours per charge depending on the usage. We can also transfer the recorded files to the PC using the USB cable.The video resolution supports upto 640 x 480 which requires an external SD card (not included). The video looks good for outdoor recording. However, the video quality is not very good for indoor recording. Its freeze frames looked quite grainy and blurred.For its price and features, it is a nice beginner action cam for kids.

The Gigastone MicroSDXC 64GB C10 provides nice storage capacity with pretty decent Class 10 speed. It also has a good write performance which is nice for video recording applications.I ran a benchmark test with this SD card on my Samsung tablet and it registered 25 Mb/s read speed and 14 Mb/s write speeds. As compared to my other Class 4 SD card, it has a 44% improvement in read speed and 2.5 times improvement over the write speed.I used the SD card mainly for video recording and playing which runs quite well without problems,

I have used quite a few task chairs for my home office. The HON HVL511 Mid-Back Task Chair comes in the nice package including tools for the assembly. The instructions are well written and the assembly process is pretty straight-forward.The height and tilt of the task chair are adjustable similar to many other standard task chairs. The back support works quite well and I can seat on it comfortably for a few hours without any discomforts. It also provides enough cushioning for seating comforts. As other reviewers have also shared, the  main down-side for this chair is the short un-padded arm rest.Overall, for its price, this task chairs is a good choice for home / office use with its nice cushioning and back support.

The Ziploc Space Bag works nicely for providing compact storage for comforters with its XL flat bag. The bags are very easy to use and seals well with an air-tight storage. There are no needs for attaching a pump to suck the air out as we can simply roll and press the bag to squeeze out the air pockets.  It stays in its compacted shape for quite a long time.The Ziploc Space Bag also works very well for packing clothes in a luggage for travelling. I was able to save a lot of luggage space by using these bags.Highly receommended.

The National Geographic Walking Prague book comes just in time as I am travelling to Prague this month. I particularly enjoy self-guided tour on my trips as it gives us the flexibility and time to explore interesting places.The Walking Walking Prague book is compact (it measures 7" x 5.25") and fits nicely in my messenger bag. It is also categorized based on specific interests such as weekend travels, museum visits, church visits, musical places, and travelling with kids. The book provides a brief description on the place of interests and specific stops with colorful National Geographic's quality and stunning photographs. It also include numerous maps and information on places to eat. The back of the travel guide include travel essentials such as travelling tips, emergency contacts, hotels, and a brief language guide.The font size of this book is a bit small but it is certainly a nice handy tour book which I would consider bringing to the trip to Prague.

This Amazon Curated Collection Sapphire Heart Pendant necklace comes in a nice jewelry  box. The sapphire has a gorgeous sparkling red color which matches nicely with the charming heart-shaped pendant. I am pleasantly surprised as it has a very nice appeal as compared to other necklace in this price range.

The TP-LINK RE210 AC750 Universal Wireless Dual Band Range Extender is very easy to set up and configure by either using my PC or my phone. I hooked it up in a remote location where a printer is installed and it worked flawlessly to provide Ethernet connection to the printer. However, this unit seems to cause conflicts with my other brand of range extender which also uses the electrical outlet. The problem seems to be related on the electrical wiring around my house which limits the use of this extender.If we were to use it as a stand-alone range extender without other similar devices, this would be a good product to consider.

The DII Kitchen Millennium 4-Piece Heat Resistant tool set makes a nice addition to my existing cooking tools. They are easy to handle and heat resistance upto 480 degrees F which is good for a variety of cooking tasks.  The tools are also top-rack dishwasher safe which makes them easy to clean.I used the tool set for cooking several meals including some pan frying with the slotted turner under high heat. It worked well with not stuck food particles on the turner which happened to me sometimes with my other turner. The only issue I have is that the handle is a bit on the shorter side.

I have used many different brands of portable battery charger for my phones and tablets on-the-go. The TSST SAMSUNG SDI Polymer  Power Bank Charger works very well when I tested it on my Samsung S5 and Galaxy 7 tablet. It has a similar form factor as the Samsung S5 and weights only 4.8 oz. The battery outputs include one 1 A and 2.4 A regular USB port and we can charge two devices simultaneously.The unit also has a LED display showing the current percentage capacity of this portable battery.I tested the charging capability by connecting a fully charged unit to my Samsung S5 with its battery discharged. It was able to bring it to full charge within 2 hours using the 1A port with 66% battery capacity left. If was also able to provide a complete charge of my Samsung Galaxy 7 tablet.For those who need a high capacity and portable battery power on-the-go, this product is a good one to consider. Highly recommended.

I used the Garnier Skin Ultra-Lift Miracle Sleeping Cream for 2 weeks by applying it right before bedtime. It does produce noticeable effects. My eyes are less puffy when I wake up in the morning.I have tried many other type of eye creams. This product is one of the few that produces noticeable effects.

I have used different brands of packaging tape for shipping. The Gorilla Glue 6045001 Shipping Tape is quite easy to use with a nice quality dispenser. The tape also sticks pretty well to the packaging boxes with one simple application.Higher recommended !

The Belkin Power Pack 2000 mAh is light, compact, and easy to carry round on trips. It  works with my Samsung phone and tablet and provides a good connection for charging these devices.However, 2000 mAh is generally not enough power for a complete charge. I tested this unit several times by fully charging it and connect it to my Samsung S5 with drained battery. The Berlkin Power pack ran out of juice at around 60% charge level for the Samsung S5. It can only power my Sansung Galaxy 7" tablet for about 2.5 hours before it runs out.  I have no problem with my other 5600 mAh power pack which can fully charge my Samsung devices on the road.I would consider using this power pack mainly as emergency backup power.

I mounted these LEDs boards on my QAV250 frame. They are very bright and visible even for daylight flying.The adhesive pads that came with it are a little thin. I used the 3M heavy duty double sided adhesive tapes instead.

I own an Instant Pot pressure cooker which is a popular pressure cooker model. The Elite Platinum EPC-678SS MaxiMatic 11-Function pressure cooker provides very similar functionality as the Instant Pot for a lesser price. We can do pressure cooking, saute, steaming, slow cooking, rice cooking, and canning with delay start timer and adjustable cooking time.What I like more about this product is its ease of use with the numerous customized preset cooking buttons on the display panel. All we need is to press one button and the remaining process is pretty much automated. The user manual is well written and easy to follow. It is also packed with pages of well written cooking recipes covering meat, soup, sauce, salsa and jam. I tried the pressure cooker using the pork spareribs (about 3 lb in weight) recipe in the instruction manual. It took about 10 minutes for it to pressurize and 26 minutes to complete the cooking. The spareribs turned out very tender and juicy.There are a couple areas which the design could be enhanced. The top cover does get very hot during the cooking process (the lid includes a warning sticker regarding hot temperature). I believe it is due to the lack of insulation materials. The instant Pot's top cover  is a lot cooler in comparison. Another area is that there is no adjustment on the pressure settings. This might not be a big issue since we can adjust the cooking time to compensate for it.For those who are looking for a full functions pressure cooker for a reasonable price, this would be one to consider.

I have read many Arduino project books. The Adventures in Arduino is very well organized with various fun projects for the young Arduino adventurers.The book is very well organized with colorful illustrations for building the circuits and detailed code for each project. The code can also be downloaded from a link provided in the the book. The book also mentioned that there are video instructions on the website. However, at the time of this review, I cannot locate the videos on the website yet.Here are the general descriptions of the projects in this book :- Adventure 1 : Setting up your Arduino  Provides an excellent introduction to Arduino with its components and software installation- Adventure 2 : Reading from Sensors  Introduction to simple Arduino programming using LED and a potentiometer- Adventure 3 : Working with Servos  Working with servo motors and building a combination safe- Adventure 4 : Using Shift registers  Working with a shift register IC and building your name in lights. Introduction to programming in loops using functions- Adventure 5 : Playing Sounds  Working with a buzzer and programming a wind chime using arrays and loops- Adventure 6 : Adding Libraries Making a crystal ball with capacity sensing circuit using code libraries- Adventure 7 : Working with Arduino Leonardo  The Arduino Leanado is a newer version broad with built-in USB interface and more digital I/Os for expanding our applications- Adventure 8 : Working with the Lilypad The Lilypad is another version of Arduino which is designed for wearables. This projects builds a POV (Persistent Point of View) hoodie with arrays and data passing using functions- Adventure 9 : The Big Adventure - Building a Marble Maze Game  The is the final and most complex project with sensor and sounds . The program also keep scores.

I have been using the Foscam security camera with remote access for checking my indoor activities while away from home. This required quite some technical work to set up including port-forwarding configuration on my AT&T router. The FLIR FX is a lot easier to set up by simply plugging it in and installing the FLIR FX app. I was able to get it up and running within 5 minutes including the registration of the FLIR account for remote viewing.There are quite a few nice features which I like about this product particularly its ability to do a quick video review. This is very useful for visually checking a potential break-in when I received an alert from my remote alarm system. Here is a list of what I like about this product :- nice video quality with two-way voice communication- wide field of view with digital zoom (it does not support panning)- easy access to action and recording from the app- smart zone recording to avoid false motion triggers- various sensitivity adjustment including audio, motion, temperature, and humidity- built-in rechargeable battery for recording outdoor activities  (lasts for about 2 hours)- free cloud basic with limited 3 recap per month and 48 hours of event storage. For those who only wanted to use rapid recap for occasional events, this would be sufficeIt would have been nice if this camera supports remote panning. May be this product is still new , I was not able to register the product or locate a full product manual from the FLIR website.

The packaging of South Shore Jambory TV Stand with Storage Bins on Casters needs some improvements as I received the product with the top board damaged. I also noticed that there were no protective materials wrapped around it which made it more prone to shipping damages. The customer support was pretty good and they shipped a replacement part right away..The South Shore Jambory TV Stand with Storage Bins on Casters is quite heavy and would require some help for the assembly. It is primarily made of particle board materials. The assembly instructions were quite well written with the parts clearly labelled. The storage bins with casters are nice for storage items out of sight. The top section provides pretty good clearance for placing my DVD player and receivers.The product is not as stylish as I would like but it provides practical use as a TV stand with storage bins.

My wife has used various brand of perfumes. She likes the Josie By Josie Natori Eau de Parfum which carries a nice floral scent. The design of the bottle is quite nice with a stylish appealThe perfume carries a slight musk scent  with subtle hints of the sampaguita flower. It also has a pretty long lasting fragrance and remains strong throughout the evening.

I have been handling my own investment and retirement planning for years. Social security is a critical element for supporting our later years and it is very important for it to be accurately reflected  in our retirement modelling and analysis.The Social Security For Dummies provides a comprehensive and thorough coverage on the Social  Security system. This book provides a nice introduction for those who are unfamiliar with Social Security and expanded details for those who wanted to get a deeper understanding of this complex system. It also provides a nice guidance to help the readers to make to proper decisions to fully leverage the Social System's benefits tailored to the individual's situations. It covers various situations such as survivor benefits, disabilities, and discusses the pros and cons of delaying the application of the benefits. The book also provides some general information to the Medicare program.For those who are interested in retirement planning, this is a great book to add to their reference library.
Love this carving board. The size is just right for my daily meal preparation and dough making. Great quality and well made.

The  Acer Aspire Switch 12 is a nice choice for those looking for a larger sized touch screen notebook which can also be used as a tablet. I particularly like its versatile design with the detachable keyboard and smooth pivoting hinge which allow us to switch easily between the desktop , notebook, and display modes. The entire unit (with both the display and keyboard) weights about 3.1 lb. The tablet display itself weights about 2.5 lb.The Acer Aspire Switch 12 is thin and easy to carry around. It comes with 1 micro-USB 3.0 port, HDMI micro port, web cam, microSD card ready, and a stereo speaker. I would prefer to have more than 1 micro-USB port instead of carrying a USB hub to hook up multiple devices. The keyboard  is light and quite responsive. It also has a pointing stick for controlling the cursor. The touch screen operations are also quite smooth and sensitive. However, the display is not as bright as compared to the other touch screen laptops I am using. This also makes it a bit hard to read under bright sunlight.I installed my frequently used programs including the Microsoft office, video editing and photo editing software. The applications started quite quickly and they ran quite smoothly without glitches. Performance of the Acer Aspire Switch 12 is pretty nice indeed. I ran the full suite of the PCmark 8 home computing tests and get a evaluation score of 1988. This is quite a bit better than my Dell Inspiron 11 touch-screen notebook with the Pentium N3530 processor which scores 1353 on the PCmark. From the individual benchmark tests, the web browsing and video chatting tests also scored quite well and are comparable to the other laptops with higher end processors.Overall, this is a pretty nice versatile unit for multiple purposes with pretty decent processing power. I would have given this a 5-star rating if it comes with a brighter and better display.

I have been a fan of Hershey's chocolate for years. The Hershey's Nuggets Milk Chocolate with Toffee provides great treats for the family with its nice attractive gold wraps and creamy crunchy taste,. The 3 lb 12 oz bag would provide enough treats for a large gathering and events. I would not recommend it for individual consumption as It could be quite a bit addictive with it extra creamy milk chocolate mixed with toffee and almond.

For about the same price, the SOLAR 6/12 Volt 4.0 Amp PRO-LOGIX charger provides more capabilities as compared to my existing battery charger. The charger covers a wide variety of battery types including the conventional, maintenance free, AGM, Gel Cell, spiral wound, and deep cycle batteries.  Its also has a nice display panel which provides useful information including the battery voltage, battery type, modes, and charging progress.The charger has intelligent functions built-in for monitoring the charge state of the battery and turns off its output. This is ideal for battery maintenance and avoiding over-charging of the battery. It also has a variety of protection circuitry for checking reverse polarity, battery fault, short circuit, and over-voltage. This charge is easy to use and works quite reliably for maintaining my car batteries and occasional re-conditioning of my home solar panel batteries.Highly recommended.

The Arkon Windshield or Dashboard Sticky Suction Universal Magnet Mount works nicely for mounting my Samsung phone on-the-go. The kit comes with the mounting pedestal with a smooth operating 17 mm ball head, adhesive pad for dash mounting, and magnet head / metal plates. It also comes with an alcohol pad for cleaning the surface area for secure mounting of the adhesive.The metal plate fits nicely on my Samsung phone case and holds steadily to the magnet head. I found this more convenient to use as compared to the snap on mounting which I was accustomed to. The mount also works nicely with my mobius action camera as dash-board camera.Highly recommended for phone and camera mounting on-the-go.

The Scotts Turf Builder Grass Seed provides an cost-effective solution for minor repair for our lawns.The product is very easy to apply by using a lawn rake and fertilizer spreader. It does not require heavy watering which is important for the critical drought situations in California. It worked quite well for growing new grass on the side of my backyard lawn and sections affected by squirrels. And it costs much less than replacing that with a new lawn.Highly recommended

The Extech MN10 Pocket Multimeter  comes with the batteries pre-installed and it is compact enough to carry it around in the pocket. The display is sharp and easy to read. I also found the non-contact voltage sensing function very useful as it provides a safe and convenient way to check for live outlets,However, this multipmmeter is lacking a few functions such as  audio continuity tester, auto-power off, and auto range function which can be found in other multimeters for the same price range.If you need to check for live voltage for outlets frequently, this would be a great tool to buy.

I have been using various Colgate products and very please with their results. The Colgate Optic White Platinum Toothpaste seems appealing based on its claim of achieving whitening results in 3 days. I followed the directions and used it continuously for 4 days. Unfortunately I have not noticed any improvements at all. I also prefer the better taste on the other versions of Colgate toothpaste.

The Philips 65-Watt Equivalent SlimStyle LED Dimmable Light Bulb fits perfectly for the recessed fixtures with its 4" long  neck. The bulb uses 9.5 mA current with a 2700K color temperature.. Its 3.5" diameter flat  surface also provides excellent even lighting for the study area or kitchen. The dimming functions also works very well with no buzzing at the dim setting.Highly recommended !

I have used several different brands of iPhone battery case and the Lenmar iPhone 6 Battery Case is by far the best in its class. Here is what I like about the product.- light weight and provides good protection for the iPhone with its raised edges- recharges an iPhone within 2 hours- using micro USB connection for both charging the unit and syncing with the iPhone 6- nice quality speakerHigh recommended !

The Miracle Gro Ultra Lite Hose is built with nice quality materials. Installation is easy and it fits perfectly to my garden faucet.There are a few features which I particularly like as compared to the other garden hoses I have used. It is noticeably lighter as advertised which makes it easier to maneuver  for watering our garden and washing our cars. The hose also stretches and extends nicely with no annoying kinking effects. And it performs quite well even with full water pressure.If you want a durable and easy to use garden hose, this would be a good selection to consider.

The Linksys N600 PRO Wi-Fi Range Extender was pretty easy to set up for the first time. All we needed was to plug it in an outlet and use a tablet to the set up the extender. I measured roughly 15% gain on the signal strength of my existing Wifi network.The problem was that once we have it set up, there are no instructions on how to add another network or verify that the extender is functioning. I was not able to re-do the setup as the http address for the Linksys Extender set up was apparently no longer accessible. After playing around the unit for a while, I found out there was a small opening on the unit which allow us to do a reset by pressing it with a paper clip's tip. This allows us to re-configure and/or adding new Wifi connection. I also discovered that by using the Wifi Analyzer Android App, I was able the see both the original Wifi signal and the extended Wifi signal which confirms that the extender is working.I hope Linksys can improve the setup guide to reflect these steps and make it easier for the users.

The Miele Compact C2 Onyx Canister Vacuum is well built and runs very quietly with its 1200 watt low-noise motor. Here is what a I like about this product :- very easy to set up with the parts snapped nicely together- telescoping wand for hard-to-reach areas- adjustable suction power with the rotary dial on the vacuum unit- one-button operated retractable power-cord- 3 replaceable filters system including the FJM HyClean  filter bag, dust compartable filter, and exhaust filter- easy access to the accessory tools with the accessory clip on the top of the telescoping wandI have tried the vacuum on various surfaces including carpet, hard wood floor, and sofa. It works very nicely and easy to maneuver around some tight spaces. There are a couple of slight drawbacks with this unit. The capacity of the FJM filter bag is about 3.7 quarts which would require more frequent replacement if we do a lot of vacuuming. The rollers on floor brush are a bit small which makes it a bit harder to move over heavy carpets.Overall, I like this unit a lot based on its compact size and built quality. The product also comes with a 7-year motor / warranty and 1 year warranty for the other parts of the product.

The Kenwood KMC010 Chef comes in a large box with the mixer, blender, and food processor in separate boxes. The  main contents include :- 750W 4.9 Quarts mixer with whisk, dough hook, and K-beater attachment- glass blender with 1.2 liter capacity for hot ingredients and 1.6 liter capacity for cold ingredients- food processor with six blades for rasping, fine grating, coarse grating, thin slice, thick slice, and julienne.The mixer unit works quite well for making dough and the motor operates quietly. However, it lacks of a timer function as compared to the other mixer I am using. The unit is easy to clean and maintain. The instruction manual is pretty brief with some general guidance on using the K-beater, whisk, and dough hook.  There is no recipes guide / booklet.The glass blender attaches nicely on the top of the unit and works well for both hot ingredients and crushing ice. The stainless steel blade is removable for cleaning. The food processor's blades are well made with good quality materials for the lid and bowl. The parts are also dish-washer safe.This product is quite compact and is great for the kitchen lovers. The unit comes with a 1-year limited warranty and 5-year motor warranty.

With more devices using the USB interface for connection nowadays, the TP-LINK UH720 USB 3.0 7-Port Hub  provides a nice compact option for connecting my USB devices . Currently I have to daisy chain two separate 4-port USB hubs in order to get enough ports for my external USB hard drives, tablets, SD cards reader, scanner, and printer.With the TP-Link hub, I get a more reliable and fast connection with the powered USB 3.0 slots. One minor drawback is the large size of the power adapter. Other than that it is a nice unit to have for my desktop PC.

I have used various models of grip and grab tools which are very handy for grabbing out-of-reach items, yard cleanups, and picking up golf balls.  The PikStik Pro Aluminum Reacher is unique with its rotatable jaw head which allows us to pick up items easier without having to twist our arms. It has a pistol type grip which fits comfortably in our hands. The product seems to be also well built with a thicker arm than other similar products.

The Adventures in Raspberry Pi provides a well organized approach to the introduction of the Raspberry Pi hardware and programming techniques for the younger readers.The first two chapters provides an overview of the Raspberry Pi and its installation process. Chapters 3 to 7 focus on programming techniques with the Scratch and Python programming languages. The projects are well chosen including games with  graphics animation. For those who are new to programming, this is a great way to start. The last two chapters focus on using Raspberry Pi's I/O interface to control external hardware with a LCD screen Pi Jukebox project towards the end.This book is packed with colorful illustrations and pictures.  For the hardware projects, it includes pictures of the components connection instead of the harder to read circuit schematics. What's also neat is that it includes links to the website with videos of each of the projects.This is a nice book for those who what to experiment with Raspberry Pi and programming techniques,

I have used several paint programs including the Corel Painter X3 which is intended for more serious and professional applications. The Corel Painter Essentials 5 provides a set of nice features for general photos touch-up and artwork painting. I like its simple user friendly interface which requires very little learning to use. The program also works nicely with my Wacom tablet.On top of its standard painting tools, the program also has an auto-paint feature which automatically enhance our photos with various styles and effects. I found this feature pretty fun to use for adding artistic effects to the photos.If you are looking for a good painting software for general photos touch-up and effects, these would be a good one to consider.

Buddy Reynolds has written an excellent book.This is not an autobiography, but rather a series of chapters about different people in his life (Betty Davis, kids from high school and college).  This allows him to tell his own story in an indirect fashion, Bert through the years with people he admires, or just wants to tell us about.  The writing is smooth, entertaining, pithy, and wise.  He does not shy away from any element of his past, and there is a direct honesty when he tells about people, their foibles, faults, generosity, and brilliance.As a result, this is a very good book!  I am surprised to say that, because I am not into "celebrity biographies".  Think of this as a set of stories by a master story teller, who happens to be a celebrity.

The Turtle Beach Earforce 50x headphones have a great build quality and feel nice around the ears. They're a little tight fitting, but that shouldn't be a problem for most consumers.My two main complaints are that of compatibility and audio quality. Because the 50x works through a single 3.5 mm audio cable, I was required to buy an adapter in order for it to work with my gaming PC. Music, Netflix, and games sounded slightly muffled and less clear through the 50x when compared to my older pair of Turtle Beach x12s. The x12's mic was also the cleaner and clearer of the two.In closing, I would highly recommend the Turtle Beach Earforce 50x to console gamers, and would advise PC gamers to look for a better alternative.

This is a bifurcated review.My son (who loves fantasy novels, Brandon Sanderson, big epics, and funny YA novels) was bored by this novel.  The approach, focusing on the normal kids on the sidelines of the superhero fight, lost him.  The style lost him.  The slow start lost him (Dad, the 5 characters they throw at you in the first pages were all limp).Me, who has read tons of YA fiction over the years, to help find him good books to read, liked this quite a bit.  The main characters -- Mikey, etc -- face real problems with their personalities, the limnal edge of leaving high school, all with superhero stuff as a backdrop.  There were some quite witty moments.Maybe too meta for an actual young adult reader?

I have 4 televisions, and this is the clearest and best.  I mounted this on the stand, which was a little finicky, and the screws do not seem to all be needed or to work in the holes, but two worked, and the stand is now strong with some of my own screws, so that was OK.The access inputs for cable, computer, and DVD player are all easy to use, and I have an excellent picture with antenna...  The picture is the sharpest of the 4.... you can rally see how technology is making televisions sharper, better, easier to use, and this one is a fine product.

This is a bartender's starter kit.  The kit contains adequate tools to stock a beginner's bar, and comes in an attractive package; this would be a good gift for someone who decided to have a bar, or get into cocktail making.  This is not an advanced kit, and the tool set is decent...... the company provides some pretty cool links to videos about cocktail making.

I am surprised that I like this.This is a large unit that cleans, crisps, and deodorizes a wide range of clothing.  I use it to touch up suits and suit jackets, to give them a boost, rather than taking them to the expensive dry cleaners.  This uses pods, which are about 50 cents each, meaning this is economical to use.... This takes up room, but if you got it, not a bad addition to the laundry.....

3 starsOverall, the Razer Serval functions as only an average Android controller, and has no function as PC game controller. The build quality is average at best; it is not even an equivalent of the cheaper controller it was modeled after. I would strongly recommend passing over this item in favor of cheaper Android controllers or the other Xbox controllers designed by Razer.

This is a box with 5 chocolate bars in it.  These are not just plain Hershey bars with almonds; the chocolate is smoother and finer, and more flavorful.  They are excellent -- but mine came melted, so perhaps do not mail well during the August heat.  Would I give these to someone as a gift?  They seem all dressed up -- box, gold wrappers -- but still just candy bars.  Maybe.... but tasty!

This book lacks the flow of easy writing, and instead reads a bit blocky.  The main characters are two boys, survivors of a shooting that contains mysteries, many years later.  Did Cal Henderson's Mom really kill most of her family?  The two boys, now men, pursue the truth, amidst complications.The narrative is choppy, reads like a series of briefs, is sometimes too explanatory and not enough doing, too much telling not enough showing.  The writer fleshes out the scenes with a completeness that removes the crackle of suspense.  There is not a sense that the author really knows what a psychologist does, and the clich of a beautiful secretary, carried over from detective novels, does not work here.This is a swing and a miss.  The book is good enough to be average, barely, and is a first effort.  Maybe the next will be better.

This wood slotted turner feels good in your hand, and is useful for pans that might scratch; the handle is not wood, and cleans pretty easily.  I like this tool, it is dressy; I guess that Rick Bayless is creating a line of cooking utensils, and I also have his molcajete, and so I am a bobo, but this is a pretty nice flipper.I used it for risotto last night, and it worked great, but the rice did get stuck in the slots!

My favorite is Green Mountain Kenyan AA, and I also like several other dark coffees.  This Cafejo is milder, but with a rich flavor, with overtones of complexity from roasting (they call it carmelization, which made my son think it was caramel coffee -- let's just say roasting).This is a very nice keurig, does not have that washed out flavor that so many do....

Fun!  These are what I wanted as a kid.  They perform very well over the distance of our park, a few miles away when hiking -- a little less well in crowded urban areas.  They give weather reports, allow connection and are just what I need when out for a long walk on a camping trip.  Easy to charge, easy to use.Used these on Mt Washburn in Yellowstone, when my wife sprinted up the hill, and my son and I turtled behind her.  They worked great in the wilderness, gave us peace of mind about being separate.

These are larger than they appear in the photo.  Sort of like small pitchers.And they are very nice, solid, and attractive.  Good for a large margarita, or for a large planter's punch.Get 8.  Have a party.

The selection of poems is excellent,and the organization into chapters according to meter and rhyme is very helpful.  In a way, this is the academic class in poetry and meter that non-poetry majors feel they lack, given with a light touch within an excellent collection.  I put this into my carry on bag....I also like that some of the poems are chosen for the style they epitomize, which means that this is not just the usual suspects, only, but some that are not in other collections.  This is a good book to have in your carry on case.

My son is using this nice lamp as an aide to his computer repairs.  This lamp is great for desk work, and can articulate, moving the light to the spot necessary.  Well built, attractive, a tool as well as a light.

This is a gentle, well written journal of the author's year in Rome, raising twin sons, with his wife and a stroller and the backdrop of the hills of Rome.  The author weaves spirituality, travel writing, parenting, the life of a writer, and a sharp eye for detail into a book that makes you want to be a parent.OK, you thought that I would accredit the book with making a reader want to return to Rome.  It does.... and it makes you want to write, and read Pliny, and eat pizza, and see the Piazza Navona.... but the twins and the struggle to be a father take center stage.This is writing, the kind of book that an award winner can publish, and is so graceful and well done that it becomes beloved.

This is not "The Water Knife".  This is more "The Water Collander" -- a narrative thread that wanders, a story that is not engrossing, characters that are indulgent, writing that is awkward and uneven.We are in the middle of dystopia pornography, a sub-branch of the pornography of death, an era where every aspiring author has to have one novel about the end of times.  Thirty years ago, every author had to have an incest moment (Think "A Thousand Acres".)This one by Claire Watkins is set in the Southwest, land of swimming pools, dry in a drought at the end of times.  We have Luz and Ray and a baby and a group of people trying to survive, told in a mildly convoluted and entirely unconvincing style, without verve, without spark, without the kind of writing that crackles.  The result is dis-spiriting.As the relationship develops, the drought and the travel serve as a metaphor... wait, wait, do I need the drought to be a metaphor for a dying relationship between Ray and Luz?  The mountain range is a mortar and the colony moves through the desert, although it is almost as if the desert moves through the colony, or some such meandering writerly stuff, and we feel a sad sense of foreboding, or maybe a foreboding sense of sadness, or maybe the tragic sense of loneliness, or maybe life is s*** when there is no water, and relationships dry up, and the reader begins to pound his head on the table in a migraine of pain that Ray feels for us as he walks, and the reason to read this book dwindles into the distance, and the book moves through me like water in a desert that does not exist, and I put the book down and cannot find it anywhere, but OK, I can live with that.

I liked this book, until the end, at which point I threw it against the wall in disgust.The story alternates between a cop and a ship's captain, as they are maneuvered midst the forces of a inter-system war between Earth, Mars, and the Belts...There is a bit too much of a lens effect -- where all events are focused through the actions of these two persons.Then -- SPOLIER -- we get to the ending of this book one.  And ending in which the crazed cop argues the skeptical ship's captain into magically thwarting the combined forces of all other plants, hundreds of bombs, all to save the life of an alien-consumed girl who might not exist.  And they pull this off, because that is what the author wrote they did, common sense be damned.Yet, see, I don't have to buy book two if book one ends so stupidly.  And I can say that this author might be worth it for a later work, or works, but this was dang dumb.

I got this entirely because I was unsure if I wanted to return to Florence.  My one visit was hot, tired, and in-between, if you know what I mean.  As a result, when people talk about going to Tuscany I usually counter with going to Provence.  This book is a guide to the towns and valleys around Florence, as well as Florence, and by the end of reading this, I have created a list of what might attract a return visit.... so it is a good guide!

Totally Cool Recipes..... fish fingers!  Recipes for your kid who loves Potter and Who and the gang.  We challenged my kid to make at least one of these, and get a bit into cooking (and independence and such).  Worked like a charm, and some of the recipes are pretty good.

I am not a user of cologne, aftershave, man-scent; my wife was delighted when I got this, so that she could mark me with the mark of a woman.Err... I mean, so that she could have a new venue for gifts for years to come.Surprisingly, it is not bad.  Not bad is what a Midwestern guy says when confronted by a nice, manly, neutral, and appealing scent.  There is no higher praise.

I gave this book to my son.He started by calling this weird.  Then he started reading passages out loud to us, commenting on how brilliant and weird they were.  The book, about a young man on a ship on the way to explore the challenger deep, is a metaphor on stilts, a whirling storm of images, from talking 6 foot tall parrots to a ship that is alive.  The metaphorical storm carries along the descent into self, into depression and anxiety, that the young man suffers.I enjoyed the book, my son now loves the book.  But true creativity is difficult and hard, and so a casual reader may put this book down too soon, and miss the genius.

The science of matching -- from kidney donors to college bowl teams, from residencies for doctors to school selections -- is part art and part design, and the master of this field is Alvin Roth.  This book outlines the cornerstones of making a matching system work, from thickness to safety, aspects of matching systems that keep cheating, unraveling, and relative advantage from eating a matching system alive.Using examples from his work, and that of his students, Roth shows that design is possible, that analysis of broken or unraveled systems can yield fixes.This is pretty exciting stuff, because we all live and choose within matching systems, where price does not create a demand and supply curve, but rather choice sets create a "game" that can be "gamed" -- and that can be made workable.  This book shows how.The book is written at an undergraduate level, and the author seems to be a bit vague in the initial third, where he sets his terms.  He is also a little light in describing his solutions, lacking some technical detail.  I would suppose that he gets paid for his real analyses, and this is for more popular reading.That said, it is a heartening read, because it shows what good analysis and design can do, to assure both fairness and efficiency.

This is one of the best fantasy novels of the year.  The story of a telegraph clerk (Thaniel) in London, 1884, during a series of bombings.  He makes friends with a Japanese watch maker.  There is a mystical but very understated connection between the two.  He meets a woman, Grace, a scientist, feminist, brilliant character.  The story weaves magical themes, Victorian England, Japanese culture, watches, bombings, suspense, adventure, real character depth, tantalizing clues and a mystery.The book comes to center on an impromptu, surprising, and yet emotionally complex triangle between the central three... I did not entirely see this coming, but it made great sense and was a bit nerve wracking... good writing!This is a very fun book to read.  The octopus alone is worth the price of the book.  One of the top three I have read this year, far better than the Norell book.

Packaged like a fine collection of cigarettes, these chocolates are smooth, creamy, and come as a variety of flavors.  The almond is best, mint is great, could use more dark chocolates, wait they are all GONE!  Who ate my chocolates?These are really nice, fine quality.  The writing on the back of each states the flavor, and that makes it hard for old eyes to pick out.  Each chocolate breaks into two pieces.  Really nice after dinner treat!

The islands of Dara are united under a single Emperor.  The Emperor is not universally liked.  His son ascends to the throne in what is a civil war, or a war of dis-unification.  There are airships and air combat, and there are Gods who watch and sometimes intervene.  Kuni Garu and Mata Zyndu are two main characters, weaving banditry, rebellion (Garu) and the aristocracy (Zyndu) into an attempt to create a sweeping epic that will take multiple volumes.This book requires an investment that will take far more than the 600 pages of the initial volume.  So, a reader needs patience.  I found the pace and the complexity slowed my enjoyment the more I read.  The problem is that this is sort of a King of Thrones and sort of an Initiate Brother, in scope and in complexity, but the middle passages make me begin to nod off...So I tried to re-kindle my interest, and get into the kingdom of Dara as a setting, and that helped -- island warfare, airships, swords and factions.  I would end by saying that I liked the book, but you have to make sure to work to like the book, of you know what I mean....

This is a very zaa! pop book, with great graphics, good color quality, and lots and lots of information about careers, the requirements and pathways to getting them.This would be very good for a younger kid with a wide range of interests, who needs to work through what he/she might be, and look at lots of options.  This would be useless for a kid with 1-3 narrow interests, because that kid would be wading through tons of irrelevant careers.  I would pitch this book at grades 8-10, and NOT at grades 10-12...Very high quality.

Finally, a well written straight forward biography of one of the most interesting men of the late 20th.Like most who came of age during the Carter-Reagan years, I learned of these men through a filter of hate -- sometimes for Carter, often for Reagan.  Our national media is a disgrace, moving right past the story to the vitriol, President after President.This book tells the man's story, from his youth, to his death.  The writing is clear and informative, and the author shows the man, not the myth.  The result is a good book about a great man.Note I did not say a perfect man, or an icon, or a saint.  Those would be boring books to read.  I have read Morris, and I have read Noonan, and this book betters both by far, and adds a clear eye.  This is a great book to read and informative for anyone, even someone stunted by the media of the age, and their dark tellings of Presidents they hated.

My son and I both love Earl Grey Tea; we got a Keurig and love it.  So, trying this tea was a natural.They are not lying when they note that this has vanilla high lights.... very vanilla highlights.  The vanilla either adds a richness and depth to the underlying Earl Grey -- or spoils it.  We were divided, even within ourselves, on this question.  I finally came down on liking this tea, but a buyer needs to know that this is vanilla Earl Grey, not simple and direct Earl Grey.

This is an attractive pan -- white enamel on the bottom.  It is deeper than you might think, a good pan for a stove-top all in one meal.  I made arroz con pollo, and it was easy and wonderful.  Non-stick surface makes cleaning this easy, and the pan is light for such a large pan.  I would use this for a stovetop stew, anything that requires some initial carmelizing, and a larger volume.  This is a very nice pan!

Best opening sentence of the year.I am a fan of some of Stephenson's books -- and this is one of the good ones.  I did not like Reamde, because in the end the scope of the story did not support the length of the novel.  Whether I was right on that, or not, this (Seveneyes) is a big, epic, very cool book.  The writing draws you in -- the story of how humans attempt to survive after the moon blows up.  All told with good science and solid physics; choices made by characters that matter, story that makes sense, within the huge chain of events, leading to survival, then re-colonization of Earth.This was very fun to read, a great epic story.
This is larger than it looks, takes up one side of a Queen.  Works great for reading, very comfortable, good support.  My son immediately stole it.  I stole it back.  Great pillow!

Oliver "Boo" Dalrymple is a pale kid born with a hole in his heart.  He dies, and awakes in a town populated by other thirteen year olds who have died.  They are in an afterlife, which is a challenge to a kid who is an atheist and a science guy.  A friend arrives -- Johnny Henzel.  It turns out that their deaths involve a mystery.This is a well written, funny, interesting, challenging, and wonderful book.  The lead personality is an interesting character, and the story is both lively and challenging.  Short, funny, a great book for your teen, and suspense filled.  The main mystery -- who shot up the school, killed Boo and his friend -- takes the reader into some very dark places.  We are dealing with murder, suicide, school bullying, a Lord of the Flies atmosphere, teen justice.  The author handles these deep subjects with sensitivity and some depth.I was sad when I finished this book.  Without giving anything away, Boo is both a fascinating character, and a sad character.  What kids do to each other can be very dark, very sad, and what we do to ourselves more so.  But this book is, on balance, a positive story, one that is compelling.

The Fold centers on Mike Erikson, a local every day guy who is also a genius.  Asked by a friend to evaluate a device that a team of "government scientists" has developed, that promises teleportation, he uses his mental alacrity, which he describes as "ants" that help him analyze, to unfold the problems with the technology, and the hidden secrets that threaten human existence.I thought this book weak.  The book has a lot of dialogue, and the author lacks crackling wit.  Instead, people talk and talk and the conversations are developmental, rather than interesting in their own right.  The metaphor of ants is also lazy, because it is essentially magical -- rather than write a Sherlock, the author has mental ants "think".  At one point, the author has the ants working overtime, when instead would it not be more fun to have a main character who actually thinks?  And a writer who can describe logical analysis?The "ants" seem to be a simple method of categorization, a mental cross-tabulation of sorts, the most simple form of "thinking" any reasoned person can do...  The author describes this process as a rather magical act, the opposite of ratiocination, and thereby removes any grounding for a description of the main character as "brilliant".  He is not brilliant.  His "ants" are able to somehow lead him to leaps in logic that are magical, ill-described, and insulting to the reader.  Has the author ever figured out a difficult problem, from fixing a car to doing an algebra equation, and if so, why can he not simply describe this process, of thinking?Here is a quote:  "The ants leaped into overdrive.  They counted and catalogued and quantified.  They gave him more details then he wanted to know."  At this point, I began to wonder if the author meant that the main character actually had ANTS in his MIND, which is GROSS.  Or if his inability to have a main character think, and do things like organize thoughts, collate data, and make leaps of logic meant that we were all going to have to suffer this lame, gross, disgusting, and lazy substitute for decent writing.The author has problems with dialogue --- "Sasha let out a string of f---s".  Nice writing.  Nice mouth on that character. Is this the "poetic" writing I was lead to expect?The book is mildly inappropriate, for younger teens, and the shoot em up adventures are wooden.  The broad scope -- multiverses, bug creatures, etc, meant to be an exciting homage to 1950s science fiction, I suppose, actually comes across as wooden, poorly plotted, and sort of dumb.  Not an exciting book.

You need a Weber Smokey Mountain Cooker to make this book come alive.  That is in the title, and so this should not be a surprise.  Every recipe (nearly) refers to this.I have had the book 24 hours, and will update later, but have tried a rub, and beer can chicken, and they were easy to use, on the smoker, and other recipes look great, and also within my limited abilities.  (Update:  After 6 days, it is a great book!)Very timely.  Buy this second.  After the WSMC'er.

Syzmborska was perhaps the greatest poet in the late 20th Century.  That is an opinion.  Also my opinion is this:  her writing is clear, inviting, open, charming, intelligent, and accessible."What made me fill myself with me so squarely?Why am I staring now into the darkand muttering this unending monologuejust like the growling thing we call a dog?"This collection spans her entire career, includes her last works, is brilliantly translated, and you should buy this, read a poem a night, and a poem a day, and mutter to yourself like that thing we call a dog, and enjoy this fine, fine collection.

Larsen is hoisted by his own petard, reviewed by his own words.  At one early point in this story of Radar Radmanovic, a child born black with strange abilities, to a white family, the author has Charlene, Radar's mother, discuss Dickens.  Interlarded literary comment and pointed literary homage are a tool for this writer - and at this point he has characters note that Dickens himself creates characters like robots, who then go off within the book and do things... each a sort of distanced authorial automaton.That is Radar.  That is Charlene, his mother.  That is a description of all of the characters in this over-written, boring, wordy, precious, and cold book.  A different reviewer referred to the comic aspects of the book.  I did not get it.  Not a laugh.  This is a writing exercise metastasized into a novel of great length, by a writer who seems bent on characterization and inventiveness to the exclusion of pace, or compelling story.A case in point -- the life story of Charlene, through drug addiction to Radar.  This reads like a writing exercise in a junior college writing class... create a backstory for your major characters.  Fine, but did this have to plop down within the book, or could an editor have helped?  And the story -- tergiversations of preciousness!  Leaving the reader to mutter -- who cares, who cares, who cares.I could go chapter by chapter (although skimming did start to happen).This is built to win a book award.  But the writing, in each paragraph, can be very good.

This is a very nice little pitcher.  Right now, I have it filled with water on my refrigerator door, and it takes up about as much space as a carton of milk.You can chop lemons, or put tea in, and get an infused drink, and the lid serves as a strainer, keeping the tea leaves and lemon seeds out of your drink.  Very clever, light, well constructed.....!

Some books require that you review the ending, in order to encapsulate what the book is all about.  This is one, so I will warn for spoilers below.First, this is a really good read.  Two alien races are fighting, and the border in their war brings Earth into the battleground.  Both are far superior to humans -- we are ants.  Human beings are nearly extinct, and the war between the Gorgons and Cyphers (our names for them) is showing signs of making humans collateral damage.Into this steps Ethan, a boy, who connects with a surviving band of humans.  What is Ethan?  Are his developing powers rational?  What role is he playing?  This is a mystery, as is the purpose of the war, and much else.  This mystery includes a goal, the "White Mansion" which they must find.This is well written, horrifying in detail, and you cannot put the book down.  There are humans working against Ethan, and they are particularly horrifying.Why the 4 stars?SPOILERS:The author loses it in the last 75 pages.  We are gifted with a political exchange between a closed minded chief of staff and a demented President.  We are gifted with a new, extraneous goal, to go to Area 51, and retrieve a mcguffin, a trinket that will save the Earth.  Ethan, who had huge powers, becomes a passive victim.  The author wrote himself into a box canyon, and rather than the huge payoff that the tantalizing mystery invites, we get everything thrown at the wall, in hopes something sticks.This is close to being a really really good book.  Some may find the end less scattered than I do, and less contrived.  I call this a near miss, but still fun to read.

This cover arrived last night, and I put it on my Weber Kettle grill -- 22 inch.  The cover fit very well.  The protection will -- I hope -- prevent some of the rust issues that Minnesota winter outdoor storage cause, and also rain protection.  This is very well made!

This book is Huck Finn meets the serial killer and the scary haunted house.The lead character is a poor kid, who steals.  The author stacks the deck towards liking the kid -- he is peppy, he has a dead Mom, a crippled Dad, a difficult life, and he is trying to make things work, to steal and work his way towards self-sufficiency.  He is Huck Finn, the poor kid on the edge of town, who sees and understands the murders of teens in his small town, in a way that adults cannot.  The writing is interesting, but your enjoyment will turn on whether the main character wears you out, with his slow relation of what he knows and learns, and his cornpone speaking style.I enjoyed this at first, but the murders never really terrified me, and so I call it just OK.

This is a simple, firm rubber case for the I-Phone 6; it looks nice, is strong, and otherwise is a pretty basic rubber case.  There are more expensive, better looking glass cases out there; this one mimics the look of the gold phone, but protects the heck out of it.  If you are a dropper, a banger, and a whapper, this is a protector.

This is an intelligent book about an intelligent analysis.  Charles Taylor is opaque, at times -- we can be fair.  I am a smart cookie, and I know that there are many many smarter people than I, but to read Mr. Taylor can be heavy, rewarding lifting.This book takes a simple, direct, but learned approach to understanding the Secular Age, the analysis behind it, and the book about it.Understanding, for example, that the transformation from enchanted and transcendent world, triple embedded within what Henri Bergson called a dynamic morality, to a secular world -- understanding that it is a  subtraction story we are told, informs the reader and characterizes what is read in the larger book and theory.  How nature was seen by religious people as an accessible way of worshiping, but combined with nominalism to yield a secular nature that we now worship without God -- this is a zigzag to humanism, not a simple peeling away of God and religion.Yet this book, written directly and fairly, is not itself easy; nominalism/realism debates and Dun Scotus are not 9th grade conceptual tools.  I would say that this is a high hill, from which one can more clearly climb the mountain.

This book was intense -- a re-visit of Harry D'Amour, detective of the creepy, and his quest/investigation of the Scarlet Gospels.  Barker is a far better writer than Steven King; this book combines genres, is actually pretty short, and made me constantly look up to see if someone else was in the room.The face-off here between Pinhead and D'Amour is cheesy (high compliment.)  Specifically, most novels with a demon from hell and a detective are, ineluctably, cheesy.  Barker makes it easy to suspend the disbelief and "get into the story".  Result: chills.Here is one trick.  An opening scene involved 5 highly corrupted wizards, who have a final face-off with a demon from hell.  (Are you snickering yet?)  Fear is created by having the 5 characters be fearful, terrified, cringing.  Then horrible things happen to the 5.  Icky stuff.  I think that the author combines the fearful and the horrible to create a sensation on the part of the reader...basically, a feeling that this is terrifying, scary, death is imminent.If you like this stuff, here it is, by the bucket, and fairly well done.  If you cannot suspend, you start snickering...

These arrived in time to sling into the sack for a trip to snorkel in Hawaii.They are not tiny, but they do travel pretty well.  The fins fit normal sized feet, but not my son's size 14.  This was a very pleasant set, better than the rentals we also used, responsive, very high quality...  I liked how you felt in control with the kicking, and the mask allowed good vision.  Lots of fish!

A well thought out alternative dystopian war with verve.Water.  Drought.  The western United States has become a war ground over water, with legal rights enforced with armed National Guard troops, and the United States being at best a federal alliance of partners.  California is the big dog, the armed satrapy.  This is the story of the enforcer for the Las Vegas/Nevada power bloc, and the events surrounding the drying up of the west, the rise of California.  This is a dystopia where technology still works, people are still smart, zombies do not run the world -- but the turning of a tap can destroy people, cities....Angel Velasquez is the main character, a combination soldier, private detective, and right hand man for the leader of the arcology.  He is an interesting character, with a kind of pride, compassion, internal violence, and drive.  He is somebody you want to read about.  He intersects with two women, both very well written.And this is a thirsty war.  Water is life.  The fight is for rights, senior rights to Western waters....Google the Ogallala Blue.  Read about that aquifer.  The scarcity of water is going to happen (and not just water, but clean water).  This is a great hook for dramatic fiction, a better dystopia than so many others, because it has elements of reality.Believable?  Sure, but who cares.  What makes this good is the story, the characters, the writing.  I have read too many dystopian fictions this year (everybody has one, or three).  This is a fine novel and a great story... Very violent, but the characters resonate, and that justifies the violence.
Inexpensive, holds the phone well, a useful tool that makes the iphone more useful.

So sad.This is a pretty OK book, but everyone is writing end of the world books, and therefore this is just another, a clog in the huge pipeline of cliche'd jejune end of the world metaphors.  Dog Stars?  Check.  The Road?  Check.  Alas Babylon -- which my kid read for a 7th grade assignment --check.The cleverness here is a post-apocalyptic recreation of the Lewis and Clark journey, this time through post-apocalypse America, with ranting rabid (bitter clingers) trying to hurt our heroes (Lewis and Clark), as they seek a promised land.  Metaphor much?The depiction of the post-apocalyptic society is also cliche'd, with the bubbas in the interior falling prey to the repressive dystopian society that is the fantasy all progressives have about middle America -- that we are will devolve into the beastly persons we essentially are, without elite guidance.  This theme has been done, again and again, and here it is boring.  Some other reviewer mentioned Canticle for Lebowitz.  I mentioned The Road.  Another reviewer dislikes large vampire bats.
