Despite their diminutive stature, they're as bloodthirsty and nasty as you'd expect and desire in a work of dark horror. Rufty doesn't hold back, and, in fact, I'd dare say he brings every gruesome staple to the table here - there are impalings with rusty nails, stabbings, assaults, rape, and all kinds of other nasty business to curl your toes, including some truly creepy body horror that, on more than one occasion, made me squirm.Let's face it, though - if it weren't for an interesting story and solid characters, this book would be nothing more than a bloody mess. And while there's certainly an abundance of dirty deeds on display, the story at work was one I mostly appreciated, with some reservations. A group of social justice crusaders, many of whom have been victimized themselves, are working on rehabilitating an abandoned farmstead to serve as a recovery center for abused men and women. Only too late do they learn of the horrors surrounding their cheaply gotten property and of the fires that ravaged the now largely abandoned community of Doverton.Although The Lurking Season is a sequel to Rufty's earlier The Lurkers, I hadn't read the prior installment and never felt like I was missing any vital information, and this book works well enough to stand on its own two-legs. The precipitating details are related as urban legends, and work to fill in both new reader's like myself, as well as the book's cast of characters (and based on the info given therein, I'm certainly compelled to check out The Lurkers one of these days).As far as the characters go, well, I wasn't quite as sold on them as I was on the story and the turbulence upending the Doverton farm. Aside from Heather and Erin, two of the book's central females, I didn't particularly latch onto anyone, although the severely victimized Brooke was one to root for, if only because of the perils she found herself thrust into. The book has a pretty large cast, too, with the point-of-view shifting between multiple characters, but most of them lack a sufficient amount of depth and serve only as fodder to get run through the meat-grinder.Overall, I wasn't completely blown-away by The Lurking Season, but I did find it be an engaging read and will certainly check out Rufty's other books. The climax was suitably satisfactory, even though I found find a few moments to be stretching the bounds of credibility. However, those with sensitivities toward reading scenes of graphic sexual assault should be warned, as there are a number of rapes and threats of sexual violence throughout, which are quite disturbing.

My 10 month old niece loved loved loved her new bunny baby!!! Her perfect size and she sits and just talks and talks to it! :)) super cute!!
Cool light and bright summer top! Love it and it's light material like most lb tops are.. Comfy!!
Yum!!! Good stuff in a giant egg!! Yes please :)) shipped great!
Cool casual lb top :) light material and very comfy on hot days!!
Yummy is all!!! I buy these once a year and are my chocolate favorite :)) shipped perfect!
My 10 year old nephew loves this and when it's game night this has been his go to game! Nice size and made well :)
I love lb tops and this is.  Another cool casual top!! :) fits nice, light material and love the floral pattern :)
Love these lb crop jeans :) made well, fit great and comfy on warm days.. Perfect!!
This is a cool casual lb top! :) very comfy, fits true to size, a lighter material.. Not see threw and love the floral design!! :)

I bought 3 of these for gifts and me!! I love!! Love!! Love the scent!! Amazing and those I gave gifts to were very happy also!! :) leaves your skin soft and seriously a must have :) nice size bottle and packaged excellent!!
These were great in the kids Easter baskets.. Chocolate smiles everywhere :) packaged great!
These were.  Shipped good and came fresh.. But very over priced and the rabbits pinky size.. Kids enjoyed however and they shipped fast...
These are very good!! Came fresh and packaged good.. First time. I've had these.. Ali will buy again!
Yes these are fabulously addicting :) yummy!! Shipped here great..
This was perfect to put in several Easter bags! Great colors and size.. And good price!
Love this pretty lb top!! Classy for anytime!! Light material and fits perfect!
Lol!! Love this card :) So cute!! It's sure to bring a smile :))
These cards are unique and bring lots of smiles!! :) packaged well!

I bought this compressor to air up the tires on family bikes and scooters and miscellaneous tasks. The compressor won't generate more than about 50 lbs of pressure, but that's enough for what I bought it for. The cooling fan on the electric motor came loose after about an hour of use and I had to open up the shroud and fix it. But it is a good little compressor and for the most part is well built. I would suggest it for light home DIY projects.

Perhaps one of the most gifted writers of our time, Nick blends his characters with humor, tenacity, and smarts that makes you wish they were actually people you know. His books all manage to entertain and keep readers involved, making his work page turners to the highest degree. They also cause Pirogitis, with symptoms of morning red eye and sluggishness -the result of staying up late to read 'just one more chapter' before going to sleep. The only known antidote is to bag the workday and go finish the book.Nick's writing deserves the highest of recommendations, blowing the doors off of New York Times Bestsellers, showing the likes of writers like Patterson, Atkins, and more just how it's done. Looking for a great read? Start out with Nick Pirog. His collection of Unforseen, Gray Matter and Afrikkans is a great start, and you'll be moving on to Oz the Schnoz and the Elephant Rebellion, 3:00am and the Maddy books: Arrival and Borns in no time flat.

An intense story of little known but important people in war efforts. Focused on the Vietnam war, the author describes his experiences as a forward air controller, directing air and artillery assets and performing reconnaissance and battle damage assessments. The writing is excellent, often keeping the reader on the edge of their seat. This is an excellent book and I recommend it highly for its entertainment and historical value.

This is one of the very best monitors I've ever had. Its crisp image and colors make for a sharp and clear image. Its internal speakers are nothing to write home about though, you definitely want to use external speakers. But for display, it's fantastic and can be adjusted to meet individual preferences. Bang for buck, it's a great value for the money.
These are excellent socks for people suffering from neuropathy. They're soft and flexible and wear well without putting much pressure on the skin. I'm really glad I found these.

I was hoping for these to be a bit sharper, they take a fair amount of pressure to make a cut. But they're well made and have a solid feel. I had mine professionally sharpened and now they're a pretty good clipper.

I have a few different video editors for Windows and this is my favorite. It's simple to use and turns out good video productions. It's annoying that it makes you agree to the terms of service every single time you run the application, but for a simple video editor it's easy to learn and use.

These are foam tubes sliced down the side to fit over the plastic tubes that go over the ears on oxygen cannulas. I was disappointed that they fall off easily; the manufacturer really should have lined their interior with stickum so they would stay where they were put and not slide out of place or fall off. They're a good idea and provide welcome relief from the painful irritation of wearing an oxygen cannula, but they could be better. I tried using fabric tape to hold the protectors in place, but ended up just wrapping the cannula tube with the tape where it went over my ear. Worked as well as the protector but didn't slide or fall off.

I bought this case to carry my sports camera and accessories. It's really well built with strong latches and opens and closes smoothly. It has medium density foam inside, flat in the case and egg carton in the lid. It holds my equipment firmly yet gently. It comes with a pair of keys for the latch locks and has a comfortable handle to carry it with. Strong walls and reinforces corners make this a really great case for the money.

These are decent enough moccasins for the money. The leather is a bit on the stiff side and I replaced the laces right away because they felt weak and likely to break when tied. But they fit well and break in pretty quickly and have a sole that's a bit better for walking on rough surfaces than other, softer moccasins.

This is a well made regulator and works really well. I wish they'd included a wrench to turn the tank flow on and off, but that's a $2. accessory and no big deal to buy separately. As a general use regulator it works really well for the majority of oxygen users out there.

This is a decent floor lamp. It is easily adjusted to put light where you want it for reading, highlighting, or indirect lighting. It has a pushbutton foot switch which can be handy or not depending on where you're placing the lamp. But it's a good size for general use and puts out a fair amount of light for the size.

This is an awesome vacuum cleaner. Much lighter and just as powerful as a Dyson at 1/4 the price. Plus, it offers an array of useful accessories including a dust mop attachment that's great on hardwood and linoleum floors. It's lighter than many of the similar units out there too. Easy to empty and maintain, this vacuum cleaner works great for floors, cars, ceiling and wall fixtures. I'm really happy I bought it. Best yet, my wife likes it which is good because when mama ain't happy, ain't nobody happy!

DJI is the de facto leader when it comes to multirotor aircraft. I own four Phantom 2s, one is a Vision and the other three are the standard Phantom 2 with Zenmuse brushless gimbals for my GoPro 3 and 3+ cameras.  While the Phantom is simple to fly, people will have issues with them if they don't calibrate their compass and IMU. Both of these are easily done. If your aircraft flies in a spiral, chances are good you need to calibrate the compass to prevent "toilet bowling." The Software Assistant permits you to create a "geo fence," placing limits on how distant and how high the aircraft is permitted to go. Built in failsafe will return the aircraft to its takeoff point if it loses contact with the radio control or the battery level gets too low. The Phantom is a fun aircraft to fly, but it excels at aerial photography, permitting photos and videos that can't be taken any other way. It is necessary to wait for the aircraft to "boot" up, lock onto GPS satellites and to record its position for failsafe return. As long as you read and follow the instructions, you should have a great aircraft that will deliver around 20 or so minutes of flight time.

This is number four of the series about a Cadillac driving, pompadour wearing, black clad private detective. His world is governed by Murphy's Law, an overweight cat and a researcher/receptionist who consistently reminds the hero that he is mortal, is inept, and has bad taste. I hate spoiler reviews so I'll only say that Blake's delivery is enticing and keeps your interest up while making you laugh. I hope there are more books to come in this series!

I bought this sextant as art. Years ago I used a similar one to navigate with, but I bought this one as a muse to remind me of past adventures. I'm pleasantly surprised that it turned out to be much higher quality than the price led me to expect. From the safety for the compass needle to the leveling bubble atop the scope, the all brass construction is finely detailed. The graticule tick marks and numbers appear to be engraved rather than stamped. All in all this is a very handsome navigation device that appears to be suited for use or display.

I am actually reviewing all three of Paul Antony Jones' books in the Extinction Point series. Paul delivers us some great and believable characters and crafts an equally good story to carry them. By the very name of the series it's easy to know that this is an end of humanity story. That it happens as a punishment for mankind's waste of the earth's climate and resources is sadly become a thin and annoying, but at least Jones doesn't o on and on about it, choosing instead to focus on Emily, the book's heroine. This book, number 3 in the series, is the last of the three volume tale, which could be described as The Hunger Games meets The Wizard of Oz but that would be a bit trite and the book deserves better. While each book could be read standalone, it really only makes real sense if the series is read, in order. That said, the series is a good and enticing read and worth the purchase price. It would be good if the author released the series as a package that includes all three of the books.

I wasn't sure what I was getting into with this book but it sounded interesting so I bought it. I'm glad I did. It's an endearing look into the life of a a high functioning autistic man. Often laugh out loud funny, it also has lessons to teach us all delivered through eyes that see from a very different perspective. It's a book I couldn't stop reading, and once I'd finished it, I immediately bought its sequel, Edward Adrift. It's a wonderful tale that has you rooting for Edward unable to see what happens next. This is definitely a book I'd recommend to everyone.

Bridgeman seems to make the characters the story rather than being a part of the story. She goes off plot on long and plodding aspects of the characters to the point I found myself scanning past entire pages looking for the plot lines buried in all of the irrelevancies. The author also paints the military as overly macho, denigrating women as a weaker sex and useless to their missions in a way reminiscent of 1950s sci fi.  She also writes in a lot of gratuitous violence which is oddly lacking in the action to support it. However, Bridgeman's story is a decent enough one that it keeps you reading in spite of its flaws. I think that this book could lose a lot of textual weight and be an exiting novella, but the sheer density of the book as it is, is overdone.

I've become a total Nick Pirog fan, having read all of his books. After reading Arrival, the first Maddy Young book, I was intrigued and couldn't wait for the next installment. This book, Borns, was worth the wait. Nick is a fantastic talent and all of his works are imaginative, exciting and rewarding reads. I don't want to retell the story as some reviewers do, I don't like spoilers. Instead I just want to say that Borns is a spectacular mixture of mystery and thriller with a bit of science fiction spice that's a page turning read.

I was amazed at how well the active noise suppression on these headphones work. I have a few medical devices in my room that emit fan noises and other sounds and these headphones eradicate both those and street and neighborhood noises. Their sound reproduction is great and gives a full range from bass lows to treble highs, all crisp and not muddy. I'm blown away at how well they work. I think they offer equal performance to headphones offered at twice the price.

I'm disappointed in this power pack. I don't like that you have to press the charge button after plugging in the USB cable for the device you're charging and I hate that it shuts off the charge when it thinks your device has had enough rather than letting your device make that choice. I keep ending up only getting 3/4 of a charge rather than a top off. I have a few Anker devices and I like them a lot. I can keep a device plugged into it 24/7 and even recharge it while I'm charging devices. This won't permit that. On the whole I find myself constantly pressing the charge button because it has shut itself off while powering multiple devices. With its 11 amp capability and multiple ports, the power bank has a lot of potential but it needs a bit of redesign to make me happy.

I was kind of expecting more and better from John Scalzi. Wicked is a look at what might happen if a computer became sentient. I had the feeling after reading that I'd been there, done that, bought the tee shirt. The concept is just too over done --kind of like a Beatles tune as Muzak elevator music, it's kind of lifeless and flat. The short story is a quick read and the sort of thing that might pleasantly distract you at the dentist office while you wait for a root canal.

This is the second of these I bought from Amazon. I gave the first one I bought to my son because he liked it so much. Both of us adults ( sometimes it's hard to tell), we were chasing each other at night outside using the night vision cameras. I was using a Spy Car and he was using the Trakr. We also had fun with the Trakr driving it into rooms where the grandkids were and using it as a means of negotiating bedtimes or quietly eavesdropping on their comments about the movie they were watching. The Trakr can be programmed to do a number of tasks and you can download little programs that others have made from the company website. It's drive treads allow it to tackle a variety of terrains without getting stuck although it is possible. But it's a fun toy for both adults and kids.

I bought this on a lark. I'm a testosterone emanating, action flick loving ball of masculinity with no time for mushy tales of love. But Lost Cat grabbed me and showed me perspectives on human nature and the way that humans bond to one another and to animals. At times humorous and other time sweetly sad, this book is a tale about the emotions of love and the desire to understand the object of that love. A quick but enjoyable read with excellent illustrations, it's a book no one can hate.

Having read and enjoyed Nuttall's Arc Royal I looked forward to The Nelson Touch. I wasn't disappointed. The author weaves a believable tale that continues the saga of a once dregs of the Royal Navy outdated starship that became the salvation of earth and her space colonies. I took a single star away because the author tends to be a little long winded and repetitive, but not so that we readers get bored, The Arc Royal, refitted and with many new crew due to promotions (or battle losses) leads a fleet to attack one of the alien enemy's core planets. The story moves well, causing great anticipation about what will happen next in the story. It leaves us wondering what will happen next with the venerable ship and her crews!At the end, the author asks if readers wish a new sequel that features the Arc Royal or a side step into an earth attack that happened as they fought operation Nelson, My answer is that I hope Mr. Nuttall continues to follow the ship, the central character and star of his writing. Like Arc Royal, this was a good read from a very prolific and talented writer.

Smitherd hits on  unique situation and gives it a classic sci-fi treatment. He weaves a tale which is quite imaginable in contrast to a lot of recent entries into the genre. He grabs your interest early and keeps it with steady momentum all the way through. If I had an objection it would be that the book ends 88% through the pages. a full 10% of the books mass is a kind of self promotional statement that begs reviews. So believing that there was some twist or epilogue yet to come, instead the book ended rather suddenly. But that aside, Luke Smitherd wove a great tale and I encourage others who enjoy science fiction that is strong on the characters and merely uses sci-fi as the vehicle to read this book. It's a very decent work.

The Hawk Sky was for a time the recommended aircraft for 3D Robotic APM autopilot/flight controller and their FPV kit. I bought mine for this purpose. The initial factory assembly left a bit to be desired. I had to glue and use tape to give it the structural integrity needed to handle hard landings. But with  little preparation this is a great plane for either beginners or for those with advanced flight uses. Low throttle makes for a forgiving and controllable airplane and allows pilots to learn to use coordinated turns. More advanced fliers will find it takes well to thermals and so I can remain aloft surfing updrafts for a considerable time. As for advanced use, those who wish to build an autnomous programmable drone, combines with the APM autopilot or the Pixhawk flight controller kits from 3D Robotics you can have a very capable platform for under $750. This is an excellent deal for an aircraft cable of flying from waypoint to waypoint under GPS direction for geomapping, security, or aerial photography. Lease the landing gear off. Hand launch and body landing work best. I've flown mine in winds up to 10 mph, but that's the planes limits. Much stronger and you will need to bring it down or lose it. It has survived my treatment ad come back for more. The wings use a pass thru spar and are removable for transport and storage, Someone absolutely new to RC flight would find this a great trainer, and advanced fliers will find it excellent at flying thermals or performing clip wing mods (cut off the dihedral curved portion) to allow aerobatics. Insode it has more than enough space to handle the battery, electronics of a flight controller, the GPS receiver, and airspeed pitot system add-ons. I have been flying mine for five years almost, and have it equipped with the APM flight controller. I have gotten excellent HD aerial visuals usins a GoPro camera affixed to a mount I made from model aircraft plywood. For the price and durability, it's definitely one to consider as you choose the right aircraft for your uses. Out of the box you should be flying just as soon as the LiPo is charged,

Brian Clarke weaves a great tale that follows the genre of Deep Impact and Armageddon combined with intrigue. That said, I found it a bit distracting that the story takes place in America and is written around American characters. However, Brian writes using UK English, spellings and expressions. A lot of this stood out like neon non-sequitors. The book should be edited and "Americanized" to eliminate the distractions of this obvious and glaring conflict. The book is based on the explosion of a star and the radiation storm it will unleash on the planet. I don't think saying this is a spoiler. While Mr. Clark does a good job of enumerating the catastrophic effects the radiation storm will wreck on the planet, he seems to have overlooked that the incineration of then entire earth's surface would remove most, if not all of the means of oxygen production. I pulled away one rating star because of his oversight on the atmosphere and for his British writing voice. Other than these two issues, Clarke does a great job with his story and the book is a worthwhile read. I heartily suggest it as both entertaining and informative.

I found that I was forever accidentally hitting the right side mouse button to the extent of annoyance. Some better design is needed there. They keyboard is okay, but could really sacrifice a slightly larger size to include a wrist support. But they mouse and keyboard work flawlessly, especially across our large and cluttered living room where we use our computer not just for the usual stuff, but to control content for our HDMI HDTV. For the price, the pair are worth it, and I might offer another star, once I get used enough to the mouse to stop getting accidental right mouse click unexpectedly.

This clock is cute and would be a fun timepiece except for a few problems: It doesn't keep accurate time, losing three or four minutes a day. The eyes and tail will only move if you set them in motion manually, and then they slowly come to a stop after a minute. The hour hand doesn't line up properly, sitting halfway between the hour numerals at the top of the hour. If you want a cute wall hanging that looks like a clock, this is for you! For everyone else, stick to the Kit Kat clocks. They may not be Felix but they work.

I am more than disappointed in this version of Windows. It seems as though Microsoft has abandoned the PC market for tablets. The operating system is slow and clunky. It's counter-intuitive, reacting differently than one would expect, and Microsoft has made it difficult to configure and customize your installation that was so easily done in Windows 7. I had to change a number of peripherals because they were no longer compatible and had to start using an external wireless adapter instead of the great one that was built into my machine. I have been looking for a copy of Windows 7 to install so I can return to the productive environment I had before "the upgrade" but Microsoft has pulled it from the market, only selling system builder versions that require way more knowledge than most computer users possess. If you have Windows 7, keep it! Do not upgrade unless you have a touch screen computer with at least 6 gigabytes of RAM and a 2+ gHz multicore processor. Even then, you may be disappointed. I deeply regret switching.

A gret offering from Russel Blake. You'll love the noir character hero and the zany characters that surround him. If you like GM Ford's Leo Waterman books, you'll get a kick out of Blake's new series. This is book one of three (so far). Hopefully there will be more to follow. A really great and engrossing read.

While taking up from where Blake's premier Black noir story left off, it's totally enjoyable even if you haven't read the predecessor. story about LA detective "just call me Black."  The characters all have great personality, the action moves right along with all of the attributes a solid story demands. When you read this, make sure you pick up #3 to keep the good times rolling.

Clever but bumbling PI Black is back for a third book in a series of great noir writing. It's good reading and a tongue in cheek peek at the life of an LA detective who balances his cases with a cast of characters you immediately will take a liking to. I won't write a spoiler, I'll just say that this is definitely a book those who appreciate the genre will love.

This is a story that makes you believe it could happen while being a heck of a ride. It's an enthralling tale of an astronaut mistakenly left behind on an aborted mars mission. The book is packed with ingenuity, excitement, humor and drama as we follow the lengths the McGyver-like astronaut goes to in order to try to survive. It's  literally a page turner that keeps you wondering whether he'll make it. If you liked the real life story of Apollo 13, you're going to adore this tale.

As a costume, this is a pretty good product. It fits reasonably well and served its purpose at a costume party I attended. I had a laugh on the way home though. We'd stopped for a burger and a woman in the restaurant bumped into me and said "Oh! excuse me father!"  It's not made to last a lifetime or handle strenuous wearing, but it's a great costume and a good deal.

There's not a lot one can say about sheet metal; it's the right grade of aluminum, the right thickness and dimensions. I was impressed though, at the speed with which I received my order and the care taken to ensure the sheet was in pristine condition when it arrived. It was well packed and so it showed up with no warping, curled ends or creases in spite of what appeared to be some enthusiastic handling on the shipper's part. I'm pleased with my purchase and when the time comes to order more materials, I'll look for M-D to supply it for me.

I own a number of Anker's external battery/chargers and have given a few as gifts to friends and family. I like this product the best because you can simultaneously charge it while you charge one or two devices with it. I like that I don't have to press its button to make it charge, but it starts automatically when it feels a load connected. I use it with my Android phone, tablet and my iPad and iPod. Of all the external batteries I've used, this one is the very best.

I have three of these now, one for each model of Phantom. With precut compartments that can be deepened, there's room for the airframe (with camera and gimbal mounted), controller, charger, and a few batteries. You can also create an accessory tray if you like. The exterior is made of aluminum and is reinforced at the edges and corners. The latches are a bit weak, they could have used one more rivet at the top for strength and I took off a star for that. Considering other cases for twice the money (or more), this is a great deal and does its job admirably.

For the money, Amazon Basics products are usually good and this tripod is an example. With easy to use clip tensioners to adjust leg length, a solid head with removable platform for the camera mount, the tripod is a great steady base. It includes a weight hook at the bottom of the riser to add more stability if needed. The finish on the aluminum legs won't show fingerprints. All in all a great tripod. It comes with a nylon carry bag.

I guess for those who just can't do without cute cat pictures this is okay, but I felt a bit let down. Personally, I think this is the kind of work that belongs on a free access blog online but it makes for an ok coffee table book or something to browse in a waiting room.

This is pretty minimal, just a chunk of wood with the dragon image carved into rubber. If you want multicolor as the product photo depicts, you will have to paint ink onto the various stamp areas by hand. For the price and description I expected a flip-over stamp that self-inked and was surprised it wasn't. It came loose in a postal envelope, not even a cardboard box to store and protect it, so when you use it make sure to stick it in a plastic bag or something to keep it from inking things up nearby.

I have a Contour camera I paid the same price for and it outperforms this camera. The AS15 lacks a mount and requires that you use its waterproof case or one of its additional cost accessories to mount it. Unlike the Contour, it must be mounted upright, it doesn't permit image rotation except through software on a phone, tablet or PC. Its image stabilization shuts off if you set it to 170 degree wide angle. It only supports 120 degree. Its setup is not difficult, but working the side buttons can take some concentration and its easy to start filming or taking photos with the position and use of the shutter button as an 'enter' key. When you use the flip out LCD screen accessory, it's very difficult to work the side buttons because they're recessed so deeply. The waterproof case that comes with it is reminiscent of its Contour counterpart. All in all I'm disappointed with this camera, I expected better from Sony. Everything about it is a bit 'clunky,' and not well thought out and it requires additional cost accessories to outfit it for any real use. For the same money Sony charges for the AS-15 you can do much better with other brands.

I have a Wasabi charger for my GoPro batteries and like it fine, just as I do this one. They're basically the same charger built to accommodate different batteries. The charger has a fold out AC plug and also comes with a vehicle power cable that fits a cigarette lighter socket. The batteries are good and match or exceed the original with the camera. It's a good charger and worth the money.

I was surprised that this color LCD only kicked on as a viewfinder. It doesn't display the settings or setup, you have to use the built-in camera postage stamp sized display. It adds a great deal of size to the camera, defeating the small size. It will display video and photos in a looping slideshow format dictated by the camera. It does add a mounting method by offering a tripod threaded mount. On the whole I wasn't very impressed with the accessory.

It took under five minutes for me to set up a wireless router. I like that it requires no PC for setup, but all functions occur on the device, accessible through the touch screen. It even includes a stylus! There was nothing else for me to buy. The Almond Securify is a great little router that works exactly as advertised.

It's not just a good warm cap, it also never fails to bring a smile to those who see my wife wear it. The hat is definitely a mood enhanced; a talisman against the dreary workaday world. My wife loves this hat and wears it often. Constructed well, it's a combination of form and function that makes it a worthwhile part of outdoor attire. They say it's for kinds, but it seems to have a better effect when worn by adults. I'm glad I bought it (and its owl counterpart) for the warmth it brings not just to the wearer, but those who see it worn. Finally, a one size fits all that does just that!

Too hot for valid user. They do work as avertized; they generally put out a light similar to that of the sun and perhaps brigter. I am not kidding around A jewiwh britz could be f=performed by just raising the male part towards the lights and the child would be britzed of his face, eyelashses and sight, precluding you were good enough at bralle to appropriatety what evacuatug students, plans to leave before the hurricane sctruck.I bribed a guard my lifesavings --whcih mounted to $4.43 and was turned over to larry, curley and moe for repatriation.Thanks god we have chinese conterpart to teach them the sacred wirds of shiping; @*#%$, #(#(#&!@*!, and eve ever pupulat !!!##*$&$%^#^#*#*$#%^! This is a pretty good magnifier, it does a good job of magnifying pages for those with poor eyesight. My only complaint about it that it's a bit too flimsy. Holding it by a corner, it will droop unless you use your fingers to warp it. It's kind of like a thin paper plate that way. Except for that though, it's a good fresnel lens that does what it is supposed to do.

I had always wanted to try one of the vibration alarms because I am NOT a morning person. I hate being woken up before I'm naturally ready to wake up. When iluv asked me to test this product in exchange for a review I was really excited!This is super simple to use, you just download an app from the app story (Apple or android) and set your alarms. You can tell it to make noise, vibration or both. You can set up to 10 alarms. I use about 3 usually just to make sure that I actually get out of bed. I only use the vibration because I hate alarms and it wakes me up much more naturally than an alarm noise (which usually scares the crap out of me)I have only charged the vibrator once and have been using it for about a week now. The listing says that it can last a month but I wouldn't go that long without a back up alarm...just in case.I am a side sleeper and don't feel it under my pillow. About the only time I notice it is if I hit it with my arm under my pillow. My favorite thing about it is that it doesn't wake my husband up when I get up with the kids in the morning!  As long as he doesn't wake up, I get to go back to sleep after they go to school!  Woot woot!!

They are much tinier that I expected them to be but they really are super cute!!!  I bought them as Christmas gifts for my daughter.They come in giftable packaging (retail monster high school packaged) and are pretty easy to wrap. Please don't expect them to be full sized like a Barbie horse!  They are miniature.
Very cute. Great for young girls (or boys I suppose)

They are much tinier that I expected them to be but they really are super cute!!!  I bought them as Christmas gifts for my daughter.They come in giftable packaging (retail monster high school packaged) and are pretty easy to wrap. Please don't expect them to be full sized like a Barbie horse!  They are miniature.

They are much tinier that I expected them to be but they really are super cute!!!  I bought them as Christmas gifts for my daughter.They come in giftable packaging (retail monster high school packaged) and are pretty easy to wrap. Please don't expect them to be full sized like a Barbie horse!  They are miniature.

They are much tinier that I expected them to be but they really are super cute!!!  I bought them as Christmas gifts for my daughter.They come in giftable packaging (retail monster high school packaged) and are pretty easy to wrap. Please don't expect them to be full sized like a Barbie horse!  They are miniature.

They are much tinier that I expected them to be but they really are super cute!!!  I bought them as Christmas gifts for my daughter.They come in giftable packaging (retail monster high school packaged) and are pretty easy to wrap. Please don't expect them to be full sized like a Barbie horse!  They are miniature.

It's pretty powerful for how tiny it is!  It runs on only one double a battery. It is very smooth to the touch. It has a few ridges on it but they aren't very noticeable.It has 6 different vibration modes, they are easy to use. Push the button once to turn on, then tap the button to toggle through the modes. The Otterbox Symmetry series is designed for Samsung Galaxy S5. I already have a black Otterbox Commuter series case on my youngest daughters S5, so I switched that with the Symmetry.  I cannot personally attest to its degree of protection as I am unwilling to throw the phone on the floor/pavement, however, the Symmetry offers Certified Drop Protection -  24+ tests and 238+ hours of testing + one year warranty on the case.Unlike the Commuter, the Symmetry has no extra rubber insulator that surrounds the S5 with a hard plastic semi-enclosed case that snaps onto the rubber (see photo of Commuter series case taken apart). Instead, the Symmetry has just one rubberized lip that surrounds the S5 and a clear, rather rigid plastic backing that is wholly attached to this lip - a one piece case that goes on whole & encompasses the entire S5 phone except for the screen. It is very easy to put on the S5.The sleeker Symmetry also allows users to insert custom designs that can appear through the clear plastic backside. It also means that the rubberized lip is somewhat stiffer than its Defender counterpart. Since both my eldest daughter & husband carry their phones in high-risk mode - S5 bare phone with zero protection from a case - I am glad that Otterbox came out with this series. I am hoping to coax my errant zero-phone-case family members to ease into Symmetry's lighter, sleeker version.If you dislike the bulkiness of Otterboxs Defender or Commuter series, the Symmetry may be what youve been wishing for.

Almost everything I wanted in a laundry tub - deep, sturdy material, center drain hole. Purchasers will need to drill out hole(s) for a faucet (faucet is not included). The laundry tub has a bright yellow Notice with black upper case letters stating "FAUCET HOLES MUST BE DRILLED OPEN WITH A HOLE SAW. INDENTED LOCATORS ARE NOT TO BE USED AS 'KNOCK'OUTS'!" These indentations are difficult to discern.My tub arrived with damage but the damage was cosmetic and not structural. I am keeping it since I may not have better luck with a replacement shipment & my box also had the legs. I think that the manufacturers need to rethink their packaging since the tub is placed in a double walled box with zero padding, zero cushioning - not even a plastic bag surrounding it. The photos show the shipping box as it arrived - note all the dust and particulates resulting from its shipping trip and the damage. It is no wonder that the tubs are arriving with damage. I think I should receive a damage discount for keeping the tub & not returning it...

Scotts Turf Builder Grass Seed - Sun and Shade Mix is a product of the renowned Scotts line of lawn care products. My extended family relies only on this brand.My front lawn was ruined by a plumbing company that replaced my sewer & water main pipes. I wanted to try Scotts grass seed to see how well it would work for my lawn, which is partly sunny. I need to have my entire lawn regraded & leveled, so I decided to work on a smaller test area since this area will be ruined during the regrading process. I did not have much success with these seeds. I will wait to see what the spring brings since it became colder here and I intend also to reapply again in the spring and provide an update.

The RUSK Curl Freak works like the Babyliss Pro Nano Miracurl Steamtech Curl Machine but without the steam feature and for a lower price. I've tried both.The RUSK operates exactly the same way and has the same exact setting options (except for the steam) as the Babyliss and I saw no difference in my curls or with the longevity of the curls. I think that both curl machines are best used on people who have thicker hair. I had difficulty sectioning my ultra fine med-long strands of hair to the recommended width but this was a problem common to both machines for me. I used the RUSK and Babyliss on my 25-yr old daughter's healthy, medium thick, never color-treated hair and met with more success. Still, I find it tedious to complete the entire head and I cannot do the back of my own head due to range of motion issues.It is nice to have tools to create different hairstyles and we decided to keep this machine around for a while.

We love Izze products. This item is sparkling water with such a teeny amount of sugar that one cannot taste it. Compared to other flavored sparkling beverages, it tastes as good but no different with the added sugar.I think it was a great idea to try out since we add a splash of juice to our flavored seltzer water drinks but we added the juice or some sugary Izze to this product anyway. I really like the packaging of the glass bottles (so sturdy & safe) and like drinking from a glass bottle too!

Purchased these for my 25-yr old daughter for walking around campus. This pair was from Amazon's Warehouse deals and arrived in like new condition. My daughter prefers wearing boots around campus instead of jogging style shoes since she never knows when it might rain and she hates to have to be in wet shoes/socks all day - she commutes to college and parking is miles away.These boots have great traction on the bottom, the leather stretches to mold to one's foot, which adds comfort. She likes the look and the fact that there are no laces to deal with. She wears a size 7 and the size 7 fits well. Recommended!

Really cute item - reminds me of Wilton Armetale metalware (aluminum-based alloy metal) but it is not made as well. I can see bubbles in the surface. I like that the bottom part is ceramic - if the glaze is unleaded that is - there is no disclosure about which country manufactured the item & I could not discover this on the Internet, which makes me feel a little uneasy.I think it will look cute at a Thanksgiving table.

My grandmother only used the large Vanity Fair dinner napkins for family gatherings when I was growing up. I prefer Vanity Fair napkins to any other napkin, so I was very happy when Vanity Fair came out with the everyday, smaller-sized napkins.I use this brand of napkin exclusively and it is no wonder since it is such a high quality napkin compared to other brands. Highly recommended!

Once every year or two I make fried chicken. One of my favorite things as a kid was cold fried chicken on a picnic. My Mom/Grandmother used lard or Crisco but I've found that Peanut Oil is an excellent substitute for frying chicken.Planters peanut oil is an excellent brand of oil and I usually use the entire bottle between two large cast iron pans filled twice with fried chicken.
